Review Title: If there's a delivery policy, stick to it and don't lose deliveries!!!
Review Text: Amazon makes sure a customer can't get in touch when they claim that a delivery has been made to my door or to the porch. First problem: there's no porch. Second problem and the reason for my complaint: THERE'S NO SIGN OF A DELIVERY OF ANY SORT ANYWHERE TO BE FOUND!!! And Amazon makes sure that I will never get it!!! They say to use their chat, only the chat isn't available!!! There were two failed deliveries priced at $8.20 and $11.28. Neither order arrived. I have given the most explicit instructions; maybe I have to draw a photo map as well?!?!?!? Now I worry that all the orders I place are going to be left just anywhere and I'll just pay for things that I'll never receive. I notice that direct interaction is not possible. That forces me to file complaints elsewhere, which is what I am doing now because I am given no alternative. And I don't appreciate lying of any sort. No, it was not delivered to my door. Funny that Walmart managed to deliver to me with no problem. Amazon has failed me. There's no other way to describe it. I feel sick now. This is what is done to a disabled senior male these days. I'll just post my complaint everywhere possible; I have no other alternative. Some possibility of making contact with a human being should be available; when no possibility is made available, ripping off a customer is child's play. If I have to go out and lead the delivery person by the hand to get to my door, TELL ME SO IN PLAIN ENGLISH, A LANGUAGE IN WHICH I HAVE WRITTEN AND PUBLISHED!!! Amazon has a publication of mine on record, so they can't say my instructions aren't clear. What burns me most is the lying. Delivery was not made. The app gives me no way to make contact. Maybe they assume I'll die before a delivery is made. I give up. I have no way of guessing anymore. If Walmart made a delivery to my door, Amazon should have been able to do the same thing -- maybe. Normally, they store large deliveries in lockers on the property here and give the customer codes to log into the lockers. Instead, they claimed to deliver them to my door when there was nothing to be found. I faxed them about this development and received no notice of change in my favor.

Amazon used to be incredibly reliable, consistent, and user-friendly, however lately there's been an exponential increase in wrong deliveries, falsely reported deliveries, and stolen deliveries. I understand things happen, but I believe that when they do, particularly if one customer is experiencing this frequently, the customer should be penalized as little as possible. When voicing these concerns after not receiving the fourth delivery within a month, I was met with condescension and a lack of consideration. I have found their customer representatives to be snarky, demeaning, and unwilling to actually fix the issue or offer compensation. Even their apologies are rude. Sad because this business used to be hospitable and efficient. Seems this conglomerate has gotten larger than they can handle.

The title ‚ÄúCustomer service‚Äù must mean something different to Amazon employees than to other businesses. I needed to apply a gift card balance to my Amazon account, but the online reply was that it was ‚Äúinvalid‚Äù though it has never been used.Since the online Customer service department suggested it would be best to ‚Äúchat‚Äú with a representative, I enter a summary of the problem I was having to make it easier for my customer service representative.After one hour of waiting for a representative to respond online, Aman Joined the chat and asked if there was anything he could do. Clearly he had not bothered to read my summary, so I copied all of the information and reposted it in my reply. After another 10 minutes, I asked Aman to escalate this conversation to his superiors as a complaint and ended the session that had wasted more than one hour of my time.I am sure that it comes as no surprised anyone but, Jeff Bezos and his Amazon crew seem to only care about taking easy money as there is absolutely no interest in providing any true ‚Äúcustomer service.‚Äù

Review Title: There is no low enough rating I can give to Amazon
Review Text: There is no low enough rating I can give to Amazon. When delivery goes smoothly people don‚Äôt notice it. However, if an order has not been delivered on time, this company takes absolutely no responsibility and has no control over the situation. Amazon took 90% of a global market and they just no longer care about customer‚Äôs satisfaction. Their off-shore customer service is something else completely. If you are trying to get any information about your order that has been  delayed , forget about it. They have no access , no rights, no work ethics They would feed you with lies or they just hang up. I‚Äôve been waiting for a milestone birthday present to be delivered to my co-worker. Her Birthday was May 28. Everyday Amazon CS has been telling me that it would be delivered next day. Just now their delivery logistics supervisor, located in different country, of cause, has told me that they have absolutely no control over their delivery stations and that I should wait another 24-48 house and if it is still not delivered, I should cancel. Lessons learned, if there is any way not to buy on Amazon , don‚Äôt buy from them. Or at least NEVER buy anything that is time sensitive. It is time for Sherman Act to kick in. Amazon is out of hands .

Review Title: Legal Cooling Off period beig ignored trying to complicate matter & not give refund
Review Text: I have a legal right to cancel in the 14 days cooling off period under distance selling regulations. I cancelled the ¬£620 purchase of an O2 SIM from a 3rd party seller when I found it did not work in my area - contrary to what their website says - but the seller would not cancel. I cancelled on the advice of O2 where, after several attempts to check the SIM activation over the phone with O2 who could not find or access it, I took it into an O2 store who advised me to cancel it as that SIM and Mobile Broadband does not work where I live. I had checked the coverage checker before I bought it but was told that was the anticipated coverage after the upgrade was rolled out, their internal map told a different story. I cancelled it there and then while I was in store. My only option is a wired connection which I have now bought. I then contacted Amazon.co.uk 8 days ago under the A-Z Guarantee thinking this was a crystal clear case of cancelling in the cooling off period. I cancelled in the cooling off period in writing. It is in Amazon messages. What is there to argue about. Give me my refund. But no. I find that they say the decision is 7 days. THEN, if you add any details or chase because it is a simple case, THEY RESTART THE 7-DAY CLOCK. We are now on day 8 and as I chased/added proof, it will now be a minimum of 15 days until a decision and I cant chase before as it will restart the clock. Why will it take 15 days to 'decide' whether I can have my ¬£620 back when the service does not work and I cancelled in the cooling off period. Even when I put in the claim over the phone, it was not actually filed the first time. I am not sure if this is deliberate to get rid of the semi-serious claimants but after I did not get an email confirming my ¬£620 refund, I called again and found it had never been filed. i was told not to worry the second time, but then got a huge email requiring me to report this as a theft to the police and it went on and on. It seems the claim that was filed was filed incorrectly on my behalf saying i had not received it, then someone at Amazon took the agent's  filing as the version to work from and out of the blue introduced that looking at my messages about cancelling in the cooling off period and the agents filing, the item must have been stolen, and then proceeded to design a prolonged and convoluted way forward which involved reporting to the police and uploading the reports and it went on and on. This is just to delay the inevitable - whether I have to take Amazon or the seller to court as it was Amazon I found and used the seller from, and Amazon's A-Z guarantee that gives you false commitment to safety of your purchase. They are ACTUALLY trying to get the seller to keep my ¬£620 for providing something that does not work and something I cancelled in the cooling off period in writing through their system so they can see. The A-Z Guarantee is not actually a guarantee that your money is safe. This is causing me so much stress. My mother has just died and I cant even communicated about her funeral service without getting dressed and driving for miles to get to an area I can use the internet. I sent them proof I have bought into a full fibre wired connection now as that is the only thing that will work. Still no response. I want to upload a no internet screenshot I took from home but funnily enough, I cant. Do not trust the A-Z Guarantee. Youl could not have a more straightforward case than mine. The service provider themselves told me to cancel as it would not work, I am in the cooling off period, and here we are 8 days later with no expected decision for another week. It is so stressful not to be able to chase or ask without the clock resetting. It is very manipulative and not at ALL cusomer 'service'.
Amazon customer service is awful, Their customer service supervisors are not even having enough knowledge of how to solve issue. I am not going to use their services anymore!!!!!! Not worth it!!!!!!

Review Title: They Just Can't Get It Right!
Review Text: I think Amazon has gotten too big for their own britches. Too many mistakes, and they've forgotten the customers that brought this far. I received a package. Not the knife I ordered and paid for. It was flat. I opened it. It was a piece of rubber in a plastic bag. No idea what it was for. So, I paid $95 for a knife, and received a 25 cent piece of rubber! I went through the return process. Amazon states that I'll receive a refund within 30 days, after they receive the return item. EPIC FAIL! AGAIN! For about the 5th time in 3 months. And, of course, they won't let you talk to a human. I'm getting real sick of this stupid stuff, their 'we don't care' attitude,  and lousy service!

I immediately open my door and the driver is pulling off. I waved my hands to stop her but she never stopped. The driver never came to my door. I have a Ring cam and it caught her driving away in her white car. I immediately contacted Amazon through the app they said they would have the package redelivered later on in the day. I also contacted Amazon personally to complain on the driver and let them know what happened. They advised me of the same thing that they would reroute the package to be delivered later on. The package never came. I sat inside all day waiting on this driver. I missed out on a hotel stay that cost me $150 for one night. It is impossible to obtain a truthful response from the Amazon customer service team, and there is no avenue to escalate the issue and file an official complaint. I am frustrated with the constant lies I am told whenever an item goes missing or is delivered late. Yesterday, I ordered scattering urns for my parents' ashes, with an expected delivery time between 1.30 and 3.30 pm today.  When I checked the tracking information, it showed the driver parked near my house without any movement for hours. Upon contacting customer service through live chat, I was assured that the items were still out for delivery, despite evidence to the contrary. After speaking with multiple representatives, I was given conflicting information about the delivery attempt. Ultimately, I was informed that the item would still be delivered, but it was already late in the evening and unlikely to arrive today. To my dismay, the delivery date was suddenly changed to the 29th of May. This is not the first time such issues have occurred, and despite promises of refunds for the inconvenience, I have never received them. It seems that Amazon's customer service team protects each other, as there is no effective way to lodge a complaint against them. Unfortunately, it appears that sharing my negative experiences on review platforms like Trustpilot will not result in any action being taken. So I‚Äôm probably wasting my time writing this review as nothing will happen as usual

Review Title: The last person i spoke with was very‚Ä¶
Review Text: The last person i spoke with was very rude, and was basically telling me that it's my fault that my order was delivered messed up. I ordered the shorts needing them for an event tomorrow, but they were delivered today ripped. So, now not only do i have to go out spend more money to buy more, and even told her i didn't want or need the refund that i still want the shorts only to be told that a replacement was unavailable and that i need to send in the shorts and wait for them to be received processed before i can be refunded, so i simply asked are you kidding me then she wants to get an attitude saying no she isn't kidding and that it can take 30 days or more to get them processed for a refund i still even asked if there was any way possible for me to get my refund into my Ammazon gift card balance so that i could order another pair to which she was again rude as hell saying no i had to not only wait the 30 plus days for the refund to be issued but i have to wait another 10 days for it to go back to my card. So, satisfied sadly after this refund is processed i will no longer bee ordering anything from Amazon again, and i took screen shots of the conversation and how rude this person was and i will be on every platform i can find leaving reviews about this. So, not only did Amazon lose me as a customer today but they also lost everyone of my family members and friends that use Amazon. We will be ordering from TikTok shop and ebay from now on. TikTok shop usually has better prices and neither one of them have ever been rude like this to me before and never have i ever had something delivered to me ripped up and i get blamed basically for it and get told I'm basically screwed on getting my money back for a month and a half. I have only had one package come messed up from another place and i contacted customer support and they gave me a choice of getting refunded or i could have the same thing i ordered mailed out that day, to wait on my money for a month and a half is absolutely ridiculous and unacceptable especially when it's either Amazon's fault or the delivery company THEY USED to have my order delivered. I guess you guys at Amazon forget that us customers are the ones that keep you employed and for you to treat your customers that spend alot of money with you the way you treated me is beyond crazy. But hey losing around 10-15 prime customers in one day is no sweat for y'all even though one single person is the one that made these 10-15 prime customers leave. So, congrats Amazon keep it up and I'm sure you'll be losing alot more. Hope you enjoy this terrible review on every platform i find showing everyone how you treat people.

The Hyundai 1700w Pressure Washer I bought from Amazon failed to switch on just one year after purchase and just a few weeks after last using it.It came with a generous 3 yr Warranty (no need to register, just proof of purchase)So i emailed the Genpower Group Customer Services with a copy of my Amazon order and after a few cursory questions, they offered a replacement without needing it returnedWhen I queried a delay in confirming dispatch, they apologised that this model was currently Out of Stock in their warehouse.So I asked them for a refund instead which they apologised could only be given by Amazon.I was in the middle of a ‚ÄòChat‚Äô conversation with Amazon who indicated that in the circumstances, they would give me a refund when Genpower rang back, offering me an upgraded (1900w) replacement.They dispatched it next day with a one day delivery and as you would expect I was delighted with the improved features and xtra power which helped recover the delay in being able to use  a pressure washerSo apart from the premature failure of the original 1700w product, I have nothing but thanks and praise for the manner in which both Hyundai (Genpower) and Amazon have handled my disappointment Hence a 5 Star review to both of them

Review Title: Truth about Amazon practices are not allowed in product reviews..
Review Text: Just like others, we traditionally have great experiences ordering from Amazon; however, when we wrote a review about their sales/shipping practices, Amazon refused to post it, citing "doesn't meet community guidelines." The only part of the review Amazon could be referring to, is that we indicated that Amazon permits sellers to charge shipping fees for a product that Amazon warehouses ship for free - let me clarify that. If the seller has product in stock, "they" ship it and charge a delivery fee. If they do not have it in stock, but Amazon has it in their warehouse, Amazon ships it directly, with no delivery fee added. Yeah, that sounds totally backwards, but that was the information we received from Amazon Customer Service. We stated in our review that this is not a "customer first" approach, because Amazon does not clearly notify the buyer about this practice. I guess Amazon does not like "truths" being posted within reviews on their own website. Amazon used to be the best "big business" company for customer service, but they have slowly and steadily become a "money first" entity. Need more proof? Enjoy the ads through Prime Video.

I recently ordered several items from Amazon, to be delivered by Evri.  The items were due to be delivered a few days ago, then I got a message from Evri saying that they tried to deliver but couldn't because access to our house was blocked.  This was untrue.  I was at home all day and no delivery van appeared, and the access to our house is always clear.  I looked on my Amazon order page, and it advised me to contact Evri.  I really tried to do this.  There is no option on Evri's site to speak to a human being, so I left a message on their chatbot explaining the problem.  They didn't reply, but instead left me a message saying they had tried to deliver again and still couldn't.  This is nonsense.  Whoever they are trying to deliver to, it's not to our address.  On my Amazon account it now says that Evri have paused the delivery until I contact them with more information.  What information?! And how am I supposed to do this, when they won't talk to me?!!Instead I contacted Amazon customer service and asked for a refund for the items.  The agent told me that they couldn't request a refund until the following day, so he would phone me back today.  Today he sent me an email saying he can't get through on my number, I don't know why, and that I need to call Amazon back.  I did this, and the line was so bad I could barely hear the lady I was trying to explain the problem to.  She said she would process a refund.  Later I looked at my Amazon account to check the status of the items, and there was no change, so I phoned back to check that the refund had been requested.  I was told that it hadn't, and that it will be done now and will be in my bank account next week. After all the problems, I have little faith that it will happen.  I have wasted hours trying to resolve this and I am at my wit's end.  It is absurd and not good enough.  I buy a lot from Amazon, but this has put me off and from now on I will shop locally whenever possible.

Review Text: This web is a scam now. Be careful if you don‚Äôt want to be bankrupt. I shopped and paid my own credit card, but when orders were returned, the refund went to Amazon card. It didn‚Äôt go to my original payment method. It means I still had to pay the same amount with credit card statement, while items were returned. It wanted me to shop something else with the refund amount and I cannot deduct that amount in my credit card statement. Bye Amazon!

Review Title: Amazon does not stand behind purchased‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon does not stand behind purchased made from 3rd party sellers on their site. I purchased a Excellent condition refurbished iphone13 with battery health at 80% or more. What I received was a phone with battery health at 70% and a alert on the phone to replace the battery. This should and could`ve been checked before shipping asked for a replacement or a new battery ,and they had neither. Asked for $89 the cost per the phone of a new battery, I was offered $30, NOPE. Went to Black Market purchase same model for the same price with the battery at 89% and a 1 yr warranty. You contact Amazon and no help, so now have to return and wait up to 2 weeks for a refund. Sellers that sell items that are returned often for the same reasons should NOT be allowed back to sell defective items
One of the sh*ttiest business in the world

Review Text: They are ok for items you know cannot go wrong , however don‚Äôt buy electricals, they only offer 4 week guarantee and returning anything is a nightmare !! I am a regular customer but that counts for nothing

Review Title: Safety issues with supplements that were tampered with, and Amazon does not care!
Review Text: On 5/17/24, I picked up my order for Prevagen brain supplement. The product was packaged inside a sturdy cardboard box that had the safety seal broken. There was a red sticked on the box that stated, "The box clearly states that "This is a set. DO NOT SEPARATE". Obviously, the box has been tampered with, and 2 bottles of the product have been removed. The bottle had no safety seal at all, and there is no way that I am using this product. I looked online, and there are many more reviews that state the same thing. Amazon customer service gave me a refund, but I wanted to post the review to warn other customers of the tampering issue. Guess what? My review doesn't meet community standards! Amazon doesn't want any reviews to pertain to the seller, which is ridiculous, since the package was tampered with, the safety seal on the outside of the box had been slit open, the package had originally contained 3 bottles, not just one, and the worst, the bottle itself had no safety seal, and someone had access to the supplements before shipping. Great idea, Amazon. Don't have any reviews that warn a customer of potential safety issues on a product. Better that you make additional sales, which may cover your legal issues if the product is not Prevagen!

Review Title: New acc. got blocked over nothing
Review Text: My account has been temporarily blocked. I had created it so that I no longer had to order via my mother's account (I'm 18), so it was a brand new account.An order on invoice was canceled directly by amazon (I can still understand because of the creditworthiness of new customers) and my account was then blocked. I sent amazon the necessary data to get access to my account again. Since it didn't work out with an invoice purchase, I decided to buy with a gift card. And guess what... my account was blocked again. This time I also sent Amazon my receipt from the supermarket where I bought the gift card, only to receive an e-mail informing me that my account would still be blocked. I don't understand how Amazon determines what is suspicious and what is not. The fact is that my 80 euros are now waiting at amazon and I can't use them...Watch out! Because the service doesn't seem to care whether their work has done any good or not! And yes, contacting a customer via no-reply mail also shows a lot of understanding and problem-solving skills. I am totally amazed! Amazon's competence is even worse than I have ever experienced!

Review Title: Beware of Customer Service tactics when it is picked up from India
Review Text: Just had a very bad experience twice now. I have beem Prime member since 9 years now.Earlier back in 2016 i got a problem with my order; i talked with Amazon Customer Service and they not only refunded me the whole item but also issued a 50 $ amazon card just because of my loyalty with Prime; remember here that the Amazon Customer Service rep was "English speaking"; being an indian myself, i know how an indian would speak english, no matter how hard he tries.Last year i had problem with an order, i talked with Amazon Customer Service rep and they plainly refuse to do anything about it and my refund was also not full. Remember this was an "Indian CSR".Just now, i had problem with an order; it was elligable for partial refund; when i talked with a CSR, an english speaking lady picked up and she was very polite and gentle and told me that i am elligable for 40-45% partial refund; i wanted to talk with my wife for the decision so i thanked her and hung up; after that i called again and this time an Indian CSR picked up and he plainly told me that i am elligable for only 30% refund; and i was like "whattt" and i told him that just now i spoken with a CSR and she told me that i had 40-45 % refund; hearing this the Indian guy simply got confused and told me that its a "special refund" and that he will see that i am elligable; after some time he said that ok i am elligable for "special refund".So guys be aware, keep on calling AMAZON CSRs until you met with an English speaking person, they seem to have "more morality" than the Indian CSRs.
Bad! Ordered some earrings and out of 20 individual earrings they was 1 matching pair

Amazon told me my parcel would be delivered,driver turned up no parcel,I phoned Amazon and was told parcel on its way,few hours later I was told parcel would be delivered by 10pm at midnight I received email that parcel could not be delivered as damaged, all day I waited in and two long phone calls and kept telling me my parcel is on its way, poor service, Amazon has gone down hill,not as good it was years ago, customer service is very poor.

They didn‚Äôt tell me my refund was being held hostage on a gift card.  Or didn‚Äôt tell me my last order was discounted with a gift card. After doing the math. Amazon kept $5.17 cents. After on the phone for 45 minutes, I told them, they was never to put my refund on a gift card. It is suppose to go back to my credit card. Amazon was told another thieving incident like this and I will file with the attorney generals office. Be aware of amazons scams. Make sure your refunds go back to your card.

Review Title: Amazon customer service is second to‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon customer service is second to none. Waiting time to get through can be a bit tiring but provided your grievance is fair, they always go out of their way to resolve problems with a purchase, even if it's past the stipulated return date.
Will never use Amazon again. Disgusting delivery drivers to lazy to walk up stairs. I asked please come up the driver threw parcel at me . Absolutely disgusting unacceptable behaviour!

I had a very bad experience with Amazon.deI ordered multiple pairs of Falke socks in the promotion in different colours. Since you could only order 4 pair of any colour at the same time, I also placed multiple orders.On the Amazon website it stated that these socks were all to be delivered within a week or maximum 14 days to the Netherlands.I received the largest part of my orders within 14 days, however Amazon could not ship 8 pair of socks at that time and I was given an indication of another 2-3 weeks for delivery.After waiting patiently for these socks for 3 weeks, I received a message from Amazon (the day before these socks were set to be shipped) that they were cancelling the order.I contacted the Amazon helpdesk to ask what happened. They told me the colour could not be found in the warehouse and therefore they would cancel my order. I asked them if it would be possible to get a different colour (at the time of ordering multiple other colours were also available for the promotional price).After some discussion Amazon agreed to sell me 8 pair of socks in a colour of my choice. They even promissed me an additional discount of 10% and refund of the shipping costs because of all the hassle.They told me I had to cancel my orders and order these socks at the current price. They would than refund me the difference in price once I received the orders, as well as the 10% discount and the shipping costs.To make sure I understood correctly I even send them a calculation of what refund the would be giving me (the price was more than double compared to the promotional price). They confirmed I understood everything correctly and I wouldn't have to worry.So I ordered 8 pair of socks and send Amazon an message to receive the refund. However, Amazon refused to give me the promised refund.I have had long message conversations as well as 2 phone calls for over an hour with the help desk. During these calls the Amazon employees agreed with me and promised me to arrange the refund. Afterwards I got written messages that I have been misinformed and that they can't/won't give me the refund.Finally, I have returned the 8 pair of socks to get my money back. It was impossible to get Amazon to keep their word and you should be aware that the promises they make mean nothing.
Amazon is an amazing website with instant shopping items and often have low price tags on amazing things.
Appalling customer service and driver was so rude, he didn't wait to listen to what I was saying, just ran and jumped in the van.Spent over an hour, 3 calls to get the matter resolved.

Review Title: My experience with Amazon Seller Central has been the worst.
Review Text: There should be an option to rate Amazon 0 stars. My experience with Amazon Seller Central has been terrible. Despite creating an individual account, I was charged $39.99 for a professional selling plan, and my account has been deactivated since its creation. Contacting customer support is very difficult with a deactivated account. It's been a month, and the issue remains unresolved. I will need to dispute the charge with my bank. Reactivating my account is impossible as I can't provide the requested document, and alternative documents for address verification are not accepted.

Another horrific delivery experience.  Another lie about failed delivery, another email from an account you cannot reply to, although they will write back to you telling you they will not reply to your mail - no other method of contact offered.  How do they have a reasonable reputation?   Oh well, at least they pay tax‚Ä¶..

His birthday is before then and it was bs they canceled the order to begin with especially when I explained to the guy it was very important. Just like the same thing happened with my daughters gift when I ordered her gift. So all the important packages they seem to not be able to handle and get to me. Absolutely ridiculous.  This was after the last time when I sent back a damaged item they received the item admitted that them it took me filing a dispute with my bank to get my money back. Their starting to do this quite often trying to keep my money and no product. It was for my son's bday you canceled then lied about. Sorriest people I know to do a kid that way on his birthday.  Why do you think I did rush shipping. Exactly inconsiderate jerks.

They never add on postage to the locker, even if it's only a few quid and even though I don't pay prime mostly my items have been delivered the next day. So for now way to go Amazon.

Also someone was in the house and we know that no delivery van came into the close. Can't be bothered sounds right. Advised delivery next day now have to wait up to 72 hours. Review Title: Amazon used to deliver reliably, but no more!
Review Text: Amazon used to deliver reliably, but no more. They promise delivery on a specified date, but rarely keep their promise. Almost every order is delayed. Amazon had a great marketing position in the past, with reliable, on time, deliveries, but they have fallen from their pedestal and rarely deliver on time. Very disappointing! I hope someone else picks up the ball and provides the same selection and actually deliver as advertised!

Review Title: Prejudice against the disabled. Uncaring business.
Review Text: They sent 2 dresses that were not the dresses in the picture and were just plain ugly for over $40.00. I am bed ridden and my daughter just passed away and she was my caretaker. They are refusing to send me a postage paid envelope so I can have it picked on one of the twenty times I see an Amazon truck on my block. Because I suffer from 2 rare diseases am on disability I have loose over $40.00 because they were deceptive and allow those who sell on Amazon to be deceptive also and refuse to do anything about it.

I have been an Amazon Prime member for well over a decade and a Music + Member for several years. In my opinion, they were once a good company (I remember when they were a book seller!). Over the past few years, their service has detiorated drastically, in every way possible. I firmly believe that Walmart, Target or Home Depot are better options, depending on your needs. For your pet supplies, Chewy also offers 5% off on Subscribe & Save and they are a MUCH more personable company.  Streaming music is available from so many different companies and several are compatible with Amazon Echo devices, so there's no problem there. It seems as though Bezos got the money he needed and is now resting on his laurels. I could could go into the vast number of problems that now exist with the company, but it would take days and most people are probably already aware. I'm starting to feel like I am always on the phone with a representative who "can't help", but will escalate my case, which of course, means you will never hear from them again. They believe if they offer you a $5 credit for your "inconvenience", everything will be fine. It's demeaning, condescending and insulting. I'm all for capitalism, but, in my opinion, supporting Amazon's continuously and drastically worsening business practices, is an enormous mistake.

Review Title: Need to get back to using decent delivery people
Review Text: I am a prime member and for years I have had a great delivery service from Amazon all my deliveries if I wasn‚Äôt in were left in my safe space but my last few deliveries have just been left at the front door and not in my safe space but my last one the delivery person said it had been handed to customer which was a lie I wasn‚Äôt in just left at the front door again luckily they hadn‚Äôt been stolen it has really put me off ordering with them it‚Äôs happened to my family and friends too Amazon really need to sort this out

*Disappointing Amazon Purchase Experience*I recently had a frustrating experience with an item I purchased from Amazon, sold by a third-party vendor called LAFIYA US. While the outer bubble packaging appeared undamaged upon delivery, the product itself inside was in an unacceptable condition. It was torn apart and crudely held together with masking tape.This shoddy state of the item has severely diminished my view of Amazon as a reputable retailer. And just two years ago, I had spent nearly $10,000 on computer parts (to build for Custom Fully Water-cooled PC) through their platform without any issues. However, this recent incident has made me reconsider being an Amazon customer going forward.What I find most disheartening is that Amazon would allow questionable vendors likeLAFIYA US to operate on their marketplace while selling non-returnable items in such poor condition. Despite being just a $20 purchase, the fact that Amazon would permit this kind of subpar seller experience after my substantial patronage over the years is truly disappointing and discouraging.

I've purchased OnePlus 10R 5G phone from Amazon on 10th November 2023. From the starting, the pin of data cable was loose and after one month it stopped working and the pin came out.I contacted Amazon for that and they asked me to go OnePlus service center. I went to service center and they mentioned that the charger, data cable and adaptor is not original and told me to contact Amazon regarding this as I got cheated from Amazon so OnePlus will not gonna help with this. I asked the amount of the charger and it was Rs.3000.I reached out to the Amazon customer service and they asked me to call you OnePlus customer service for the deniel letter then only they can help me out. They provided me the phone number i.e. 18001028411. I spoke with someone from OnePlus customer service. They said that they don't provide any deniel letter and asked me to again contact Amazon for that.I again called Amazon customer service and told them what OnePlus customer service guy told me. After that Amazon asked me to e-mail OnePlus support and wait for 3 days for the resolution. I did receive e-mail from OnePlus only one time and after that I'm tired of taking follow ups but no revert received yet.I reached out to OnePlus customer service via live chat and they promised me multiple times that someone from them will gonna contact me within 24 hours but still it's been many days that no one contacted me via e-mail or call.Due to this duplicate charger, my new phone started hanging and the screens got black and blank. I don't understand why the hell am I facing this issue.Whom I blame for this?? Amazon or OnePlus?? Is there anyone who can help me out.Also I updated reviews regarding this incident in Amazon multiple times but they mailed me back by saying that they cannot update ky review due to blah blah reasons.Amazon and OnePlus customer support is useless. They cheat people and never help them out and provide the resolution.

Review Title: Prime Membership is now a fraud
Review Text: I've been with Amazon for years as a Prime member. They knowingly false advertise about their delivery times. Had one order come in two days late, another over one week later than advertised. They are so messed up that the girl said she couldn't even find my account after I verified it by text. We will try our best to find alternatives like TEMU or Alibaba or just drive down to the store and get what we need as we are finding that Amazon Prime is NO LONGER worth it. You pay for it and get regular delivery like everyone else. Oh yeah, after 45 minutes on the phone, they did give me a $10 promotional credit, lol. Hardly worth my effort.

Review Title: Excellent Experience with Amazon.com - A 5-Star Review
Review Text: User-Friendly Interface and Vast SelectionOne of the most commendable features of Amazon.com is its user-friendly interface, which facilitates an effortless browsing and shopping experience. The website is well-organized, making it easy to find products among the countless categories and subcategories. Moreover, the vast selection of goods ensures that one can almost certainly find whatever item they are searching for, ranging from everyday essentials to specialized gadgets.Reliable and Fast ShippingAmazon's shipping services are exceptional. With Amazon Prime, users can enjoy the benefit of fast, free delivery on numerous items. In several instances, products arrive even sooner than promised, showcasing Amazon's commitment to reliability and customer satisfaction. This efficiency is particularly valuable for last-minute purchases or urgent needs.Competitive Pricing and DealsAmazon.com offers competitive pricing, frequently accompanied by deals, discounts, and promotions that enhance affordability. This pricing strategy, combined with an easy-to-use price comparison feature, empowers consumers to make informed purchasing decisions, ensuring they get great value on their buys.Customer-Centric Return PolicyThe return policy at Amazon is straightforward and customer-centric, designed to ensure that if you're not satisfied with a purchase, the process to initiate a return is simple and hassle-free. This policy, coupled with excellent customer service support, enhances the overall shopping experience, instilling a high level of trust and confidence in the platform.Secure and Safe TransactionsSecurity is paramount on Amazon.com, where transactions are secure and user data is protected with high levels of encryption. This commitment to security reassures customers, making them feel safe while shopping online.Robust Review SystemAmazon's customer review system is robust, providing prospective buyers with honest, detailed feedback from other users. This transparency aids customers in making more informed decisions about their purchases 4 6 .Innovative Features and TechnologyAmazon continually integrates the latest technology and innovative features into its platform, enhancing the shopping experience. Features such as Alexa shopping, one-click purchasing, and personalized recommendations make shopping seamless and more enjoyable.ConclusionOverall, Amazon.com stands out as a leading e-commerce platform due to its comprehensive approach to online retail, which includes a vast selection of products, competitive pricing, fast and reliable deliveries, and a customer-focused service ethos. Its continuous innovation and commitment to customer satisfaction rightfully earn it a 5-star rating.

Review Title: I ordered an electric gate kit through‚Ä¶
Review Text: I ordered an electric gate kit through Amazon at ¬£ 299 including a ¬£ 30 discount which got lost in their delivery process so I was told to re order which I did.  It didn't include the ¬£ 30 discount this time so I contacted Amazon via Live Chat who confirmed in writing ( a copy I have ) they would honour the ¬£ 30 discount and to contact them once the gates arrived for them to initiate the refund.  I did this and was told on 5 different occasions they now wouldn't honour their promise and there was nothing they could do.  It is now available again with the ¬£ 30 discount which I'm not eligible for as I now have the goods !!  Absolutely shocking service !!!  To add to this, the gates that were delivered had to be signed for.  I was out, they left them at my back door which is visible from the street !!  Their records said it had been signed for by me.  I had left instructions for it to be left in my garage !!!

Review Title: Used to love Amazon and when Prime‚Ä¶
Review Text: Used to love Amazon and when Prime started it was great. The issues started when Amazon began to Make their own in house deliveries since then in over 12 months every delivery has been late or delivered to entirely the wrong address on my road. With complaint after complaint doing nothing to resolve this. Customer services are a joke asking if I have canvassed the local neighbours if they have received it. I would appreciate that if I were in the middle of nowhere  but with two blocks of flats I am not spending hours doing the delivery drivers job for them. Or straight up marking packages as attempted on the week when I am home all day.In short prime is a waste of money for several reasons;1) video has gone from a streaming service to having poor choice with most items being pay to rent or buy. Those available are now saddled with a premium service within a premium service with adverts throughout.2) prime next day delivery is hopeless the drivers either lie and mark deliveries as complete when they haven't tried or are too clueless to find an address (royal mail and other providers manage just fine,)3) over priced rubbish with little benefit

Review Title: Amazon didn't issue a refund for a recalled item even if I received a confirmation email about it
Review Text: Amazon sent me an email informing that an item I purchased was recalled for safety reasons. I called to get a refund and I got a confirmation email saying that a refund was approved and it would be processed in 2 hours and it wasn't. After chatting with an agent first and his manager after, they told me that it was a mistake and that they wouldn't kept their word. So, I asked if Amazon credibility was worth $20 (my refund) and they told me yes (I have a screenshot about it). I will modify my shopping habits accordingly since we are not protected and we cannot trust Amazon

VIOLATIONS OF FEDERAL FAIR TRADE COMPETITION LAW The FTC and states allege Amazon‚Äôs anticompetitive conduct occurs in two markets‚Äîthe online superstore market that serves shoppers and the market for online marketplace services purchased by sellers. These tactics include:Anti-discounting measures that punish sellers and deter other online retailers from offering prices lower than Amazon, keeping prices higher for products across the internet. For example, if Amazon discovers that a seller is offering lower-priced goods elsewhere, Amazon can bury discounting sellers so far down in Amazon‚Äôs search results that they become effectively invisible.Conditioning sellers‚Äô ability to obtain ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù eligibility for their products‚Äîa virtual necessity for doing business on Amazon‚Äîon sellers using Amazon‚Äôs costly fulfillment service, which has made it substantially more expensive for sellers on Amazon to also offer their products on other platforms. This unlawful coercion has in turn limited competitors‚Äô ability to effectively compete against Amazon.Amazon‚Äôs illegal, exclusionary conduct makes it impossible for competitors to gain a foothold. With its amassed power across both the online superstore market and online marketplace services market, Amazon extracts enormous monopoly rents from everyone within its reach.

Review Title: The dark side of Amazon - what everybody should know. seem to be two weights and‚Ä¶
Review Text: There seem to be two weights and measures for setting up shop with Amazon.com. One for the local (read: American) people and one for the international (read: Chinese) sellers.I recently helped someone local setting up an Amazon Seller‚Äôs Account. What a tedious, strenuous experience. Lots of documents and information required: driver license, proof of residency, bank and credit card details, business address, description and references, verified phone numbers and email addresses, name of business owners, company representative, nationality, etc‚Ä¶etc‚Ä¶etc‚Ä¶I understand, Amazon is protecting its brand and wants to weed out bogus operations to protect itself and sellers, right?Well, I got a big surprise when I had to contact Amazon concerning a failing product sold by a third party vendor (read: Chinese).(1) impossible to contact the seller directly, no information about the seller is listed. Only the name is provided (let‚Äôs say ABC)(2) contacting the seller is only possible through the Messaging Assistant who states: ‚ÄúI send your message to ABC‚Äù. Since no response from seller is received, I contacted Customer Service Support for help getting in contact with the vendor directly.And here it gets juicy. The Agent also did not find any contact information about seller ABC. Agent escalated the question higher up to a Lead Agent who came back empty handed. No information is available about company ABC.How is that possible? Since I experienced personally how though the vetting procedure is to set up shop on the Amazon platform and all the verified contact details that needed to be provided before a sellers account can be opened, here is a third party vendor (read: Chinese) company ABC selling on the Amazon website and nobody knows how to get in contact with them.In the meantime and that because of the staggering complains about their faulty product(s), company ABC changed its name into XYZ apparently without any scrutiny by Amazon. That way, company XYZ does not need to reply to complains about products it did not sell. They keep selling same unsound products using same templates on the Amazon portal. It‚Äôs obvious that the screening by Amazon is non-existing. Corporate greed towers above buyer‚Äôs protection. Permission is given to Chinese companies who can distribute their cheaper but faulty products to us and unaware Americans are left behind holding the bag. Time to wake up people! Buy local (read: American)!
U owe me 40 euros. I paid for fast delivery and its slower than normal delivery.  Tell Jeff im about to throw hands!

I sent manual verification, to be told my card wasn't saved to my account (it was). Afterwards, I was asked to resend my details which went back and forward around 3 times until I had to call them to chase it up as I needed a product urgently for an exam on Friday. Unfortunately, nobody was able to assist and my details were passed around everywhere. I've only since started receiving scam emails claiming to be from 'Apple ID' and 'Amazon Pride' which have been sent to the hide my email for Amazon. After reporting this data breach, they have done nothing about it, refused to accept responsibility and again put the phone down, while my order is still half processed. I also received an email saying someone had unauthorised access to my account and to call Customer Service, who can't do anything.I'd never trust Amazon with my details and will close my account as soon as I've received my order. Disgusting treatment of customers and don't deserve a single penny!

Review Title: Amazon is my favourite shopping experience.
Review Text: Amazon probably provide my favourite shopping experience. Everything you want to know about your product is available to you from reviews, to dimensions, to Q&A, to comparisons with other products. Price is clear and normally very competitive and you can choose on delivery options to suit your price requirements, or subscribe to Prime and get things delivered scarily fast. They've been pretty good when I've had problems with things. I guess this exposes a flaw in Trustpilot as a platform. Amazon have so many customers and there is no motivation for customers to leave a positive review on the website, even though I'm sure the majority of customers would, however when you're angry you'll post a 1 star review everywhere you can. As a result the company with the best shopping experience has a sub 2-star review.

Review Title: Amazon's Customer Service Nightmare: A Saga of Salt and Incompetence
Review Text: Let me regale you with the tale of my recent descent into the abyss of Amazon's incompetence. Picture this: I'm locked out of my account because, surprise, surprise, I no longer have access to my phone number. So, what's Amazon's brilliant solution? Use a credit card. Sounds straightforward, right? Wrong! Apparently, the geniuses at Amazon haven't yet grasped the concept of credit card expiration dates.In my quest to untangle this mess, I attempted to reach out to their esteemed customer service. But alas, the phone numbers provided might as well have led to the Bermuda Triangle, because they were utterly useless from my corner of the world in New Zealand.It's mind-boggling that a company swimming in cash like Scrooge McDuck hasn't managed to figure out basic customer service protocols. And so, in a fit of exasperation, I was forced to resort to the drastic measure of creating a whole new account just to make a simple purchase. Bravo, Amazon, for turning what should've been a routine transaction into a Shakespearean tragedy of errors. If you value your sanity, steer clear of this tech behemoth's abyss of ineptitude.

My nightmare with amazon customer service started off a few days before Christmas when I ordered a gift for my parents. A few days after placing the order, I checked my letterbox on my way back from work to find that my package from Amazon had been delivered to my neighbours, however, it was not specified which neighbours the package was delivered to. Bear in mind, I live in an apartment block with over 100 residents. So I put up a sign on the entrance asking if anyone has received my package to please contact me. I also contacted amazon asking them where my package is exactly. Consequently, Amazon launched an investigation with the courier and found that there is no further information as to where the package was delivered and as a result starts a refund process. So far so good. However, after waiting for more than a full week, I still did not receive my refund and there are no further updates from Amazon. Therefore, I called customer service, spelled out my unbelievably long university email about 3 times before they got it right for them to check what the refund status was. They then assured me that all is in order and that I will receive my money soon. Nevertheless, days passed and I still did not receive a refund. So I decided to call again. After giving the customer service worker all my details they told me that my account had been blocked due to an outstanding payment on Amazon.es, although I live in Germany and order from Amazon.de. Therefore, the refund has also been blocked. As a result, they escalated the issue and promised me that I would receive my money as this outstanding order nonsense made no sense. Nevertheless, a week went by and my bank account was still 160 euros short. Consequently, I called a third time to ask what the situation was. Bear in mind, each time I call I have to explain my situation from the beginning and carry out the verification procedure of repeating my long and complex email address and home address. After explaining my situation, customer service once again told me that they have made a mistake and that my refund will be issued. Nevertheless, the EXACT same thing happened as last time. I didn't hear back from them for days and my refund never arrived. At this point I am 3 calls and several emails in with absolutely no progress.Subsequently, I called a fourth time to figure out what the hell was going on. This time I was forwarded to someone higher up in the customer service rankings. After almost one hour on the phone, the lady assured me that she would tend to the issue herself. Once this has been done, she would call me back with the final outcome. It was already 630 pm after work when the call was coming to an end. Nevertheless, she told me that she was working until midnight and would call me back before then. So I literally stayed awake until midnight waiting for a call which never arrived. At this point I really wanted to give up but it is a lot of money for me so I checked my emails 2 days later only to see that my account has been unblocked but there is no sign of a refund. As a result, I called a 5th time now. This time I insisted on a solution on the spot. After almost an hour on the call and the customer service employee talking to his superiors while I was on hold, I was told that the final decision is that no refund will be issued. Well, let me explain their logic. Apparently, a one time pickup code was issued to me and given to the courier. Long story short, I got screwed over almost 200 euros for no reason, be careful with Amazon.

Review Title: My 65 year old Father who has Sciatica
Review Text: My 65 year old Father who has Sciatica, blood clots and anxiety was attacked, thrown to the grown causing injury to his back and punched in his face by one of your drivers. He was sleeping in his house when the delivery man came to delivery a package to his next door neighbour. Then the delivery man pressed down on my dad‚Äôs bell holding his finger on the bell for a prolonged amount of time. Which started my dad and he got up to go to the door. The delivery man then tried to give him the package and he said it was not his. My dad then told him to press the number 2 bell, the driver said he alll could not find it and my father said it was on the middle of the door right I in front of the drivers face if the driver had cared to look. At this point the driver started shouting, knock my elderly father to the floor causing him to fall straight back into the house hitting his lower back in the step as he fell. The driver then came over him to punch him in his face, threw the package that he had came to delivery for next door toward their door and ran out before my father could get up to get the registration of the van. My dad has been undergoing man diagnostic test since January of this year and is not a very Will man health wise. I find it appalling that your drivers would attack an old man for staying the obvious to them. The man park directly outside the house and also has a lady sitting in the passenger seat which I know is slaps not allowed during work hours in your vans.  My dad has report the incident to the police and has a cad number which we will like to share with you when you get back to us. The incident happened at his address at 4pm ish on 02/05/2024. You driver has left My Dad in pain, stiffness and worsening his sciatica symptoms and his anxiety. This was appalling and you must see to it that the driver is fully reprimanded and that you share his details with the police. We have the details of the package he was delivery to identify which drivers van it was loaded on m. So you can identify, pull up and reprimand the correct driver. We will share this info with you once you get back to us.

Review Title: The great Amazon believes that our time‚Ä¶
Review Text: The great Amazon believes that our time is unimportant, and their written resolutions are not obligatory. I purchased an item and was supposed to receive it after two weeks. After four weeks, I didn't receive the item. I contacted customer service and tried to cancel since I had already bought an additional item. I couldn't cancel the order but I was promised a full refund without returning the item. More than two additional weeks passed, and finally, the item arrived. I contacted customer service again to proceed with what I was promised( and got an email confirmation regarding such a resolution). A refund was issued. I have waited for dates for the confirmation, which I didn't receive, so I contacted customer service once again. Once again, I was promised a refund and even received an email confirmation. Again, days passed, and nothing happened. When I finally reached humans, one said they would process the return and refund the sender but didn't. I then had to call the next day. The first woman said she couldn't return the item and refund the sender. Because I had already had the experience, I knew that wasn't true and asked for a supervisor. FINALLY, Trace got on the line and beautifully escalated the complaint and processed the refund and return. (Thank you Trace!) Amazon, however, needs to get its act together on the customer service end. I couldn't even lodge a complaint on their service online. Not good, Amazon. Not good.

Furthermore, Amazon disallows bad reviews regarding late or in accurate deliveries that failed to arrive on time. This is a concern to me because it appears Amazon is only interested in profits and not customer satisfaction. They need to do better with the respective delivery companies charged with making sure things are delivered on time and to the correct address. It‚Äôs inconceivable and inexcusable for Amazon not to properly vet their sellers and deliver to the correct address on time.

Amazon is the issue, not the drivers. Drivers do not appear in a vacuum, they are hired by Amazon. For what they pay, I am surprised they are not worst - well, not yet at least. Most interesting is when a package is ordered, on the web site it shows next day delivery or even overnight, and then it transforms into a 3 day delivery AFTER the checkout, or never delivery....in some cases I think this is a tactic to skim money from millions of customers, who pay prime, and deliver whenever they like. Basically a free pool of floating money for Amazon at your expense. I do not want to name other sellers out there, but if all the products come from China, why pay the middle man for crappy service when I can get them less expensive directly from Chinese sellers. No, I am not advertising for any one here, but I am done with Amazon and fed up with them. Already canceled most of services I had through Amazon, and will close them all. Not worth it anymore.

Review Title: Don't Believe The Promised Delivery Date
Review Text: I've found that Amazon can't be trusted to keep their word, and many of their product listings are outright deceptive. I ordered a product on Friday, the listing said "Free delivery tonight if ordered within 2 hours." I completed the order within 10 minutes. While paying, the details said "delivery tomorrow." What? Why did that change? Okay, so I paid for the order. The email confirmation said, "Delivery by Sunday." Really? It keeps changing at every step. The clincher was when I later got a notification that said "Your item will be delivered on Monday." The shipping details on their website are a complete bait and switch to get people to buy. My last four orders from them have followed this same pattern, and two of those orders were delivered to the wrong address. Amazon delivery service has gone downhill terribly in the last couple of years.

Amazon took an item that had just been delivered by another retailer. They acknowledge that it happened and that it was a mistake. They refuse, however, to return my property or pay me the value of the property they took. They instead sure me that they will return it, if it turns up in their warehouse. An interesting response to theft, however accidental the original offense may have been. It has been well over a month and I'm fed up.

The "delivery person" delivered a non urgent parcel and ran off without delivering the urgent signed for parcel. I am fuming after waiting in all day and having the delivery time set back several times. We are used to this with evri and yodel and suspect he needs to re locate to a more suitable company.

Reported fraudulent listings on braclet sellers claiming "sea turtle tracking" that did not include "sea turtle tracking" and they are still up a year later with the misleading/fraudulent listings. My last experience was bad with customer service as well. I rated Amazon 5 stars 10 years ago but the service has really declined since then.
Reliable trustworthy,delivering on time

Unacceptable Product Recall - Natures Aid DHA Drops (Amazon)I am writing this review to express my outrage at a recent product recall from Amazon. In July of last year, I purchased Natures Aid DHA Omega-3 Mini Drops for Infants and Children. Just this week, I received an email stating the product has been recalled due to containing hazardous chemicals!Here's the most disturbing part - my son, who was 19 months old at the time, consumed these drops! Amazon offered a simple refund as compensation. This is absolutely absurd! A refund does not come close to addressing the potential health risks my child may have faced.I am utterly disgusted that Amazon considers a measly ¬£5 sufficient compensation for potentially exposing my child to harmful chemicals. Their response is shockingly dismissive of a very serious situation.This experience raises serious concerns about the safety of products sold on Amazon and their handling of product recalls. Parents trust them with the well-being of their children, and this kind of nonchalant response is completely unacceptable.Other parents, please be aware! Check your cupboards for these recalled drops and take immediate action to protect your child's health. Furthermore, I urge Amazon to take product safety and recalls much more seriously. A simple refund is not enough when a child's health is potentially at risk.

Review Title: Amazon stole my money, and probably yours too. Check all refunds received from them.
Review Text: I ordered a product for $299.00 from amazon, the day it was supposed to arrive I checked to see if the order was out for delivery, at which point I got an alert that the product was damaged in route. I contacted the company I ordered the product from and was told that was an amazon issue not their issue. I spoke to amazon about the order and they said I could not request a new product but they would refund my money in 5-7 days. 5-7 days later I get a refund for $289.98. Now don't get me wrong I know $9.02 isn't a lot of money but I DIDNT GET THE PRODUCT AND WASNT GIVEN THE CHOICE TO REPLACE THE ITEM. When contacting amazon to find out why they didn't refund the whole amount they stated that promotional credits are non refundable. How does that make any sense at all? Amazon stole my money plain and simple. THEN, when I tried to leave a review about my experience with this order i was told and I am quoting exactly from the email I received from them, that they couldn't post my review for the following reasons: "Please edit and resubmit your review Hello Ashley, We couldn't post your review because it focuses on one or more of these topics: Sellers Delivery Packaging Pricing Availability Why isn't that allowed? These aspects vary by order and won't be relevant to all customers. That said, we want your feedback about sellers and packaging, just not in product reviews. Please edit and resubmit your review. Before you do, make sure it meets all of our community guidelines." So, where should I leave a review about my feedback relating to sellers and packaging then? I cant even give other consumers an accurate review of my experience, I'm guessing because amazon stole my money. I will never order from them again, and hope this will prevent a few people from making the same mistake.

I specifically ordered on amazon and then the day after,my delivery was given to a seller which i never heard about...and guess its late with no tracking info...i wanted amazon why you gave my parcel to someone else??

Review Title: Horrid site with a lack of transparency and lack of easy access
Review Text: I have two email addresses linked to amazon site for Australia and USA. One business and one personal,  and I'm unable to log in with either of the emails on the Amazon.au. Therefore have attempted to change password but the process has been ridiculous because of it continuously being repetitive with puzzle solving and input matching. I've used the visual and audio etc, and it never stops and never completes the process even though I've continuously input correctly. I've tried to contact customer service and yet that continuously goes around in circles too, leading me back to the repetitive process that never ends.I have products on amazon.au and tried to contact them to find out why they have deliberately increased the pricing to 3 times the amount than I nominated. For example, a book in paperback is higher than the hardcover of the same title. Why would they do that to a producer of a product and certainly discourage a sale for the most popular customer preference. The fact I cannot get past log in process and they blatantly make it impossible to question why they have nominated to make a producers product pricing questionable does really spell a lack of transparency for the company. When it comes down to me being a customer, the site is certainly losing sales from me and for the sellers because they don't make it easy to log in to an account to make a purchase. Poor form and very unprofessional.P.S, It does make me question their selling tactics. Do they have staff on retainers or commission who also sell their own products on the site? Therefore, pushing their own products to make sales above all other sellers and do their staff have a place in listing other sellers product pricing, only to cause a dire affect to deter customers from purchasing thus the other sellers products which would only give advantage to the staff products being reasonably priced to influence sales for themselves.I know of another site that I have become very familiar with over the past 5 years who are doing the same thing and it became obvious by their marketing emails with the same old artists products being in the emails, high up in search on the site, and always in the artists spotlight. Very biased, indeed.

Review Title: Worth customer service on the planet, what happened?
Review Text: Amazon customer service is the worst I‚Äôve ever experienced, or, I should say, has become that. This year marks the worst so far, and it‚Äôs only April. Nobody trains the agents what to do except lie, or they do not understand what you say to them. You can even water it down so anyone could understand it but they're always lost.¬†At the beginning of the year, I had to update my phone number. It took a month of working with the BBB to even attempt that. A billion agents each telling something asinine, thinking I‚Äôd believe it being they made constant assurances that never go anywhere. They are surely trained in that.I had to give them my blacked-out ID to merely update a bloody phone number that was easier with my bank, pharmacy and post office. After all, this whole country is based on phone numbers and codes when not involving targeted ads. The former is what finally after almost a month got my number updated after all their insanely ridiculous replies to the BBB case, which shows how dense and clueless they are. It sadly gets worse.That same month, I received two items damaged beyond repair. An agent two months ago said there was no need to return the item. I have screenshots. If you mention this, they seemingly panic and lie some more. Weirdly, there are screenshots, but the mere mention of such things sends them into a frenzy. The agents in turn assure more things which they never bothered to do, like a refund for one.¬†Two months later, I received  an email to return the item I was told to never send back. Screenshots tell the truth. They naturally took the money out after saying that if you‚Äôre charged, meaning you will be, we will reimburse you. They took it out twice.¬†¬†Another agent said he fixed it and issued it, but there was no confirmation email. More screenshots. Always take them, or they‚Äôll just lie some more. Of course, in essence it‚Äôs all they do when not assuring it is fixed and leads to more issues.¬†I thought to check if the refund even went through two days later, but I never received a confirmation email, so I merely engaged to check. An hour later, I was promised four months of free Prime because the other agent lied about issuing a refund just two days earlier.¬†I found out from the third agent during one chat alone (many get lost and transfer to another sometimes even more lost) for a simple issue (checking the status of non-existent and promised refunds). Amazon also conveniently and quite stupidly have no reference or ticket numbers for any chat so future agents won‚Äôt be as lost as they always are. Lovely.¬†This agent was as nice as most are, but clearly in over his head. I took billions of screenshots, but I am fearful all the promises will lead to more chats from hell. I know nobody wants to work there since Rocket Boy is so cheap; there‚Äôs nothing worse than the people working there. 2024 has already been an absolute nightmare. ¬†Always use chat so you can get screenshots of these fake promises. The emails have no reference numbers, as is now policy so ask for chat transcripts. Good luck in getting concrete answers for anything, as it‚Äôs all assurances to seem nice while they mislead you, or outright lie until you get the next lying agent. Fix this now, Rocket Boy.

No passwords. A simple life.

Review Title: "Reputable and customer-centric" becomming a "used to be" reality!
Review Text: I have mostly had good luck with Amazon over the years, but it's my most recent experiences that have me not "smiling".I recently ordered a new set of Sony surround speakers that were part of a renovation of what we call our "sunroom". When the "new" speakers arrived, one of the main tower speakers and the set of two Atmos ceiling-directed speakers were obvious returns. The tower speaker was without the soft foam "sock" that keeps it from being scratched and the Atmos speakers were carelessly wrapped in the soft foam (hanging half off) plus there were the remains of speaker wires being previously attached. I sent the tower speaker back to get another one and Amazon would only do a credit to the account and not a refund. I kept the Atmos speakers as they seem to work ok, but I felt cheated. These items should have been sold as "warehouse" items at a reduced price. New is new and not kind-of new and we pay a premium price for that privilege. The most recent problem was with a lightening arrester that I needed. I bought an item that would work with standard coax used by satellite and cable companies but received an item that was for larger coax. I sent it back for another one only to get the same wrong item. I'm now dealing directly with the producer of the item who is correcting the situation.After having the problem myself, I have since read where others have experienced the same problems. To add to the problem, Amazon has made it impossible to find and actual contact phone number where you can talk to a human to right things. If not for being able (at this point) to Google the number, I could not have talked to someone.These are some of the signs of a non customer-centric company.

Review Title: Customer service cant find numbers to Amazon carriers
Review Text: 3 Days ago I ordered  a package that I was told would be next day delivery, and it did not show up, I did get an email saying the delivery person "tried to deliver but couldn't enter the building"The building is my home, not a business, the delivery instructions said "deliver to the front door", even if it were a business it was at 5:08 in the morning.I know they never even tried to deliver the package, my home has a vestibule, and a sign saying to leave packages inside the door. The door was unlocked, I was home, and up at 5:08 AM. The package as per delivery instructions could have been left at the front door!This is one of many times Amazon said they tried to deliver, but never even got out of their truck to try.The note from the Tracking told me to contact the carrier for information on the delivery. No Number, No address, just told me to contact the carrier. Who is the carrier? Who do I contact?I called customer service, I thought they could help. They simply said SORRY, we will try again tomorrow. (It was supposed to be delivered yesterday, What happened to today?)I asked the customer service rep to give me the number to the carrier. He said Amazon is the carrier but he didn't have the contact information, and could not get it. AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE CAN'T GET THE CONTACT INFORMATION TO THEIR OWN CARRIERS???I was extremely frustrated, told them they need to fire the driver that didn't do his job, (I may have cussed a little, LOL) and hung up

Review Title: Had so many problems with Amazon that I‚Ä¶
Review Text: Had so many problems with Amazon that I will no longer use them, even though I have outstanding items to be delivered. As far as I am concerned if it's on the Amazon website then regardless of third party or not it's going back to Amazon. This problem has been bouncing around since the end of March 2024. Just spoken to someone in Customer Services (another person appearing to be helpful but not) and that is the main problem 2 different addresses. This is definitely the parting of the waves with Amazon I really cannot stand all these problems is stressful and worring.

Review Title: Amazon screwed up my bank account and won't correct their mistake
Review Text: I made a purchase from Amazon on 4/22/2024.  Amazon did the preauth and settlement on the 4/22/2024, but it put the settlement date as 4/25/2024.  So the settlement was done on the 22nd, but the preauth won't be released until the 25th.  Leaving my account overdrawn.  The bank said it would release the hold now if Amazon would fax the a letter asking them to do it.AMAZON REFUSED TO DO IT, EVEN THOUGH THIS SITUATION WAS CAUSED BY *THEIR* ERROR.UPDATE:  An idiot on Amazon responded to my complaint at the Better Business Bureau by saying, "we didn't charge you twice."  I never said they charged me twice, I said the preauth was held after the settlement, instead of the settlement being taken out of the preauth, because the screwed up and put the settlement date as 4/25, but settled it on 4/22.  That explanation CAME STRAIGHT FROM MY BANK, and these incompetent people didn't even listen to what I told them.

THIIS IS THE DATE OF THE FIRST RETURN DELIVERY TO SELLER THE SECOND IS THE 12TH OF APRIL.  i HAVE RECEIVED ONLY ONE REFUND AMAZON STILL OWES ME $232.79,  AMAZON PUTS THE ONUS OF PROVING i SENT THE SECOND ORDER BACK, EVEN THOUGH BOTH RETURN LABELS WERE PRINTED FROM AMAZON'S OWN WEBSITE AND THEY SHOULD THEREFOR BE ABLE TO SEE THE EBIKE WHEEL KIT WAS RETURNED.  THIS WOULD NOT HAVE HAPPENED HAD AMAZON PUT BOTH ORDERS IN MY ORDERS INSTEAD OF JUST THE SECOND ONE, THAT WAS ONLY ORDERED BECAUSE THE FIRST ORDER WAS NOT IN MY ORDERS!  i WILL NOT ORDER ANYTHING ELSE FROM AMAZON WHO PUTS THE BURDEN OF PROOF ON ME, A DISABLED PERSON THAT CAN'T READ BECAUSE OF EYE SURGERY, AND HEALTH INSURANCE DELIBERATE INDIFFERENCE TO EYE CARE.  PLEASE UNDERSTAND THAT i CANNOT READ THIS AND i APOLOGIZE FOR ERRORS.  AMAZON IS REFUSING TO GIVE ME MONEY BACK UNLESS I PROVE THE RETURN WAS DELIVERED WHEN IT IS THEIR MALFEASANCE OF DUTY TO KNOW THEMSELVES.  Had they put the FIRST PURCHASE IN MY ORDERS INSTEAD OF ARBITRARILY LEAVING IT OUT OF MY ORDERS, THEY WOULD HAVE THE PROOF INSTEAD OF PUTTING A BURDEN OF PROOF UPON ME, VIOLATES VIRTUALLY ALL CONSUMER PROTECTIONS IN PLACE AND IN LAW.

Review Title: Amazon hustled me, was not given refund
Review Text: I bought a pair of shoes, and I got a date when they should arrive. They did not arrive, and suddenly a new date was set, with a message they were delayed. This second date also passed, with no shoes and no further tracking info avaliable. I waited for a while, but then I reached out to customer serive by chat. I was told the item seemed to be lost or stolen along the way. I was asked to get new shoes. However, I was starting to be in a hurry for the date when I needed the shoes, and with normal delivery, I would not get them in time. I was then offered free express shipping. I was told i had to pay for it, but when the item arrived I was told to contact customer support again for a refund for the expenses of the express shipping. I was also told the chat would be stored so that i did not have to tell the whole story again. As this was promised to me, I aggreed to have the shoes sent another time, with express shipping. This time the item reached me as it was supposed to. I then contacted customer service again, but the person i got to talk to then, knew nothing about it. I had to explain everything all over again, and in the end I was told some other department or whatever had to handle it, and they would contact me within a day or so. I heard nothing from anyone after that. So now I tried again, as I am still missing the refund for the cost of the express shipping. I would not have bought the shoes otherwice, and at this point I would have been able to buy the shoes somewhere else for less. I was put in chat with first one person today, who sent me on to someone else in another department, that again left the chat so i had to start from scratch again with someone else for the 5th time. This person just telles me i was wrongly informed and they will not refund me anything. I used to think Amazon was a deasent company, and I was really not happy to be hustled like that. I have saved the entire chat history and can document everything, but when someone at their company has told me something wrong, they still let me as a customer be the looser. What happened to "we are sorry, of course you'll have the refund, there must have been a misunderstanding on our behalf"?Never shopping at Amazon again, and i strongly recomant the same for everyone else. Stay away.
