Review Title: REFUSE to fix THEIR problems and it's costing ME money
Review Text: Sold me devices that I cannot useAmazon have sold me devices, falsely claiming that they allow me access to my music, to call my family, to stream video, etc. and I am unable to ANY of this on the devices at all. Amazon REFUSE (SEVEN attempts so far) to remove 2-factor authentication from my account meaning that I cannot register or access ANY of my devices (Echo, Echo Show, etc.). Review Title: How far the Mighty Amazon has Fallen
Review Text: I can't begin to describe how far Amazon has fallen over the years.  I was a customer from the beginning.  I was with Prime shortly after it came out.  I seriously thought it was the best company in the world, until it wasn't.  Then it wasn't even close.  Amazon now has among the worst customer service I encounter anywhere.  It rivals Comcast and Verizon Fios for the worst service you can even conceive of.  There's literally no way to describe the thousand ways Amazon fails at basic stuff.  It's service is a nightmare now.  You're sent off to a foreign country, with people who are supremely unhelpful, with the simplest issues taking hours to resolve.  I'm over it.  I no longer trust Amazon.  It's that simple.  Most recent case in point: I called Synchrony Bank, the issuer of the Amazon store card, to pay my bill.  It said the balance was over $400, so I thought I'd go through to a live person and see what the purchases were, to make sure nothing was unauthorized.  I recognized every purchase, except one.  There was an $11 charge for Amazon digital services.  I knew I hadn't authorized any digital purchases, so told them to put me through to Amazon.  The Indian man I spoke with was completely unhelpful.  Mind you, I mean him or anyone else no disrespect for being foreign.  He spoke with a thick accent likely because English was his second language.  GOOD FOR HIM.  It's something to be proud of.  But it also makes it very difficult to take care of issues that have any degree of complexity at all. He insisted I definitely ordered Amazon Music Unlimited, because I played [unintelligible] on my Alexa device.  What was the name of it?  "It was [unintelligible]"  HUH?  SAY THAT AGAIN SLOWLY?  Literally, his accent was so thick I couldn't tell at all what he was saying.  After repeating it a fourth time, I made out the word "noise."  It hit me that Amazon was charging me $11 a month to play "brown noise" on my bedroom Alexa device.  I've played that as a background sleep noise for YEARS.  Didn't start in December.  I've literally played it for about 3-5 years, every single night.  Suddenly it apparently started charging me for it in December.  I never heard it ask me ANYTHING about a subscription and certainly never agreed to any such thing.  But that didn't convince this Amazon rep, who apparently could read my mind and insisted I absolutely did order it.  I grew increasingly annoyed, especially as he kept going silent for 20, 30, 40 seconds at a time without saying a word, no hold or anything.. just silence.  Finally I told him, "why are you being silent?  I don't know what you're doing."  He then hung up on me.  So much for customer service.  I called angrier now and spoke with a second rep.  She was so very sorry the first rep hung up on me.  If I would just take more time out of my Saturday night to explain everything all over again and verify myself again... which I had no choice but to do.  She took a complaint on the last rep, but said she couldn't help me.  I'd have to be transferred to Amazon music.  Mind you, by this time it's nearly 1 am in the morning on a Sunday morning.  She puts me on hold... and I wait and I wait and wait some more.  About 15 minutes she comes back and says "I'm sorry for the long wait.  I'm still in the queue to speak with Amazon music."  I told her I would wait.  She puts me back on hold... 20 minutes pass... 30 minutes pass... 40 minutes pass.  Finally I had to give up.  She never came back on the line to say anything.  Just the same canned music playing over and over and over and over on a loop.  Called again.  Asked for a supervisor, but my phone died because I'd been held on the line so long.  He didn't call back.  I gave up because I had to give up.  Otherwise, I'd have a stroke from my anger and high blood pressure.  Amazon, you suck. Every single time I have a problem now, this is what I encounter.  Amazon is no longer a great company.  It's a company that will cut every corner, that disrespects its customers and their time, and that cares only about its bottom line.  It will go the way of Sears because it deserves to.

On April 16, 2024, I received an Amazon Prime charge of $9.99. On April 15, 2024, I received an Amazon Prime charge of $16.53.I reached out to Amazon and was told by an Amazon rep that they could not see a charge for $9.99 when both charges are clearly seen on my bank statement. I filed a BBB complaint on April 16, 2024. Amazon reached out to me via email on April 19, 2024, totally ignoring my BBB complaint which is where I expected communication. I do not appreciate it when business circumvent BBB in order to avoid the complaints being listed on their website.The public has the right to know how all businesses conduct their business including when they are ripping off consumers and being unprofessional.I contacted my bank but I am not satisfied with Amazon's response to my complaint. I attached the BBB complaint, my bank statement double Amazon charges, and the emails from Amazon for your viewing.

Review Title: I ordered a phone and was delivered a‚Ä¶
Review Text: I ordered a phone and was delivered a book. I have been passed from pillar to post with customer service with different reps telling me to do different things. Review Text: So my order got canceled even though everything was saying it was a successful order. After the 18th time of having hope that I‚Äôd be transferred to the right department I ended chat. Then I tried doing the request a call. Three of the times it didn‚Äôt go through the call just went to my voicemail like that‚Äôs where they directed the call. Then I got an actual call, except the app automatically ended the call. Then I got to a woman she was nice and was able to help me and told me she needed to transfer me to the grocery department. I get to the grocery department and the representative has attitude with me. Now I understand what customer service reps I work for customer service in a banks fraud department trust me I understand. But if I‚Äôm telling you what‚Äôs showing up on my end that everything was successful and that I didn‚Äôt receive a failed payment method until an hour later stop telling me it sent a minute later I even have evidence of it as well as the alerts through the app being sent through an hour later. My problem didn‚Äôt get resolved but I asked if I‚Äôd still get my free delivery for being a first time customer, as it says on the main page as a headline, first time customers with orders over $50 gets free delivery. I asked if I would still get it and she said no you can‚Äôt get free delivery unless it‚Äôs over $100. I said it‚Äôs right here on the main change and she keeps arguing with me and then I told her go to the Amazon app for Amazon fresh and it says it as a headline and she said okay I‚Äôll escalate it to my manager to let them know about this issue, then waited 7 minutes in silence when I finally decided to end the call. THIS IS BY FAR THE worst customer service I‚Äôve ever received. Like I said I understand what you guys go through as CS reps but please Amazon EDUCATE YOUR REPS WITH ALL INFORMATION. No one knew anything

Review Title: Non existent customer service / nightmare delivery drivers
Review Text: I have been a member of Amazon for over 20 years, I love Amazon, most of the sellers are great, you can get absolutely anything at great value, but the past 1-3 years the outsourced 'lack of' Customer Service and the Delivery Drivers have driven me insane.What the feck has happened?!There is no longer a customer service, the online support has been ceased, you are passed from team to team and person to person, they tell you what you want to hear and all band together and nothing gets resolved.Jeff Bezos please sort this cr*p out.We pay for the products and the delivery service - we leave instructions for our safe place etc, and yet this is ignored over and over again. They even have the audacity to update the job stating the parcel has been handed to the customer - I'm not even home. An advisor has also changed my delivery instructions.This week I got really p*ssed off with it and was online with advisors and a so called manager during the early hours of the morning - what a total waste of my time. He just kept telling me how to add this info to my account. I was sent an email after asking me if I was happy with the service, yes or no, and to click on the relevant link, but the links don't open, so you can't provide feedback. I've emailed twice since with photos and no replies.The service and deliveries have become an absolute joke. After being such a long term loyal customer this has seriously made me think of leaving Amazon.So Amazon, what are you going to do about this? Am sure 1000s feel the same.

Review Title: Not recieving a refund for item I returned
Review Text: On January 29, 2024, I made a purchase of an Apple 2022 iPad Pro 12.9" Wifi + Celular, 512 GB from Amazon.it. Shortly after making the purchase, I came across another website where the same product was offered at a better price. I therefore decided to return it to Amazon.it and purchase it again from another seller.The return process was carried out through the DHL courier company, which delivered the package to Amazon.it. Confirmation of Amazon.it's receipt of the package was documented by the DHL courier, and I also have a letter from the courier company in which Amazon.it signed for the package upon receipt, at VIA PELLONI 5 41057 SPILAMBERTO MODENA, Italy.The shipment was posted on February 13, 2024 and delivered on February 16, 2024 at 10:51 a.m. The weight of the package was 1,795 kg. Despite having documentation confirming the delivery to Amazon.it, the company claims it never received the package.

Review Title: Be sure not to get ripped off
Review Text: Hi Guys Please except my apologies for the delay in sending in a review regarding which I believe that Amazon has resorted to cheating and illegal tactics. And I want to make you aware of this just in case it has happened to you. I noticed an unauthorised payment going out of my bank account to Amazon.com, now I have been a prime member with Amazon.Co.uk since 2011 and I have spent a lot of money with them. Now I contacted Amazon.Co.uk customer service regarding this unauthorised payment, they told me because the account was set up with Amazon.com. That it was Amazon.com that I had to contact, which I did so I explained to them the details of the payment. And I also told that this payment dated back to July 2018, so everyone please check your bank accounts and make sure that they haven‚Äôt set up a bogus account whereby you are paying them a monthly subscription by either paying it to Amazon.com or Amazon.Co.uk. Now as I have mentioned I have been paying for something that I have never used, and the payment has amounted up to ¬£700+, the account was set up via a visa payment. Now I will give them a little bit of credit, because after contacting them they have paid me back 22 months. But I have be paying for the subscription for a total of 81 months, but if they can pay me back for some of the money. Why can‚Äôt they pay me back the full amount, now during the passed few years I have been of ill health due to becoming disabled and been on a lot of medication which has had an impact on my mental health and I am more or less sure that if I would of had my facilities I would of picked up on this pay sooner rather than later. All this has been explained to them, but they are telling me that there system will only allow them to go back so far. And that there system won‚Äôt allow them to be able to generate a payment no further than the 22 months. I have spoke to Amazon.com via there chat room so that I have got some kind of record of what has been said, and I have also been in contact with them via telephone calls. If they had decided to reimburse me the full amount, I will be perfectly honest with you. I don‚Äôt think that I would be writing this review, but I am glad in a way that they haven‚Äôt paid me back the full amount. Because it has given me the chance to make you all aware of What Amazon are capable of doing now I am hitting a brick wall, now I have never read any of your reviews and I can see now how bad Amazon are being run. I have also had many problems with there delivery drivers,Now I thought that I had already written a review, but reading through the  reviews I noticed that it was not there, so please except my apologies for informing you later rather than sooner.

Review Title: Amazon: great in the US. Absolute trash in Europe.
Review Text: I'm from The Netherlands and I feel Amazon is a pretty sh*tt y company in Europe. In the US you get your stuff delivered to you the next day. In Europe... three weeks. You want to buy something in the US, click-and-buy. In Europe, you get this notification saying that you need to live in the US to be eligible to buy video's, TV-series, etc. In my country, Amazon is worse than the worst webshop, worse than the worst pirate bay download server. Review Title: Amazon driver THREATENED and ABUSED ME!!!!!!!
Review Text: Amazon driver was delivering to houses on my road. Parked his van fully across my driveway so that I could not get my car out. I was going out and needed to use my car and asked him to move so I could exit my driveway and he ignored me.  I told him to move immediately and he began walking to me and swearing aggressively. I ran to my front door and told him I was going to call the police and he threatened to "bust your head in". I had photos and immediately telephoned Amazon and also sent emails to the CEO and my MP. Amazon customer service replied and said they would telephone the next day but they never did. Instead they sent an email saying they called and did not get any answer, but they LIED because I did not receive any call. I have asked them to telephone so that they can investigate the matter and take action against the aggressive driver but they  still have not called. The driver was threatening and abusive so I have taken legal advice and contacted the police.  I am a woman and literally living in fear that the driver will come back.  If I am killed by their driver then I hope the media/public will report my story so that the driver does not get away with it. Amazon only cares about money, it does not care about the safety of women or customers!!!  They employ aggressive, angry, threatening men drivers who abuse and terrorise innocent people.

Amazon security is rubbish. Our family Amazon account has been fully hacked, and our hacker easily managed to change our account phone number, email and password on our Amazon account without a single barrier stopping that hacker. Now our hacker has access to our home address and bank cards in our Amazon account, which is really worrying. We received an email from Amazon that our old email address A has been changed to the new email address B, which was shocking because we never changed our email address. Amazon could have send us a link in that same email to give an option to undo this email change if it wasn't us, something that all big companies have for their customer account like gmail. Or Amazon could have send a code to our phone number or old email address that our hacker needed access to before that hacker could change our account email address or password so basically some sort of security barrier, but clearly Amazon thought that there was no need for any of these barrier even if everyones Amazon account contains peoples bank card and personal details plus our hacker can freely order stuff on our account and properly will do other suspicious acts. Who ever made Amazon website have clearly lacked some simple security standards. I called Amazon customer service (which Amazon customer service was hard to find because we didn't have access to our Amazon account) and they said that they cannot close our account that has been hacked because the email and phone number has been changed by our hacker and we also can no longer access it.

I‚Äôm done wasting my money and supporting this company.

Review Title: Delivery driver said he handed me parcel but I wasn't in. No refund or replacement from amazon. Amazon Awful.
Review Text: I am so distressed and upset at the way I have been dealt with by Amazon today. I used to think they were a good company. Not now. My deliveries used to arrive. Not now. So basically I ordered a couple of small items that would have fitted in the mailbox today. I got an email they would be delivered by 9pm. I was out of my apartment for about an hour. When I came back I checked my amazon account and it said my item had been delivered and handed to resident. Which it hadn't. This really annoyed me as it had not been delivered I was not in and it had not been handed to me. I really hate it when a delivery driver says they have handed something to you when they have not as its a complete lie. I live in an apt on the first floor and all I want is for someone to ring my bell and hand me my delivery. This rarely happens. I have written clear delivery instructions which are never read and I've complained before. If I'm not in go to my apt on first floor and leave outside my door. I don't want it thrown outside and I don't want it thrown downstairs in a communal area. I don't what it handed to people that live in other apts that I don't even know. So it takes me ages to find amazon's customer service number. As they keep changing it. Then I've to listen to lots of recorded stuff. The call gets cut off and I phone back. Then I have to go through a painstakingly long process to give my number and my email several times repeating every letter. Then they say there's no account with my email and my number despite me using amazing for years. Then finally then I've to go into my email. I can't understand the person I'm talking to they can't understand me. Why can't amazon employ people in local areas to deal with local issues. It's insanely hard dealing with amazon. I wasted hours today and it's after midnight and I'm still upset. I'm told sorry to hear you didn't receive your item I will help you. Then I'm transferred to some other team logistics or something and I got the rudest woman I've ever encountered on a phone call jia or something I honestly didn't get her name. I really wanted to report her for being absolutely horrific and completely upsetting me. She had zero empathy. I told her I just wanted what I had ordered as I had paid amazon and it was meant to be here. I said just send it next day delivery or give me a refund. She said no they were launching an investigation whatever the hell that means. And you have to wait 3 days! Hold on I've already waited 3 days for delivery and now I've to wait another 3 days. Before I can even get a refund or replacement. Are these jokers for real? With a guy that has lied about giving my parcel to me as I was not physically there. Where the hell do these parcels go? I have a severe back injury and one of the items was to help that and I was going into hospital in a few days I said look please just send out what I ordered. She had zero empathy and just kept taking over me saying only when the investigation has concluded. I said I will be in hospital then. She couldn't care less. I also said well the delivery driver has obviously lied that he handed me the parcel and I can prove I wasn't in. She then kept talking over me very negatively zero empathy and finally hung up! I've actually been in tears over her attitude and it's ruined my day. I phoned back again to complain about her but of course I couldn't as you get through to a call centre that couldn't care less. There's no official customer service team. I go through the whole drawn out process again with a nicer girl this time but still saying no refund no replacement. How is this even legal? Amazon failed to deliver what I paid for and already waited 3 days for. And now I've to wait another 3 days.  I asked to speak to a manager and then it was, the same robotic response our policy is bla bla bla. No human empathy. This is not on. Amazon need to get delivery drivers that deliver and stop telling lies that they have handed you a parcel. I feel like cancelling amazon account and I wish there was a better place I could order from. Thus whole experience has ruined my day. And I've been in tears and stressed out. Now I've to wait for the outcome of an investigation with a delivery driver who has already lied as he didn't hand me the parcel. Amazon sucks and I really dislike this company now and want nothing to do with them. I need the items that I ordered and they told me to order again but there's no guarantee I will get them and I have to wait 3 days if I even get a refund. I don't think this is legal. And Amazon are horrific now. I will be looking into ordering elsewhere. Amazon make out that you're almost not telling the truth or something. It's absolutely horrific customer service and if you've an injury or disability amazon couldn't care less. Inhuman and awful company now. Used to be brilliant. Very annoyed and disappointed. Amazon get delivery drivers that tell the truth.

That's *with* Amazon Prime membership, which, for $130/year, does not seem to provide the same fast shipping it used to. Given Amazon's horrible labor practices, its non-responsive customer service, and the frequency of counterfeit goods, I am going to try to stay away from them as much as I can.

Review Title: I've been a pretty frequent amazon‚Ä¶
Review Text: I've been a pretty frequent amazon customer over at least the last two decades. The downfall started with a decision to purchase a macbook pro for around $3000. A large purchase, but I had confidence that if anything went wrong amazon would right things quickly. I received a one time passcode or OTP as they refer to it. I greeted the amazon delivery person, I gave him the passcode several times- he kept repeating it back incorrectly. I took the package and remarked to my girlfriend that man they make macs light these days. I opened the package to find an obviously used and abused macbook box. I opened the box with an ever increasing heart rate as I knew at this point my worst fears were about to be realized. It was EMPTY! My girlfriend rushed out the door to the driver who was just down the street. He stated you want to look in the back of my truck? Nothing I can do, call amazon support. Of course I called right away. I sat on hold for at least 30-40 mins. Amazon's first attempt at resolving the issue was to tell me there was nothing that could be done since I gave them the OTP- they stated I should call the police???!!!! When I refused and stated I had already wasted my day with this whole situation they put me on hold again for many minutes. They finally returned and refunded my order. This person refunded me with the most disgust I've ever experienced in my years of customer service. She quickly said bye, none of the usual thanks for being an amazon customer... Little did I know the issues would only continue from here. Later that evening I received an email stating my account had most likely been hacked and all my orders were cancelled. Next I came to find out that any order around $100+ would require a OTP- meaning they send you a passcode via email a couple hrs before your order arrives that you're forced to give to the delivery person- meaning you have to be present all day long if you actually want to receive your order. That's exactly the opposite of what amazon was designed to be. I called in multiple times to have this obstruction / inconvenience removed. One person from logistics stated maybe I should buy my macbook from apple like he did? I asked if he ever bought anything on amazon for $100+ he stated no. After talking to several more people from all over the world one person agreed to give me a partial refund of around $79 of the $139 I was so exhausted I agreed to it. I now realize that it makes no sense, given it's only almost April 1st and a prorated refund would be $100+??? This has been a pretty ridiculous experience to say the least. I repeated my grievances multiple times and I don't think one person understood once, much less did they try and correct it or provide any kind of customer service. PS I'm still waiting for my $79 refund...

I have been an Amazon Prime member for numerous years. I am well aware of the purchase and return process. However, about three months ago, I have noticed a huge change in the return process. I ordered a small piece of furniture, worth $181.00. The item was damaged upon opening. I quickly filed a return on Amazon. I went to UPS, with the affixed label that I was provided, and they explained, I had to pay $240.00 in order to ship it back. The return label was not paid for by Amazon. I only had the item for less than a week and it was damaged. Why would any company expect me to pay that amount to ship it back? I have called Amazon at least a dozen times and every time I talk to someone new, I get a new answer. It‚Äôs a third party seller and we don‚Äôt get involved in that. After waiting three weeks with getting absolutely nowhere, I filed a dispute with American Express. Thank gosh for them because I would have never received a refund. I made the mistake and gave Amazon another try and ordered a bathingsuit a month ago. Here we go again! I returned it via post office per Amazon, with a delivery address to New Jersey, and item was delivered but no refund. Again, a third party seller. Even though, return address is in New Jersey. I had to call Amazon ten times so far and the A - Z process is ridiculous! They act like they are helping but they don‚Äôt! I am cancelling my Prime Membership and will never deal with this nonsense again! I heard that Amazon company sold off to third party sellers so buyers beware!! It‚Äôs scan now, if you ask me!

Review Title: Amazon issuing gift cards instead of refunds for returns
Review Text: I ordered and returned a number of items from Amazon.com in the month of February. Instead of the refunds being returned to the credit card I'd used to purchase them, Amazon took it upon themselves to open an Amazon gift card for me. This is so unethical it leaves me speechless. I was never notified that they were doing this, so if I hadn't placed an order in March I wouldn't have known I had several hundred dollars sitting on a gift card with my name on it. The customer service person did his best to transfer the refunded money back to my credit card but it will take another week for it to show up on my credit card -- so Amazon has had the use of my money for a month and I'm paying interest on money that should have gone back onto my credit card. I'd have given them 0 stars, if that were possible.

Now they say I can't get a credit to my Amazon Card because these last two orders were charged to my gift card. Review Title: Empty promises, poor service and disappointment
Review Text: It is worth pointing out that this happened with the US Amazon.com who decided to suspend my newly created account due to what they called ‚Äúsuspicious activity‚Äù(clearly a machine error). While I appreciate how this can help protect me, this turned into a nightmare experience.I placed an order to send to a friend as a surprise, when the account was suspended, my order containing various individual message was also canceled. I contacted customer service 4 times over the course of 1 week. Continually all agents kept on promising and reassuring me that my account will be reinstated in 24-48 hours as well as my order with each individual message and I was promised a $15 gift card for the trouble. I followed up on my account status 48 hrs after the initial contact and I was told my account is still suspended but it‚Äôs not their responsibility to reinstate it instead it was Accounts team. After failing to put me in contact with this team I was asked to grab a pen and paper to call this department myself. I requested a call back instead. The call was promised the same day. 3 days later no contact so I reached out to customer service again to be told again how they can‚Äôt do anything about it and should speak to another team. Having spoken to 6 agents over the phone and about 12 in chats I can‚Äôt begin to describe my frustration, disappointment and whirlpool of emotions. This last agent told me that there is no way my order can be recovered and that there is no such $15 credit in my account. Confused and upset I‚Äôm just speechless about this whole experience. I would recommend against Amazon.com at all cost. If you can order with another provider who values their promises and delivers quality , trust me it‚Äôs worth the extra dollar. Avoid dealing with their empty promises and poor quality (both services and goods).PS: there is still no resolution to my problem or any reasonable contact/communication with Amazon.comThe whole thing has literally turned from a computer/model error into a human led poor customer service.

Review Title: Jeff Bezos has the unique privilege on‚Ä¶
Review Text: Jeff Bezos has the unique privilege on being classified as a rilobber baron alongside many early 20th century figures. Amazon Export Services (AES) employs the cheapest 1* rated companies for international deliveries. It makes it imposdible to record a complaint. It tells a lot of lies on its invoice about how it will handle import processes. In New Zealabd, if your package is worth more than 1000 nzd, for which you have already paid import fees, your package sits in limbo forever. Aramex NZ, which Anazon employs, is a frachisee provider. There is one customs broker who tells a lot of lies about how the the package is due soon, when it has been held by customs for 17days. Mr Azmir Siddiqui (AamirS- his domain name is aramex.com in case you need to put his contact details together) is not inclined to respond to emails. The contact centre is in the phillipines and likely to hang up on you. Aamir is a bottleneck and nothing happens. He probably has too much paperwork in between delivery of 1* rated uber eats. Mr Danny Murphy, supposedluly the Canterbury General Manager of Aramex NZ (1.3* rating only because you cannot rate zero) is uncontactable. This is Amazon for you. The customer can only rate the seller who is not to blame. Customer cannot rate AES. Cunning.

If I could leave zero stars I would. Amazon has now entered into the new world of zero customer service sadly. They removed the option of print your own label. So now you are using your own time and gas to drive to one of the Amazon return sites which are 25+ mins one way from me. $7.99 to have UPS box it up and ship the return back --that is 30 mins 1 way. Basically, Amazon is driving customer into Kohls, Staples, Whole Foods and UPS the stores THEY choose to business with!! Then they present it as trying to keep trucks off the road. Who cares if its a truck or my car. The truth is they are saving a TON of money by inconveniencing their customers!!! A return took me 1 min, put it back in the box or bag it came in, print a label, slap it on and drop it in a UPS drop box --any time of the day or night--even midnight if needed. The box is 1 min drive. Now I have to chat with an Amazon representative they email me a label it takes about 20 mins of my time. So RIDICULOUS and beyond maddening!! So happy Amazon is using their customers to save money. Is Amazon going to pay for gas and time for their customer returns to the stores they do business with?????? I do not choose to drive to any of those stores. I was a HUGE amazon customer HUGE-- I am done now--I can not take it anymore!
Amazon is Communism, i won‚Äôt buy item from Amazon anymore.

I have contacted and paid international phone-fees several times (5+) to get access to my amazon.com account with digital purchases at least 5+ times over the last 5+ years.Each time the same thing happens.. After I finally get to a representative who can disable the 2FA from the old phone number it works for 2 weeks to 1 month and then the old phone number is re-enabled as 2FA on the account - completely without any action from my part.Amazon doesn't prioritize Account Recovery, otherwise there would be steps for customers to follow to disable 2FA indefinetily and regain access to the account.This is clearly not a priority however, they must assume everyone is creating new accounts - or simpy don't care.It is extremely illogical that current account login information is overwritten with old information (incl. 2FA phone number) but this is what happens.I can't access any of my digital purchases because amazon keeps locking me out of my account. This has never been an issue from my part. This is an amazon IT department technical issue relating to the account logins.I can't be the only person in the world this happens to, but I can only imagine that they are losing business cuz I have avoided amazon in every of my purchases if available elsewhere anytime, I'd even pay more to avoid amazon because this site is simply broken.What I think happens as a qualified software developer is that I think amazon has some legacy software between its site networks that might restore or synchronize an old backup incl. 2FA between accounts.There is no other logical explanation.But what is logical and completely reasonable to understand is that I will avoid amazon at all costs for all purchases.Horrible company, horrible services, horrible customer support. Avoid this trap.

Rating: zero StarsI recently experienced unacceptable service from Amazon. The lack of clear communication and effort to address this misunderstanding shows a significant flaw in Amazon's customer verification and support process.This incident has drastically diminished my trust in Amazon, and I caution others about using their services until they improve their approach to customer care and respect.

Review Title: The Earth's most customer centric company? Don't make us Laugh!
Review Text: WARNING - Do not use Amazon as a platform to keep your book reviews. I was stupid enough to do so for several years. A process I enjoyed and one that caused no issues. In April 2023, I submitted a review which was rejected because they said 'it breached the guidelines' Examining the guidelines it was not obvious how, but I re-wrote it, resubmitted it and heard no more. The same happened in November 2024 and then in December and completely out-of-the-blue I got an email saying 'I'd breached guidelines and my review rights had been withdrawn'. What they did not say was all my review were removed. Gone - years of input, a real treasure trove of memories of my reading hobby. From that time I tried hard to communicate with Amazon to ask that they be restored, but they were rude, hostile, they continually obfuscated, were totally unclear, seemed unable to grasp basic concepts and their responses were frequently unintelligible and on several occasions they lied. They denied repetitively they have a complaints department and they showed a general lack of any personal care or concern. This is a company that strives (so says its mission) to be the earth's most customer centric company. This is an insult to it's customers - they might delivery parcels ok, but when things go wrong they it is clear that they have the  'Earth's most incompetent customer service department'

Attempted to reinform customer service today, and at least expected to receive some Tech Support for prolific hacking of my paid Music Unlimited and paid Prime Video accounts.This had been reported to Police and Action Fraud, for some time now.Been a paying customer since 2015.This involved hijacking of my account through my devices and the downloading of movies and music from individuals I had identified, to the authorities.The fraudulent linking of much equipment such as a Fire-stick which I have never owned, in the registered devices menu.On calling customer service to end these paid services due to this intrusion, I received a Scottish Lady who seemed helpful but when she informed me I was being passed onto tech support I was left on and then hung up on.Second call to customer services involved attempting to communicate with a sarcastic female who did not seem interested, gave long deliberate hmmmms and asaaahs and told me tech support wasn't on call.I asked why and she just repeated the same answer.I then received an email from this agent informing me that she was ending my services, deleting all accounts and data records from my memberships of paid Prime services with Amazon.I had not requested this and found this suspicious, considering the continuous hacking and downloading of data from Music  unlimited and Prime video account of mine, which I had paid for and as I had reported.Third operator seemed marginally interested enough to correct this involuntary action by the previous operator.It seems a dark cloud has descended on Amazon on multiple levels and I won't be paying for any more services untill this has lifted.

Review Title: Amazon won‚Äôt honor the Amazon Promotional Credit bonus for Samsung S24 and other phones. It‚Äôs false advertising.
Review Text: I purchased a Samsung S24 phone on Amazon for a family member because she requested it due to the $150 Amazon.com Promo Credit that was included with the phone. Their promo credit allows the buyer to spend $150 on items sold and shipped by Amazon. Seemed like a good deal for someone who wants to buy some extra accessories or other items.The instructions clearly said that the promo was applied automatically and that the buyer would receive an email after the phone gets delivered. The phone was delivered 2 days ago and still no Amazon promo credit. I spoken to 12 customer service agents and NONE of them knew wth they were talking about and gave non-sensical responses. They acted like the promo didn‚Äôt exist and asked me to send them links and screenshots to the phone even though they have my order and can see the product listing. I eventually gave up and my relative (who was already disappointed by this) asked for the phone to be returned. I went online to see if anyone else had this experience and I saw posts the past months where other buyers had the same problem. What a waste of time and why am I not surprised?!

Review Title: Honestly I could not make this up.
Review Text: Honestly I could not make this up.I landed back in the UK a month ago and ordered a new sim/mobile number on contract.  Updated my Amazon account using my mobile.  Went to my account a few days later to order something but kept getting a wrong password message.  I reset my password and placed an order using my new debit card.  Changed the address to my new address.Problem was it wasn‚Äôt my account.  Someone had my mobile number before me and I had inadvertently hacked their account.  There address, their card details, their order history, all there for me to read.I contact Amazon and we go through the process of sorting out the mess.  They cancel my order for me and I was promised that no payment would be taken from my card.I re-order on my own account.After checking my bank account I find I‚Äôve been billed twice.  I don‚Äôt get the order twice, just the money removed from my account.I have called several times to sort this mess only to be told by various agents that they can help me as the transaction I am disputing is‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..on someone else‚Äôs account!!!I now appreciate why Jeff is doing so well.As of today the 14th of March I am still waiting for my money back.

- A customer of 8 YearsAs a company in terms of offering customers value it  undeniably does so. I dont use their software services much as I already had spotify/ youtube but have still got value from prime delivery through their food and items as well as occasional prime video and audible. There's more they can be doing environmentally to offset such a large footprint but due to how logistically efficient they are it brings down the CO2 emissions per parcel compared to driving to collect the same item yourself! They can also invest in electric or alterenative fuel methods for their vehicles.Paper and cardboard packaging on all orders is recyclable/reusable and I've been able to support small online/sustainable businesses through the marketplace The shopping experience is excellent and the delivery very professional.The value offered is great, and with such a large selection of products and reviews its not difficult to find what you're after. The tracking and history of orders is exceptional, as well as the ability to create multiple lists (wish lists) that could be shared.Used items can also be found on the platform too, which is a better choice for the environment than brand new, I've recently found a growing offering of recycled plastic items which is even better as it creates a demand to get the products out of our environment.I barely touched on the software/ streaming applications and services offered which is a large part of the subscription and could be worth the monthly fee in it's own right.I'd be quite surprised if you had anything but a positive experience. I can't comment from an empoyee/ seller side of the company but as a customer I keep coming back and will continue to aslong as I receive great service. As buyers we need to continue to carefully consider the demand our purchases place on the environment but it's good to know that Amazon can align with this goal shoud we choose to.I look forward to seeing more sustainably powered vans adopted and encouragement for smaller local and quality goods sellers promoted on the home page.

Review Title: Amazon closed my account without an explanation
Review Text: A couple of weeks ago, Amazon abruptly canceled my account. I was attempting to access my account to make a purchase, and upon reaching the login page and entering my credentials, the following message appeared: ‚ÄòYour account has been terminated for improper use of Amazon services. We have sent you an email with more information.‚Äô (It was written in Italian, I translated it with Google translate). However, no email arrived in my inbox despite repeated attempts. I began searching online to see if anyone else had encountered the same issue. I found an email address where I could file a complaint. They responded stating: ‚Äòas already communicated to you, we have closed this account. From our records, we have previously terminated your account for violating the terms of our user agreement. Following termination of your account due to breach of contract, you are not permitted to open a new account or use another account to place orders on our site. Following a thorough evaluation, we have decided not to restore your full access to this account. It will therefore not be possible for you to place orders on our site. Any digital content purchased with this account is still available to you. To access the content, click the Manage content and devices link in the My Orders menu on Amazon.it.‚Äô Despite my attempts to seek clarification, they provided the same generic responses, failing to explain the exact reason for the account termination and how I violated the terms of the agreement. Furthermore, they mentioned that I could still access digital content purchased with the account, which was untrue since my account was closed, leaving me without access to anything.Adding insult to injury, I own a Kindle that was linked to my account. A few days later, I attempted to read a book on my Kindle. As I am Russian and my Amazon account is Italian (and all the books in the Amazon store are either in Italian or English), I purchase eBooks from Russian websites and download them via USB from my PC to my Kindle. However, that night when I opened my Kindle, it was EMPTY!!! All my books were gone! And on the screen was the login page to the Amazon account, which I no longer had access to. Here arises an interesting question: how did they learn that my account was closed if my device was not connected to Wi-Fi? This implies that Amazon has another means of controlling my data and my device. All the books I downloaded, all the notes I made in the books, all the progress I made (I usually read several books at the same time) - everything was gone! An empty Kindle!!!I am deeply disappointed and angry with the situation and feel utterly helpless in resolving this problem. My account was canceled without explanation, I cannot ask questions through the app's customer service as my account is closed, Amazon support has ceased responding to my emails, my Kindle books have been deleted, and there is no one who seems to care or can offer assistance in any way to address this issue.

Review Title: Amazon's Seller Policies Facilitate Fraud and Exploit Sellers
Review Text: As a seller on Amazon's platform, I must express my utter disappointment and frustration with their blatant disregard for the well-being of their sellers. It's evident that Amazon prioritizes profit over the integrity of its marketplace, as they consistently side with consumers even in cases of obvious fraud, leaving sellers to bear the brunt of the consequences.One of the most egregious issues plaguing Amazon's marketplace is their lenient approach towards fraudulent claims made by customers. Despite ample evidence proving that customers have received the items they ordered, Amazon readily refunds them at the expense of the sellers. This not only results in financial losses for sellers but also creates an environment ripe for exploitation.The fact that Amazon retains the fees they charge sellers, even in cases of fraudulent refunds, highlights their complete lack of accountability. Sellers invest their time, resources, and efforts into the platform, only to be met with indifference and exploitation by Amazon.Unlike on my own website, where stringent policies deter fraudulent activities, Amazon's lax approach enables customers to exploit the system with impunity. The frequency of such occurrences is alarming and severely undermines the profitability of selling on Amazon.It's evident that Amazon's policies are designed to prioritize market share over the well-being of sellers. Their relentless pursuit of dominance in the e-commerce industry has led them to sacrifice the livelihoods of countless sellers in the process. It's high time that sellers unite and hold Amazon accountable for their unethical practices.In conclusion, Amazon's facilitation of fraud and exploitation of sellers is unacceptable. Their policies not only undermine the integrity of the marketplace but also pose a significant threat to the livelihoods of sellers. It's imperative that sellers take a stand against such injustice and demand accountability from Amazon.

Review Title: Reconsider your loyalty to this company.
Review Text: I have been a loyal customer to Amazon for 10+ years. My household items are practically all ordered on Amazon. I have never missed a return window. I started a return 2 weeks ago and then had a very stressful time with my family. I realized I missed bringing my items to UPS by a few days and contacted Amazon Customer Service for support. Customer service had me wait for 90+ minutes (first via a lost help chat and then via phone with long hold times and a transfer to a new team), only to tell me that there was nothing they would do for me.

Amazon has resorted to cheating and illegal tactics.  They receive and accept items for return, process the return, and then weeks later, charge you for the return, citing that you must upload your photo identification, even though they accepted and received your items already, with no mention of that requirement anywhere in their policy.  And, at times, they insist that an item is not eligible for return, even if it says that it is eligible on the website and in your order details.

Review Title: File complaint with BBB if ARC does not respond
Review Text: Tired of waiting for ARC (Amazon Claims Department) to process my claim, I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.  Within 12 HOURS I got two phone calls and an email from the lawyer representing ARC, expressing his wish to settle.  The next day, I got another email or phone call from the same lawyer. In the email he stated he agreed to what I had claimed.  And I gave the lawyer permission to cut the check by email. I am sharing this because I am so surprised at how expediently they want to avoid a lawsuit.  It must not look good to have high numbers of lawsuits filed against Amazon to report in their Annual Report to their shareholders.  "Claim # AMZ.  Christina is the person handling the case.On a rainy day, an Amazon driver attempted to back out of my driveway, skidding down and running over my mailbox.  The van got stuck on the mailbox post, and a tow truck was called to pull out the van.  The damage to the lawn and the mailbox is well documented in video and photos, which ARC received.  Most recently, ARC stated that since I had filed for lawn damage 3 years ago, this is a repeat claim.   And demands that I submit a photo of the lawn repair from three years ago because the present lawn damage may be a replicated claim.  And I quote Christina from ARC representing Amazon.com.   "As for the previous damages and showing the repairs, this is a new policy that has been put in place. Unfortunately this alerts us to people who have filed multiple times for damages."  My argument is when new damages are inflicted by Amazon drivers,  Amazon should pay for damages no matter when it occurs.  When I sent her the email from three years ago, which never mentioned a photo she was using to reject the claim, she stated that she would look into it.  It is impossible to produce a photo from three years ago that was not taken or requested.  It is such a nonsense to reject a claim.  And Christina will ignore me until I bug her again; this has been going on for over THREE months!    It is utterly surprising that Amazon has resorted to this kind of CUSTOMER UNFRIENDLY practice.  Amazon.com is NOT a customer-friendly company!  I will file a claim with the small claims court.  I am so disappointed at how awful Amazon has turned out.  Seeing the same type of claim as mine here shows that this is not just one ARC representative who has gone rogue. It is Amazon's policy.

They give you a large window which is fine you know what to expect. The driver calls me to confirm the delivery it is my turn and says he is 15 minutes out. The installer called me earlier and said he would be able to do the install today. When the driver called and said he was 15 minutes out I let the installer know. An hour goes by and the driver never shows up the installer does. I spent the next hour calling customer service trying to track everything down. Finally I hear back that the driver will be there 30 mons to an hour. Finally almost 3 hours later the driver shows up. He shows up with my sticker on a treadmill which is barely stuck to the package at this point. I had to pay the installer to Come out and not install the TV which I have already been charged for and didn't receive. I am out almost 3k. My next few hours trying to contact customer service were the most frustrating I ever had. I actually was hung up on stating this is a "professional" conversation. I am out 3k and they think that is "professional". I should mention to that the TV is now out of stock as well. They are saying they can have another week but I'm not optimistic. I'm still out 300$ for the Install that I will never get back. I don't even know of it is worth seeking counsel on this or not. As it stands I am out of alot of money with nothing to show for it.

Review Title: NEVER use a product box as a shipping box...!
Review Text: On February 28th I returned a sump pump and check valve. I wanted to send them in one box so I used an empty Remington Solar fan box I bought from them in November. The return was delivered on March 1st and I was told by Amazon CS it would be 15-20 days before being issued a refund.Today I got an email reading I was refunded for the Remington Solar Fan I bought three months ago and $311.99 was sent back to Affirm. I had to contact CS over the phone and tell them there was no fan in the box, I used it as a shipping box for the pump and valve. Payments go instantly, refunds take 3-5 days to process and I won't see the $311.99 back in my checking account until Tuesday or Wednesday. Then I have to call Amazon CS and reimburse them for the refund sent in error. Then I still have to wait until the 20th to be refunded for the pump and valve, if at all, and if not may have to have Affirm dispute the account which can take 60 days or more. Amazing they just blindly issue a refund for a product I didn't request a return for and is wildly past the return window. This one will be a REAL cliffhanger. I already contacted the seller that I didn't request to return the fan in case Amazon sends it to them.
Poor customer service unauthorized charges

Review Title: amazon can ship you an empty box and you can do nothing about it!
Review Text: What went wrong this time?  Simply put, amazon delivered an empty package in place of an Intel CPU.  But it gets worse.  The seal on manufacturer's package had clearly been broken BEFORE it was shipped from the amazon distribution centre, as the amazon shipping box had not been tampered with.  Would amazon provide a replacement or refund?  Nope!Instead, amazon insist that I report the matter to the local police to get a Crime reference and a crime report.The police provide the Crime reference but will only give the crime report to amazon but amazon insist that I need to get the report to them.So now I am playing-piggy-in-the-middle, with the police saying they will only talk to amazon and amazon wanting me to get the crime report to them and refusing to talk to the police.Meanwhile, I am ¬£550 out of pocket!  And amazon call themselves the most Customer centric business on the planet!UPDATE:After wasting half a day with email exchanges between myself and amazon or myself and the police, every email to amazon gets the same response: We couldn't verify the details of the Crime Reference you provided.So the Crime ref provided by the police is not good enough for amazon and "Therefore, we're unable to assist you any further in this matter. We would ask you to resolve the issues and reshare the Crime Reference with us".So the police have issued the Crime reference but amazon do not like it so the process stops and there is nothing I can do.I have had 7 phone conversations with amazon and it is like talking to a wall. They want me to provide the crime report, which is impossible as the police will only give that to amazon.

Review Title: Avoid the try before you buy option - it's broken - just like the rest of the company
Review Text: It may be temtping to  use try before you buy - which i did and when i tried to pay for the item - my payment was  declined because Amazon's admin and payment systems are rubbish. I had 3 customer support staff try to fix it - they all blame my bank and my bank explain that Amazon just dont know  what they are doing. We've had a lot of theft in our neighborhood of packages left outside of homes. We've requested on Amazon that all deliveries be left at our front door not the entry gate, a 20 step walk to the front door. Also, on the gate is a sign with Amazon on it stating deliveries made to front door. Lately that's totally ignored by the drivers and tonight the driver left 4 big boxes outside the gate and my wife was able to catch him getting into his truck and he just ignored her and ran away. We order lots from Amazon and don't want it stolen and also I'm 80 years old and home today from another medical procedure so would be nice to have our delivery request honored and not ignored by these lazy drivers. The following are the order numbers which were left at the gate with the explicit sign to deliver everything to the front door.111-4651581-4353842, 111-4651581-4353842,113-7714709-5873865, 111-4651581-4353842Because of our age we rely on these deliveries so don't want them stolen!Finally we did get the dresser delivered with one of the drawers broken. Drivers who were from Wayfair as they wore Wayfair shirts and drove a Wayfair truck we noted to them the broken drawer and did not sign for the delivery. The driver stated he would notify Wayfair and that they'd send someone to fix the drawer or replace the dresser. Next we find out the driver most likely told Wayfair nothing and we were billed full tilt for the dresser. So the battle now going on 3 months goes on and what more can I say but I would never buy from Wayfair again and hope others that might, would read this saga and do the same not ordering from them.

Amazon do not give me choices on what shipping carriers to use for my orders.  I tried to order and used 1 day shipping in hopes that they will use UPS or FedEx.  They still use USPS.  I will not ever order from Amazon again till I can pick to use UPS or FedEx for shipping.   No more orders from me.

Running around by getting transferred from one agent to the other, no one knows what they are doing. It feels like the body without a brain.  Absolutely frustrated and horrified at this company's customer care.

I strongly caution anyone who buys from Amazon to LOOK FOR ALTERNATIVE VENDORS as I ordered and paid ¬£483.00 + ¬£4.99 for 24 hour premium delivery for a brand new Gigaset GX6 smartphone from Amazon on 15/09/2023 and was fraudulently sent an unsealed / opened used ¬£282.00 phone in a tatty water-soiled box. Even though I rang and reported the problem within an hour of opening the box and provided pictures I was not provided with a replacement which I requested on at least a dozen occasions when communicating with 18 different employees and was instead just repeatedly advised about returns and had to wait 28 days to get my money back. As an Amazon customer of over 12 years I am disgusted with their response especially as they make the most OUTRAGEOUS CLAIM of aiming to be the "MOST CUSTOMER-CENTRIC COMPANY ON EARTH". The companies who I have ordered from in the Asian continent may take longer for their items to arrive if I am prepared to wait but at least they are HONEST IN THEIR INTENTIONS and if there is an issue, they genuinely attempt to make amends. 	It appears that while Amazon get orders and their balance sheet is ticking over then nothing else matters, the customers are an afterthought, and their staff seem primed to stick to a rigid script designed to repel customers seeking to get redress for any wrongs that they have experienced.Amazon need taking down a peg or 2 as they have become incredibly arrogant as their financial clout has gone to their heads and THEY NOW HAVE A CONTEMPT FOR THEIR CUSTOMERS which they try to camouflage with the absurd claim of being the "MOST CUSTOMER-CENTRIC COMPANY ON EARTH"Have you ever heard such garbage???Please pen your reviews as these are the only real safeguards we have against the injustices that us as consumers experience when dealing with these commercial titans because when they are in the wrong they just say sorry and there is no empathy shown just cold hard invoicing.Remember it is your choice where you decide to spend your money and companies only listen when their profits start decreasing.

Review Title: Amazon is a plague on the planet earth
Review Text: It is a textbook example of capitalism gone mad. Squeeze out the competition to such a degree that you're answerable to no-one. Become such a monopoly that cities outbid each other to offer tax-incentives to build one of their modern day slavery 'fulfilment' centres in their locality. And when something goes wrong who is there to talk to? Chatbots, phonebots and livechat with Indians who have no authority to do anything but read out scripts. There is no accountability. And all the while we sit here addicted to plastic tat, fuming at delivery drivers who are paid peanuts per parcel, powerless as Amazon evades tax on an industrial scale while valued at multiple trillions of dollars. How are the state schools doing in your area? Hospitals? Police force well funded? Roads in good nick? No, they're not in my neighbourhood either. That's thanks to mega-corps like Amazon whose stock price has rocketed while your teachers and nurses go to food banks.

Review Title: Package tracking stated "delivered", but it wasn't.
Review Text: Package tracking stated "delivered", but it wasn't. The ordering was straightforward and the delivery to a business address was clear. The tracking status was changed to "delivered" - allegedly personally to the recipient - but nothing had been delivered. Following Amazon's guidance, we waited 48 hours before trying to contact them - which they don't make easy. Speaking to the customer service advisor they offered a replacement or refund. We chose replacement as we wanted the items. As potential future customers we wanted to know whether Amazon would be safe and reliable by asking what had caused the delivery failure and to receive an email or phone call describing how the problem had been resolved. Either the driver accidentally scanned the item and then binned, stole, or lost it; or the driver delivered it to the wrong address; or the driver left it outside the building and lied about handing it to the recipient. None of these are acceptable. The first customer service advisor told us the vehicle was moving and that the package would probably be delivered late. They then gauranteed that it would be delivered within 48 hours (it wasn't). The second customer service advisor offered the replacement or refund and refused to offer any communication about what went wrong and what they were doing about it. Amazon, you have multiple systemic failures in your system and your refusal to engage with curious and unsatisfied customers does not fill us with confidence regarding your services.

What happened to Amazon???Been a customer for over 20 years and I had so much trust with Amazon until what happened today...For reference:2/19I placed a high value item order (a smartphone) with my Prime account. 2/20 Amazon first updated item to be delivered by 2/23.2/23 Item not arrived and pushed to the next day.2/26 Still no delivery and no more tracking update. Upon contacting Chatbot, delivery date pushed to 2/27.2/28 Live online chat agent report item is lost by carrier and I need to fill out an incident report. Requested phone call from Amazon that I wanted to cancel my order and get refund ASAP.Phone assistant claims the item was never lost and should deliver on 2/28 but due to my cancelation request, item will go back to Amazon and refund can take up to a month. I asked what happened if the item is indeed lost per the other agent's claim and never returned to Amazon? Agent has no knowledge of the consequences that may affect my refund process. Now I'm left feeling extremely concerned without my highly anticipated new phone and no refund in time to repurchase it before I travel abroad.The huge disconnect between the Chat and the Phone customer services providing inconsistent information/solutions has made me lost my trust with Amazon. On top of that, major problems with the security of high value item shipment.I am ok with longer delivery time if it's stated in advance. However, I don't feel safe as a customer when items were advertised with Prime shipping that came without proper updates resulting lost or never delivered package.Amazon was known for their quality and fast services, but sadly, I would need to find alternatives from now on.

BEWARE OF AMAZON!  I paid for some recent orders for a birthday party with gift cards, specifically because I don't want Amazon to have my bank info.  (In America, we are free to shop anonymously, but Amazon seems determined to stop that.) When I placed another order to use up the balance on my gift card, I got the message below.  I've wasted hours trying to either get my merchandise or my money back for the gift card. Presently, I have neither.ü§¨"Your Amazon account is temporarily on hold."Hello,"We have detected unusual payment activity on your Amazon account [An Amazon gift card is unusual?!]. For your protection, we have temporarily placed your account on hold and placed any pending orders [that I already paid for!] or subscriptions on hold as well."If we are unable to confirm your payment information within 72 hours, your pending orders will be canceled. Your account will remain on hold until we are able to confirm that you are the authorized owner of the payment method used in the recent transaction [How can I prove I own a gift card??!!!!]."To restore access to your account, sign in and follow the on-screen instructions. You will have the option to upload a document [A billing or banking statement!!ü§¨] with the required information to verify your account. Once you have provided this document, we will review it and respond within 24 hours. [So if I don't, they keep the money I paid for the gift card?!!]"When uploading a document to verify the ownership of a payment method [I have to do all this to buy something with a gift card at Amazon?!üò≥], be sure that the name, address, payment type, and relevant transaction information are clearly visible. For your security, only display the last 4 digits of the payment method number..."HOW AND WHY WOULD I PROVIDE THIS INFO IF I PAID WITH A GIFT CARD?!  Their whole retail operation is clearly a ruse to get your sensitive information into their database.  You can't buy anonymously from them.  BOYCOTT AMAZON to do at least a little something to fend off the Chinese-style fascist state they want!   They chose their name appropriately from the outset:  AMAZON - to dwarf all us little people and force us to submit to their will.  Americans BEWARE!

Review Title: Terrible Seller and Customer Service Experience
Review Text: I have been an Amazon customer for 15 years but unfortunately I will not be renewing my Prime membership or ordering from Amazon anymore. I had ordered a computer and was sent the wrong computer. I sent it back and did get my refund right  away. I ordered another computer from a different seller and was sent the wrong computer once again. I received an approval from the seller immediatly to return it, so I returned it immediately. This particular seller decided to not issue a refund. I reached out to him and he was telling me how he is "investigating" it, even though he sent the wrong computer.  However, he used the "investigation" as an excuse to hold my money hostage for weeks. I really needed my money back as computers cost alot of money and I needed to buy another one since I had dropped and broken mine. I reached out to Amazon customer service and the customer service rep profusely apologized and said they would submit the prime A-Z guarantee ticket and also give me a $10 gift certificate credit to my Amazon account for my troubles. I was pleased about this and was immediately sent a survey in which I gave raving reviews of the customer service I had just received. However, as time passed,  I hadn't heard a word nor did I receive any confirmation email and also didn't see any $10 gift card credit. I had to take time out to reach customer service again and the new agent said, I'm so sorry the agent before me never submitted the ticket for refund request and did not give you the $10 credit. I couldn't believe it and wondered what kind of customer service is this? So this new rep and me went back and forward with a bunch of bs they were telling me that this computer  isn't covered with A-Z guarantee and there is nothing they can do. I reminded the agent it WAS listed as Prime and they are incorrect and then I started asking what is wrong with Amazon sellers and customer service at Amazon? I told this agent I have witnessed some of the sellers and customer service going downhill fast. I asked them if Amazon is supporting their sellers stealing from their customers  even when they order a Prime listed product. All of a sudden it was a miracle as the rep decided to issue my return. I asked him, how about issuing me the $10 credit also. This rep said, oh yes, of course, but it will take at least a couple hours to register in your account. At this point, it was no surprise that I never have received the $10 gift card credit nor any notice about it even being initiated. Needless to say, I am bewildered. I decided to get a Costco membership the next day and have already found replacements for many things I've ordered over the years with Amazon and set up to have my account not renew my Prime membership in April. Something is seriously wrong at Amazon now and they lost me as a customer.  I have ordered thousands of dollars each year for many years. Here is a statement from Jeff Bezos I found on the Internet. ‚ÄúWe have always wanted to be Earth‚Äôs Most Customer-Centric Company.  We won‚Äôt change that. It‚Äôs what got us here.  But I am committing us to an addition.  We are going to be Earth‚Äôs Best Employer and Earth‚Äôs Safest Place to Work.‚Äù  My question to Jeff is....what kind of "addition"  have you established in the workplace that allows shady sellers and awful customer service? I looked online and found a bunch of complaints about the seller who people are saying is an outright thief. It took me two minutes to run the company name and find this information. It took me to long to figure out how to see the actual Amazon seller reviews on which seems like it is hidden it's so hard to find now. I wrote a review stating what happened,  but to date I can't see it on his Amazon seller account and he's still on Amazon selling his computers! This is not acceptable.

Review Title: I purchased a mobile phone in November‚Ä¶
Review Text: I purchased a mobile phone in November 2023 for a Christmas present.  This was used from the 26th December to the 23rd January and then completely stopped working.  The seller refused a refund stating it was out of the guarantee.  I spoke to Amazon Customer Services on the 26th January, I was apparently passed to a supervisor who apologised for the problem.  I advised that this had a years Amazon Guarantee and it wasn't that i didn't like it it was because it was completely broken.  The CS person advised that I return this to their returns warehouse in Dumfremline Fife.  He advised to send a copy of the returns receipt to the CS email address.  I returned this by Royal Mail on the 26th January by Special delivery.  I sent confirmation of this to there CS email with a copy of the receipt showing the tracking ref number.  This was received by them on the 27th January at 10.18am.  I have contacted them multiply times, every time they ask me to send the return receipt to them again as they haven't received it but I have the email response from the CS email on the same day to say they have it.  I have sent 2 complaint emails to their customer complaints department and not had a response.  I spoke to the specialist team on  the 12th February, they asked that I send the information again which I did and I got a email response stating I would hear in 3 days. I didn't so I wrote to them they said I had to wait until the 26th February.  Today I chased them as I hadn't heard only to be told nothing they can do I need to go back to the seller but they had my phone. I emailed no reply and so I called, CS would not put me through to the specialist team nor a supervisor.  She told me I had returned the phone to the vendor which wasn't the case.  She said they didn't have the returns receipt and was not listening to me say that they have my phone.  I have sent them 2 emails asking for the phone to be sent back and they are ignoring this. So they now have my money and my phone and I have paid for return postage that I have not been reimbursed and I can no longer take this up with the seller as I don't have the phone.  Absolutely so angry.  My prime membership is being cancelled as this company has absolutely no contactable customer service not chain of correspondence with regards to a complaint.
The package is missing and they say that they can‚Äôt do nothing and we have to contact police‚Ä¶

Going downhill fast.When it comes to searching for items, Ebay has always been superior. Search for a frying pan on ebay, you'll get frying pans in whatever order you choose, on Amazon you will get frying pans but many other items, plus a different search may find other prices. Delivery charges are not always available until you start the order whilst ebay shows p&p or is often included. On Ebay a lot of items from China can be found in my country and that is reflected in the few days to delivery. I don't mind waiting a few weeks for an item but today it said "Delivery by 8pm today" but after I had waited in all day at 8.03pm it said, "Delivery now in 5 days time".I have no problem waiting but if communication regarding delivery is not forthcoming until AFTER the promised delivery date, that is unacceptable, if they told me yesterday, no problem but after wasting a day, that's not good customer service.

Amazon platform was designed as a, "online retail outlet" for businesses and people to sell on.It wasn't enough to put many mom & pop stores out of business, their greed took over and they turned their backs on the very same people that built their business, the sellers.Once Amazon analyzed sales reports and repeat sales they decided to screw the seller and began to sell their own branded products like batteries etc.They used the US Postal Service, FEDEX and UPS until they decided to operate delivery services.They place their "ads" prominently when you search for a product, giving them a greedy, unfair advantage.If that wasn't enough their Prime Services have gotten more expensive and they pushed back their delivery guarantees.Prime has increased, Amazon Music has increased, Audible has increased and NOW, after paying for an inferior "Prime" product that continues to decline, they decided to put ads on Prime Video and if you want "ad free" it is an additional $2.99 per month.Amazon Prime is inferior to Netflix as I have no issues streaming on Netflix or other Apps on tv, but Amazon constantly has lag issues and connection issues and doesn't respond.I have already been trimming my Amazon reliance, left Amazon Music, left Audible, using Amazon much less and can't wait to pull the plug on Amazon completely.I heard FEDEX is now going to compete with Amazon and in Fall of 2024 they are supposed to be launching their own online selling platform!! I can't wait!!

Review Text: I bought 3 mini blink cameras just over 11 months ago unfortunately 1 of the cameras stopped working I got in touch with  tech support on line they carefully ran me through what had to be done so they could remotely check the camera .they found it was a fault with the hardware they are sending me a free replacement camera ,there support with this matter was dealt with promptly and professionally ,thank you blink team

My son was scammed and ripped off by Amazon!!! In general, I love Amazon and their products and services. But recently my son who is 18 opened an Amazon account and I wanted to teach him how to use and order from Amazon. Of course, we ordered goods like "warm socks". A few days later the courier delivered to the wrong address well, according to the photo of the 'proof of delivery' we were able to prove that it was not our address and house and of course it was refund done. A few weeks later we tried to order again exactly the same and guess what, the same again! This time he got a "suspicious activity warning" warning on my son's account and I tried to speak to customer service to confirm it wasn't his fault! A few months later he ordered 'headphones' which cost around ¬£100 so guess what, same thing happened again!!! We were at home and no delivery only an email that you received the parcel...?! I called again and told the situation that we did not receive the shipment, I have security camera footage and can send proof that the courier was not at my place at the time. He said wait a few days and maybe the courier will deliver because sometimes the system mistakenly says delivered but they are still on their way. So we waited and called again after a few days. They advised to check the neighbors and come back in 48 hours. After a few days we called again... they said that will investigate and report back. After that call... a few days later my son's account was suspended due to an investigation. Tried to contact again and called like 10 more times trying to figure out what's going on here....asked for a photo of "Proof of Delivery"....but (still haven't received it yet) ...so they shut down completely account and did not refund because their courier said the package was delivered safely to the location. today I spoke to an amazon "manager" who did not help me at all...couldn't give a ''Proof Of Delivery''...and no one can help because the courier said the item was delivered to the address and she can't change anything. The advice was from her... to contact the police...... So my son was left without money and without headphones. Therefore, dear future customers of Amazon....be careful...because if the courier steals from you...amazon will do nothing and you will be left without money and goods...and nothing to prove that it is not your fault. I am very disappointed with amazon!!! It's very scary that in the UK there are no laws that would protect the common citizens and such companies can steal from simple people's... it's very disappointing....

Review Title: I recently had a baffling and‚Ä¶
Review Text: I recently had a baffling and frustrating experience with Amazon UK. On February 15, 2024, I was shocked to discover a random debit of ¬£53.97 on my credit card by Amazon. Puzzled, I immediately contacted their customer service, hoping for a swift resolution. Little did I know, this would be the beginning of a two-hour odyssey through the depths of Amazon's incompetence.After enduring an endless cycle of chat and call sessions with their customer service representatives, I was left more bewildered than when I started. None of them could provide a coherent explanation for why I was charged for a product I had already purchased days earlier with a different card. As a loyal Amazon customer of over 5 years, I expected better treatment than being left in the dark and wasting precious hours of my day.Not only was I inconvenienced and frustrated, but I was also left feeling vulnerable and paranoid, fearing that my card had been hacked and wrongfully used. To my dismay, it was Amazon itself behind the unauthorized charge. This level of carelessness and disregard for customer trust is simply unacceptable.I demand that Amazon rectify this situation immediately, compensate me for the time wasted, and reassure me that my financial information is secure. It's high time for Amazon to step up their game and provide the reliable and trustworthy service that customers deserve.
