Review Title: Amazon Key Installer Damaged Our Locks
Review Text: Amazon Business Key installer came out our multifamily condo complex at 11:21pm and decided they would disassemble the two postal style locks on our gate control box and cut the added chain to gain access to our control panel and install their hardware. This is ridiculous at best. Who the f$#k do they think they are? We are considering pressing charges as it is all on recorded camera footage. First to come out at 11:20pm is a bit shady, and then to damage our locks and cut out chain and twist and bend the (brand new!!) gate control box cover is just uncalled for. Amazon Business Key is nothing to begin with. For our property,  the driver still has to enter a code on his/her phone (or something similar) to send to the gate controller to open the gate. It takes no longer amount of time for the driver to reach out the window and enter a four digit code to open gate. Amazon has gone too far this time. Showing up at 11:20 in the dark of night to cut our chains and damage our locks is not acceptable.

I had to "battle" with the IVR (Automated phone thing) and was eventually connected to a person who had to validate me. After he did, at around seven minutes, he just "disappeared" and said nothing on the phone. I called again and "battled" with the IVR. A man answered but could not explain properly why the problem I had occurred---it didn't make sense, so I disconnected the call.

Avoid Purchasing from Third Party Sellers on AmazonI recently purchased an item through Amazon that was sold by a third party seller. During shipping, the carrier marked the package as "incorrect address" without attempting delivery and said it would be returned to sender.After weeks of trying to get this resolved, neither the carrier nor third party seller could deliver the item or provide a refund. When I complained to Amazon, their customer service repeatedly passed the buck back to the third party seller rather than helping as the merchant of record.I offered extensive documentation, screenshots, and spent hours on calls trying to reach a solution. Amazon refused to step in and resolve the situation themselves, even after it was clear the package was lost. They would only say they "notified the seller on my behalf" but took no responsibility.It is unacceptable that Amazon sold this item but then refused to remedy their inability to fulfill the purchase as promised. After threatening chargebacks and complaints, Amazon still denied a refund and closed the case. They clearly have no intention of standing behind third party transactions that go wrong.I will never purchase something sold by third parties on Amazon again after this nightmare experience. Amazon has proven they are unwilling to protect customers when issues arise beyond our control. It is a waste of time to work with their customer service, who will only pass you off endlessly without resolving the problems their marketplace creates. Buyer beware of this risk if using third party sellers on Amazon!

Review Title: Amazon reviews block due to important community health issue.
Review Text: I have sent email complaints to two different Amazon customer service email addresses and have spoken to one of their reps. that asked me to send an email to an Amazon address that does not accept emails! I would like to know exactly how my reviews violated their very general guidelines.  For example, Kindle includes hundreds of gay mm romance books that contain many long, graphic, explicit anal sex scenes, yet no mention is made of the need to douche beforehand, both for hygiene and health reasons.  That makes Amazon complicit in the continuing STD problems in the gay community.  They can't have it both ways. Amazon needs to filter and censure the authors whose books contain these scenes, which is probably all the books in this category, OR allow important, constructive reviews like mine.  This is a very important community health issue. In my emails to Amazon, I asked them to please reply with specifics on how I violated their guidelines.  They can't just send me a link to very general review guidelines that looks for certain words in the reviews without considering the context.  I have already canceled my Kindle Unlimited subscription.

These warning letters as well as the threat that a price adjustment may be in order concerns me, after all the effort i put into my returns. i have no idea how their shipping contractor treats the items  after i drop them off. I am now in consideration of store shopping where i can touch, try, hold, the item before i buy it and hassle free return if needed. i have tried to speak with a live person to see where they come up with their info on my returns, or is it just a computer generated letter because i returned something.

I will think twice next time before I order anything from Amazon due to this incident.

Review Title: Amazon -- when you absolutely need it next month
Review Text: I ordered a rollator walker for my 91-year old mother on 2/5/24. I was promised delivery by 9 p.m. 2/6/24. At about noon on 2/6/24 I went to track shipment and saw that the delivery date was now changed to 2/27/24 by 9 p.m -- even though it was picked up from a carrier facility 7 miles from the delivery address. I was back and forth with customer service chat who didn't want to tell me why it would be an extra day to deliver an item 7 miles away. They deflected and gave me UPS's number. UPS told me that it told Amazon last night that it wouldn't be able to deliver it today.Meanwhile, Amazon stopped the chat while I was holding with UPS and I had to start again. For a $250 item they wanted to offer me a $10 gift card. Then they offered instead a month off my prime membership -- and cut off the chat again. I called customer service but apparently they said they were the promotion department. They said as a gift and an apology they'd offer me a $100 voucher but I would have to pay for the shipping and handling. I pointed out that it's not a gift if I have to pay shipping and handling. The rep said he wasn't charging for the voucher just the shipping and handling. I told him that's not the way to treat a loyal prime customer. He kept saying "OK you're not interested" and I said that wasn't true I just didn't feel I should have to pay shipping and handling. He hung up on me.I called again and got through to customer service and he said he couldn't give any compensation, then said he could give $5. I told him that I had saved the previous chats and I was offered a month of free membership (about $12). He said Amazon can't do that which I know isn't true. I asked for an email address to send the chat and he wouldn't give me an email address. He then hung up.This is Amazon's idea of customer service. You are warned.If you want to order from Amazon, don't order anything big that you really need at a specific time -- and when they promise you something don't believe them.

Review Title: Inaccurate Product Descriptions and NO SUPPORT from Amazon!
Review Text: I ordered some Contact brand shelf liner.  The product is advertised as, "Con-Tact Brand Creative Covering Shelf Liner, 18" x 50', Black, 6 Count".  It clearly states "6 count", which to me means six rolls.  I ordered two "6 counts" (12 rolls), but only received 2 rolls.  I tried to contact Amazon about this but good luck with that.  They have an automated chat bot, which doesn't answer your question.  You can request a phone call, but that's automated as well, so I could not talk with anyone about this issue.  If you ever have an issue and need to actually speak with someone at Amazon, it's not going to happen.  Beware of inaccurate product descriptions.

Absolutely seething. I bought a few christmas presents from the website for dear family members. You wouldn't believe it when I tell you that they arrived just today (06/02/2024). I asked for a refund and got told over the phone to physically "do one" and "jog on". Until it got to far and one of them told me my mum wears ear plugs in the bath. Never ordering from Amazon again.

Although I have been using AMAZON for over 10 years, I noticed lately that their delivery service has detreated beyond imagination. Not only the drivers will drop the parcel at the door without even considering ringing the door-bell (if the parcel is to large to go through the letter-box) regardless to the weather condition. They use to be careful about delivering the parcels but no anymore!! It could be a result of work pressure and delivery quota per driver. Our house is located on the corner of two roads with a front garden leading to the front door via our drive. Last Friday 02nd Feb we were expecting a delivery of a new air-fryer as notified by AMAZON. We were sitting watching TV at lounge which by the front door at around four o'clock in the afternoon when I received an e-mail  from AMAZON stating the the package was delivered and left by the front door (with a photo showing that), so immediately we open the door but found nothing!!!! We looked everywhere around the house in case the driver decided to hide the package but there was nothing!! It is unusal for our neighbours to pick anything from the front of our door unless we were on a holiday and have requested them to do so! Our neighbourhood where we live, is very safe and never encountered nor heard of any theft! Furthermore, It needed someone there and ready for the delivery to be dropped so that he/she swiftly grab  it and run with it which is remotely to happen. Unless, the driver took the photo and picked it up again and took it. No one would've  suspected that action as it would look as if he was returning the item back to the van!! Even if we caught him doing it, he could easily say I didn't want to leave it at the door!!  Both our cars where there on the drive and our door-bell is working!!!!!!! So, we called AMAZON who initially integrated us asking if we are sure is not there, or with neighbours ..etc before telling us that we need to wait 72 hours before we can report it undelivered. So, we waited until Monday 05th and we requested a call-back where we discussed the issue!! Regrettably, the customer-service agent who was based in Ireland could not get through to the correct department who could resolve the issue and told us that she will leave a message on the system for them to call us back and assured us that the case will be resolved. No call was received so today (Tue 06th) once again requested a call back and we spoken to another agent based in Ireland who passed us to another colleague (sounded as if based in India) and who also passed us to another of his colleagues there who told us that they 72 hours  to investigate the matter and we have to wait!! Besides being frustrated with this matter, we feel as if we were accused of false claim!!!   Shameful that AMAZON treats customers like this!!!   .

Review Title: Amazon has held my money 20 days after item returned to their carrier, without estimated date of refund
Review Text: I purchased an item over $1000, but it was stopped at the custom of my country due to lacking permission from the laws, and I had to return the item. The carrier received my request to return the item on 14 Jan 2024. The item had been kept by the carrier at all time. Since then I contacted with Amazon representative several times to ask about my refund. Some even promised I would receive after 2 days because I was a loyal customer, but they are just liars. Even one of their colleagues told me they were wrong, when I quoted the promises. Today, I talked with one supervisor, and the only thing she provided is that I would receive my refund once they receive the item because the item has high value.  I think at some point I will receive my money, but I don't think my case is acceptable to every customer. I don't even have a chance to see the item, so if it was damaged it is not my fault. What is the reason to hold my money for so long? If their employees could consider my case with common sense, they could do more than just generic, useless instruction, as a machine. Either Amazon tries to exploit me or their system is at fault. Either case, I would have to pay interest for the credit I used to buy such item if Amazon does not refund me on time.

Review Title: Rip off their sellers and partners
Review Text: Rip off their sellers and partners. I recommend you use amazon for window shopping only and then try to source directly from sellers to stop what amounts to an evil business continuing to grow. Dont use AWS , don't use Alexa and don't subscribe to prime.

Where do I even begin? My encounter with Amazon's customer service was nothing short of a nightmare. It's as if they go out of their way to make your life difficult.Firstly, getting in touch with a representative is like navigating a maze blindfolded. The automated system seems designed to frustrate and confuse you at every turn. And don't even think about trying to find a direct line to speak with a real person ‚Äì it's like searching for a needle in a haystack.When I finally did manage to connect with someone, they were about as helpful as a broken pencil. It's like they're trained to provide the least amount of assistance possible. Instead of resolving my issue, they passed me from one department to another, each time repeating the same tiresome process of explaining my problem from scratch.And let's not forget about the wait times. I could have watched the entire Lord of the Rings trilogy twice over while waiting for a response. It's almost as if they take pleasure in making you wait endlessly, dangling the hope of resolution like a carrot on a stick.To top it all off, when a resolution was finally offered, it was so inadequate that I might as well have been talking to a brick wall. It's clear that Amazon's customer service is more concerned with closing tickets than actually solving problems.Save yourself the headache and frustration. Avoid Amazon's customer service like the plague. It's an experience you'll regret ‚Äì one that will leave you questioning why you ever chose to do business with them in the first place.

Amazon's A to Z guarantee is worthless. It only reassures customers until you actually need it. Then you wake up very unpleasantly.I had always thought that Amazon was on my side in the fight against unfair sellers, but far from it: they take their side and leave me out in the rain.There are now many alternatives to Amazon, I'm just discovering them online and I'm using them more and more.

Here's the thing about mega huge companies that service consumers: They don't need to care about you. If a company has many millions of customers, and 90% of those customers escape doing business with amazon without issues, then the company has little to worry about.If amazon is making enough to send rockets into space, build their own warehouses, and buy their own delivery vehicles, they just don't need to care.I've been using amazon for decades and I suspect my recent issues have to do with policies enacted specifically to increase revenues.A few years ago I got locked out of my amazon account and customer service was no help. I pleaded with them to allow me SOME way to prove my identity beyond their asinine "tell us the last 3 things you ordered." At that point, I hadn't used my account in 3 months so I just did not remember the last 3 things I ordered, AND, amazon had at that point stopped showing orders on order confirmation emails. Instead, confirmation emails were only giving a link back to your amazon order page. Useless if you're locked out of your account. I did ultimately realize a way to get back into the account on my own.Most recently, while traveling, I ordered some items from different sellers, but items fulfilled by amazon to be delivered to an amazon locker. I waited, and then checked the amazon order page which showed that ALL the items were cancelled. I called amazon customer service but they knew absolutely nothing, so I reordered those items and waited again. A week later, I checked the amazon order page and yet again, all items were cancelled. This time, I insisted on talking to someone above the first person I spoke to. Then, they ended up handing me off to an actual American who worked specifically with the lockers, but that person just listened to my complaint and then said they'd tell someone else, blah, blah, blah. For some reason the UPS driver was cancelling my orders and nobody would tell me why. When I went to make the order a third time, I saw on the order page, for the first time, in red text, that the locker I had chosen was full. Mystery solved, no thanks to amazon, because they obviously have a low cost deal with UPS to deliver packages to their amazon lockers and the deal does not include bringing undeliverable items to a UPS facility so a customer can pick stuff up there. Instead, the driver just cancels the order and everything gets returned to amazon fulfillment centers with zero notification to the customer. My other major issue with amazon is that they did away with commenting on reviews for products. This was a super valuable method of sharing information with other consumers who took the time to write reviews. I suspect they stopped allowing this because people occasionally were recommending different products and that was obviously not good for them. Amazon has gotten progressively more and more antagonistic towards consumers but they know they can because there just is no alternative for us.

Review Title: I can't rely on Amazon anymore.

I should have gone and found one in a shop instead of relying on this dreadful company!Here I am still sitting waiting for it at 8.15pm, knowing full well that it won't arrive tonight.I'm now wasting my 7% charge on writing an angry review!From now on, I will go into the city and find things myself. If I can't rely on Amazon, then there's no hope for online shopping anymore.

Review Title: DO NOT use Visa debit gift cards - AMAZON's system steals your money!
Review Text: Amazon received two $100 Visa debit gift cards from me - these were referral rewards from my health sharing program. The first I loaded per online instructions as a debit card, and it looked fine, for a day. I then loaded the second Visa debit gift card, but it loaded as $89.12 instead of $100. Got on chat and went through 3 people until one of them said something like "Okay, I'm adding $11, plus a $10 courtesy for your trouble." It was apparently a glitch in the system. The Visa debit was showing as $100.12 on the order. I then ordered a vacuum cleaner, putting the balance on my CC. TODAY my account now says "We couldn't charge your selected payment method, so we charged your backup payment method." They charged my CC $100. This is not cool. I am doubly paying the $100 for the vacuum. Back to the first Visa debit card, which I loaded and had appeared as a gift card with $100 in the system. I received an email on 01/31/2024 that said I had successfully loaded it, and they gave an $8 bonus for the load. Great! Problem is, it was zeroed out quickly, and when I went through the chat, one guy told me the amount would be reloaded within 24-48 hours. I then got an email saying that the payment failed. Of course it failed! They already got it from the card balance!Back to chat the morning of 02/02. They sent me to a phone person immediately, a lady named T. She was SO rude, as we had a lag, and she insisted on schooling me about how there was now no lag and so forth. T. was completely condescending. Needs education about tech and how to treat customers with respect. She  finally told me that the first thing people usually do is call the issuing bank. I am not in the habit of using Visa debit gift cards, and did not know that. She treated me like a child. I called the bank and they were completely helpful, giving me two transaction numbers when Amazon transferred funds into their system. But this is for Visa Debit GC #1. Who knows if it will work? I still have to try to claw $ back from them for the vacuum cleaner purchase with Visa debit #2. This has already cost me 2 hours of work. SO frustrated.The upshot - DON'T trust Amazon to deal with these debit gift cards. Their system will steal your money. Their Customer Service is quite ineffective and apparently doesn't work for this issue. They should be set up to not receive them at all, since it's so screwed up.I will edit this post after my next contact with Amazon Customer Service.

Review Title: DONT subscribe for a "free" membership of Prime Video !!!
Review Text: Oh, I see that Amazon has the world record in low trust already, so they probably dont care about one more bad comment.Well: I subscribed for a 7 days long free subscription to Prime Video - wich I got, and what I could watch was few and lousy movies and a loooot of crappy series. All the good stuf was "temporarely not avaiable in your area"...It gets worse:I tried to end the subscription 2 days before it ran out. No way !Clicking on "end membership" had no effect at all - NOTHING happened - not even an error message came up...BUT there was a link to Help, so I clicked that, and got an error message - the page was not existing...After an hour or so, I gave up, and guessed that Amazon/Prime Video had a problem with their site.NEXT DAY: I tried again - guess what happened...You got it - NOTHING !!!!!! Same crap as yesterday.Today I see that Prime Video has drawn the subscription fee for a month.AndToday I have ended my subscription - nooo problem.What is going on here - are Amazon/Prime Video so low, that they pull a scam on their potential customers ???I can assure that it has ONE effect on me:"NEVER AGAIN PRIME VIDEO OR AMAZON !!!"Also I will sell all my Amazon Stocks - because I cannot believe that Amazon is a good business that will grow, when this is how it works.Addition on feb.02-24:Getting Worse: They took payment for my unwanted subscription and i put it to an end, so they will not grab more of my money, and what I see now is, that I can't see much <1% of contents, and mainly bad series, and the rest is only possibly to watch if I buy or rent or is not avaiable at all, so I payed for 1 month, and I got 1 day.So I have payed for a subscription in one month, and I get basicly nothing.That is called theft !F. Amazon !

Review Title: Used to be an ok company
Review Text: Used to be an ok company that sold decent products but for the last 5 or 6 years it is a crap shot as to whether you are getting a quality product or not.  They will not tell you in the description if something is being made in China or not and they allow bogus reviews to get the rating of a product up because they know most people look for things with as close to a five star review as possible.  They also allow false advertisement on their site.  Numerous products have pictures to show you what it is they are selling but once you receive the item it‚Äôs nothing like what was pictured.  That is another thing actually receiving your purchase.  I‚Äôm so tired of it a logistics issue.  I can receive items from other companies with no issues but Amazon can‚Äôt seem to find my house.  If I do get what I ordered it is almost always after the promised delivery date.  They advertise two day delivery for prime and I do good to get within 5 days, if I get it at all.  I actually quit buying clothes off of Amazon because 99% of all clothes on Amazon are made in China and sizes in China are totally different than they are in the US.  That or they deliberately make them smaller so you waste your money buying them.

Literally the worst shopping experience I've had online. Account was closed for suspicious activity. Customer service is a joke, you'll get 15 different answers no one knows what's going on. You need to talk to an unreachable account specialist to get your account reinstated. Do not shop here. I lost two weeks of my life I'll never get back. Nevermind the $50 balance on my account that I'll apparently forfeit. I genuinely hope you all die a slow and painful death

Review Title: Expensive item avoid Amazon unless you're rich.
Review Text: Faulty slow running laptop bought as a Christmas present for my daughter and her studies, so I returned the thing on Boxing Day and was given a timetable of when the refund would be issued when you click on track return.So I check this morning and they have now added a further 2 days to the timeline to issue the refund, so I phoned them and have now been told It can take up to 30 days, 14 working days, wait until the 7TH Feb, so I've just phoned my bank up and done a chargeback which will payout by tomorrow morning. My advice if you're rich then keep the return receipt and Amazon will eventually pay you your refund, but if you can only afford one laptop at a time then either use a different company or do a chargeback asap.
Worst. Not buying again!

Review Title: My recent experience with Amazon was‚Ä¶
Review Text: My recent experience with Amazon was mixed. On the positive side, the delivery was prompt and arrived as expected, which I appreciated. However, I was a bit disappointed when I received the package and noticed some damage to the box.Though the exterior of the box was less than ideal, I was relieved to find that the items inside were unharmed. Still, it was disheartening to see the package in such a condition, especially considering the care I expected for delicate items.While I value Amazon's efficient delivery and wide range of products, I hope they can take steps to improve their packaging methods. Ensuring that orders arrive in better condition would greatly enhance the overall shopping experience.Overall, my experience was satisfactory, but there is definitely room for improvement, particularly in terms of packaging quality.

Review Title: Amazon has been consistently great throughout the years.
Review Text: After creating an account at trustpilot to save others from dealing with my total disappointment with Bizay / 360online Print / 360 Print / Bizay.com, and never having my problem resolved although they claimed it was, nor receiving satisfaction from Bizay.com and being exhausted by dealing with them, I was not looking forward to dealing with Amazon on an item I received that was damaged. I braced myself for my call with Amazon, and was relieved and surprised at how easy it was to deal with Amazon, this huge company. I was so shocked, that I became curious to see how Amazon was rated as compared to my horrendous Bizay.com experience. I decided that since I already have this account to do reviews, I would review my great experience with Amazon. But this was not the only great experience I've had with Amazon. They have been extremely easy to work with throughout the years, and they deserve to be positively reviewed for their continued good service that I have received throughout the years.

Review Title: I was offered a FREE 7day No Obligation Amazon Prime shipping...However...
Review Text: I was offered a FREE 7 day, NO OBLIGATION trial of Amazon PRIME as I landed at the check out webpage. I opted in: "sure why not says I"However after a day or so, I had buyer's remorse and choose to cancel my Amazon Prime membership. What happened next was disappointing:My item went missing for 10 days without a notification from the seller - who had shipped it - or Amazon PRIME - who had lost it! Reaching out to Amazon online, I asked what had happened to my purchase. Having been compelled to call Amazon, after a long wait, I opted for a call back. A very nice lady offered me a full refund. FYI, this option was not displayed to me online. "Great ! thanks, yes please. Let's do that". Guess what happened next? She sends the money back into my credit card account  and withing a couple of hours of it happily resting in my account - don't I get an email next day saying the product was being delivered!  It arrives; I print the RETURNS LABELS and stick them to the unopened box. Then I noticed that the Package required a STAMP, which turned out to be ‚Ç¨9.00 So I found myself being put in a position of PAYING for accepting a NO OBLIGATION FREE TRAIL OF AMAZON PRIME 24-48 HOUR SHIPPING - should I RETURN a refunded order. Mmmm!?!OR alternately I am tacitly being invited to injure my personal integrity if I don't post the (now) unwanted item back to the shop who in fact had sold and shipped it in good faith. It seems to me that it ought to be the manager responsible for the online Free AMAZON PRIME trail promotion- who should be the individual sanctioned for making an offer s/he never intended to honor in word as well as spirit.  Shame on you Sir or Madam, no doubt on a lower wrung of the Regional management ladder, on your shifting your lack of integrity from yourself and onto the shop or the guileless customer you have out witted today. Are you proud of your interpretation of fair procedure of a dispute between a shop, a customer and Amazon Prime?

Review Title: I went to the Whole Foods in Palm‚Ä¶
Review Text: I went to the Whole Foods in Palm Desert to return an Amazon item.  They have a new "self service machine" now to do this.  The line for returns was out the door.  I waited 45 minutes.  The woman in front of me broke down crying.  There was a Whole Foods "assistant" who trying to help people but he seemed confused.  I returned two items but only got credit for one.  When I called Amazon I was informed that it takes 2 weeks for the refund to be credited.  But one of my 2 items was credited immediately, which has always been the case.  Stores everywhere are trying to replace humans with machines.  Please listen Jeff Bezos--I know you are broke and need to make more money but this isn't the way to do it. I have always supported Amazon and Whole Foods but this experience was bad enough for me to consider going elsewhere in the future. If you continue using the "self service return machine", you will end up disappointing your customers, as you did with me and the other 30 people who waited in line today.  I have patronized your company for years and have appreciated your vision for making shopping easier.  That all changed for me today...as it did for the many others who had the misfortune to experience this.  Lots of very unhappy Amazon customers today at the Whole Foods in Palm Desert.

Well, y'all lot know what it is. It is the one-stop shop for pretty much everything innit?I am not here to talk about that tho. I mean, you literally think of someting, "amazon it" (I use the term like "google it" here) and it can be at your doorstep threshold or in your hand in a matter of days. Selection is massive, options are endless across every sector or industry. Household appliances, consumer electronics, books, clothes, groceries, space crafts and asteroids.. well maybe not that far-fetched, yet. amazon prime's perks are pretty sweet as well, free shipping here, fast shipping there, access to prime video with a large inventory of tv shows, movies and series, prime music included.but the real deal where amazon puts itself forward is the customer service. whenever you have an issue with the product quality, how the seller has treated you, late delivery, or anything of the sorts, they've got your back, bruv. It is all about convenience, variety, reliability and customer satisfaction with these guys. I think they are definitely on the right path and they will be one of the milestone companies that will shape the future for the next generations to come.

Review Title: Amazon CS is lately a complete mess
Review Text: Amazon CS is lately a complete mess. So much so, that I've actually stopped using Amazon. When you have an issue, an agent (on the chat) tells you that they'll take ownership, but it's always a lie. Each and every time you send another email, following-up on the case, you get a template-based answer from a different agent, mostly filled with empty words, and little substance. On several occasions, they've sent me contradicting or incorrect information about delivery dates or deadlines for certain actions. When they give you false information, they don't take any responsibility for it, nor do they ever provide the official complaint form, as they should do as per EU legislation. My time is worth more than the discounts or variety of products they may offer. It's just not worth it.

Amazon offered what they call a, "Lightning Discount", to an item in my cart. The discount was for $81.When I went to check-out, the discount was taken away. I spoke with a supervisor at costumer service, who told me that those discounts last for 15 minutes. To me, that's ridiculous. Especially for a 5 year Prime member, who's spent thousands with Amazon. I learned this after a 2 hour long run-around with customer service. The supervisor refused to re-honor their discount. I'm paying $100 more than Amazon's regular price with one of their competitors. The competitor is honest, and a human being.Amazon's discount policy, in this case, is deceptive. Beware

Review Title: Just sheer incompetence being displayed there, BUT after an interjection with corporate and their CEO, they managed to come through for me and the mistaken item was finally sent back to them.
Review Text: Just sheer incompetence being displayed on the part of this organization and never wanting to take full responsibility for their actions, especially when it comes to making mistakes and then they have the gaul and nerve to accuse me of lying to them?! Here's what happened here and hoping these fools get exposed for what they are doing there and Bezos gets his head out of his butt and takes a further and strong look as to how his operation is being run there and whom he's hiring as customer service staff there, aka cheap labor from third world countries who can barely speak English or be able to formulate a sentence properly...here is what happened to me recently...I would like to voice a complaint against the biggest online retailer in the world, that being Amazon.com. So in a nutshell this past week, I ordered a Coke Zero mini fridge they were selling and there are two different designs to them, one has a bottle on it and the other has a full logo splurged horizontally across the door, and thinking I was finally going to receive the bottled version after two other attempts at getting this resulted in returning them both back for full refunds, a few leadership team members had promised and assured me I would finally be receiving the item that is pictured and when I received the item late last night at home (1/20/2024), I received yet the same item I received the other two times over and now having to return that as well. I have been in constant battles with their inept & incompetent customer service division & I have requested to speak to higher ups there to rectify this problem, but they have done nothing but lead me astray like a puppy dog, ignoring my requests and then accusing me of lying to them that I actually received the correct item when I did not & I showed them the two links in question, side to side and pinpointed this in as many ways as possible, but still, they refuse to do anything to help me out and I have just about had it with them. I truly feel they are practicing fraudulent and deceptive advertising at that website and I am at my wits end with them to boot! I do not appreciate being accused of something I didn't even do here and I could care less whether promotional credit was used or not on this item to cover said costs of the product, it was still the wrong item shipped out to me and nothing has been done to rectify this mess. I submitted further proof & evidence as they had requested to show them I was not making any of this stuff up and I never heard back from them, so I re-contacted them to no avail, so hoping this situation gets remedied this once & for all! They're oblivious to never wanting to admit they were at fault for anything but rather, blame the customers and now they're asking for solid proof too?! Well, they got it as this kind of chicanery needs to cease right here and now!All this over a mini fridge they're selling that has two different logos to it and when you order it from them, what is displayed versus what one actually does receive are literally quite different in so many ways and aspects, as it's beyond comprehension with them. Just a sad excuse for an organization to be doing any of this to their loyal and faithful customers.UPDATE on 1/23/2024 at 2 PM CT...Well, I have to give them credit where credit is due as it took a major interaction with their corporate team and CEO to get to the bottom of this craziness and I am happy to report that they came through with fixing this messed up and screwed up order and they even offered humblest apologies for accusing me of lying about everything associated with that order and what I received and such. I still would be very cautious about doing business with them, no matter how well known they are as their customer service division really needs a huge and major overall and to bring in people who can actually speak the English language properly and truly give a damn about helping their customers who keep that business afloat on a daily basis. Serious re-training of their staff needs to be done at once as they all seem in quite a bit of a hurry to conclude chat and phone conversations without properly delving into the key issues one might have with their orders. I'll change my rating to a 4 star review from one as they acted appropriately but again, thank goodness for getting in touch with their corporate division and CEO or I'd still be having issues with getting this nonsense solved to this very day, but it's now done and completed and let's hope they don't screw up any more of my orders from here on out. I can hope, right?!

Review Title: Refuses to facilitate Refuses to facilitate a mobility impaired person!!a mobility‚Ä¶
Review Text: I purchased an android 5G capable phone, on startup it took over an hour to complete, storage was 30% used - 70% available. It never recognized my fingerprint to unlock apps, and ran slower than my 3G android. I inquired a better refund explaining that I am mobile impaired. They insisted that I needed to bring it to the post office and send it that there was no way to have it picked up. Discontent but still agreeing I ordered a new phone upon its arrival I began to switch insensitive apps to the new phone and everything appeared to be fine I searched the internet so that I could probably factory reset the other phone to clear my data. I then began to reenter passwords and log into accounts and verify the IP address to the new device when I noticed that I didn't have administration rights on the new device because it hadn't completely wiped the old device and fragments of the applications remained. Which meant I needed to reboot the First new phone that I got so the IP address would register in the applications and I could make the transfer from within. After 4 hours of watching the screen turn and turn and tell me downloading and updating I powered off and put the phone away and try it again in a few hours. Extremely frustrated I called Amazon customer service back again today and made it very clear that they need to do something because I have to bring that phone now to a technician to have him go into the hard drive and extract my data. This is going to cost more than the phone is worth and Amazon refuses to do anything. I will happily return the phone but somebody needs to come and get it. It's winter time in Quebec I am mobile impaired how in the world do they expect me to get to a post office

Review Title: I have found recently when you return‚Ä¶
Review Text: I have found recently when you return an item if it's under $100 they will provide the refund within a week, if it's over $100 they can take up to 30 days. I decided to call back 10 hours later and how interesting I was able to get the refund but the last agent from a different call center quotes a policy that is clearly "flexible". I won't buy anything over $100 from Amazon again as the quality is horrible.

Amazon has changed something so that many more packages are shipped via USPS.  The problem is that USPS is so overwhelmed that they now routinely lie about delivery attempts when no attempt is made.  Instead, they falsely report an attempted delivery to force customers to go to the post office, stand in a long line, and pickup a package they made no attempt whatsoever to deliver.  The Amazon system is lied too, so it appears nothing is wrong.  Amazon plays dumb and blames the post office, but customers have zero recourse.  Amazon knows this, and continues to play dumb.  Shame on Amazon for dumping an impossible shipping load on the post office, then pretending it has nothing to do with Amazon‚Ä¶‚Ä¶deceitful.

Because of increased problems with 'Porch Pirates', I have specific instructions that when a delivery has been made, that the driver take one additional step and ring our doorbell. When the doorbell is rung, our front door idms opened and the delivery is found and brought into the house.  Time and time again, that simple, additional, step is not made and deliveries linger at the door, sometimes overnight!  I call to speak with a 'LIVE AGENT', and after providing them with the same information, time after time, in the end, all that can be done, is to escalate the matter up the management line. Review Title: Again updating a request to Bezos and‚Ä¶
Review Text: Again updating a request to Bezos and Amazon prime.Why isn't there a discount for people receiving SSDI or SSI seniors?We are NOT on Snap or do not get food stamps.But we are barely getting by.What that isn't poor enough for you.  We could qualify for benefits but will not until needed.  Not everyone can afford mansions.Most of us are living month to month.We have gotten 2 COLA raises that were way over due.  And what happens?  Everyone jacks up prices yet again.  Our trash company went from $84 to $136 every 3 months.  We in my town can not pick a different company since the City decided one company for us.  So the have free  will on what we pay.  The cost of living is $2300 a person I get $800 plus on SSDI.  My husband $1200 plus $2000 for retirement.  Our house payment went from $850 to almost $2000 a month. He spends out of pocket $400 on PT 8 times a month. Insurance doesn't cover Holistic treatments.Our CCs are still maxed since attorney in his car accident didn't apply all medical cost to settlement.OOPS too late now.  And took almost half of his settlement for payments. But yet he has life long medical issues.  Couldn't sue a 22 yr old that has nothing or his friend who owned the truck that hit my husband,  Had what is required for insurance in my state.  Which is basic coverage.  We can't downsize since rent is more than we're paying for house payment.We can't borrow against house since we did that to take care of MIL for 15 yrs. So we are looking to move out of state.  We have no equity anymore in house.  And will be lucky to get $50,000.But we can't get a discount on Amazon for seniors or disabled????  Come on Bezo's your yacht is bigger than our house and lot.  And your online CS is all people outside the USA so they have NO clue about disability.We also have to pay for extra insurance because government insurance is rotten.  We pay almost $400 between us for government required insurance and almost $1500 more out of pocket.  We're both ill and disabled. My husband is diabetic and has traumatic brain injury and back and neck, leg foot and more injuries. I have life threatening allergies to  almost all antibiotics and foods and environmental , fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue asthma, knee, neck and back injuries from work injury. And also 3 brain injuries as a child.  I think we deserve a discount more than most getting free rides of the government.I get Amazon several times a month. A complaint was officially logged with Amazon who said they‚Äôll look into it. Pictures were sent to give the required evidence they asked for the same day (23rd December) but nothing was done about it still and they keep saying to ‚Äúcontact them again in a few days‚Äù every time we try to contact their customer services. I had to go out on the 23rd December to try and buy the gifted iPad elsewhere (from Currys, an actual store) and told Amazon this which is further proof we didn‚Äôt receive the iPad from them but they still delay and don‚Äôt offer any solution.

Review Title: A SENIORS Shopping with Amazon & Prime
Review Text: l have been ordering from Amazon for awhile with no problems, until NOW!!!..l am a Senior 89yrs, & during the Xmas season found it very useful.However some of the items, (4, to be exact) had to be returned..The returns were initiated at different times, firstly 2 items, then l more, with no problem..Intel picked them up...The last item was refused with a pickup, and had to have a label to be returned, l do not have a printer, neither does anyone l know...l am now trying to figure out how to do this, the item cost $85.79...In the past l have not returned that many items, so why has Amazons policy changed ?..How many items are you allowed to return, and how often ?..Any orders l have returned were thru UPS with no issues, they printed the label & it was returned without dispute...l guess my question is HAS AMAZON & PRIME changed their RETURN POLICY ? How does a Senior without a printer, return an Item ? Where does a person go to get a LABEL printed ? Someone told me the Library, how does this work when the instructions are on my laptop ? l know l am looking for an EXCEPTION due to my AGE, which will probably not be recognized by either Amazon or Prime...For all the times l would use a printer, it is not feasible for me to buy one !!! l am looking for suggestions as there is no reason for me to keep the item in question...(DOESN"T FIT ME EITHER)..l will most certainly have to consider my online shopping with Amazon or Prime in the Future.. It was a convenient way for me to shop, due to my advanced age & capability of getting around physically...There are other companies for me to shop at, but l have had issues returning things to WISH, LITE INTHEBOX too far away in China, only once or twice but until NOW felt quite satisfied with both Amazon & Prime...Will never feel the same about ONLINE SHOPPING...

Review Title: This is more of a review on Amazon‚Ä¶
Review Text: This is more of a review on Amazon service!I took in a parcel from Amazon, for the property next door. It is a rental property and it turns out that the family moved out before Christmas so are not aware that I have this parcel.I took a photo of the label on the front and contacted Amazon to see if they could either trace the recipient so they can tell them to come and collect it, or at least arrange for one of their drivers to collect it and take it back to the depot.However on contacting Amazon I was told there was no way they can do this, and I can either keep the parcel or dispose of it!!Either of these options make me very uncomfortable, as it feels totally wrong!It does make me wonder how many goods are just kept or disposed of by people who are being neighbourly and basically doing Amazon‚Äôs job for them! I won‚Äôt be taking in any more parcels for that property from now on and will hang onto the one I have in case they realise they haven‚Äôt received it and come and ask if I have it here. What on earth would I do if they did that and I told them ‚Äú oh sorry, Amazon said I could just keep it ‚Äú I would be mortified.So my advice is, don‚Äôt take in anyone else‚Äôs parcels unless you know the neighbour well enough to know they haven‚Äôt moved house!

Review Title: They're so bad it's hard to know where to start
Review Text: It's hard to know where to start because there is now so much wrong with this company's services.Having been an Amazon Prime customer for well over a decade I have seen a lot of changes but recently the service has gone downhill to the point that I will not be renewing my subscription when it next expires.Particular issues that I've experiences are:1. Fake products - There are now a large number of cheap/dangerous knockoff products on amazon and it is impossible to tell from the listings which are genuine and which are the fakes.2. Reviews - The review system is broken and now so full of fake and even fraudulent reviews it has lost all meaning. Basic tricks like aggregating reviews for several products or even switching reviews over to a completely different product are common and no attempt seems to be made to stop this practice.3. Prime Delivery - This increased significantly in price and whereas once next day delivery was the norm, the minimum I am now quoted is 3 to 5 days with most items not even despatching for a couple of days after the order - as bad as the free delivery for non-prime members. It is not unusual for items to take two to three weeks to arrive despite paying the Prime premium.I am also seeing a lot of instances where the item goes to "collected by courier" status very quickly preventing order cancellation but no further movement or valid training information appears for several days suggesting that the item has probably not actually been despatched and that status change was just to stop me cancelling when I discover the delay.4. Prime Video - This was always a bit of a rip-off with most items incurring an extra charge on top of prime membership but the latest change forces you to pay an extra subscription on top of the already expensive Prime membership to get the add free viewing I got for free up until now.5. Prime music - this is another service that has been deliberately made almost unusable unless you want to pay yet another addition subscription on top.6. Customer services - All contact is via chat or phone, not email, so hard to make formal complaints or keep a paper trail. Although occasionally helpful, most of the time they merely read information to you that you can already see on the website and promises of action are rarely followed through.I have, at one point or another raised all of these issues with Amazon customer services only to be met with responses that ranged from complete indifference to promises to pass on my concerns which clearly went no further because nothing changed.In short, other than the convenience of having so many items in one place there is little to commend this company any more. Amazon Prime in particular is most definitely no longer worth the money.

Review Title: THE TIN OF PAINT ARRIVED BADLY DENTED ON BOTH SIDES, INCLUDING THE LID!

It is totally unacceptable for this Amazon order to have arrived in such a bad state and, even though I eventually received a refund, I am totally unhappy with the whole experience as I intended to paint a freestanding bathroom shelving unit, which I made myself from scratch, and give it as a Christmas present to a family member. I naively did not look at the company that was providing the paint and with a name like Lightning and Mobile Accessories UK, I am not surprised. However, Amazon wrote back to me saying that they could not post my review, which now needs to be edited, because it focuses on one or more of these topics and not the product:SellersDeliveryPackagingPricingAvailabilityMake of this what you will. Review Title: Amazon's customer service has totally‚Ä¶given overseas customer service that although they pormise they never do or understand how to give delivery instructions to the delivery driver
Review Text: Amazon's customer service has totally let me down. After having an article stolen and another taken by animals I bought a box for the delivery driver to put the stuff in on the advise of Amazon's customer service personnel. She told me to contact customer service with delivery instructions and the driver would correctly put my stuff into the box.I've literally spent around 1 ¬Ω hours trying to get the overseas customer service dept to set up delivery instructions. Review Title: Too high on their own hubris.
Review Text: When I signed up for prime, parcels got delivered on time and usually with a reliable delivery slot. Then, over time,  the delivery time occasionally changed to 'Today by 10PM'. Fair enough, sometimes things go wrong. But then this happened again and again to the point where it became standard practice. I don't work for Amazon and I didn't pay for Prime so that I could wait around for eight to ten hours a day until they could deign to provide the service I was paying them for. When I phoned up at 3pm on a friday (the same day as posting this review) to complain about it regarding an order which was marked as 'Out for delivery' since 9AM, instead of solving the problem, the agent on the phone said that "actually, that's in a queue and might not be there until Sunday". If that was the case, why was it showing as 'Out for delivery'? This combined with the reduction in selections to the point of being really quite pathetic on Amazon Fresh, and raising prices to cover the amount of money they have wasted on Prime Video just makes the company as a whole both complacent and arrogant to the point where they no longer deserve anybody's business. In fact, it got to the point where just dealing with Amazon literally just felt like being in an abusive relationship, which is why I cancelled my subscription. There is a popular phrase: 'fluff' around and find out.Amazon do the 'fluffing' around. Their customers do the finding out.

Review Title: Breach of the Data Protection Act 2018 - Theft of Intellectual Property
Review Text: I‚Äôve written to Amazon‚Äôs CEO, Andy Jassy and his Executive Relations team on numerous occasions about Amazon‚Äôs breach of the Data Protection Act 2018 (DPA) and theft of its customer‚Äôs intellectual property.  I stated in an e-mail to Mr Jassy, among other things, that I‚Äôm complaining about Amazon‚Äôs unlawful delivery policy.Amazon UK Services Limited (Amazon) continues to breach the Data Protection Act 2018 (DPA) and is deliberately intruding on its customer's privacy and stealing their intellectual property by taking photos/images of their person and of their private property (location) without their express permission and Amazon is not transparent with how its processing, sharing and storing such data and is exacerbating its misconduct resorting to evasive tactics to avoid the issue, which is totally unacceptable.As far as I‚Äôm aware the conditions of purchase on all of my orders thus far, DID NOT include me having to give up my rights and allow Amazon to violate my privacy and take my intellectual property in exchange for delivering my parcels. If that were the case, I would certainly not have bought anything from Amazon. Amazon's fulfillment of contract is to simply deliver the parcels and ask for the recipient's name and signature which is legally sufficient for proof of delivery and which I would oblige if the drivers presented me with that option, but they don‚Äôt. They quickly snap a photo of you as soon as you open the door, drop the parcel off and walk away, even despite the large security notice on my front door clearly stating, "THIS IS PRIVATE PROPERTY, NO PHOTOS OR VIDEOS ALLOWED!"It is clear that Amazon needs to urgently address its delivery policy and give customers an option to sign for their deliveries and it must train its drivers to understand and respect PRIVATE PROPERTY and the right of privacy.Below, are some of the evasive tactics that Mr Jassy and team have responded following my Complaint and Request for ‚ÄúRight of Erasure‚Äù (SARs)[OPEN Quote] This is Jassy with Amazon's Executive Relations team.By corresponding with me, you have reached the highest level of customer service within our company. The Executive Relations' Department is the most senior department to which an issue may be escalated within Amazon.co.uk. This department liaises with customers on behalf of Amazon's most senior business executives, including the Amazon.co.uk Managing Director, the Amazon.co.uk Director of Customer Service, and our CEO.Your request was sent from an email address that is different from the one we have on file for you. I realise that you're concerned about deleting the photos or videos. It's never our intention to prolong this process, but in order to protect your privacy we can only send account information to the email address associated with your account. Please send this request from that email address.[END QUOTE]So according to his request I sent Mr Jassy my Complaint via the email associated with my Amazon account and this is the slippery response I received:[OPEN QUOTE]  ‚ÄúHello,This is Gaurab with Amazon Executive Relations.I'm sorry but I couldn't find an Amazon.co.uk account under the e-mail address from which you've written.[END QUOTE]Consequently, I sent Mr Jassy and team step-by-step screenshots of me logging into my Amazon account via the email associated with my account which Gaurab above claimed s/he could not find and this is the evasive response I received on that attempt:[OPEN QUOTE] Dear¬†Nicola,This is with Amazon's Executive Relations team.I was hoping to speak with you directly, on the number listed on your account, but unfortunately I was unable to reach you nor leave a voice message confirming my call.I hope you‚Äôll first accept my apologies for the frustration and inconvenience you‚Äôve experienced. [END QUOTE]These are many such examples of Amazon‚Äôs evasive tactics.I still haven‚Äôt received a satisfactory response from Amazon and as a result, I have no knowledge of how my personal data, photos/images are being processed, shared and stored as Amazon continues to arrogantly breach the Data Protection Act 2018.

Review Title: A Cautionary Tale: Intellectual Property Theft on Amazon - Buyer Beware!
Review Text: Beware of sellers on Amazon, particularly those seemingly based in China, who have illicitly used my Registered Designs and images. Despite reporting this intellectual property theft to Amazon and providing them with all relevant registration numbers, the listings have not been removed. I had expected Amazon to promptly address instances of IP theft.Prior to making a purchase on Amazon, I strongly recommend conducting a reverse image search to verify the ownership of the images associated with the seller. No one wants to risk receiving a low-quality imitation from China. Exercise caution and ensure the authenticity of the products before proceeding with any transactions.Thank you for your attention and vigilance

Review Title: Monopolies get lazy, arrogant, and oppressive.
Review Text: You can type in anything you want in the Search bar.  Amazon will give you what they want you to see, not what you are looking for.  They will even ignore specific search terms if they want to.  You can even put double quotes around a word and Amazon will still ignore it if they want you to buy something else.  It is very frustrating that I cannot rely on a simple search function to find the items I am looking for.Also, when you have to return some items, they often make you put each item into a separate box/package and charge you $7.99 for each one.  Why won't they allow us to put several small items in one larger box and charge us $7.99 for only that one box?  It seems as though this "return fee" is being used to "punish" customers who dare return any items.In addition, when you are trying to find an item that has specific properties that you need, you cannot isolate such items using the selection bar on the left side of the screen.  They give you some selections, but they are vastly incomplete and often irrelevant.

Review Title: Amazon did not pack box properly! No refund!
Review Text: I ordered an external battery, airtags, and waterproof airtag covers. Some of the items were missing, and others arrived damaged beyond repair because the Amazon box had no packing around the individual items, and the weight of each item crushed other items and caused the tape to break on the Amazon box, allowing some of the items to fall out. I have contacted Amazon three times and spent over 3 hours on the phone, only to be hung up on. I have contacted them by chat 15 times with no help. One person finally said I would receive a refund but had lied. They told me to return the items through UPS, but UPS will not take the package because the items contain lithium and are dangerous to ship through the mail. I was then told to get a police report, but the police wouldn't write a report when the package was not stolen, and it was Amazon's fault for not packing the box properly. The items cost me $179.25, and I cannot get a refund, and Amazon refuses to help. They just reply with automated responses to return the items or get a police report. Still, I cannot do either because of the circumstances they caused by not packing the items properly for shipping. Buyer beware! Do not order expensive tech through Amazon because you cannot trust that they will be adequately packaged, and if they arrive damaged, Amazon will not issue a refund. I'm left with dangerous, useless items that I cannot dispose of.

Review Title: Buyer beware of digital gift cards
Review Text: You will be locked out of your Amazon account for supposed fraud by simply attempting to order any of their digital gift cards. Amazon is incapable of fulfilling these orders due to their failed ‚Äúverification system‚Äù and helpless customer service agents. Even at the supervisor level there‚Äôs no human being who can override the system upon confirming with you on the phone that you‚Äôre in fact placing the order rather than a scammer. Amazon gives the appearance of great customer service by allowing you to speak with agents directly‚Äîagents who are trained to be pleasant and patient but given no access to fix any real issues. The software truly runs the company. I spent more than 3 hours speaking with 3 different departments trying to get back into my account and re-placing my order over and over. After two days of this, my order was canceled by their system repeatedly, my account is still frozen for any kind of digital order, and a family member also got locked out immediately for the same purchase. By comparison, we were able to purchase the gift cards (barely in time for Christmas) at a physical retailer quickly and with zero aggravation. Amazon lost $300+ of sales to a brick-and-mortar because their software is abysmal and their customer service impotent. Considering the constantly rising cost of the Prime subscription and the record profits Amazon reported during lockdowns this is all a cruel joke. We need to support what few local businesses are left before they too are eliminated by Amazon and their AI decides what gifts we‚Äôre allowed to buy.

Appalling customer service.I have purchased from Amazon many many times and never had an issue. This said however on 12 December I ordered a large item (a chair/bed) which is something I have not done before. I needed the chair/bed for a guest visit and ordered it on 10 December. I was initially happy with the fast delivery date which was due to be 14 December. However despite the fact that Amazon claim to have attempted delivery in 14 December this attempt definitely didn‚Äôt not happen (I have an advanced security system which I had reviewed) when the chair eventually arrived with no notice in 18 December on a dark wet and windy evening it was left by my gate in the rain until I could get help to lift the very heavy boxes inside. Once inside it took hours to put the chair together with the poor and hard to follow instructions. Once installed it was apparent that the chair was of very poor quality and defective. I immediately reported the matter to amazon who quite frankly have been totally unhelpful. They have basically explained the item is from a ‚Äòthird party seller‚Äô which apparently means they don‚Äôt really care!! I have always believed that items bought on the Amazon platform gave me some kind of protection but this is definitely not the case. I am now still arguing with the ‚Äòthird party seller‚Äô with no help from Amazon. I have been informed that the seller sees no problem with the chair which quite frankly is alarming in itself. I have been told I need to return the chair in the original packaging (which I don‚Äôt Have as it arrived wet and damaged) and pay for a courier to collect it !! I have since discovered that previous reviews of the same chair are much of the same . Please read reviews before making any purchase these are often informative and an insight into the kind of company you are dealing with .

Review Title: Amazon Orders for Hawaii Customers Take Weeks
Review Text: For most of 2023, the time it took from placing orders to receiving orders averaged 4-6 days.  I felt that was reasonable given that we live in Hawaii.  My wife has a Prime account, but I don't.  However, both of us have noticed significant longer delivery times beginning mid-November 2023.  We're talking about in-stock items that are now taking 18-28 days which they tell you before you order.  Unfortunately, I don't order something until I need it so the 18-28 day lead time for Hawaii deliveries is not going to cut it for me.  Starting to use other options...

Review Title: The return process is a rip-off
Review Text: The return process is a rip-off! I bought something and it was much larger than expected.  I wanted to return it.  During the process, I had a couple of options, first print my own return label in which the charge was over 13 Dollars!  Expletive (I can't use bad language)! 13 Dollars to print your own return label!!! The second was just to drop it off for free at the UPS store.  I had used the latter method before and it took well over two months to get a partial refund.  I never got a full refund.  Calling the service center took such a long time on the phone with someone who barely spoke English. On my current return, they said it would take over a month to "process" the return!  Expelitive! In years past, I would get a refund once the item was scanned in at the UPS center.  Why are they holding my money for so long?!  I have been an Amazon shopper for years.  I think that in the future I  will be looking to other online retailers.

Worst service throughout the December period. Ordered throughout Amazon to have my items disappear with a notification ‚ÄòLeft at Postage Box‚Äô even though i don‚Äôt have a post box. Do NOT recommend. Go somewhere else and be looked after.

Amazon is the type of company that will offer an array of products from brands, but values money over ethics. They may seem friendly with their interface and show convenience through services. It's all a facade.However, that's a totally different story when it comes to communication and treatment towards employees.Reviews on the site are sometimes fake with scammers acting as sellers while authentic opinions are being suppressed. I noticed the number of bots frequenting there as well. Also users/buyers can find their reviews being removed and discover themselves being banned from contributing for "unusual reviewing activity" by Amazon.  The moderators really have poor judgement behind their monitors. Another example is when employees that opperate in warehouses experience awful working conditions, the bosses there give the employees little time for a break. If you're an employee that have a problem, your boss is not going to show any mercy for your mental anguish.Pathetically enough, workers resorted in using pee-pee bottles if they need to urinate instead of going to the bathroom.Workers in that environment usually breakdown mentally and become severely exhausted. The most ludicrous resolve Amazon has to offer was coping spaces in 2021. These are mental health booths known as "AmaZen."In the Summer of 2023, Amazon decided to lock one of its customers, Brandon Jackson of Baltimore, Maryland, from his home connected with the smart home devices because a delivery driver allegedly heard a derogatory term through his doorbell. This has made news in my country.Apparently, no one was home at the time as evident and Amazon finally granted access to the man's residence and his accounts without explanation.I'm not going to deal with a business that tries to control its customers in an abusive manner. I have pity for the workers who are delivery drivers and warehouse employees that have to endure such an unhealthy workplace. I share a better relationship with Ebay and Walmart customer services long before this! Ebay and Walmart are more ethical businesses I would use as a customer. I would not recommend Amazon.

Review Title: Unresolved Theft Incident - Disappointing Customer Service
Review Text: I am compelled to share my disappointing experience with Amazon, specifically regarding an incident that occurred in August, which has left me frustrated and dissatisfied with their customer service.I made a substantial purchase exceeding $500, only to have the package left unattended on my front porch and subsequently stolen. Despite reporting the theft promptly, my attempts to seek assistance have been met with ongoing delays and unfulfilled promises from Amazon's customer support.This situation is deeply troubling, and as a valued customer, I expected a more proactive and helpful response. Unfortunately, despite providing all necessary details, including the order number and relevant documentation, the matter remains unresolved.The lack of responsibility and follow-up in the face of a significant financial loss is concerning. I believe that a reputable company like Amazon should take swift action and provide adequate support to customers who experience theft or loss.My hope is that by sharing my experience, it serves as a cautionary tale for others and prompts Amazon to reassess their commitment to customer satisfaction, especially in situations involving security issues with their deliveries.

Review Title: Terrible customer service and lying delivery drivers
Review Text: This Christmas has been horrible with Amazon.  So much so have started using other suppliers like Argos and Currys.  I have had too many deliveries registered as 'handed to resident' but the parcels have not been left.  No photos.  And when challenged via customer services you get 'the status must have been changed prematurely' and please check with neighbours or wait a few days.  Customer service and deliveries used to be the best bit about Amazon.  I've been a prime member for almost a decade but won't be renewing.  If I can't depend on deliveries, and I can't talk to someone to correct until almost another week has gone they don't deserve my custom.  Absolutely terrible.

BUYER BEWARE. As a Prime Member, Amazon did NOT make good on an order even though they didn't follow delivery instructions asked for at the time of order. As a result, and as a possible theft, Amazon did NOT provide a refund or replacement order even after completing every required step stated by reps. Beyond the financial loss, be aware most reps are hard to understand, don't listen, don't bother to refer to file notes (if there are any). They seem to use the same scripts not related to a question or to the information just provided. Example: I tried to explain the local police referred us to the Sheriff‚Äôs Office to file a possible theft report as they have the law enforcement jurisdiction at our rural address. No question or acknowledgement but repeatedly stating, ‚ÄúYou must file a police report.‚Äù Finally, when I asked to speak to a supervisor, the rep hung up!  Also, as in my case, you will never speak to the same rep again. Even after your claim reportedly goes to ‚Äúescalation,‚Äù you must call the general customer service number and start over, which includes reexplaining EVERYTHING as if it‚Äôs the first time you called.  Maddening! Still, I did EVERYTHING required, even repeatedly.  I was finally reassured by one phone rep that he saw my PDF report on file, that all had been done including talking to the USPS. He said our claim would be resolved quickly after he sent all to Escalation and not to worry about the deadline since we had completed everything required by that date. Yet on the ‚Äúdeadline date,‚Äù I called and spoke to 2 reps. I was told by the first rep after placing me on an extended hold, that he had called the police department and they had no record of a report from me on file, therefore there was nothing Amazon could do.  I again explained I had sent a PDF of a Sheriff‚Äôs Department report due to law enforcement jurisdiction as instructed by the local police department three times! He just repeated the same thing again with no acknowledgement of what I just said.  I begged him to listen and not hang up. I asked what "police" number he had called to verify he had called the Sheriff's Department; he said he couldn‚Äôt share that information due to privacy. I verbally stated the phone number of the Sheriff‚Äôs Department and asked if he had called that number - he wouldn't answer. I then asked to speak to his supervisor and was assured the supervisor would give me the same information he had. After an extended hold, someone new got on the phone. With a rude demeanor, he repeated that they had no police report on file; therefore, there would be no further support ‚Äì refund or reorder. When I insisted it was there, again explaining that the jurisdiction was with the Sheriff‚Äôs office, he stated it did not contain all the information required. With witness at my side, I asked repeatedly for him to provide specifics of what was not included as I had referred to their email requirements, emailed those requirements to the Sheriff's Department, and saw the report with my own eyes, confirming all requirements met. He would not answer my question and provided no details. Finally, he said it was an ‚Äúinitial report‚Äù and not a ‚Äúfinal report.‚Äù I told him this was the first I heard this as required to which he insisted they had provided me this information. Their email information had said to call Amazon during the police's office hours so their rep could verify information and I did this. (As soon as my call ended, I called the Sheriff‚Äôs Department myself and got immediately through. The gentleman in the report/records department told me no one from Amazon had called. They also said the rep doesn‚Äôt understand law enforcement investigations because if they don‚Äôt have a suspect as in my case, it is considered an open case with no final report written or available.) Bottomline: I have wasted significant time and effort ‚Äì for nothing. I‚Äôve taken a big financial loss on goods not delivered and paid at the same time a Prime Member fee to experience this type of treatment. (I also unfortunately ended up in the ER due to the stress of this all with heart issues.) Almost humorous, as you are on hold, Amazon‚Äôs recording speaks of their desire to have the best world class service. I am not a rude or unreasonable person. I used to be the Sr. V.P. in charge of customer service for a large company where we strived to protect the company but be fair with our customers. Trust me, Amazon's service is the worst. It‚Äôs inexcusable and I‚Äôm surprised there hasn‚Äôt been a class action lawsuit over inconsistent and unfair practices. Even if you‚Äôve heard positive things about Amazon or you haven't had a problem yourself, just wait. Your turn may be coming. And it may be a horrific experience like mine.

Review Title: Amazon Closed My Account Without Notice
Review Text: On Sun, 24 Dec I received an email from Amazon saying, "We have temporarily placed your¬†Amazon¬†account on hold and canceled any pending orders or subscriptions because we detected unusual activity on it. To restore access to your account, sign in and follow on-screen instructions."I signed in and followed the instructions to the letter. Yet on Mon, 25 Dec, I received another email from Amazon saying, "We have closed your¬†Amazon¬†account because we were not able to confirm that you are authorized to use the payment method associated with your account. Your pending orders have been canceled. If you believe this is a mistake, please contact Customer Service."I tried tweeting them only to be told by their support on Twitter that I must reply to the email about my account being close. I told them it came from a "no-reply" address so I could not reply to it. Their support person said I could reply to it.Yet when I did reply to it, I got an email back saying, "You've written to an address that does not accept incoming e-mails, but we have provided links to help answer some common questions.", and that I must try the links on their Help page. All those links require a login, but they have closed my account, so I can't log in.I finally managed to find a button on an Amazon page that let me chat to an associate. He kept me waiting 20 minutes, asked me to wait longer, then closed the chat without any answers.

Review Title: Inability to Communicate with Customer Service
Review Text: Two items that I ordered on Amazon were never delivered, and when I look at the order status on Amazon, it says "Your package may be lost."  This has happened a number of times with other orders.  I called Customer Service to get my lost items replaced, and I spoke with a rep who was nice and polite, but I simply could not understand what she was saying to me.  I had to ask her to repeat what she was saying many, many times, and when she did, I often still could not understand her.  I realize that providing overseas customer support has financial advantages for Amazon, but it is at the expense of customers.  On almost every customer service call I have made to Amazon, I have had a great deal of trouble communicating with the rep.  And I have often received information that is completely incorrect.  I remember when Customer Service reps were based in the U.S., and they were great and I was able to communicate with them.  My heart sinks every time I have to call Customer Service and I hear someone answer with a heavy accent because I know the interaction is going to be difficult and stressful.  I love  Amazon because of their huge and varied inventory and the ease of ordering from them, but I hate their Customer Service and Amazon delivery services.  Before Amazon created their own delivery service and delivery was handled by Fedex and UPS and a few others, I never had a problem with delivery.  But now I've had multiple problems, with my items being delivered to the wrong address (when my address is clearly posted on my house), with my items not being delivered at all but being "lost," and with my items being delivered late.  I miss the old Amazon and have definite mixed feelings about the current one.
