Review Title: Will Amazon ever deliver my order?
Review Text: I ordered a product first week of November. When it did not arrive as scheduled, I contacted "Customer Service", a mostly polite but completely ill-prepared group whose main purpose is to read to customers the information about their order that is available on the Amazon web site.Customer Service declared that there was no inventory to fulfill my order; however, on the Amazon web site for the item, it explicitly stated that there were several in stock. I have contacted Customer Service several times with the same result. They have no authority to resolve the issue by expediting an order that is now almost two months old (as many other online retailers would do), and the item continues to appear available (I have time-stamped screenshots). The price has increased since I first placed my order, so I cannot help but wonder if Amazon is trying to outwait me and planning to send an email telling me how sorry they are that the product is no longer available (when they could have sent it at any time in the past two months).

I have purchased homeopathic remedies from boiron on Amazon many times but in the last 2 months they have sent me the wrong remedy with a false label indicating it was the remedy I ordered!  Very poor business practice....I will not be trusting amazon for homeopathic remedies in the future!

Won‚Äôt order anything from these charlatans again. Sick of their cheap fake merchandise and belligerent customer service.  I spent almost an hour on the phone dealing with this ridiculous problem, and the last rude idiot ‚ÄúRegional Customer‚Äù Service person, if you can call him customer service.

Review Title: I was scammed by this company
Review Text: I was scammed by this company. I ordered wireless headphones for ¬£150. The headphones were the wrong color, so I decided to return them. The instructions were for me to take the item to an Amazon location. So I did. The postal worker scanned the product. He put it in the box and did everything for me as per the instructions. He even let me take a photo confirming that the product had been returned. I received a return parcel code. The problems started when on the same day I saw that the product did not have an updated status as "dropped off". I called Amazon and an Indian guy told me on the phone that everything was fine and that they were having problems updating the system and everything would be fine tomorrow. Nothing like that happened. 3 weeks have passed and they told me in Amazon chat that I would not receive my refund. Because they didn't receive my drop off. I was shocked and gave them the tracking number. They said that it was an invalid number and that we were ending the discussions and turned off the chat. I was in total shock. Be careful with this company, I lost my Christmas present and ¬£150. Don't buy anything on Amazon! there is no money back guarantee like on ebay. People, buy only on eBay, there you have a money back guarantee and no one will cheat you.

What the hell has happened to Amazon?! They used to have the best customer service, now it‚Äôs gone to hell. I recently purchased an expensive watch from Amazon and they sent me an EMPTY WATCH BOX. I called to report the issue, thinking that just maybe they would be able to check their cameras and do their own due diligence since clearly someone in their facility had stolen the watch but instead, they tell me I‚Äôm the one that needs to file the police report and once I send them a copy of it, they will decide whether or not a refund will be granted! Yes, you read that correctly. I paid for an empty box and then they will decide if they want to give me a refund! I know this sounds crazy because it is!!! Nonetheless, I filed the police report and submitted it and to my surprise, I still got kickback telling me that my police report is invalid. It‚Äôs a legal document from a police department. How much more valid does it need to be?!! Unfortunately, I‚Äôve spent almost a week of my time trying to provide them with everything Amazon needed in order to receive my money back and it‚Äôs still not enough so it looks as though I‚Äôll just have to refuse the charge since they did not send me what I paid for. In sum, I did not receive what I paid for and in theory, I should be filing the police report on Amazon. They stole my watch and/or they are stealing my money‚Ä¶however you want to put it. It‚Äôs disgraceful and they should be making every bit of effort on their end to get to the bottom of this because clearly they have a thief in house.

Review Text: I am so upset with amazon. They have ruined a 13 year old girls Christmas.  I have been begging all day to get replacement products and it has been a no go. I don't have alot of money . To many that's not costly but to me it is because I have numerous children to buy for that's in my family and it adds up. But anways I ordered these products the not your mother comes in, when I opened it the I noticed the plastic looked wet so I open the plastic and this oily stuff was coming out so I cleaned it up off my carpet and when I really looked  the bottles were empty and the lids were barly on. Ok the brittany spears body spray comes in, the lid was busted off and the spray thing did not work. So I call amazon I swallowed my pride and begged and begged for them to replace the products. I explained to them over and over it they were Christmas gufts for my niece. Basically I was told no because I didn't take a picture of the bottles leaking. Who in their right mind thinks of a camera when greasy product is leaking all over their carpet. Ok at that time I didn't know I had to take a picture, who would have known that. I have talked to numerous people on amazon everyone has something different to tell me. I'm very upset because I told them I don't want the money back I just want the products so she has a gift from me. They didn't even care. I cried I was so hurt because I have been a very loyal costumer, I have 4 services with them for the last 2 years. I don't have the words it's Christmas damnit!! I don't have no more to give. The only one that will suffer in this is my niece, i guess she supose to open the lid on the body spray and dump it on herself. It's like she is to blame, I guess she is the one who put the damaged products in the boxes knowly they were damaged and gifts at that. I did it for my niece she don't have rich parents they struggle as well. What seems cheap to some may be expensive to another.  I'm sorry for the long review I just want people to know how a multibillion dollar company will take my money quick but at the Sametime won't make it right for the costumer when it was their own company that damaged the products. You should be ashamed of yourselves knowing you don't give a rats ass and that's what really upsets me. Also I want to add they said if they were to decide to give me my money it would be 30 days. Christmas Disappointment ‚Äì Missing DJI Camera BundleI recently received my parcel, or so I thought. The delivery man left it on the floor and requested I enter a code on his phone. Suspicion arose when the weight felt off, and upon opening it, I discovered baby items instead of the expensive DJI camera bundle set I ordered. The disappointment prompted an immediate call to Amazon customer service, as evident in the attached photo.Despite the tracking indicating a delivery on my street for five hours on 21.12.23, the package mysteriously arrived on 22.12.23. During the redelivery, the delivery person, with limited English proficiency, placed the parcel on the floor and asked me to enter a code on his phone‚Äîraising further concerns about the legitimacy of the process.The evident scan became apparent when I noticed the packaging opened too easily, contrary to Amazon's usual tamper-proof measures. This ordeal is especially disheartening as I cannot have children, and the unexpected delivery of baby items shattered my Christmas spirit. The mix-up not only ruined the holiday but also raised questions about the security of Amazon's delivery system. I hope for a swift resolution to rectify this unfortunate situation.

I was again told I need to do it, after 3 back and Forths, I asked for a manager, the manager gets on the phone and verifies my info but called me by my name initially. I explained the problem again. She said we cannot help you. I asked why she said we don't know how we have never been trained. I said you have not been trained on how to set up a new default payment method. She said no Amazon has a history of failing in the training. I said who can i speak to, I do not know was her reply. So we have a either she was straight up lying to a customer or Amazon fails in training either way to say things like this to a customer whose company spent 236k in the last 3 years with them is extremely poor customer service. I will take my business elsewhere.

There is absolutely no reasonable way to contact Amazon to make a complaint about a blatant lie by one of their delivery drivers. So I'm putting the details here which is the only website that seems to allow me to do so. A note on my Amazon account, presumably from the Amazon delivery driver, says: "Your package was delivered to a neighbour James at door H Signed by: James."This is a blatant lie. This is a small block of 8 flats, and there is only one James in the block, and that would be me. The delivery driver is a liar. This is what actually happened.The package was left outside the main security doors where anyone passing by or visiting another tenant could easily have stolen it. Fortunately, it was noticed by a neighbour who brought it to my door. Whilst I had asked for the package to be delivered to my neighbour, I was at home all day. A simple push of either MY bell or my neighbour's, would have got an answer. Instead, the package was left outside the security doors at the front of the building and the driver who delivered it lied about it. As an aside, I ordered something else at the same time as the item above and it was supposed to arrive yesterday. I still haven't got it at the time of writing this review. I will never buy from Amazon again. IMO, the customer service is abysmal. The chatbox 'assistant' (I use the word advisedly) is ludicrous. You simply go round and round in circles and never get to make the comment/s you want to make in the first place. There is simply no way to write a complaint to Amazon itself - except in spaces like this. So thank you Amazon for nothing and for wasting my time.

Review Title: Leadership Principle's No 1: Customer Obsession - Not so much
Review Text: I have ordered a vacuum robot. It took them almost 20 days to dispatch the item. When they did delivery guy decided not to show up and instead logged as "customer didn't accept the item" and returned it to Amazon. I called them filed a complaint about it. They investigated and returned with an e-mail that says "you are right delivery guy did this on his own". -I asked for replacement. They said there aren't any in stock. -I asked them to send the one which I couldn't even see. After all it was only carried by the delivery guy and its brand new. They said its not possible. Since it labeled as returned amazon sees that as used so they can't do that either.-Then I asked the refund which they already started without even asking me.-6 days past. no refund. I called them again. And the answer is I might have to wait up to a month on the top of this almost a month of waste of time. Because they need to investigate since the amount is bigger then 500 euro.So to summarise it: I have waited for almost a month for them to decide not to deliver. And now it seems like i will have to wait for additional month for them to decide refund the money back which they charged for nothing a month ago...

Review Title: I had to give this a 1 star to write‚Ä¶
Review Text: I had to give this a 1 star to write the review. It's not worth a star.My friend sent a Christmas present through Amazon. They delivered it and left it in full view on my front door step, so that made a nice present for the thief who took it. Their delivery service is absolute rubbish. My friend and I are now upset.  Still, Amazon is a great service for thieves.

Amazon customer service has plummeted over the past year or so.  Now they are making returns harder and charging if you use UPS.  They are also requiring a copy of your ID which is unacceptable!! They claim they need to identify us but they don't seem to need that to take our money!!  That is invasive and opens us up to identity theft in the event they get hacked like everyone else.  I will never give them this!!!  To make matters worse any phone call to customer service takes far too long.  Now, after you've spent 10-15 minutes with a customer service rep they often say they need to transfer the call and you sit in yet another long queue waiting for that person to help and they are less inclined to resolve problem easily putting the burden on the customer.I recently ordered 2 gallons of fuel stabilizer.  After multiple emails that it had been delayed, I called to cancel the order because I was leaving town.  They said they couldn't, but as soon as they could locate te product they would refund my money.  Then, I got emails saying the product "was likely delivered on December 2nd", when it wasn't.  They still would not refund my money.  They said I had to wait until after December 12th - almost 2 weeks and I would have to call back and go thru the process all over again.  Finally, after 4 phone calls and over 2 hours of wasted  time, they refunded my money for "their" mistake.  Yesterday, I received a $16 item that was not as described online and they wanted a copy of my drivers license or ID.  Well I told them to take a hike.  Instead of placing my next order on Amazon I bought several hundred dollars worth of goods between Walmart and Home Depot and even saved money!!  I will be cancelling Prime and using Amazon as little as possible in the future.

Buyer bewareDO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON,  I purchased a bunch of items from Amazon and  when I went to open the undamaged , not tampered box, which looked exactly like the picture taken by the delivery personnel and what was attached on my Amazon order saying delivered . I was missing one item. The one item missing that I ordered was an easy bake oven .I originally wanted to order from Walmart as it was cheaper ($59.97) but it was sold out everywhere but on Amazon it was $185.xx approx with some extra items food items for the easy bake oven but it was in stock.Other items in that box that I received,costed more than the easy bake oven.When I called Amazon to let them know that one item was not in the box but everything else was , they told me I had to file a police report.Which they believe it was stolen and I had to file a report .I don‚Äôt believe it was stolen , it was just not sent by Amazon . So I filed a Police report anyways cause Amazon won‚Äôt give me my money back to get a new one until I file a police report and to boot it‚Äôs now a week away from Christmas .I sent the incident number by email which I filed with the police department before 10am on Friday dec 15th,2023 and I also told the Amazon customer service rep that I would be calling back after work as I would like an update . When I called back after work the lovely lady listened to my story and tried to call the police department at that time but because it was after 6pm the police department was no longer open . They had since 10 am in the morning to call but no Amazon customer service rep called and now I have to wait over the weekend . Now, I have to  call back on Monday and go through the same process for a missing easy bake oven that I believe they never had or sent. Plus, I have to go and try and find another one somewhere over the weekend .Amazon packaging tape is so unbelievably hard to get off on any package , the package I received was in perfect condition and the whole box was on my porch. There was no question in my mind that the package was open or tampered with. Now, I have to go through all the extra work and stress for something that was never put in the package in the first place . If someone was going to steal anything would they not just take the entire box or pick the more expensive items in the box and wouldn‚Äôt the box be damaged ?????All good questions that three + managers at Amazon cannot answer or help with. They don‚Äôt have a picture of the package inside before it left Amazon but a picture of the package/box on my porch from the delivery personel , which looks exactly how it was when I received it .I will not be purchasing anymore from Amazon ‚Ä¶ I received all my products that were suppose to be in my package except for one item and I am the one that has to do all the work and file a police report for something I believe was not stolen . I believe Amazon didn‚Äôt sent it . Which is more suspicious is that Walmart was sold out everywhere in the GTA. Which makes me think‚Ä¶ did they even have any easy bake ovens and what‚Äôs the chances that the one thing I am missing is what was sold out from Walmart .. hmmmmm makes you think ü§î????Recommend not to buy from Amazon

Review Title: Took my 1900 euros and ignored me
Review Text: Took my 1900 euros and ignored me. I've purchased 2 gift cards each for 950 euros and used both of them to place orders. Disappointed with Amazon  - we bought a JOOLA table tennis table during Black Friday at a steeply discounted price. It was supposed to be delivered on December 7th, but never arrived. I eventually was told that it was damaged in transit and would not be delivered, and that my only option is a refund as no replacements were availably since the item was out of stock. We have since ordered another JOOLA table on Amazon, but at a much higher price. Feels like we have been scammed by Amazon. Not what I would expect from Amazon. Disappointed with this poor service. All we wanted was a replacement at the same price we paid during Black Friday. JOOLA on the other hand provided us with amazing service. Post my initial negative review they contacted us, apologized for the inconvenience and graciously sent us a variety of JOOLA products to make up for the mishap. What great customer service! I have been converted to a lifelong supporter and client.

To all my fellow shoppers , I would like to start a boycott of the purchase of any Amazon products , I have just recently found out a week ago that I need open-heart surgery and my life has been thrown for a loop as you all can imagine , I have been a member of Amazon for over 10 years , I never missed a payment until last month , I had $400 credit in my Amazon which I was going to utilize for Christmas, I made my purchases and woke up the next day to find they have all been canceled , I called to see what the issue was and they shut off the remainder of my credit and reversed my purchases , I am in a bad spot due to the medical issue that has arose but to be treated like this on Christmas is absolutely disgusting and when one of you are down and out like me that‚Äôs when Amazon will turn its back on you too, I do not think a company like this deserves our time money or respect as Americans and I think the boycott should start today on the purchase of Amazon for any items ,everyone have a great Christmas, I will try to make more with less like I always have but this really hurts at a time when there‚Äôs enough pain in my plate allready , Merry Christimas

Review Title: All the bad reviews, and yet Amazon work so hard and have never let me down.
Review Text: I am glad that I am able to write a review for Amazon, the hardest part is finding the correct Amazon (with me living in the UK), and a search for Amazon revealed pages and pages of Amazons', all linked, with different country extensions etc.Anyway, despite the negative feedback, and there seems to be an awful lot here, PLUS, despite the feedback about what goes on in the background, I have to say I am delighted with Amazon. Truly, they have never let me down, deliver ALWAYS on time, keep me updated all the way too, and so easy if a return is needed.I see our Amazon drivers every day struggling in this constant traffic, literally stood still at times on motorways and peak time, and yet they still raise a smile, and deliver all the goods to the correct place even following any instructions for safe places.This Christmas 2023, (at the time of the review), they will be busier than ever, and yet they still deliver, even up to 10pm at night.  Hats off to Amazon, and I just hope the odd good review now and then will help others think, again, how hard this company are working to get this right, and on time.

"Arrive tonight by 10pmÔºÇis a myth. No matter what the website says or the countdown timer says - just forget about receiving it the same day. I have yet to ever receive an order the same day after selecting that option umpteen times. Amazon may as well remove this option since it's an out and out lie.When I rang up to find out more, I was told "well, you ordered it this morning so it's going to be next-day delivery.' Tried to convince me that I didn't see the words 'ARRIVE TONIGHT BY 10PM' as I hit order. I didn't select next day delivery as I knew I wouldn't be available.Frustrating experience - don't get your hopes up with that is all I can say on that.The couriers are hopeless. They rarely knock and will happily leave your parcel out on the street. When they do knock, they expect you to instantly teleport to the door, seeing as they give you a nanosecond to open the door after ringing your doorbell. If you take any longer than that, they'll drop your parcel on the floor and take off down the street.

Review Title: NEW SCAM - DO NOT ORDER iPHONE or anything expensive - Warehouse or delivery THEFT!
Review Text: To all,We have been Amazon clients for a very long time.We have just ordered an iPhone XV for our daughter...when we received the package, we gave the Amazon code to the delivery guy. The package was sealed with tape. When we opened it their was a Dove lotion bottle - clearly the same weight and size of the iPhone.We called right away the customer service but Amazon said that the package was delivered. They were not nice at all and after 5' of conversation did not seem to care. We had to send photos and we are awaiting their answer within 3 days. This is theft. It can only have taken place in their warehouse or while it was delivered but...someone somewhere must have known what was in the package - which means access to Personal Data! DO NOT ORDER ANYTHING EXPENSIVE.NEW SCAM - DO NOT ORDER iPHONE or anything expensive - Warehouse or delivery THEFT!

Review Title: A CAUTIONARY TALE: ABANDON ALL HOPE, YE WHO ORDER FROM HERE
Review Text: I ordered an IPad Air from Amazon (the company itself rather than a Marketplace seller) on 24th November. It was meant to be my daughter‚Äôs Christmas present and it cost several hundred pounds. It should have been delivered to me on 26th November, though instead I was delivered a box of opened dry cat food. I presume that an Amazon employee somewhere along the chain took the IPad and replaced it with the cat food that they emptied to an equivalent weight.I phoned Amazon Customer Services on 26th November and explained what had happened. I asked I be sent an actual IPad Air, though was told I could only be refunded the money, and only once Amazon had ‚Äúreceived my return‚Äù (the cat food). UPS collected the cat food from me on 27th and delivered it to Amazon on 28th November.Two and a half weeks and several phone calls to Amazon down the line I was told today that ‚Äúhopefully‚Äù I should be refunded my money on 3rd January 2024 (38 days after I‚Äôd initially explained to Amazon what had happened and ‚Äúreturned‚Äù the item).Each Amazon Customer Services person over the past couple of weeks has treated me indifferently, as if I‚Äôm a customer who has returned an unwanted book rather than someone who has essentially been defrauded by an Amazon employee. In actual fact I‚Äôve been treated worse than someone returning an unwanted book, as if it had been a low cost item that was being refunded I would have been reimbursed within 14 days, rather than it taking more than a month because of the financial cost involved. I have kept on being told to ‚Äúbe patient‚Äù and that I‚Äôll be refunded in 5 to 10 days, though the date keeps being put back for no reason that anyone has explained, and now for some reason I won‚Äôt be refunded until 2024. It means my daughter will be without a Christmas present this year. No one at Amazon seems particularly bothered or sympathetic.I might continue to buy inexpensive items from Amazon that I can‚Äôt easily get elsewhere, though I certainly won‚Äôt be buying anything expensive from them again. Though buying from Amazon is often convenient, it is much safer to shop with a retailer with decent, accessible and relatively transparent Customer Services.

On 14/05/2023 I ordered an e-gift card for US$100 to be sent to an email address of a family member in the USA. The corresponding 95 euros was debited to my Amazon.fr account. No problem. The e-gift card was not delivered but after extensive tracing I established that the amount of 95euros was in actual fact deposited into the recipients Amazon.com account. Euros cannot be used for purchases on Amazon in the USA. It has been impossible to obtain a refund or to open the account section containing the 95 euros. Amazon have referred me to Amazon.fr, Amazon.uk, Amazon.es. All not interested. The 95 euros is now frozen in an Amazon.com account and nobody at Amazon is interested in assisting me to resolve the problem. I have to warn prospective users of e-gift cards to be aware of the difficulties and waste of time I am encountering.

Four months ago I bought 2 bike tires from Amazon.  I returned both tires in the same box because they were the wrong size for my bike.  A month after they received the tires, Amazon sent me an email saying they were going to charge my account for 1 of the tires because they didn't receive it, even though it was together in the box with the other one that they received.  I called customer service and they assured me that it was an error and they have both tires so they will not charge my account.  Then 4 months later I get another email from them saying that they again do not have the tires, and that they will be changing my account.  So I called them twice, and they assured me that this was sent out in error and they will not charge my account.  A week later they ended up charging my credit card.  I called them again, and now waiting for a refund.  I also called my credit card, and they said that if I don't get a refund with 5 business days, they will dispute the charges, and refund my account, and will cancel my credit card, and give me a new one so that Amazon can't keep doing this to me.  After this poor experience, I am going to stop shopping at Amazon because this is a waste of my time to deal with this crap from them just because they want to make a profit.

Review Title: I would give it a 0/5 star rating if I‚Ä¶
Review Text: I would give it a 0/5 star rating if I could as their Accessibility, ease of use and neurodiverse options are limited when you ask for help for Prime Video. It is very confusing to have to click a whole bunch of tabs and then find out they don't have a message box or email address. Amazon also has no formal complaint process that is easy to find. False advertising that you can email them. I went through every drop-down bar, and not once did the email light up. I did not want people contact today as it is my day to watch series or read my ebooks and wanted to report a strange IT glitch by email/message that I felt confused me and didn't really fit any of their drop down bars. Not Amazon Video, Kindle or main website provide help message boxes or email addresses. You only have the option to speak on chat and mobile. The help page takes 5-8 clicks. You type in Binge contact us and their email address is easy to find in Google. Paramount has their easy to access email address on their international website, Everand has I think either easy to find email address through google search or a message box. Use these websites. They have more user-friendly, easy help service for streaming, ebooks and audibles.

What a terrible outlet/online store.I have purchased a great deal for convenience,  however I'm going to be terminating for many reasons. One reason:The amount of terrible quality chinese crap that doesn't last long.Second reason:They class "seller stores" as being a separate entity and it's not made obvious you're buying from one of these stores until you hit a problem. Third reason:There's no quality control or testing on any products sold. I have purchased electrical items (240v) which are unsafe, to the point they'll kill someone who's not vigilant or knowledgeable.  Example? One of many, I purchased some ceiling spots. The wiring inside was needle thin, definitely not capable of 240v at the usual 13A. This is a fire hazard.  Furthermore,  its a metal chassis and there was no grounding of the chassis! A literal death trap.Fourth reason:The returns and refund processes. They completely ignore uk consumer law and I've reported them to trading standards numerous times. They're always Claiming that because it's a seller's shop they don't refund! News Flash, my contract is with amazon who take my money and who appear on my back statements.  Amazon have a separate contract with their seller stores. What SHOULD  happen is that ANY refund should be made by amazon and if its from a seller's shop, amazon claim that back from them.Fifth reason:Customer service.  Well lack of. Trying to contact them is a mission.  They're making it harder and harder to reach an actual human! Then when you do get through,  clearly indian call centre agents with fake names follow a standard,  generic script which in no way is relevant to a customer's specific issue.Sixth Reason:No refund without a return.  Example? I ordered a box of paper clips. It was poorly packaged and had split during transit.  There was a trail from my drive to the front door.  It was a wet day, so even when i cleaned them up, they couldn't be used.  I contacted customer service to explain and they said "without a return we cannot refund ". What absolute nonsense. Seventh reason:Delivery and drivers.  I'm easy to find but i leave good instructions.  They always deliver to the wrongbplace. On the of chance they get it right, they leave gates open, don't knock on the door and they always lie saying "handed to customer " when you're lucky if you even see the van arrive or leave. Eighth reason:Amazon Prime TV. There's nothing worth watching anymore.  If you find one or 2 things they've started making additional charges and the amount of ads is beyond ridiculous and Furthermore they have no 4k or uhd content. *please note, the date stat3d is just one example of many*

On September 4, 2023 I gave Amazon a 1-star review (since a ZERO was not an option) and stated I would never order from Amazon again. Well, I goofed--and placed another order on November 28, 2023. At the time I had almost $7.00 remaining on my account. I canceled the order within minutes. When I checked my account, my credit had disappeared! Silly me, I called Amazon. Going through two different people, giving the same information twice, verifying via email my name twice, I was finally directed to a "specialist." She asked question after question, had an accent I could barely understand, and it sounded like 50 people were chattering in a foreign language in the same room. Perversely, I didn't hang up--I wanted to see how long the "process" took. I carried my phone with me while I worked on other tasks in my home. Well, 40 minutes later, she told me I'd get a credit on my credit card "within 3-5 days" later.Shame on me for daring to do business with Amazon again. And sadly, Bezos doesn't give a s**t and never responds to any of the negative reviews.

Review Title: Amazon customer service manipulating, gaslighting, double speaking, terrible was not enough to describe
Review Text: I am writing this review to share a recent experience with Amazon that has left me deeply disappointed and concerned. After purchasing a Panasonic camera, I discovered that it was missing an essential component - the battery charger. This led me to contact Amazon's customer service, where I expected a simple and straightforward resolution. However, what transpired was far from satisfactory.My interaction with a customer service manager named Cris, based in the Philippines, was not only unhelpful but also deeply troubling. Cris's approach to handling my concern was evasive and unprofessional. The situation escalated to a point where, following my expressed dissatisfaction, I received a notification about "abnormal activity" on my account, which I believe was a retaliatory action.This experience has raised serious concerns about the misuse of power within Amazon's customer service. The treatment I received was not just poor service; it bordered on tactics I would associate with organized crime - using intimidation and authority to suppress and control. As a customer of over 18 years, I am shocked and appalled.I believe such behavior within Amazon's ranks is unacceptable and poses a significant risk to customer trust and loyalty. I urge Amazon to address this issue seriously and take necessary steps to ensure that no other customer experiences such treatment. Until then, my confidence in Amazon and my decision to continue as a customer remains uncertain.
Do not buy anything expensive and definitely not from a 3rd party seller. When things go wrong it's almost impossible to get hold of anyone.

Review Title: Tried to force me into a Prime Membership
Review Text: I have spent over 2 hours today trying to order my product WITHOUT a Prime Subscription! It kept trying to sign me up as I checked out.I spent a hour trying to stop the Prime Membership on my own, then I spent a good hour with a Chat Agent. This is not counting the15 mins trying to even locate how to do find a live agent! They DON'T make it this easy. Finally she says "Well I need to transfer you to a higher up agent. I had been asking for that for a long time during our conversation. lol  She just couldn't understand why I didn't want it! I shouldn't have to tell my life story, if I don't want it, then please cancel it!!I FINALLY got it cancelled so I could order it without being charged in 30 days. It shouldl NOT be this hard to order a item. Simply have a box that says Prime or Not Prime!! Fis this PLEASE!! All the time it has taken today to order a $12 item is absolutely insane!

Why? - Constant packages going 'missing' saying they've been handed to resident when they have not hmm- Increases to Prime grocery delivery costs - it's now easier for me to shop with Tesco and get them delivered sometimes same day too for same price or less- Range on Prime grocery reduced and a lot of products always out of stock - Changes to Prime music where you cannot skip songs or just play one particular track - have instead got YouTube premium so can do this for music but also for every video on the platform Been a customer for so long of Amazon and used to swear by them but with the missing/stolen packages and other recent changes I'm sick of it and will step away from Amazon to other national & local companiesGood while it lasted Amazon, but everything that goes up will come down....

Review Title: Amazon Prime customer for five years and treated like garbage

I have been waiting all day for my order I noticed it was getting late so I called Amazon and the lady I spoke to put me on hold to check on my order then came back to me and said rest assured its arriving today by 10pm twenty five mins later  I get a message to say its arriving tomorrow so I called again and put on hold again to be told the delivery updated at 5pm and amazon were notified that its being delayed until tomorrow so the first person I spoke to lied to me it was after 7pm when I spoke to her so I asked to speak to a manager to raise a complaint and he didn't apologise didn't help and didn't make any concession he just said it should arrive by the 4th. I'm fuming Amazon are you going to read this and do nothing. I asked if he could just resend my order to ensure I receive it. Its only ¬£8 but no I was told I had to re order it because it wasn't sold by amazon. I have been a prime customer for at least five years and I'm treated like garbage. I did tell the manager what I thought of him

Review Title: Resolving problems with Amazon is a headache
Review Text: Like a lot of people, I gravitate to Amazon when I need to buy something because of their massive inventory.  The convenience of one stop shopping is very alluring to me. However, my recent experience makes me rethink my Amazon shopping habit.  In a nutshell, I believe I was overcharged $115.00 by them and rather than go through the enormous hassle of trying to resolve it through a human representative, I am going to pay the $115.00.  To me it‚Äôs not worth the frustration of trying to deal with such a huge uncaring behemoth and probably end up paying the money anyway.  I suppose I am letting them get away with suspect behavior by not further investigating the overcharge, but my response is that I prefer to look into buying from other sellers from now on and not automatically throw all my business and hard earned money to them.

Canceled an order, the replaced the order and Amazon suspended my account under "suspicion of fraud."Called customer service- several times, and not only could I not understand the 8 different Indian call reps, but they couldn't understand me, and I repeated my e-mail alone no less than 37 times! After asking to be put through to "someone who speaks English as a first f**king language", they hung up on me, and when I called back, they had completely locked my account for fraud!My account is in my name. My credit card linked to my account is in my name. My address correlates to the address on my card. The order was to be shipped to my address... Can't think of how this makes ANY sense! HOW IS IT FRAUD?!!2 days later, I get an e-mail saying the order has been shipped... yet I'm still locked out of my account!So, if there is fraud on your account, they still ship it out but lock you out of your account so you can't dispute anything!Also missing a promotion for a game key which was supposed to be e-mailed to me, which I haven't received.I will update this in the future.I am filing a lawsuit in small claims court!

Review Title: They purposely put packages in open
Review Text: They literally put your packages ON DISPLAY when they deliver them. Baffles me. Even when instructions are given. Review Title: Reduce theft of in route product
Review Text: The driver dropped a 'Prime" bag in our garage but the bag was cut open down the entire side.  There was no product in the bag.  How can the driver not see this?? Amazon should add a step to their handling of product delivery.  Why can't the boxed/bagged product barcode indicate the weight of the package and upon last movement to the Prime delivery truck it is weighed again. The weight should match the original package weight that is provided in the bar code.  If the weight doest match - that's a process Amazon would need to figure out. This would reduce theft and would help identify where the theft is taking place. Would be also a huge win for customer service.

**Title: Deceptive Sales Stunt - An Unfulfilled Promise**I recently had the unfortunate experience of participating in what was advertised as an "invite-only" tele event on Amazon, and the entire ordeal has left me deeply dissatisfied. It's disheartening to realize that what was initially presented as an exciting opportunity turned out to be nothing more than a sales stunt, and the lack of transparency in this process is concerning.The concept of an exclusive tele event piqued my interest, and I eagerly engaged with the promotion in the hopes of securing an invite. Unfortunately, like many others, my anticipation turned into frustration as the promised invitations never materialized. It's hard not to feel misled when a company as prominent as Amazon engages in what seems to be a calculated marketing strategy that falls short of delivering on its promises.Transparency is the bedrock of trust between consumers and companies, and in this instance, Amazon's approach has left a lot to be desired. If the intention behind the promotion was to generate excitement and engagement, it backfired for a substantial number of participants who were left empty-handed and disillusioned.I believe that it's essential for a company of Amazon's stature to uphold a higher standard when it comes to marketing practices. Customers invest their time and enthusiasm in these promotions, and the least they deserve is clear communication and fulfillment of promises. This experience has undoubtedly left me questioning the integrity of Amazon's promotional activities.I sincerely hope that Amazon takes this feedback to heart and reevaluates its approach to such promotions in the future. Clear communication and a commitment to fulfilling promises will not only prevent customer disappointment but also contribute to a more positive and trusting relationship between Amazon and its customers.

Where to start? A week of poor Amazon service. The main issues were as a prime member I ordered three items for next day delivery. I waited all day as were vehicle parts and tools. When they arrived one of the parts was missing, A rear brake master cylinder. After over an hour of trying to contact them I got through to a chat with a human person.  They refunded the money for the part but this was not the point. The person on chat did not understand why I was not happy for a refund. I needed the part, it was that simple. They then promised if I reordered the part it would arrive early the next day. I explained I had no faith in this but after half an hour of chatting on their app and them continually making the same promise I relented and repurchased the item than them was to arrive next day...today. that did not happen,I got a new email promising it tomorrow,  Monday. That is not in time, I missed a weekend of working on my vehicle and limited remaining time this year to use it. Amazon has no understanding of customer service and think the promise of a ¬£5 gift card as compensation resolves every issue. Really not good enough. I pay for Prime, it is n9t free and does not often provide the service quality promised. From now on will be looking to shop in my own locality where I get to see the goods as I buy them. Review Title: There have been many recent issues with‚Ä¶
Review Text: There have been many recent issues with Amazon customer service associates AND supervisors being incompetent, impatient and just generally unwilling to help because they honestly don't care. They recently lost a package of mine that happened to beat gift for someone else. Embarrassing already since I ordered it in advance to avoid any issues only to have to go through at least 20 different people telling me there's nothing they can do. The tracking information through UPS shows nothing, not even an acceptance scan and despite sending Amazon screen shots, I keep getting the same scripted, generic apology email telling me to wait another week. Except in every email, the date changes so no one knows what they're talking about. On my end, it shows the order was canceled and returned. They're not allowing me to get a refund and keep brushing me off. I already reordered another item myself and it was delivered to my family member no problem but now Amazon tells me if the other item gets delivered, they're supposed to refuse it? What if they're not home? Why is it now their problem because Amazon screwed up? I've talked to supervisors and "specialists" who are all just unwilling to help and actually hang up on me when I ask what I'm supposed to do. Original delivery date was 11/22, a day before their birthday. I reordered another item and it was delivered just fine on 11/23. The lost package, I'm being told to wait until 11/28 before Amazon will even think about doing anything.

Delivery - handed to resident, but not!Amazon UK's Logistics delivery is useless. Some people may find getting a delivery at 8.30pm convenient, I do not. Why do they leave it so late to start their deliveries?I have had several deliveries where in my orders it states "parcel handed to resident" but in all cases it was just left unattended at the front of my property. I assume management are instructing the drivers to leave the parcel no matter what.My tip - do not give Amazon permission to leave the parcel unattended in your amazon settings and/or delivery addresses. If the driver/Amazon choose to leave the parcel unattended then they are liable for the loss. If they do not give you a refund or send the item again you can do a chargeback against them via your card. If your order says "parcel handed to resident" and it wasn't ask them for picture proof of the parcel being handed to the resident.It is a shame I now have to do this with Amazon UK. Like someone else below has stated you can't either email/call to complain or leave feedback as they have removed the options from their site. I assume because they were getting to many complaints. Even my Evri deliveries are now better then Amazon UK!Just a thought for Amazon UK, why not give the customer the option of using a different courier at the checkout?

Review Title: I was banned for no reason

Review Title: Horrible Customer Service & Won't Refund Me For A 3 Month Old Return
Review Text: Sure, Amazon is convenient, typically. But over the past couple of years the customer service has gotten so bad. I returned an item three months ago and got my advance refund, as normal. I get an email a month ago stating I was going to be charged for this item. So I reached out and was told to disregard this email that they had this item and I won't be charged. Which, this has happened to me in the past. And typically it always gets taken care of. Last week I get another email stating I have been charged. So I reach out again to get refunded for it. Well they tell me they need me to submit some kind of form of ID because they have detected abnormal activity on my account before they can process my refund. Not sure how processing a refund back to my credit card that I have used for years has anything to do with this so called abnormal activity. Yet I have made several purchases and returns since this order from three months ago and have no issues. So I have spent days calling and chatting trying to get my refund issued back and was told a couple different times it was, only to find out it wasn't. Filed a complaint against them with the BBB because this is crazy thay they charged me for an item I returned three months ago. I was able to obtain the tracking number from one of the reps I had spoke with, since so much time had passes the return label wasn't available on my end. Of course after 120 days UPS tracking numbers are no longer valid. So I had to reach out to UPS, and they emailed the proof of delivery. Which Amazon received the return within two days of me shipping it back. So, I've been emailing back and forth with different reps making the same bs excuses and won't even tell me why this order is any different from my other orders that they feel the need to have my ID uploaded. They keep saying it is to protect my account. If protecting my account was the case and there was abnormal activity, why let me continue to place orders?! I could understand if this was for an item over $300, but it was for a $22 sports bra! Not sure hoe not refunding me my money is protecting me. I'm not uploading any personal information through an email and I should not have to. I never should have been charged in the first place. I think someone at Amazon simply misplaced the item and don't want to own up to their mistake and they are trying to keep money. I did end up disputing the charge with my credit card company and provided more than enough documentation showing they have my return and correspondence showing they received it and a refund has been issued, even though they didn't issue it. This whole experience has ruined shopping at Amazon for me. I had a ton of subscription orders and canceled all of those and will not be renewing my Prime either. I am all done shopping with them.

Review Title: I had been a customer of Amazon for‚Ä¶
Review Text: I had been a customer of Amazon for sometime..I purchased a lot of stuff like house hold items to shampoo/conditioner..I even purchased stuff for our new addition  like pictures  hand towel holder and clocks..Well, I ended up changing my mind and I return a few items..When returning these items I had no idea that crap was about to hit..My account had been hacked, and I notified Amazon about my account I've been hacked so they go in and they lock my accounts and I think nothing of it a few days passes and still my account is locked and I'm not able to reorder or you know do anything so I call customer service they said they would relate it and take care of it and I would receive a phone call, few days later my account was still locked. I called and I found out that they supposedly had sent me an email from Amazon telling me that they had close my account permanently and that I can no longer be a customer .because The email stated I had requested too many refunds, and  the second email stated that I had returned too many items due to their policy requirement that your limit on how many stuff you're allowed to return..I never once received any letter  through the mail letting me know what was going on my with my ordering history, instead amazon took it upon herself to go ahead and permanently close my account...I was Informed by an email and never at one time had I received a phone call from freaky amazon regarding my account...In my email I was informed that since they looked at my ordering history and my account had been closed, I was never allowed to open another account with Amazon and neither was my family members that I lived with..I can't understand how Amazon can close my account because I RETURNED TOO MANY ITEMS, AND REQUESTED TO MANY REFUNDS!!!! Walmart allows you to buy and return without totally banning you from there stores...So. as warnings do not be a customer of freaking Amazon

Review Title: Don't rely on Amazon CS to solve a problem
Review Text: Tried to purchase an inverter which is the same model as one I bought last year from Amazon shipped to the same address.  This time Amazon website would not accept the address.  I tried different addresses of friend same result.  I contacted Amazon CS twice to get problem resolved.  Today (after going through all their hoops like deleting my address and re-entering it which I had already tried) I got on with the "top tier" supervisor who finally said there was nothing wrong with my address but the item is restricted to certain addressed due to regulations.  My B.S. sensor went off scale so I asked him what restrictions?  He could not answer because he had better things to do other that actually fix a difficult problem.  During the entire call I remained respectful even though I was being treated as if my business was of no value to them.  I explained to this guy that I could purchase the identical unit (electronically) but was in a larger housing due to it being a marine version of the same inverter and there was no restrictions related to that unit.  He did not care to explain why because it would have actually meant he had to think about something outside his window of knowledge.  To be sure after the call I went back to their website put the "restricted" item in my cart and used the address autofill function of their website to arbitrarily find addressed in other states and I could not find an address that was not restricted.  So Amazon has an issue with this particular item and they will not do anything to correct it because they simply do no care about any one customer.  It does not matter if you spend thousands on their website, it does not matter how long you have been a customer, it does not matter how great a customer you have been YOU DO NOT MATTER TO AMAZON!  As Lily Tomilin used to say when she played a phone company operator on Laugh In "We dont care because we don't have to"  Thankfully there are still retailers that value their customers like Costco.

Review Title: Warning to all Amazon buyers!! Never ask for a refund to the Gift Card!
Review Text: Warning to all Amazon buyers!!! Never agree to your money being refunded to the Gift Card in your Amazon account! Amazon has a very confusing and strange way of dividing the refunds so once you agree to your money to be refunded to the gift Card rather than to your bank account - even for one item,  then it is impossible to find out how much money was really refunded and where. The original payment method does not mean your bank account. As soon as you agree to it then for ever can  be the Gift Card and you will never be in control of your refund again.

Review Title: Oh my, just ignore the customer
Review Text: For starters: 1 star only, because I can not enter a 0 value. As for the Service: Free 1 day delivery. Nope. Repeated issues with holding the timeline. Well, thas nothing new. And to be clear, not a Karen, but if after more then 20 Minutes nothing is moving, I push a level up. Thee request was ignored. The service personel just returned with, quote: "Soeben habe ich Ihre Anfrage mit meinem F√ºhrungskraft diskutiert." - so he talked to the manager. Not me, as I requested. That was the point where I thought, lets keep them busy, to I made a formal request for Data Access based on GDPR. Which was commented with a link to the pricacy policy. Not quite the reaction. Absolutely impossible to enforce your statutory rights under UK consumer law. Policies provided to ‚Äúcustomer‚Äù service agents in foreign countries are inadequate at best and misleading at worst. They have no knowledge or understanding of The Consumer Rights Act 2015. Managers and ‚Äúteams‚Äù are unable to communicate outside of the provided script which does not include consumer laws. Even getting contact to notify them of intended prosecution for failing to uphold consumer rights over a product is impossible. You end up in a loop of quoting your statutory rights and being advised the product is out of warranty to find out your statutory rights and links to trading standards. This is all deliberately designed so that Amazon does not have to fulfil their legal obligations to consumers.

Review Title: Amazon Brand - Presto! Multipurpose Kitchen Rolls
Review Text: I'm not typically one to voice complaints or write reviews, but I felt compelled to do so in this instance. This marks the second time I've ordered these rolls at ¬£16.15 per pack of six, and regrettably, both times they arrived in a damaged condition. Given that these were intended for food-related use, I had to discard the initial batch as they were fused to the plastic packaging, which I suspect was due to moisture.Hoping for a resolution, I decided to give Amazon another chance and reordered the rolls, but my optimism was misplaced. They arrived once again in a damaged state, with the same issue and an additional rip in the plastic packaging.However, the most disheartening part of this experience was the interaction with the customer service agent. Their demeanor was exceptionally rude, condescending, and arrogant. They didn't allow me the opportunity to explain what had occurred, instead choosing to rant and abruptly ending the call. It was truly an abysmal encounter.Today's service did not reflect anything remotely "Prime," so I have decided to cancel my Prime membership and will not be shopping in-store either.I've wasted two days waiting for deliveries and more time on the process of returning the item. My suggestion would be to save your time and consider purchasing your kitchen rolls from a different source.My review was deleted twice, and despite assurances of a manager's contact weeks ago, there's been no call or message. They denied any issue exists, which seems untrue.I've noticed they persistently ask for reviews but delete them if they're negative, especially for their own brand products. Recently, I tried Marks and Spencer's and Waitrose's own brand rolls, and they're far superior. Not only is the product better, but the service also matches the quality.Amazon, you can do better.

Review Title: Seriously need to retrain your drivers‚Ä¶
Review Text: Seriously need to retrain your drivers and keep track of what they are doing. I ordered a signed for package, unfortunately I was on the school run yesterday when he arrived, however I asked for it to be left with my neighbour. I watched on my doorbell and he did not attempt to deliver to my neighbour, he just walked off. The next day, no driver came, no van came, but it was put as another attempted delivery, even though he had been nowhere near my house. Do you not want the sale Amazon? You will just end up refunding a very unhappy customer. Absolute joke and liars.

I am compelled to write this review to share my deeply disappointing experience with Amazon regarding a recent purchase (Order #203-5391742-2345144). My ordeal began with the delivery of a pack of 10, M8 x 1m (1000mm) Zinc Plated Threaded Rod/Bar, which was irresponsibly posted through my letterbox by Royal Mail, resulting in significant damage to my vinyl flooring.However, the core of my frustration lies in Amazon's response to this incident. Despite the severity of the damage and the clear evidence provided, including photographs and a video from my Ring Doorbell, Amazon has completely denied any responsibility for the mishap. Their justification is that the item was sold by a third-party seller and delivered by Royal Mail, thereby absolving themselves of any accountability.This lack of ownership and customer care is appalling. As a customer, I purchased this product through the Amazon platform, trusting in their promise of quality service and reliable delivery. The fact that Amazon refuses to acknowledge their role in this chain of responsibility, or to offer any form of assistance or compensation, is unacceptable.The damage to my property is not just a minor inconvenience; it is a significant financial and emotional burden. The flooring that was damaged was costly, and the idea that neither Amazon nor their delivery partners are willing to address this issue is deeply troubling.This experience has severely eroded my trust in Amazon. It's clear that their customer service and support systems are severely lacking when it comes to handling issues with third-party sellers and delivery partners. I am left feeling frustrated and disregarded as a customer.To anyone considering making a purchase through Amazon, especially for items involving third-party sellers or heavy goods, I urge caution. Based on my experience, if anything goes wrong, you may find yourself in a similar situation, with little to no support from Amazon.In conclusion, I am extremely dissatisfied with how Amazon has handled this situation. Their refusal to take any responsibility or offer a resolution is not only disappointing but also reflects poorly on their commitment to customer satisfaction and service.

I ordered a Pixel 8 Pro deal from Amazon with the Pixel Watch 2. Delivery was given for the following week. Then a delay was introduced (silently) for 7 more days. When I reached out, they promised me repeatedly that there was no issue and I would receive my Pixel 8 Pro and Watch. Then another delay happened (silently). If I didn't keep checking my orders, I wouldn't know because they don't send any email notifications when the delays are on their end. So I reach out again, and again they say that my item is ready to be shipped. Finally, my order is cancelled (again, silently), because they've run out. If they'd run out, why did they let me place my order? If they'd run out, why did they string me along for 3 WEEKS?!I could easily have grabbed the deal from another more reliable store. But they lied and lied until it was too late and that promotion had ended.

Review Title: Don't pre-order from Amazon, it's a gamble
Review Text: I pre-ordered a book on september 1st that would come out november 7th and a book on october 7th that would also come out on november 7th. The iron flame sprayed edges and the fourth wing holiday special. They would both arrive on the 14th or 15th of november, but on the 15th I received two emails explaining for both books that they are currently unavailable and that they would email me when a new delivery date was known. Well, i contacted customer service about this, and I got a very 'know-it-all' CSA , they explained to me that they are currently sold out of both books and are waiting on confirmation of the publisher... Excuse me? I pre-ordered, what do you mean sold out? The CSA kept telling me that this is how a pre-order works , no! If I pre-order I reserve a book for myself. If Amazon does not have the stock, then they shouldn't sell it. And both books were still available for pre-order long after I bought them, so I know a LOT of people are as disappointed as I am right now. But the CSA wouldn't answer my question of why, they just kept repeating that this is a pre-order. Bs. Then, i contacted another CSA and they told me one of my orders was canceled!!!?? I have never approved this cancellation and I still have not received any email about this. I did get my money back, but it seems like contacting customer service had triggered this cancellation because Amazon still hasnt cancelled my other book. But moral of the story, dont pre-order from Amazon, they are just trying to make as much money without actually knowing if they can deliver. So pre-order on your own risk, its a gamble. I also cannot order a new book because it's literally sold out everywhere and I cant undo the cancellation. The CSA also told me that they can't promise me that I'll get my books because they don't even know if they are gonna get 'new' stock from the publisher.... (probably never because both books are limited edition) Very very disappointed, and also very very angry and frustrated.

Review Title: Disappointed with Amazon‚Äôs Declining Delivery Service
Review Text: I‚Äôve been an Amazon customer for years, and I have to say, I‚Äôm quite disappointed with the current state of their delivery service. Once hailed as the epitome of convenience with their same day, next day, and two-day deliveries, it has become a hit or miss experience.I remember when I could rely on Amazon to deliver my most important items promptly, without fail. However, in recent times, I‚Äôve had multiple instances where these deliveries were either delayed or, worse, lost altogether. Needless to say, this has left me feeling frustrated and dissatisfied.It is absolutely unacceptable for a service that prides itself on efficiency and reliability to provide such unreliable service. Customers rely on Amazon to deliver their goods on time, especially when they‚Äôre crucial and time-sensitive items. Countless times I‚Äôve found myself waiting anxiously, only to be disappointed when the delivery is delayed or simply never arrives.It‚Äôs disheartening to see a company that was once the gold standard for fast and reliable deliveries struggle to maintain that standard. If Amazon wishes to retain its loyal customers and attract new ones, they need to address these shortcomings immediately. Not only should they improve their communication regarding delayed deliveries, but they should also take concrete steps to prevent these delays and losses from happening in the first place.I hope Amazon realizes the impact these delivery issues have on their customers. For now, I can only express my disappointment and hope for a significant improvement in their delivery service.

Review Title: The scam called third party selling on AMAZON...
Review Text: Third party sellers on AMAZON.com do not have to disclose their true, actual identities. They come up with a pseudy-name, a fake name. A third party seller only needs a pseudy-name, a working email address and a bank account. That's it! AMAZON has no idea who these people are in reality. Nor do they care either! Its a scam! And there are millions of them on-line, doing business under the AMAZON domain name. Its an unfair market  advantage since American businesses need to incorporate (usually this is a good idea for legal reasons), pay taxes and fees, file tax returns, file for business licenses, etc. AMAZON and the millions of third party sellers who transact business under the AMAZON domain are scamming the US economy and the American consumer! If these AMAZON third party sellers get into trouble with AMAZON, they only have to change their fake business name and get a new email address! AMAZON knows this too! It is a cycle of perpetual chaos and insanity!  The largest population of third party AMAZON sellers are in CHINA and AMAZON protects these sellers at the expense of the American consumer - crazy! :(

Review Title: Timing may not be everything but -- it is important!
Review Text: At 11 AM delivery was to be today at 12:05 it is now 2 days or so later. I had ordered a desk for a new computer (which also came from Amazon). Since I am older I ask a friend for help to assemble it. He is taking off work and driving 45 miles to help me. I called him at 11 AM and said the desk would be here. He left work. At 12 05 PM got an e-mail that the delivery will probably now be on the 19th. I ordered a matching table and that will be here today, but I really don't need help putting that together. Have to go he is at the door. Timing is everything - even the timing of missed delivery notifications!

I thought it was a joke.  So all day I contact them over 100 times hung up on about 10     Never resolved. I had 3 orders totaling 500 dollars they said we‚Äôre canceled but never heard anything about refunds.  So now I feel like they stole 500 dollars from me.   Will never use Amazon again after this.

What an Absolute joke. For many years the pay in 5 months instalments via Amazon themselves has been active on my account, I've used it loads of times in the past without missing a payment as well as I've literally just finished paying off my last item a few days ago with no issues whatsoever. So after doing some research and asking others in shops at the check out they have all said the same that theirs has just vanished. However I've checked on my mother in law's Amazon account and her's is still active. Like huh how is her's still active and mines gone? My Amazon account is squeaky clean and I've easily spent 20k+ over the years. So until Amazon decide to put this back I will never use them again and the 1 star will remain.Update 06/05/2024: amazon has finally put the pay monthly option back on to my account, however I have noticed now that they request the full amount of the item first through your bank but they don't take any money, then once that's confirmed they will only charge the monthly amount, so if you have less money in your account than the item you want to purchase, they will not allow you to pay in 5 or 12 monthly instalments when they used to only requested the monthly amount. Now what is the point of this monthly payment if you have to have the same amount of money or more in your account than the item?? if you have the full amount in your account then you don't need to pay in instalments. So what an absolute joke and complete shambles. Worst part of it is, when I spoke to amazon the person said they have not changed how it works and it's been like that for years then left the chat then another advisor came on. But I can 100% guarantee you they have changed how it works. So it looks like I know more than the fully trained amazon advisor. So the 1 star remains until they take the request of the full amount off and put it back to what it was before.

Review Title: Had to contact customer service today‚Ä¶
Review Text: Had to contact customer service today about an incorrect charge to my credit card. I have never had to jump through so many hoops to contact someone. First I tried online chat and was told I would have to phone Amazon but couldn't supply a phone number. Attempts to find phone number on their website just looped me back to online so I ended up googling the number. After several conversations with the computerized I was finally connected to a real person who informed me that no charges had been applied to my account yet the info on the bank charge was the same as previous charges from before I cancelled my account. When I further pressed I was told that the charges could be connected  to a previous account that I had years ago. She said that she could see I had this account but she could not access it. When I asked to be put through to someone who could help she said the there was nobody and I should just dispute the charge with my bank which I have done but I can see this becoming a recurring problem that Amazon should be able to rectify.
How do I share items? I used to be able to share links. Why would Amazon make sharing lists & gifts harder?

After years of brilliant service Amazon you have let me down. Instead of leaving a 5 star I've had to leave a true negative review and sadly will close my account.I purchased a fire kindle for my 6 yrs old daughter of which a free subscription for 12 months and after expiry chargeable. Knowing this I took the time to contact Amazon and was told don't worry Mr Brown you have no subscription and no up and coming subscriptions I explained what the subscription was for and when expired. I was not aware that my 6 year old had her own Amazon account when I registered the device and had to put my credit card details on being an over 18. Amazon started taking money out of my account in August and I only noticed this November.I made contact and explained I was told I would be credited back the 4 months then I was cut off when I wanted to complain about the fact that it had been debited after I had taken the time to stop the subscription. It then turned in to hours of my time wasted with Amazon customer service to have the money given back.Because its not my Amazon account and belongs to my 7 year old daughter they could not deal with me. I had to contact again through my daughters account even though it could be anyone on there they even asked to speak to her. Its pathetic I am the father owner of the credit card and due to data protection use this as an excuse. They tell you when have contact via phone call you are taped by chat you have the transcript which I will add was wiped on my account on my device .however I did after being told find it on another device when I added my details so I have taken snap shots. I like this as the customer and the seller can see and listen to exactly what has been said.Amazon will not acknowledge that I made contact with them to cancel the subscription.I've asked for an apology and only had a verbal one and now as its not my Amazon account they will only speak with the account holder my 7yr old even though its my credit card Pathetic Amazon.What happened to the customer service integrity common sense ?Thank you for my time you wasted and as soon as the credit hits my account I will be closing my Amazon account a drop in the ocean.Customers beware of this Peter B

Review Title: I have been trying to get a refund for‚Ä¶
Review Text: I have been trying to get a refund for over a year on an item I returned. I had ordered a jacket that didn't end up fitting. I returned it to ups for them to ship it back so I could then be issued my refund. I was never issued a refund despite sending the item back. I have been given the run around for over a year now with one rep telling me the item was received and it would be credited to my amazon bill, and another one telling me the item was lost, finally by the last rep assuring me that I would see a credit to my account despite them being unsure if the jacket had gotten lost or not as they could still see it was given to ups to be sent back to the warehouse. I spend a lot of money at Amazon and have never had an issue before. I am really disappointed in how this whole situation has been handled as the charges still haven't been removed from my account. I had an issue last year with some identity theft which ended up having my paper credit card statements stop in the mail as well as me being locked out of my amazon account. All of this made this refund fall on the back burner as I had bigger issues to deal with at the time. I assumed it would eventually be credited to my account as I had been reassured the last couple of times I spoke with customer service. I have now started receiving my paper amazon statements, and seen that the refund for the jacket was in fact never credited back on my bill. I don't feel I should have to pay for an item that I don't even have anymore that I followed the directions to return correctly as after that it was out of my control.

Review Title: Customer service went from A to F
Review Text: Amazon has been slowly going downhill, but in the past year the customer service has become horrific. It is no longer worth shopping on Amazon, ever. You run a high risk of having a horrible experience if something goes wrong.Amazon has had issues with shipping speed, fake reviews, empty boxes, used products sold as new, and bad packaging for a long time. But the saving grace was their customer service would fix your issues. That is NO longer the case. Customer service will instead try to do anything they can to not refund you for a package lost in shipping (even with tracking!) or a return. Every time you talk to a representative you will hear something completely different. They have no clue what they are doing, they just want you off the phone/chat ASAP.I will never use Amazon again, after 18 years and $15,000+ PER year spent, they will never get another cent from me. Ordering anything from them is now stressful because you anticipate something will go wrong. Try literally ANY other site. Want electronics? B&H. Want regular goods? Target or Walmart. Trading cards or art? eBay or Etsy. Literally anything but Amazon. I never thought I would dump Amazon, but it is now far more trouble than it‚Äôs worth. If it continues on this track, Prime will be removed as a service in the next few years.

Review Title: AMAZON IS LYING ABOUT ITS SHIPPING
Review Text: This review was written on November 2, 2023 and updated on December 6.  A new order I placed on November 15 was PURPORTEDLY shipped on November 24, but I received two notices of delayed delivery, the last one saying I would only receive my shipment on January 6 ‚Äî 52 days after placing my order. On November 24 the tracking information for my November 15 order said, ‚ÄúCarrier picked up package at Los Angeles International Airport. Shipment is on its way to destination country.‚Äù Ten days later the carrier‚Äôs website still said, ‚ÄúNovember 24, 2023: Package is on the way to destination country.‚Äù Now, on January 6, it says, ‚ÄùDecember 5, 2023: Carrier picked up package at Buena Park, CA.‚Äù THIS MEANS THAT THE FIRST TRACKING INFO WAS A LIE. Another order that I placed in early September only reached me in late November. Amazon used to hire good carriers like FedEx, UPS or DHL Express. Now it is making millions of dollars on its shipping charges by using the cheapest and slowest carriers in the world while charging its customers high shipping fees and LYING TO THEM. My messages to Amazon‚Äôs CEO Andy Jassy about this are always answered by a standard bureaucratic replies claiming unforeseen circumstances and other delays but never addressing the content of my messages. I have asked Jassy, ‚ÄúIs this Amazon or Alibaba?!‚Äù He has never replied. Amazon calls itself ‚ÄúEarth‚Äôs most customer-centric company.‚Äù That is a sad joke.

Review Title: Amazon Flex - Driver Support is Equivalent to Poo Poo
Review Text: Amazon Flex - Side GigThe quality of Driver Support is severely lacking; it appears to be more of a facade than genuine concern. Support is often incapable of providing meaningful assistance to drivers and tends to offer recommendations that harm their standings. Despite my brief tenure of less than 15 days and only 5 attempted/completed deliveries, I've filed numerous reports without satisfactory resolutions. No one responds to your support emails and direct contact with Support is useless. They're dismissive and just want to end the call so they can carry on with their laziness.There is a noticeable lack of care from just about everyone, exemplified by unanswered emails, unhelpful support responses, and the logistical failure of multiple drivers delivering to the same location simultaneously. My account seems to be shadow banned without any fault on my part, a consequence of ill-advised recommendations from support representatives. Once shadow banned, available offers are scarce and undesirable, often requiring the completion of more deliveries than you can actually handle and in an unreasonably short time frame, particularly to challenging locations. (apartments, building complex's, gates, codes, with poorly written instructions)It's perplexing that, despite only three deliveries, I've garnered a multitude of compliments from customers, yet support continues to recommend actions detrimental to drivers' scores. With one incident again, recommended by a support rep, I am now seeing 0 offers and the offers that I do see are so bad that you're almost always going to be late. A company of such stature, built on innovative minds, should prioritize refining its Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Standard Work Instructions (SWIs). The current lack of coherence in support recommendations suggests a need for substantial improvement.The repercussions are evident when company leadership prioritizes personal gain over reinvesting in the company. Profiting extensively from AliExpress products, they display negligence towards their flawed mobile applications, lackluster pay, subpar support team, and logistical shortcomings. It serves as a prime illustration of poorly developed AI and algorithms.
