Review Title: Haven't been happy with Amazon the past‚Ä¶
Review Text: Haven't been happy with Amazon the past few months. Everytime I reach out about a complaint towards a driver and hoping I don't have to deal with anymore ignorant ones not following delivery instructions, I deal with another one. Dealt with one today. I reached out and complained about them, agent apologized twice and said they'd take care of it and also escalated the situation so it won't happen again. Was it really escalated and taken care of though? I've dealt with it before and complained and I was told the same thing. I can't stand when anyone but myself and my boyfriend walk or try to walk between my vehicles. That's ignorant. There is no reason for it especially where my front door is they can just walk through grass. I'm tired of reaching out about this. Always seems to be random drivers that haven't been here before too. But I have it listed on my account for drivers not to walk between my vehicles at all. Wish people would have commen sense and respect but clearly lots of people out there lack both. I will stop ordering from Amazon for as long as I live here if I'm going to continue to get ignorant drivers. Also every driver reported no matter what company they work for, should be punished in some way and not be able to deliver at the house that complained about them anymore. I also have had issues with rude/unhelpful agents many times.I also don't like how you have to have a credit card to do try before you buy. A debit card should be just fine! I also like the Amazon payment plans, I've used it for 3 or 4 items, but now I no longer see payments available when I browse and don't understand why. If they were available to me before, they should always be available to me. I paid off everything on time to.

According to their own statement: "returning their item at a UPS Store when there is a free option closer to their delivery address, a very small amount of customers may incur a $1 fee." A small amount of customers?? Plus there are non of their so-called closer locations to me. UPS is it. So they started charging me $1.00 per item returned. I have been with them for 22 years and have made 3 returns. Plus, they advocate reviews by their customers to help others. DONT DO IT! They block your account from ever doing another review. I am so feed up with this company. And when they charge you for returns-they block you from ever sending a simple customer service contact. Cant be done. They fix your account where it can no longer be accomplished. We started giving gift cards to family members because of what they are doing.

Review Title: Placed an order for next day delivery‚Ä¶
Review Text: Placed an order for next day delivery that was a gift.  Received an email saying my package was, not only delivered, but handed to me and signed for by me.  Neither of which is true.  Package was never delivered and customer service was a joke. This is not the first time this has happened.  I have read a lot about drivers stealing packages.  Amazon prime is a great online shopping option but when delivery is this bad it's not worth it.Update on 11/16/23  Regarding the above order. Finally received the order in 3 separate shipments.  I needed to return 3 items via UPS store.  One item was refunded the following day the other 2 have been received by the shipping facility but the refund is being held until December .  I wrote the following to Amazon when they asked to rate my experience when speaking with their customer rep today:"Where is my damn refund?  And, when did Amazon change the policy on refunds without informing their client base.  I returned 3 items to ups. Received a refund for 1 item the following day.  The other 2 show my items were accepted by the facility in Indianapolis and I can expect a refund around December. 1st...what in the hell?  I need the refund NOW .  Maybe your customers should start charging Amazon interest on our refunds they are stalling. This in no way reflects on the customer service I received from Nana.  Although prior to speaking with her I spoke with another who referred me to the chat bot because the verification codes he kept sending , to which I responded, were not received on his end.  Get it together Amazon before your customer service rating falls below those for Temu."

Review Title: Amazon has pros and cons - Good overall!
Review Text: Amazon has it's pros and cons, but one thing they usually have going for them is good return policies!I know that not all Amazon sellers are required to adhere to the standard return policy, but that is shown on the item page where the item is sold.  If you check that, and order only RETURNABLE items, and check the specific return policy for certain items - should be a good experience.I've placed literally hundreds of orders through Amazon, and 98% of the time, I've been satisfied either with the product I received, or a full refund.The only reason I'm not giving Amazon 5 stars is because they definitely have room for improvement, and I don't like how they've impacted the business of so many local brick-and-mortar stores.

Bought a Corona Furniture  4 Door Arch Top Wardrobe.Quality 0 out 10. Dented, scratched, damaged, whole thing not square. Pre drilled holes in wrong place, gaps as wood not long enough at front and rear. Instruction book but none of pieces of wood labelled so like a massive jigsaw puzzle. Mercers did say they would replace damaged pieces or could return. (They obviously do not check quality of products and leave it to whether buyer will complain, ask for refund etc)I Explained I'm disabled, suffer mental health due to a mental breakdown and i  am not well, also offered to supply proof if they needed( blanked my messages). I had to pay someone to assemble as cannot do myself, they followed the Instruction pamplet step by step but pieces didn't fit as holes in wrong places, so could not use all the dowels. They wanted pics of rear of wardrobe but again explained I'm disabled and against wall.Ignored what i was saying and kept saying disassemble, box up and make appointment  to be collected. I couldnt cope, got upset to point of tears that I said I'd keep as found the whole process extremely upsetting and take money off. I Provided pics of damage, the unit not square,with pics of spirit level showing not straight. Images of doors misaligned, 4 shelves not straight with images of spirit level showing, images of damage, dents, scratches, gaps and they offered ¬£15 off ¬£350 cost with finance. Amazon didn't least amount they could to help and it seemed the whole thing was in sellers favour. I then got an offer of ¬£25 off. I should also add the doors don't stay shut are higher than one another, from the left side going to the right, starts off flush and as it goes to other end gap starts and gets bigger and bigger ending in 2 to 3 inch gap. Photos provided and Amazon refused my first review, 2nd in review. Buy at your own risk, I explained to Mercer's that it had me in tears, affected my mental health, couldn't go through process of having to pay again to be dismantled and returned. They didn't show one bit of care, no empathy. Worst experience I've ever had to deal with to get money knocked off. I'm stuck paying for a year for a piece of rubbish at cost of ¬£325.

Ordered a lens on Friday for my husband it was ¬£669 very good value and was supposedly on sale with Amazon.  It was due to arrive on Sunday.  Sunday morning I received an email informing me that the lens had to be cancelled due to unavailability and that it would take 1 - 2 business days before the money would go back on my account!! I went into Amazon where the lens was showing as still having 6 available. I finally contacted Amazon by phone, asking to speak to a Manager, there was a definitely a language barrier, I found it extremely difficult understanding what they were saying, with at least 2 customer service reps speaking very bad English, and did not understand what I wanted and basically just put the phone down on me.I could not get in touch with a manager at all, despite trying for over an hour, finally I used the chat option. I was put through to someone who said he was a member of the leadership team, who told me the 6 that were showing available, were already pre-ordered, (which is surly rubbish, as if pre-ordered surely they shouldn't show as being available).  I said that I had ordered these on Friday and if they weren't available, why had they taken the money for these out of my account?  He was not able/refused to answer that question.Earlier this week I had a generated email from Amazon, telling me I was cancelling items and if this continued they would not refund me.  When I got in touch with them about this, they said it was automatically generated email.  I pointed out that what they were saying about refunding was illegal and that, in my case, it was they who were cancelling items not I.  This is all very strange isn't it?  I have attached a picture of the lens, this I uploaded at 11.36 on Sunday 5th November, so you can see for yourselves it is still stating 6 available (NOT 6 PRE-ORDERED).  Again the 6 lens are still showing as available at 17.26pm and again at 17.50pm on Sunday 5th November.  I have taken a snap shot and can share if required.  This is very frustratingSeriously considering closing all my accounts with Amazon, having been with them for many years the level of customer service, is now non existent!!!!!

Review Title: Stolen iPad by Amazon-NO REFUND, BLOCKED account
Review Text: I have been a loyal Amazon customer since 2016, consistently engaging in numerous transactions with a clear and honest track record. It is with great regret and frustration that I find myself compelled to leave a 1-star review after a recent experience that has left me questioning Amazon‚Äôs commitment to customer service and fair play.I recently purchased a 10th generation 256 GB iPad (Order No. 113-7489110-7733059), but upon delivery, I was shocked to discover a metal plate instead of the iPad I had ordered. Acting promptly, I reported the incident to Amazon within 30 minutes of delivery, providing all necessary documentation, including a detailed police report (Report No. 01-23-094996). Despite initially assuring me that a refund was in process, Amazon later retracted this and, without any valid justification, suspended my account, tainting my reputation by labeling me as a 'serial offender'.The handling of my case was not only unjust but it also highlighted a severe lack of evidence on Amazon‚Äôs part to substantiate their claims. Despite my efforts to resolve the issue amicably, including providing photographic evidence and engaging in extensive communication, Amazon has remained uncooperative. The discrepancy in package weight and the condition of the packaging upon receipt were clear indicators of tampering, yet my concerns were dismissed.My intent behind this review is not only to express my dissatisfaction but also to alert others to the potential pitfalls of dealing with Amazon‚Äôs customer service. It‚Äôs disheartening to have one's integrity doubted and to be denied a basic consumer right ‚Äî the right to receive the purchased product or a refund.As I continue to seek a resolution through the Delaware Department of Justice Consumer Protection Unit, I am left with a tarnished view of a company I once held in high esteem. I can only hope that this review serves as a call for Amazon to improve their support processes and to treat their customers with the respect and honesty they deserve.Buyer beware ‚Äì your loyalty may not shield you from a similar ordeal.

first, I have been a satisfied amazon.com customer for over fifteen years.   This review involves an issue with an amazon.com approved return.   I purchased a product from amazon which turns out I didn't need.  So, I put in for a return, placed a copy of the original invoice in a sturdy shipping box, taped it up using 3M shipping grade tape then dropped it off with our shipping clerk for pick-up by UPS.   Day before UPS was scheduled to pick-up the package, an amazon.com delivery driver takes the package from our shipping clerk and leaves no receipt or tracking number.   This made it impossible for me to prove that amazon.com had picked up the package for return.   The next day, UPS attempted pickup and to their credit left a shipping label along with a tracking number with our front desk shipping clerk.   amazon.com refuses to acknowledge the pick-up for return and refuses to provide a refund ($99.99).   I'm headed to the Washington state Attorney General's office along with the Federal Trade Commission to see what they have to say about the problem.

Review Title: Disappointing Customer Service and Product Quality from Amazon
Review Text: I recently had an incredibly disappointing experience with Amazon, and I feel compelled to share my dissatisfaction with the community. My purchase of a rice cooker from Amazon turned into a frustrating ordeal that highlighted their poor customer service and lack of empathy towards international customers.I purchased a rice cooker from Amazon, hoping to have a reliable kitchen appliance. However, the product arrived broken, rendering it completely unusable. As I was overseas at the time, I utilized a freight forwarder to have the product shipped to my location. Unfortunately, due to logistical constraints and the time taken for the shipment, I couldn't initiate the return process within the ten-day window provided by Amazon.Upon contacting their customer support, I was met with a series of canned responses that lacked any form of empathy or understanding of my situation. It seemed as though I was conversing with automated robots rather than individuals capable of critical thinking and problem-solving. Their refusal to provide a replacement or a refund left me feeling utterly disregarded and disrespected as a customer.It is deeply disheartening to encounter such a lack of consideration for the challenges faced by international customers. The rigid adherence to a ten-day return window, coupled with the robotic and unhelpful nature of their customer support, has significantly tarnished my perception of Amazon's commitment to customer satisfaction.As a loyal customer who has relied on Amazon for various purchases over the years, this experience has left me disillusioned and hesitant to continue using their services. I urge Amazon to reevaluate their customer service protocols and extend greater support and understanding to customers facing genuine difficulties, especially those outside the United States. It is crucial for them to remember that behind every transaction is a real person with genuine concerns and expectations.

I have been a loyal Amazon customer for many years, and I must say that my experience with this platform has been consistently outstanding. Amazon is a one-stop shop that offers convenience, a vast product selection, and exceptional customer service.The convenience of shopping on Amazon is unparalleled. From the comfort of my home, I can find virtually anything I need, and the user-friendly interface makes it easy to browse, compare products, and make informed decisions. The search and filtering options are incredibly helpful, ensuring that I can quickly find what I'm looking for.One of the standout features of Amazon is its fast shipping, especially for Amazon Prime members. The Prime membership has been a game-changer, with free and often same-day or two-day shipping available for a wide range of products. It's a great value for frequent shoppers like me.Amazon's product selection is unmatched. Whether I'm shopping for electronics, books, clothing, or groceries, I can count on Amazon to have a diverse range of choices. The platform also allows third-party sellers, which means I can often find unique and niche products.Customer service on Amazon has always been responsive and helpful in my experience. Any issues I've had with orders were quickly resolved, and the return process is straightforward. Their commitment to customer satisfaction is evident.Overall, I can confidently say that Amazon has made my life more convenient, efficient, and enjoyable. It's my go-to platform for shopping, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable and customer-focused online retailer.Amazon's commitment to convenience, product selection, fast shipping, and excellent customer service has made it my preferred online shopping destination. It's a five-star experience, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Amazon to family and friends.

Review Title: I bought a water heater and some other‚Ä¶
Review Text: I bought a water heater and some other stuff from Amazon. They broke the order up into 4 different deliveries. The first box had a car manifold in it. it was all labeled right with my name but i didn't order it. I called them to PU the item. After 2 days 2 other boxes came on separate trucks. They left them by my door and never PU the manifold box. The third truck arrived and Instead of picking up the car manifold, they PU the water heater they delivered that morning. I came home from work and called to see what happened and again I got some third-world person that I could hardly understand but this time I heard a baby crying in the background. I tried to explain and all their they answers were they were reading from some flowchart. They are told what to say word for word. They kept saying it was impossible that could have happened. I tried a few more times and I would get the same answers. After months of calling I gave up, now out 450 dollars. Then I figured maybe I could get some money back I lost so I told them to PU the manifold which was over 300 dollars. My name and address were all over the box. They said I'm sorry, you never ordered that Item and we can't give you credit. Now I'm stuck with a Ford 2012 manifold and out 450 dollars. Don't call or try to reason with customer service. They are completely useless. Better yet, save yourself a lot of aggravation. Don't bother ordering from Amazon. Does anybody have a use for a 2012 Ford manifold?

Review Title: Amazon creates an environment where damaged products are acceptable, they'll give you refunds, but it's a hassle to even bother with in the first place.
Review Text: In the start, amazon used to be really good and I could rely on them. I read a lot but the books I like can't be bought in most book stores, or I want new releases that will take months to come out in bookstores. I've had books come in pristine condition so the odd ¬£30 I've paid for them has been worth it. But recently, sellers have been sending out books that are so dirty they can't be cleaned or removing the dirt damages the books and they see this as an okay thing to do. There is never holes in the packaging, the packaging is bent but even then how is this much dirt getting on the books?In the end, I've come to the conclusion that sellers are just selling really dirty books and nobody cares if you send it back or not, because the majority of the time people won't send them back or they'll forget. Thankfully, these specific books can be bought in bookstores for ¬£3 more and they actually take care of them.It's pathetic that amazon thinks this is okay. However, they also seem to have a tendency to sell you broken ram sticks   costing almost ¬£40 that just do not work on computers.I'm not paying for damaged items, and the reviews always say they're wonderful, but I still get damaged products.
Sort out your packaging. The biggest box for some crappy item.

I reached out exactly 2 weeks later, the exact date they said I could request it, then they told me I had to wait until the end of the day. Meanwhile, my package has been in the same location since it was shipped. It's obviously lost. I request the refund the next day (2 weeks and 1 day) and now I have to fill out some form that will take them a while to review, to see if I'm even eligible for a refund. My package was lost. Period. Give me money back already! This is absolutely absurd.

Review Title: Got my money back through my legal insurance
Review Text: I have ordered stuff online for two decades, sometimes from sketchy shops with little hope for customer protection, yet I never got scammed. Until I ordered from Amazon.On April 2023 I placed a fairly expensive order (403-1085610-9838734) worth almost 600 euro, to only receive the wrong goods in a damaged and incomplete fashion. Although I immediately contacted Amazon I ended up in a nightmare for five long frustrating months without any reasonable compensation. I finally threatened to sue Amazon and got my money back through my legal insurance!Their nerve to claim "Amazon strives to be Earth‚Äôs most customer-centric company" is utterly appalling. Never in my life have I been treated so horribly. Amazon is by far the very worst online shopping experience I can imagine. Their level of incompetence is simply criminal.The whole thing went wrong when an Amazon helpdesk employee filed a ATOZ claim prematurely that had me waiting for one month, voiding my right to get reimbursed. It was their mistake for which I received multiple apologies from Amazon but which in the course of another four months couldn't be fixed. All this time I remained patient, polite and confident that Amazon would make right. Only, despite promises, they never did. After finally threatening Amazon with a lawsuit Amazon's Executive Customer Relations stepped in, making me a truly despicable offer: to put my money on a voucher "with something extra for the inconvenience". How on earth is that reasonable? The item I ordered was no longer available through Amazon, so I kindly declined the extra's and just demanded my money back. Their response: "We apologize we could not find a solution to the problem. Unfortunately we are unable to offer any new information. We will no longer respond to anything related to this order." Not find a solution? How about just giving people back their money when you screw up so miserably, causing five months of frustration?Although my case was solid and well documented my legal insurance advised against litigation because a lawsuit could take another five months to win. My patience had run out and I ended agreeing to be paid out my incurred losses by the insurance. Amazon went scot-free and probably continues to scam more honest customers out of their money. Utterly disgusting. Naturally I terminated anything related to Amazon. This will remain the first and last time I was robbed of my money by a billion dollar company... I'll stick with the smaller "sketchy" businesses that have remained decent and reliable.

Subject: Complaint regarding refund issues and poor customer serviceDear Amazon Customer Service,I am writing to you with great dissatisfaction and frustration regarding my recent experience with Amazon. As a loyal customer, I expect a certain level of service, which unfortunately has been severely lacking in my recent interactions with your company. I made a purchase on Amazon, using my own funds, for an item. To my disappointment, the wrong size was sent to me not once, but three times. In order to expedite the process, I used the return refunds provided to me in gift card form and immediately repurchased the item. However, due to the repeated errors made by Amazon, I finally requested a refund for the item to be returned to my original account.To my dismay, it took four weeks and multiple attempts to contact customer service to receive a response. Eventually, the refund was processed, but contrary to what I was informed, it was credited back to the gift card instead of my original account. I subsequently reached out to seniormanagers and was assured on four separate occasions that the refund would be transferred to my account within seven days.However, it has now been an unreasonable amount of time, and I still have not received the refund in my original account. Furthermore, when I contacted Amazon again to rectify the situation, I was informed that they could not refund the money from the gift card, which was originally my own money.I am deeply disappointed and frustrated by this level of service. It is unacceptable for Amazon to provide false information and promises regarding refunds, causing undue inconvenience and financial loss on my part.I kindly request a thorough investigation into this matter and a prompt resolution. I expect the refund to be immediately credited back to my original account without any further delays. Additionally, I would appreciate appropriate compensation for the time, effort, and frustration I have experienced as a result of Amazon's errors and poor customer service.I value my long-standing relationship with Amazon and hope that this complaint prompts a change in the way you handle such situations. I trust that you will take immediate action to rectify these issues and restore my faith in the company.I look forward to your prompt response resolving this matter.Thank you for your attention to this urgent issue.Yours sincerely,Nigel Lane

Review Title: Beware when item comes in multiple pieces
Review Text: I recently order a tonneau cover for my truck. The item ships in 2 pieces: the cover and the rails. Amazon only shipped the cover and did not ship the rails. I called their customer support and was told there was no way for them to ship me the missing box... instead, I would have to return the product and re-order.I returned the one box I had received and waited for Amazon to receive the returned item. After 2 weeks, I still had not received a refund, so I called customer service once again. Apparently, something was missed so they hadn't issued a refund. 5 days later, my credit card was refunded.As requested, I re-ordered the product. Once again, I received only the cover and not the rails. When I called Amazon, I was told I couldn't return it because it hadn't been delivered even though it was clearly sitting in my garage (apparently it did not show up as delivered in their system). I waited until it showed as delivered online and called customer service again (4th time if you're keeping count). Same story... they cannot send me the missing box so I will have to return the cover and re-order.This has been going on for almost 2 months now.The saga continues... Given this is an oversized item, it must be picked up by a local carrier. After 10 days, 3 calls to customer service, and 4 emails to customer service, I finally received the email I needed that needed to be forwarded to the local carrier. 2 weeks after initial delivery, the box was picked up and is on route to Amazon.Not over yet! The one box was picked up from my home on November 10th. It took until November 21st to get to Amazon in Toronto. Amazon now claims they need up to 14 days to process the return and issue my refund. As of November 30th, Amazon's systems have yet to be updated... and of course, no refund.

Review Title: I‚Äôve bought 4 items from Amazon in the‚Ä¶
Review Text: I‚Äôve bought 4 items from Amazon in the past few weeks. Firstly, a book, which though not damaged in transit had a damaged corner and a torn dust cover when I opened the package. Clearly it was picked and packed in that state.Secondly, another book, which was delivered while I was home and I saw the Amazon van arrive outside and waited by my front door to take the delivery. Except he didn‚Äôt come up to my front door. Out of my line of sight, he left the package in my half full garden waste bin, taken a snap of his fine work, and driven away! Staggering stupidity.The next item was delivered on time, no problemThe latest purchase was due for delivery yesterday by 8pm. It never arrived. The so-called trace leads to the Royal Mail website and when to try to track the parcel it sternly tells you that tracking can only be done when they‚Äôve attempted delivery! I guess it‚Äôs the Royal Mail at fault, but in agreement with many other reviewers I find it astonishingly difficult to actually speak with an Amazon employee who are after all the supplier and whose responsibility it is to ensure the goods arrive with the purchaser when they should and in a good condition.I‚Äôve made a mental note to use Amazon only as a last resort. It‚Äôs funny how many big business operations performance only ever gets worse the bigger they become. See IBM.

I have been posting book reviews on Amazon for many years, always buying the books at the site to get the cachet of ‚ÄúVerified purchase‚Äù. My efforts resulted in more than thirty reviews appearing on Amazon, many rated as either ‚ÄúTop Positive Review‚Äù or ‚ÄúTop Critical Review‚Äù. But when I submitted a review of ‚ÄúThe Last Politician‚Äù by Franklin Foer, I got a terse email from Amazon that it could not be posted ‚Äúbecause it doesn‚Äôt meet our guidelines for one or more of these reasons: Profanity, Harassment, Hate Speech, Sexual Content, Illegal Activity, Private Information‚Äù. This had never happened before, and I was quite surprised. I went to the link that showed the ‚ÄúCommunity Guidelines‚Äù and read all six pages, scratching my head, trying to figure what I‚Äôd done wrong and then I realized the issue was politics. The person checking my review was apparently an extreme liberal so I made some changes that I thought might let my piece ‚Äúpass‚Äù and I resubmitted it. But I soon realized this was a waste of time because I could make changes piecemeal again and again, but without knowing exactly what in my 850 word review was the ‚Äùproblem‚Äù, my efforts would be fruitless.How could I get the nameless and faceless Amazon person behind the ‚Äúwizard‚Äôs curtain‚Äù to tell me what to do? I remembered seeing on my ‚ÄúAuthor‚Äôs Page‚Äù a place where I could recommend books. I‚Äôd never used this feature before but now got the idea to cite Franklin Foer‚Äôs book as a ‚ÄúRecommendation‚Äù, writing in the comments, ‚ÄúI wrote a review of this book that did not pass the Amazon Moderator and I hope they will tell me what to change.‚Äù This was an act of desperation because I truly wanted to get my review posted and I was willing to make rewrites but had to have some guidance, sort of like we got from our high school English teacher who would take a red pencil and underline the problem.Apparently, my ploy with Amazon backfired because I soon got an email saying my post was ‚Äúoutside of our guidelines‚Äù and ‚Äúconsider this to be a first warning.‚Äù Amazon‚Äôs ire was about the book recommendation I‚Äôd put on my author‚Äôs page (specifically the comments showing Amazon in a bad light) since this was the only ‚Äúpost‚Äù I‚Äôd ever made other than book reviews.This was going nowhere, and I was not going to play Amazon‚Äôs games. I replied to the email, saying, ‚Äúif you cannot tell me what I am doing wrong I will cancel my book advertising, Amazon Prime, and the Amazon prime credit card and quit making purchases from Amazon.‚Äù Six days later I got a reply email saying, ‚ÄúYou have repeatedly posted content that violates our Community Guidelines . . . [and therefore] we‚Äôve removed your ability to participate in Community features.‚Äù This was untrue because I‚Äôd only made one post, the one where I said, ‚ÄúI hope they [Amazon Moderator] will tell me what to change [in the review that had been rejected].‚ÄùUnfortunately, all the book reviews I‚Äôd posted on Amazon over the years were deleted. This was quite disappointing because I‚Äôd spent hundreds of dollars on dozens of books, reading them closely over countless hours in order to write honest and informed book reviews and now my work had come to naught. I truly doubt that anyone has put more effort(both in the reading and the writing) into creating a book review than I have. Amazon‚Äôs actions have not only hurt me but are a disservice to millions of readers who rely on quality reviews to make wise decisions in their book purchases.As I said earlier, I‚Äôve submitted critical assessments of other books to Amazon and never had a problem and I must conclude the current issue is over politics, simply having a different opinion. While I did say some positives about the author, I also faulted him for being almost sycophantic toward Biden. What he wrote was an uncritical fluff piece and I called it as such. The review, as written, would be passable to any reasonable person and there is nothing out of bounds in it. I read the book thoroughly and wrote an honest, critical review with no malice or evil intent. For anyone interested, a google search of ‚Äúbook reviews of ‚ÄòThe Last Politician‚Äô‚Äù will take you to Goodreads where you‚Äôll find my piece and you can decide for yourself.

I could run you through the brash emails the hanging up of the phone or the weird decisions they seem to be making but whats the point you will all have your own versions of that to relate to. What I will say is that Amazon has become so big the tail is wagging the dog! Items dont arrive, refunds dont arrive, returns do arrive but then are deemed to be wrong by Amazon so further charges are applied to accounts. Do yourself a favour and shop about, there are better and even cheaper options out there its a little more work but when you get to the point of spending thousands a year Amazon should be your last choice not your first!

Review Title: A couple of years ago I had a problem‚Ä¶
Review Text: A couple of years ago I had a problem with my Amazon membership and was able to get through right away to someone who could speak good clear English and it was taken care of in less than a minute. This time I just got a notice saying that my order of light bulbs was attempted but not left. No explanation why, no nothing. Tried calling customer service got put on hold by someone who I could not understand 3 times then the phone on their end hung up after time. Their customer service has done a 180 not for the good.

Buyer beware.Amazon are increasingly touting themselves as "A Marketplace Seller".  A recent experience with a USA book seller is something I will strive to avoid from now on.Basically I ordered a used book on Excel spreadsheet programming etc.  The order was completed early... but the contents were a book called 'AUTOCAD 2020'.Something I have zero use for.I am now in the process of returning a hefty book to California, USA.I will bear the cost of a return post.The really bad news is that 'Amazon' will not refund MY money until the seller informs them of receipt.  This would be the same seller, that Amazon now tells me, has NO STOCK of the original book I ordered... leaving me to conclude that a book known to be misnamed on their stock inventory may have been shipped.Bottom line; this is a lot less like 'good service' than I would like.  The tick-box systems of so many businesses these days offers NO obvious clues that Amazon are likely to do much more than refer me to the task of reading their (no doubt) extensive T&C's which will justify their lax attitude to putting right the mistakes THEIR contacts have made.The one star refers to this issue.  I freely acknowledge that I find that their 'own sales' are in pretty good shape for most purchases.

Amazon just keep sending it to people until someone does not complain. Unbelievable.

While they obviously have questionable business behaviour, & in a lot of cases actually cruel working conditions, I've understood (like many of us) that convenience is king & I have chosen this over paying more for items, waiting longer for & paying extra for deliveries elsewhere. I had hoped that some that corporate body would keep them in check. Futile hope I guess but it's not the consumer's responsibility to organise & sacrifice themselves & their accounts for this. But I draw the line at such insanely poor customer service. I'm not sure when it died but the customer service in this place has been murdered. I've spoken to 5 different agents today on their live chat - over a span of 12 hours - to figure out & sort a seemingly innocuous issue; they create random accounts for each of your devices. I've been promised that a specialist would call me back 4 times & each time, I've been left waiting with no such call coming my way. At a certain point, being 'happy to help' is the most faceless thing you can say to someone who's tired of the constant BS & lies. I'm still waiting on that call but in the mean time, I've deleted my account.

Review Title: Master Bait n Switchers, Hate Crime Commissioners, Two-Faced Frauds
Review Text: For years have I tolerated this cesspit trifecta of fraud and corruption absolute. Between frequently defective streaming service, 3rd party commerce fraud, and illegal in-house withholding and contractual lies, this steaming pile of whistled Dixie knows not when to quit, even allows its own staff to violate their own forums with self immolating hate crime to torture their less happy customers--who retrospectively vilifies every psychotic "genius" he can of whom thinks that they can grift our unsuspecting OP for whatever it's worth--by pathologically lying in many forum accepted comments that hate breeds hate, neither supported nor condoned, not surprisingly expected and noted, neither surprisingly similar to the compulsive bull, forum violations, and finite fraud of both Amazon staff and whoever reported it the 1st place. (I wouldn't be surprised if it has nothing to do with that either, I have so many enemies, each only suffering a bed of their own making.)Anyway, whether removing content(s) from merchandise post-purchase, regardless of warning of change of terms in any way; outright fraud in description of content, services, or policy, even as blindly illogical so as to contradict itself in the same paragraph or sentence and then denying either, all the while denying refund (last time this happened was only a few months ago); or simply good, old fashioned BS (my review: "said new, sent used. liar. thief."), this place is the pit of iniquity. Finally saying it because I've gotten sick of being kicked off streaming several times in two hours. Between episodes is bad enough, still unacceptable, not user related. It's all Amazon nonsense, and I'm dead sick of the theft. Pay for episodes? Withdrawn. Buy another set. Pay for new? Used. Watch a new channel enough to make it worth the while? Hell, no. Kicked, over and over.It isn't bad enough I'm disabled and watch a fair bit, I have to put up with this absolute, actual theft from Amazon, the empire of organized crime itself. Enough. I'm spreading the truth and getting what I deserve back. It's not about the money though. If your liable pathological embellishment fraudulently takes me down in flames, I'm using every legal means to take you with me. You psychotic, compulsive liars deserve every bad review you've seen for stealing and defaming mine. Like I've already informed you, I'm going legal and this is justice. You can't hide the truth.

I recently purchased a video game from Amazon, and I couldn't have had a worse experience. The game arrived without the disc, and to make matters worse, the case wasn't wrapped in cellophane, and the disc slot was empty. It's painfully clear that someone at their warehouse pilfered the disc itself. This situation was extremely frustrating and infuriating.When I contacted Amazon's customer service, it took a mind-numbing 30 minutes to explain what had happened because, frankly, it seemed like they were completely clueless. It's as if they were living in a different world, disconnected from the problem I was facing.After I explained the situation, I was told I needed to wait for a "72-hour investigation." The entire time, I had to be the one reaching out to them for updates because they never took the initiative to keep me informed. Their customer service representatives were unbelievably rude, and they would abruptly end chats without my consent, as if they didn't want to deal with me anymore.After nearly a week of back-and-forth, I finally received a refund. However, this refund didn't include the ¬£5 voucher I had used for the purchase, which effectively left me out of pocket. I repeatedly asked how to make a formal complaint about the whole ordeal, and it seemed like they were actively avoiding my question and cutting me off. The lack of transparency and accountability was appalling.In conclusion, this experience with Amazon was a nightmare. The missing disc, the inept customer service, and the loss of the voucher all added up to a terrible shopping experience. I would strongly advise potential buyers to exercise caution and be prepared for a potential lack of assistance should anything go wrong with their purchase. It's incredibly disappointing to see a company of Amazon's stature failing so spectacularly in providing basic customer service and support.

Review Title: Delivers to wrong address - wants me to file a police report
Review Text: Amazon delivers items to the wrong address, delays delivery, damages items during shipping, and loses deliveries.There are two distinct patterns related to Amazon deliveries:1. Most are delivered to the right address with random deliveries to the wrong address.2. Clusters of multiple deliveries to the incorrect address over the course of 2-6 weeks.When there are repeated errors with deliveries, Amazon blames the consumer, asks them to update their delivery information (even though it's correct), denies refunds, and tells consumers they must file police reports, and provide that information, to be considered for a refund. It is my understanding, they will still deny a refund, which seems wrong.Amazon has asked me to return items for a refund on items I never received.Today I was told I had to file a police report about stolen packages, however, I have proof these packages were delivered to the wrong location, which is not the same as having them stolen. Filing a false report of theft is a Class A misdemeanor and I'm not willing to commit a crime because Amazon delivered several packages to the wrong address.They say based on 'their investigation' and my response, the items were stolen, unless they see my ring camera, which shows no packages, it seems their investigation is incomplete.

I contacted amazon and have to get a police report but in the UK you can only get a crime Reference Number so I can't even get a refund or return. Review Title: BEWARE of error messages - payment still taken!
Review Text: Usually great.  Today not so.  I tried to order 10 Covid test kits. Got an error message "We're sorryThere was an internal error in our system. We logged the problem and will investigate it later. Our apologies for the inconvenience." and a button to "Continue Shopping".   OK - so waited and tried again - same message.  Nothing to state payment would be taken.  So I went to another retailer site and ordered from them.  Then later I checked my credit card only to find TWO identical payments taken from Amazon without any notification to me!!  So I tried to cancel the order but system said it could not as dispatched.  So today, 20 Covid test kits arrived that I do not need. I tried to initiate a return, but system said these items cannot be returned or refunded. So I did an online chat with customer services to explain the issue, the system error message etc., but they simply refused to take any action or take the goods back.  So I am ¬£22 out of pocket with 20 Covid test kits I will not use, (the expiry date of each is just 11 months hence.) So peeps...BEWARE - if ever you get a system error message as you order - that order WILL BE PROCESSED without your knowledge!!
Lisa good service

For big ticket items, Amazon apparently has a policy that refunds can take up to 30 days. Now, I've been a regular customer (who isn't). Between me and my husband, we probably buy something from Amazon 2-3 times a week. Then one day we buy a big ticket item ($350), return it, and this happens. It certainly leaves a bad taste in my mouth about this company, but more, I am so disheartened because I have really loved Amazon. Calling customer service is something I've rarely done. I don't even mind the song-and-dance scripted responses. I know the call center people are just doing their jobs, and they're honest people just like us. I am always polite when I speak to them, but the clincher for me was when I asked to speak to the supervisor, the guy practically told me in not so many words, 'If I transfer you, ma'am, I guarantee he will tell you the same thing anyway.' Through polite insistence, I managed to make him transfer me to his lead guy, who seemed to be more polished in language and demeanor. After more song-and-dance exchange, the bottom line is the lead person couldn't even override the system to plead my 'proven and very legitimate' case. But he at least gave me a viable excuse. They received my package through UPS a week ago, yet my app dashboard does not reflect that. Apparently, the communication breakdown comes from the return center, who has not processed the return. I am exasperated. The $382 refund is not going to bankrupt me, sure, but what this tells me is this: it's only going to get worse as this mega shopping platform gets even bigger.

Review Title: Following is a review I sent to Amazon‚Ä¶
Review Text: Following is a review I sent to Amazon after a recent order for three bags different loose leaf tea from Tealyra. All three were ordered on the same day, one arrived, and the other two were identified as "undeliverable."Atrocious customer service. No delivery of products. I was notified of the "problem with delivery" which in itself was a puzzle, as I ordered three items from the same company - 1 was delivered but the other 2 had a problem? I gave time for a refund to be made (products were purchased on 10/2), and finally I called today (10/16) and was then informed that it would take 5-7 days for the refund to be carried out - unless I decided to agree to an Amazon Card in which case it could be immediate. In other words - if I agree to another Amazon product then I can get a refund immediately, otherwise you will have held on to my money for a total of 19-21 days. You are always ready to take my money the moment I order something, but to refund takes days if not weeks. Additionally, if I had not taken the time to call about this issue, I would never have received a refund - I wonder how much money you take from this kind of poor customer service? This really is verging on scam territory!To say your customer service is disappointing is an understatement.

Duplicated from Amazon.co.ukWe returned an item, only to have issues from the get-go. Amazon used UPS to collect this product. UPS decided to hang on to it for longer than was necessary. After some pushing, UPS delivered and now Amazon is delaying refunding the original cost. 3-5 days became 14 days, which then became 14-30 days.Talk about moving the goalposts.Amazon has had our return for >10 days. I know this because the UPS tracking site shows this. Amazon has not synced its systems to correspond, and so we are now - out rather we were - running round in circles, speaking to people who seemed wholly incapable of independent thought.Talk about sacrificing something of yourself to perform as a robot in a consumer supply chain.Not one of the people we have been in contact with at Amazon have been able to do anything but regurgitate the company line.We are now told that customer complaints are dealt with internally - which is standard - which is where the results remain - which is not - with Amazon. Outcomes are not usually shared with the complainant.We asked what the point of complaining was if no feedback was released, to which there was no discernible reply. Seems there is no reply. Not a lawful one in any event.Amazon seems to have made its refund policy increasingly difficult to navigate. We strongly suggest that customers end all contact with this greedy industry. Take, take, take. That's the long and the short of it.We saw this coming when Amazon began to whittle down the benefits of being a Prime customer. Where once there was a "Free to Me" selection of movies, you now have an ads-free option, which isn't quite the same thing, with paid-for opting heavily outnumbering any kickbacks.Why bother?Also, Amazon Music makes it difficult to listen to your favourite tunes. Ever since the option to play your favourite album has been interfered with and the songs mixed up, any point of paying for Prime has gone out the window.Everything is engineered to illicit more and more cash from the customer. I get how difficult it can be to move on, but sometimes we just have to cut our losses and look for better deals elsewhere.There are other options. There are alternatives. Amazon does not have to be - indeed it is not - the only vehicle through which to interact with the worldoutside your window.Greed has finally got the better of this company. Do yourself a favour, and look someplace else ‚úä

Review Title: too many items not available for locker‚Ä¶
Review Text: too many items not available for locker collection or drop off point collection. Bought items froim Ebay instead.

Placed an order over ¬£700, driver turned up Thursday asked for a one time code, was given it then he checked the van no package. They said come back tomorrow, they didn't. After speaking to several staff at amazon all saying you have the code so your not having an exchange or refund. I have now informed my bank, the police and a solicitor and now the money is back in my account. I'm still following up as I don't want this to happen to others but please don't hand over the code until the products in your view. They even said we've checked your account you've had loads of refunds so i checked my account I've had 1 refund in 4 years. I asked for a copy of the details of the driver for the police, proof of a photo or video of delivery, along with a copy of the voice calls as 1 of the staff said its the drivers fault as he's supposed to have the package in hand and you exchange code and parcel. The driver was asked to sign some paper to say he'd not delivered it which he did. Amazon kept saying they'll email me the correct links but they did not. I had to keep requesting a call back. I was told I'd get a call Sunday they didn't call I had to contact them. No wonder they've got a poor rating. I've cancelled my prime and once this is resolved I'm cancelling my account and so have my friends and family.

Review Title: Customer service is very hard to get in‚Ä¶
Review Text: Customer service is very hard to get in touch with and very unhelpful once you do.I suspect that there is one or two people who ruin the experience, that should really be fired. I remember the voice. Since changing my phone number it has been completely impossible for me to access my account. I have tried to talk to amazon customer service about this five times already and they have neither gotten me access to the account again, nor deleted the account as I requested.After I gave them an honest feedback on the customer service a specific person provided, where I also stated my concern about someone else possibly getting access to my account if they obtain my old phone number and using it to order things, I recieve a no reply email stating that Amazon has detected suspicious activity on my account where someone tried to order things.It seems highly suspicious that this happened exactly after I wrote to customer service about my concern of exactly this happening, when it hasn't never happened to me even once during the 4-5 years I've had that Amazon account.It seems possible that this was done by the customer service person who got upset with the review I gave.I recommend looking into the cause of why this email was sent and firing the person who sent it, if it was sent without legitimate cause.

Review Title: Amazon drivers take photos of the‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon drivers take photos of the packages once they place it at the delivery door. The problem is, when they don‚Äôt have the correct address, the photo is useless to the person who made the order. I think drivers should have to pay for the missing items or pay for expedited delivery for a replacement. People order items they need in the time frame they need them. Why else pay for Amazon Prime?  This is becoming more and more inconvenient for the money members pay.
What made my experience great was the very low prices to shop away with clothing, make-up, and other things. The company is doing well, by the ways it made itself to be.

Zero star if I could based on the level of service.I have been with Amazon Prime membership for as long as it started and the actions of this customer service literally put the nail on this coffinI was being charged twice since september 2021, i pay annually for my subscription and noticed an added monthly subscription of 8.99 as well. When I called the customer service to call this out and also let them know they charged both my debit and credit card...i was concerned my bank card might have been hacked and  the customer service staff laughed at me for complaining, his tone was rude and was dismissive of my claims, he wasn't aware of their product either. I demanded to speak to the Manager who was not far off. I asked to raise a complaint and he asked "why?" "Do you want the service personnel fired?" I was shocked and said a complaint is to ensure the right training is provided where necessary. Needless to say, he refused to provide a reference number or followup details, stating it is an internal affair????Long story short, the manager managed to request a year's worth of the double payment and I decided to end my subscription with Amazon....I no longer wish to have this service, there are alternatives.

Then when the day arrives at 10 at night I get the we are sorry your order is late bs and I get it the next day or so times a day after that. Glad they raised prime, offer next to nothing for free movies on prime video, and deliver significantly later then promised. Now I was supposed to get my order Saturday, didn‚Äôt arrive, then Sunday, didn‚Äôt arrive, then today, didn‚Äôt arrive. I bet next they lost it and I‚Äôll get a refund, all the time wasted waiting for it but just apology and refund.

Review Title: I noticed the Amazon Prime van was‚Ä¶
Review Text: I noticed the Amazon Prime van was parked in one of the disabled bay spaces outside my sheltered housing accommodation. He had taken up 1 and 1/2 of the only 2 disabled bays for the building which has 27 flats. I was unable to park my car due to the limited space that was left. I was entering my building as he was exiting. I asked him if he was aware that he'd parked in disabled bay to which he replied" So what,there's worse things to complain about!" I told him how inconsiderate this was as I couldn't park my car in the space he had left me. Also there was other spaces he could have parked his van.His reply" Well tell folk in your building not to order stuff then" I asked for his name as I was not happy with his attitude, very unprofessional. He wouldn't give me his name. He walked away and made fun of me saying " Ooh go ahead and report me then spekky!" This happened at 1pm on Saturday 14th October 23. I feel this kind of attitude towards an elderly disabled person is totally unacceptable.  Does Amazon not do a Customer Service training course for these drivers? If not its about time they did! I am absolutely furious with this driver moreso when other drivers have been very courteous and professional towards every service user who depend on Amazon for their needs. I'd like to think that this review would be taken seriously and dealt with appropriately.

Review Title: The art of creating hurdles to prevent reclamations.
Review Text: At the recommendation of my post-graduate supervisor, I commanded "Marketing Accountability: A New Metrics Model to Measure Marketing Effectiveness" by Malcolm McDonald on Amazon on September 21, 2023.Since the delivery was expected between October 3 and October 16, I didn't pay too much attention as I was expecting an email on delivery.Today (October 14, 2023), I decided to check on my Amazon account what was happening with my delivery. It turns out that the focal item was supposedly delivered on September 27 - at least one week before the expected delivery range. Yet, as I look at my email, I never received any notification that the shipping was delivered...For God's sake, how is a normal customer supposed to do their due diligence with their shipping if the goods are delivered outside of the expected date range and the carrier doesn't even bother to notify the recipient that the delivery has been done?Naturally, being a post-graduate student living with less than $12,000 of yearly income, I try to request refunding. No way to chat with customer support and the chatbot says banality about it is the seller‚Äôs problem and not theirs. Then, I requested a phone call and yet another automatic voice-robot saying the exact same banality. With no other choice, I tried to contact the vendor via their system and didn‚Äôt even get an email proving that I contacted them so I could make a reclamation to my credit card provider under the ‚ÄúConsumer Protector Act‚Äù.Exasperated, I wrote a bad review on the product describing the exact same problem, which naturally was silenced by their moderation team.Good job Amazon on making it impossible for the poorest people in society to get a refund and doing such a good job managing your reputation on your own platform (owned media). It‚Äôs a shame that there are independent platforms on which exasperated customers can do negative eWOM without your interference, though‚Ä¶

Well, I never thought I would be writing a negative review about Amazon. After many years as loyal customers, and being a Prime member for many years, spending a lot of money, I find myself writing a negative review.Whilst being Prime members we have never had problems with faulty, not as described, not received goods, etc. Now we have cancelled out Prime membership, the customer service and customer support has become sub-standard. It just shows that you are not treated equally and there is no equality.If we had a problem with an item, the money was refunded either as soon as the item was returned or within a very quick period of time. Now we have cancelled our Prime membership, we have had nothing but trouble getting a simple refund for an item that was clearly sold '!s new' but was infact 'ex-display' and not as described. This is a clear cut case and should have warranted an immediate refund.After contacting the seller and getting no response, then one response, and no further response, we contacted Amazon. There was excuse, after excuse. They eventually said they would refund the money and said it will be in your account, but it wasn't.So bearing in mind they said they had refunded it! Two days later they send a message saying, "your A-Z claim has been successful and we will be refunding you payment." So the initial refund they said they had refunded, they had not actually refunded it. Now I will have to wait another 7 days for a refund. In total that will be 15 days from the item being received back by the seller.Why would you receive lesser customer service than a Prime member? Surely, all customers should receive the same customer service, after all we are all customers. Why is a non-prime member discriminated against? We are disgusted and disappointed in the service we have paid for, and this is not the experience we have become accustomed to over the many years with amazon.We have spend thousands of pounds with Amazon over the years. This will probably the last time we purchase from Amazon, and we will be closing both of our accounts with Amazon.

Amazon customer support is becoming progressively worse. You strugle to get a human, then you get someone that speaks English as a 3rd language (barely).  They are located in the Philippines or S. America.  Since they cannot understand you, or you them, resolving anything the least bit complicated is a struggle.  And for this you pay $179/yr?

Review Text: I have been waiting for a delivery this afternoon. I kept checking for updates. It eventually said delivered through letterbox. I don't know which one but not mine. I contacted them and said this is the second time running this has happened. I eventually managed to bypass the computerised moron and got through to alleged customer service team. Review Title: Do not allow customer service to access your devices!
Review Text: I gave a customer service rep access to both of my Kindle Fires due to a problem (that I later figured out wasn't actually related to Amazon) and he deleted a few hundred bookmarks.  4 phone calls later and I still haven't gotten them back. One person told that my only option was a  factory reset which I had been trying to avoid because it's a total PITA.  According to the settings menu this should have restored all of my data; it didn't.  The last person I spoke to told me that the info in the settings menu about factory resetting your Kindle is "wrong." He wasn't able to tell me why it was never addressed.  When I told him that when I purchased my second Kindle all of my bookmarks were downloaded from my backup, which means my info is stored somewhere, he told me my Kindle must be defective.  Oh. And this was supposedly a supervisor I was speaking to.  I've sent a registered letter off to their main office but am not expecting any response.

Review Title: Unable to get next day delivery
Review Text: I've been unable to get next day delivery for nearly two months now. I've lost count of how many times I've called and how many hours (it's double digits) I've lost answering the same questions.- Each time I am told that it's because not all items can be delivered next day, or because I am not selecting the right options, however after lengthy conversations it's agreed that there is an issue with the account. I've been a prime customer for years so I am very familiar with how next day delivery works.- On three occasions the agent has checked and verified that items that should be available next day for my delivery address are in fact not showing as such when I try to place the order.- On three occasions I have tried to order the same item sitting alongside my wife or a neighbour only to see that they have the next day option and I do not for the same item at the same time. - I have been told to delete and reinstall the app. It didn't work.- The last 36 or soitems I have ordered all the same - almost never available next day.- I have had to go through this same cycle so many times it is now an absolute joke. Each time I am told that they will need to raise a the issue with their technical team. If they have done this then it has not worked. Today I called again - put through to a manager and the line drops. I call back again, now explaining it for the fourth time in one day to a gentleman called Uday. The line drops. Thankfully he called back. He is telling me that it is still being looked into. 4 weeks at least. I think it's clear that it is not going to be fixed.It cost ¬£95 for prime, Uday is offering me a ¬£50 refund and suggesting I cancel my account. So I will be ¬£28 ( I already had a ¬£17 refund) out of pocket and have no Prime. One of the reasons he will not refund me the full ¬£95 is that he says I have used prime music - I did not ask for prime music, they sent me an email to say "you have prime music for a month". Another reason he gave me was that I have had 45 items deliveres express. On checking he reduced that to 6. Then it was 4. Better than I thought but still 4 out of 36. He then said "I don't see what the problem is". To be honest I think that is quite offensive.I don't know what changed at Amazon this year but it is now very frustrating, poor customer service and not at all convenient.

One item took them took 4 days to finally reach me and other one is currently 2 days late, ruining my weekend.Customer service are a bunch of robot parrots that will just repeat apologies at you, but will not actually do anything helpful.I'll stick to reliable retailors in future.

I have shopped at Amazon for years. I‚Äôve spend thousands of dollars with their company and always had good customer service up until now. I ordered some curtains from a third-party seller which didn‚Äôt look anything like they did in the picture. I asked Amazon for a refund and they told me to contact the third party seller first. The third-party seller refused to give me a prepaid shipping label until I provided pictures. Which I did. After that I never heard from them again. I contacted Amazon again and was told that I could keep the curtains and that I would be receiving a refund within 3 to 5 business days. Well a week goes by and nothing. I call Amazon again and they tell me that that the first customer service representative shouldn‚Äôt have told me that and that the best they can do is open up a claim and in the meantime I should just try and send the curtains back myself and they‚Äôll refund me the shipping cost. I go to UPS and they tell me that it‚Äôs gonna cost $600 bucks to send these curtains back. Then I receive an email from Amazon denying me on the claim. I call them yet again and tell them look, I can‚Äôt afford to send these curtains back for $600 bucks. They tell me not to worry they will send me a prepaid shipping label and I will get refunded for the curtains. This time I ask for an email confirming this. Which they send me. The representative also files an appeal on the first claim. I received another email telling me that the appeal has  been denied on the grounds that I did not contact the third-party seller within 30 days. I call Amazon AGAIN and send them screenshots proving that I got in touch with the third-party seller within a week and that their own representatives had told me I would be getting a prepaid label. When they finally get back in touch with me they tell me that both of their representatives shouldn‚Äôt have said that and they will train their employees better in the future but since both appeals were denied they can‚Äôt do anything. So what they‚Äôre telling me is that they allow their own customer services representatives to lie to you just to get you off of the phone and also sorry not sorry your just out $200 bucks for the curtains you can‚Äôt return. I ended up canceling my prime membership and opening up a claim with the Better Business Bureau, no matter what happens though I‚Äôll never shop with them again. I would rather spend extra money on shipping than give money to a company that knowingly lies to me.

The product was missing from the package and when I registered a complaint about this they asked me to wait for 5 days and now they are saying that they cannot do anything in this matter. FRAUD AND SCAMMERS AMAZON.

After several years of a Prime membership it is about time to give it up. At first the 'do you want it tomorrow' was working but things are slowing down rapidly. What was tomorrow is now two, three, four days or longer. I recently have found that shopping other sites or local stores is more beneficial. My last order was tomorrow but has now turned into three days. Final question is why pay for Prime when you can pay shipping and come out with more money in your pocket?

Disgusting service.. How they expect me to return a faulty oven to them that is still in warranty. I have no packaging, I can't disconnect it myself I'll have to pay someone and the courier company they suggested I contact doesn't take anything this large!!!!!

Amazon UK receives a great deal of negative press most of which in my humble opinion is totally unjustified. In my experience of being an Amazon user stretching back for many years now, I‚Äôve never really encountered or experienced anything other than the most excellent and reliable customer service, great choice & value, and excellent delivery turn arounds. I did once have a blip, something went very wrong (obviously these things will happen), however after contacting Amazon, straightaway the issue got satisfactorily resolved and I was even provided with a complete refund and agreeable compensation. I was so highly impressed with the professional manner in which that particular issue was dealt with. I find more and more these days so many high street brand stores often only provide top selling products with limited to zero choices being readily made available to the consumer and that includes their internet shopping sites. Time after time I‚Äôve visited many of these companies and then swiftly moved across to Amazon. Being with Amazon the opposite is true, so many wide ranging products, such huge variety, so many obscure products, and the opportunity to shop at my convenience at anytime day or night so for these reasons thats why Amazon always tends getting my money and vote. The only negatives for me are:- I consider it‚Äôs important that people understand that some employees both in-house and self employed aren‚Äôt always being treated lawfully in so far as the meaning contained within the UK Employment Act and this is an extremely important issue that I consider should have a much higher priority within their internal HR department. And finally, the often totally ridiculous amount of packaging involved and I‚Äôve never fully understood why this issue isn‚Äôt being more swiftly addressed.

Review Title: Half of my goods were missing, Amazon refusing to acknowledge this
Review Text: Half of my goods were missing, value of order ¬£450, ¬£160 of the goods were missing, gave the security code issued by Amazon to the driver to accept my package, what an absolute joke, the driver left, when I opened it there should have been 4 items but only 2 in the box, I contacted Amazon immediately, did everything they asked of me, report the theft and got a crime number, I sent them every bit of information they asked for even video footage of the delivery but they are refusing to re send me the items I have paid for or refund me, just continually fobbing me off, absolutely utterly and totally disgusting, this company are not fit to trade

They‚Äôre quick enough to take OUR hard-earned money, but when it comes to refunding, well it‚Äôs like trying to pry a mouse from the jaws of a venomous viper! I am ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTED with Amazon and their customer service and I DO NOT recommend anybody to use them. AVOID them like you would a pit full of hungry rats!!

Review Title: They now treat their customers like rubbish

I've been an Amazon Prime member forever and have never had such a nightmare experience with an order.The kettle arrived in fine condition, but instead of the white handled kettle I ordered, and was listed on my invoice, I received a black handled kettle. The sticker on the top of the box said "white", but later when I packed it up to return it, I noticed the sticker on the bottom stated "black". So,I called and asked to exchange it for the color that I ordered.That's when the problems began.I spoke w/4 supervisors in the hopes that one of them would be helpful in resolving the issue, but to varying degrees,I was met with disrespect, suspicion,condescending attitude, and downright talking over me.Quite honestly, I've never experienced this from Amazon,... ever...until now.Something has changed, and not for the better.To complicate matters, mine was sold through their warehouse as " like new" and they didn't want to help me get the color I ordered...even though it was their error.I guess they fail to check to be sure these boxes contain the item as described, although their descriptions online would lead you to believe they do. I was told I would be refunded only if I followed their online instructions to a T and if I wanted the white one I could go back and purchase it at the current price which is now higher. No apologies, no "let's see if we can correct this error", no... actually, one supervisor questioned whether I did receive the wrong color, Ugh...  (that theory was debunked once she saw the photo and the invoice).Because the correct color was now going to cost more as it's price moved up and down like the stock market while I waited for my package to arrive, I decided to just cut my loses of time and energy and get my money back.Amazon, it appears does not value their customers.Because of the horrible treatment, waste of hours on the phone,the stress I endured, and the lack of respect and value for a long standing Prime member, I decided I had enough, and plan to cancel my membership and stop ordering from Amazon altogether.

Amazon refused to exchange airpods that had been declared by Apple as defective and told that Amazon must replace them under the Apple program.I went to Apple they wrote a full report on x2 Apple Airpods purchased in 2020 and declared these were sold with a defect and in the report under consumer law amazon must replace these.Amazon has point blank refused and asked me to go back to Apple to play ping pong.I spoke to Katelyn June - who just wouldn't help and kept on telling me to go back to Apple and not listen to anything `i was telling her. so i have no choice but to go back to store and waste another day working this out25/10 - I have been advised by Apple to go back to Amazon an apply the consumer right 2015 which i have and contacted the MD office and will let you know how i got on

Review Title: If there was a zero stars or negative‚Ä¶
Review Text: I've been a long-time Prime customer and an even longer Amazon customer.  But, because of the way I'm being treated now by customer service, I won't be for long.If there was a zero star or negative star, that's what I would give them.  I have an ongoing issue with Amazon's shipping (I believe it's Amazon Logistics) not being able to deliver packages to my address.  No other shippers seem to have a problem finding it, but Amazon, not so much.I understand that things happen and there are glitches, mistakes, I get it.  However, this started over 3 months ago ... and they can't seem to solve it.   The worst part is the customer service itself.  They appear to be completely incompetent at every level - at best.  At worst, they just don't care about me as a customer (I am leaning towards the at worst).  They make it impossible to directly contact anyone who might actually be competent enough to fix the problem.  Took forever for them to even "escalate" the issue to the "appropriate team" for "investigations".  Once they finally did, nothing has happened.  All I get are lame, canned responses that all say the same things regardless of my correspondence to them.  No one has directly replied to what I've actually written to them - via emails and postal mail.  Just canned "Thank you for your patience", etc.Absolutely terrible customer "service"!

Amazon customer service is just one big joke, got account locked and I can change password for it, but they cant get it open, because they need more information, too bad that no-one tells me what they need. searched from the internet some emails to contant, couldnt find one from their sites, only phonenumbers, but they didnt work from finland...  never again amazon, never again...

Review Title: Amazon marks wrong, cheaper item as being returned and won't fix their records so I get full refund
Review Text: I requested a return of a Wera 05008735001 Kraftform Plus 350 PH Phillips Screwdriver, Lasertip, PH 3 Head, 6" Blade Length and was given a temporary $19.02 refund on October 4th. I went to a UPS store and physically returned THAT item in person. The problem is: my records are now showing that amazon has NOT received this item, but erroneously shows that I instead returned a cheaper ($11.93) Wera 05008720001 Kraftform Plus 350 PH Phillips Screwdriver, Lasertip, PH 2 Head, 4" Blade Length ... the latter item still being in my possession in my toolbox!All I want is for my amazon records to reflect that the $19.02 screwdriver was indeed returned and that said return is complete. Live chat was useless in this regard because they just said the problem is fixed and i "won't be charged" nor will i "receive any more emails" regarding this, totally neglecting the real issue because amazon is NOT showing the actual return of the $19.02 item (thus, the return is incomplete) and incorrectly showing a return of the $11.93 item (showing it is complete). I know it is only a $7 and change difference, but this is fraudulent and I am being cheated out of the full amount of the screwdriver that was returned to amazon in good faith!!
