Review Title: AMAZON - NOT DELIVERING OR SHIPPING AS PROMISED!
Review Text: I have 4 different orders placed on Amazon Prime as a 8 year Prime member. Three items were promised on 10/5 and at this time they all 3 show NOT YET SHIPPED? All 3 showed 2 day delivery but are not even shipped 3 days after the delivery promise date - NONE OF THEM! The fourth order was to be here Friday 10/6 and it has set in 2 area locations in DFW both of which are less than 20 miles away. It currently sits in Lewisville TX ONLY 5 MILES away with no delivery date showing???ALL common excuses on line don‚Äôt fit. They have been delivering to my same home for 8 years with no delivery issues until the last 3 months???In the last 3 months at least a quarter of my orders are delayed 1-3 days past the promise dates?? I complain but it still happens. I can see why a package can be 1-2 days late occasionally because they OVERSTATE their capabilities!! However, it gets worse every week. I get angry when this many orders go past the PROMISED date, only to find out they haven‚Äôt even been shipped. Then, OR EVEN 2 or 3 DAYS LATER, they all say NOT YET SHIPPED. How is this not violation of Federal Law as far as Internet sales?? They have a monopoly and need to be held accountable! Calling my Texas Attorney General Consumer Fraud Division tomorrow!!

Review Title: Worst experience with Amazon since Fan Courier took over logistics
Review Text: Worst experience with Amazon since Fan Courier took over the logistics company in Europe. 2 years later and they are still not on top of things. Not possible to manage delivery through various companies. They set a default in the Czech Republic on the company Zasilkovna and that company delivers only up to 15kg. Thus no one in the Czech Republic can order anything heavier than 15kg from Amazon anymore. Fan Courier is a catastrophic company.

Several years ago we made a large wooden box with a key code especially for deliveries. It sits on our small porch  by the front door and is usually unlocked until items have been delivered. The box has been admired by delivery personnel and visitors alike. My instructions always include the key code.  The problem is three-fold 1. Amazon does not provide an option to leave items in a secure box in the delivery section when we order so I have to adapt how I give the instructions - but they‚Äôre there. 2. Drivers don‚Äôt read the instructions. 3. Despite the box being clearly labelled with ‚ÄòAmazon Deliveries etc‚Äô  many delivery drivers leave parcels on top of the box, at the side of the box or even elsewhere and photograph it. Some items are quite valuable. Not all drivers do this so it is annoying when it happens. It has also gone on for too long and is NOT acceptable. We‚Äôve done our best to help delivery drivers do their job so they should do the same for us.

I am a Prime user, have been for several years and buy a lot from Amazon. I have always found them to be reliable and when things have gone wrong they have been great at sorting things out. I can see why many people don't like the company which might might explain the poor score but for me their performance would not be a reason.I use Amazon for both personal and business related purchases, I probably have two or three deliveries a week and rarely does anything fail to arrive on time.Prices are variable and not always the best but on the whole I would say they are good and sometimes very good. Also there are app's to price watch so if you are after a particular item and not in a hurry you can often grab a bargain.Obviously things do go wrong but I've found Amazon are always quick to respond and I can't say I have ever felt they have not resolved things to my satisfaction.Examples are: Expensive headphones broke after one and a half years - Amazon gave me a full refund. Extract fans delivered were not the model I ordered but I only noticed after the return period - Full refund.Diamond drill, should have been 5, only one in pack - Full refund, kept the one drillI would generally prefer to buy things on Amazon, especially electronics that can go wrong as I know I will get a refund with little fuss.So in my experience I really can't fault Amazon

Support/ manager offered me a refund or replacement refused to refund and replace the item. This is the second order in the same day that was botches and my time has just be utterly wasted. amazons delivery record is 50/50 at best if not worse.. Review Title: UNAPOLOGETICALLY and REPEATEDLY lied to by Amazon.
Review Text: I ordered a mobile phone to replace one that had broken. Therefore it needed to arrive promptly. Naively as an Amazon Prime customer I thought I could rely on Amazon. Instead Amazon repeatedly lied to me and caused me a great deal of inconvenience, aggravation, frustration and added expense.LIE 1 : Day 01 - ‚ÄòThe Item is in Stock‚Äô. Clearly it wasn‚Äôt  / couldn‚Äôt be dispatched.LIE 2 : Day 11 - ‚ÄòYour item has been dispatched‚Äô.  Untrue. No tracking information was forthcoming. The courier states Amazon did nothing other than ‚ÄòPrepare a label‚Äô.LIE 3 : Day 23 - ‚ÄòYour item will arrive by day 24‚Äô.  With great difficulty I got the attention a ‚Äòcustomer service‚Äô representative. I was told by this individual that the item would definitely arrive on day 24.  'I could trust him on that'. LIE 4 : Day 24 - ‚ÄòSorry we a re running late. Your item will arrive by day 27‚Äô. Final lie. Day 27 the item never arrived.Exacerbating the WOEFUL service is the fact that when there is a problem there is no meaningful or practical mechanism to remedy the situation. When the system works it works. When it doesn‚Äôt there is no plan ‚ÄòB‚Äô. Amazon provides no access to anyone who is empowered to either investigate or remediate. Further they filter out and censor all criticism.

Review Title: Damaged ‚Äúbrand new books‚Äù sold and shipped directly by Amazon.com
Review Text: I order quite a lot from Amazon because they have everything available and the prices are pretty good as well. I‚Äôm an avid reader so I order a lot of books. Textbooks, spiritual books, baby books, you name it. I always buy brand new & directly from Amazon. I never buy anything from third party sellers because I had multiple bad experiences with those before (mainly false advertisement regarding the book‚Äôs condition). Anyway, I noticed that half the time the brand new books that get sold & shipped by Amazon itself, come damaged, beat up or worn. There was several times when I wanted to gift a book to someone and I couldn‚Äôt because they looked used. Amazon, store and take care of your books and package them carefully! If I pay $40 for a brand new copy then I EXPECT it to look brand new. If I wanted a beat up one, I would have gone to a thrift store.

Review Title: Orders delayed for couple of days
Review Text: I have prime membership with Amazon and I spend like ¬£1000 on order and I had 3 items that they came late like 3 days after the day I order. One item has been late and then delivered to a random neighbour, I never found the item obviously, I'm still chasing Amazon about my item. First, I would like to say that I never been so disappointed like now, how bad they organise all the orders and the amount delay time. Secondly, if they know that it will take more time to deliver the items, they should put the time (days) for how long it will take the order instead of lying about the next day delivery of the items. Basically I'm paying PRIME for no reason as I could just order straight without membership. I will try not to order from here again because of the lack of time, is horrible as I really needed the item next day delivered to me. Don't put the trust in them anymore as the organisation is so bad right now in their company.

I love Amazon, I think they are the best e-commerce out there, I make regular purchases from them. Howeeever lately some of the purchases I make keep arriving late or sometimes even missing, they are using USPS which is reaaaally slow, so I would ask them to change this method delivery. For all the rest, you have to take a good look before buying, and if you have any doubts make the question before purchase. Amazon will make sure you get your item, and if it's not what you bought, they will refund you or repplace the item (times may vary depending of the supplier)
Great experience. Will always recommend amazon to my friends !

Review Title: The only review you need, games and koei tecmo.
Review Text: First who am I? A no nonesense reviewer 100% honesty from birth to death.This is regarding a pre-order game off Amazon.com Fate Samurai Remnant, So I pre-ordered it, it's supposed to come with bonus in game content, I've gotten games off Amazon for more than 2 decades with no problem, until today, basically Amazon said this to me----------------------Hello,Greetings from Amazon Team.We're really sorry for the inconvenience caused for accessing your game code.As much as I want unfortunately,  as the item is ordered out side of the USA you are not eligible for the Game code.It is our privilege to have you as our valued customer & we want to make sure you are always taken care of.On a personal level, I highly appreciate your patience, cooperation and understanding in this matter.|You contact our Customer Service Team at your earliest convenience.You can reach us by chat or phone at the link below:or call us at 888-280-4331.We'd appreciate your feedback. Please use the buttons below to vote about your experience today.Best regards,ReikaAmazon.com----------------------So I can'tget it because I'm not in USA right now? Lesson learned never buy games off Amazon.com they will lie to you as other representitives said that I would get it.I even contacted Koei Tecmo, the developer of the game, and they said this to me, ---------------Dear Customer, Thank you for your inquiry. We are afraid that the preorder bonus Phantasmal Dress "Miyamoto Musashi" distributed by Amazon is a store bonus, and Amazon is in charge of handling this.We are sorry to trouble you, but please contact Amazon for your inquiry about this matter. Even if you have already contacted Amazon and been directed to us, please kindly contact Amazon again for the above mentioned reason. We would much appreciate your understanding. Sincerely, Koei Tecmo Customer Support-------------------------So the developer of the game give their power to Amazon now? And then Amazon feel it necessary to screw us all over how they see fit?Is this the company you wanted Jeff Bezos to screw over the customers? Are you happy with this?How unhappy your consumers are with the company you built based on good relations with customers, and now everyone else working for you whilst your away sitting at a beach sipping margaritas, and those other CEO's and workers tearing it down right from under you?Suffice to say I'm a very unhappy customer....This game was supposed to be a gift, and they were expecting that pre-order bonus, we in UK your sister country to USA we supposed to be family.

Review Title: Amazon the high Street killer is‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon the high Street killer is without a doubt very convenient when they get it right and you are happy with your purchase.  The down side if you ever have the misfortune to have to deal with the obligatory Idian customer service then you have arrived in shopping hell, some idiot reading from an idiot board telling you how sorry they are for any inconvenience or you return something for a refund. In the later expect to gave your money in Amazons bank for at least 21 days if your lucky, this is 14 days after they received your item back which in my case showed by the tracking as two days but for Amazon eleven days they told me, two weeks to process and then ten days for the money to hot my account.  So in summary 35 days for a refund and only then after a huge argument with several Idian call centre experts.   Really people stop shopping with these clowns and close them down.

So I placed two orders this afternoon with Amazon - about 30 minutes apart.  Then I start getting emails that my prime card has been declined - wth?  I pay this account on time in full every single month - there‚Äôs no issue with my card.  Then I get a scam email pretending to be Amazon also saying my card has been declined - so weird!  So I go online to Amazon for help for which their chat bot is of no help -shocker!  Can‚Äôt even enter that their supplied menu does not fit why I need help -such a waste of time.  So I request a call back - I get one man, who speaks very poor English but I can make out that he doesn‚Äôt see an issue but that he has to transfer me to customer service ‚Äújust to be sure‚Äù. So I‚Äôve now been on hold for over 30 minutes with a lady whom I have already told that I am sorry but I simply cannot understand her.  I finally ascertain that she is telling me ‚ÄúI‚Äù need to call Synchrony Bank since the purchase has been declined.  I said absolutely not as there is not an issue with my card and I request an English-speaking manager.  She proceeds to tell me, of course, that there is not one, so I tell her she can cancel my prime account and I will leave a negative review here - hence the reason I am now on hold.  She asked to put me on hold for ‚Äú2 minutes‚Äù -it has now been over 30, which is what prompted this review.  To me, this is ‚Äútheir‚Äù issue between them and synchrony bank (the 3rd party payment processor who handles so many accounts it will make your head spin). I am cancelling this order and will simply go elsewhere.  Amazon has simply become too damn big and they outsource their customer service, like so many other companies, which helps to keep the costs down I‚Äôm sure.  From now on, if I can find an Amazon alternative, I will use it - despite being a stockholder -in fact, I will probably just sell my stock now - they certainly don‚Äôt deserve my business.  I shouldn‚Äôt even be having to waste my time messing with any of this.  The death of customer service - truer words were never spoken!

Review Title: I made a purchase last Monday on Amazon‚Ä¶
Review Text: I made a purchase last Monday on Amazon for a glass-top desk and a leather desk chair. I canceled the purchase no more than 20-30 seconds due to them being the wrong items. I intended to go forward with the same purchase but different items but the policy states 3 -5 business days before the money is returned to my debit card. On the 3rd day I contacted Amazon asking where the refund is because the items I canceled weren't even in my list of purchases. Amazon kept asking me for the order number and they weren't listed to get the item number! So they asked for the card number I used to make the purchase. Some magical reason, neither Amazon nor Chime bank can tell me where or how or what about that purchase. It's non-existent to them. But clear on my bank statement. It's been a week and still no sign of my refund. I've called Amazon countless times. Chime too. Today Chime had to start a claim to investigate where the money is and to give it back. How sad is it that they large corporate businesses can't handle their own customers money. They don't really care either because it's not them at loss!! Now I have to wait who knows WEEKS to get my damn money back from these 2 idiotic and ridiculous companies and I needed those items to start school tomorrow!! Never again Amazon, and Chime can definitely kiss my ass!

What I like about Amazon is the ability to order an item and receive it either the next day or the same day if available. I prefer to keep what I order, but at times, they don't fit or are described inaccurately, and appreciate the ability to return or replace them; however, lately, I've noticed a tactic that I hope is just the left hand not knowing what the right is doing and not a more grim plan to deceive their customers. I purchased an item for close to $300 and realized it did not work for what I needed it to. I printed out the return label and returned it to Kohl's. My funds were refunded and I purchased a unit that was close to $500 that served my purpose. Shortly thereafter, I started receiving emails from Amazon saying I needed to return the item and that they already refunded my money. They also stated that my card would be charged the full amount if not returned by a certain day. I may be incorrect, but Amazon has never refunded me for an item that was not returned. I was able to chat with an Amazon representative, they researched and found that the merchandise was returned and I was good to go. A month later, yesterday, my Prime card was charged the full amount for the item I charged. I'm disputing the charges and waiting to see how Amazon responds to my dispute, that will decide my business further with them.

Review Title: Amazon product reviews are not trustworthy
Review Text: I buy a lot of items from Amazon and am a Prime member. I usually like the products, but not always. I have written a lot of product reviews on Amazon about various products sold by Amazon.Amazon only publishes my positive reviews of products. Amazon refuses to publish any of my negative reviews of products. This indicates that Amazon and its product reviews are NOT trustworthy because Amazon only publishes positive reviews and refuses to publish negative reviews.All negative product reviews that I wrote were not published because (Amazon said) those reviews violated Amazon policy. All positive reviews that I wrote were published by Amazon.I do not trust Amazon to be honest and I no longer trust Amazon product reviews or star ratings.Also, Amazon does not allow reviews of Amazon itself or of delivery reliability. Why? Probably because they don't expect positive reviews.

Review Title: Customer Service? They Have NO Idea What it Means!
Review Text: I have bought treats and dog-related items off Amazon many times. Sadly, my dog died four weeks ago so having those constant reminders of him every time I use Amazon is painful and upsetting. The issue is the 'buy again' display on the 'Your Orders' page.Today, I spoke to TWO so-called customer service agents who, between them, I would trust to open a door! For a start neither actually LISTENED to me (the first guy incurred my anger when he asked me what order I was referring to!) even when I explained very carefully what I wanted done: removal of all my dog-related purchases from my 'Your Orders' page.The second agent, a woman who preferred the sound of her own voice to mine, assured me that it would be done. I was not in the least surprised to learn, when I checked, that it was yet another false promise.So, thanks to the inherent idiocy of Amazon's set-up and the incompetence of their undertrained staff I am forced to be reminded of a most painful and upsetting experience that is still very raw. Thank you SO much Amazon.  Customer-centric company? Don't make me laugh! You don't stand a chance!!
Amazon is scammer , robbers and fruad company ,don't buy anything wrost service lootere

Did you know that Amazon no longer accept PayPal?? I didn't.I recently wanted to buy an item, the price with postage was ¬£112. I went through to the purchasing area for delivery address and method of payment and looked for PayPal. Obviously I couldn't find it. I backtracked through the ordering procedure and again I couldn't find a PayPal button. It was then that my phone pinged and I was told that the cash had been taken from my account by Amazons BuyNow procedure. I had not agreed to pay and I had not finalised payment, but Amazon had taken the money (illegally??) - without my consent to a contract.The item is still in the 'my basket' area.I asked for a call back and after 20 minutes waiting for a call went back on line and found how to cancel and cancelled the order.This morning I have been on a chat line for about an hour to find out that Mr. Bezos will not be returning my money (which was taken within seconds) for at least seven working days. Obviously the multi billionaire wants to hang on to the cash so he can make an extra penny or two in interest.Moral of this post - make sure that every detail of your purchase from Amazon is 100% correct before you enter the final page or you MAY be charged whether you consent or not, or even if you decide against the purchase.

Amazon accidentally cancelled a large order. Via online chat, email and also over the phone advised me to reorder all the items and choose paid delivery. They stated they'll cover the costs of delivery and any subsequent price increase between the accidentally cancelled order and the new one. After carrying out these instructions and on politely contacting Amazon as advised by email then, then over the phone,  finaly the 5th person told me what I'd been told was all wrong and it's not Amazon policy, they won't cover those costs they said initially said they will, going exactly against what they told me to do, costing me time and money all because of their own mistakes. In all I spent many hours doing all that they asked of me, and trying to communicate with them, only to be told they wont honor what they told me as their representatives had been wrong. Nasty little scam that. I want to say I won't use them again, but who am I kidding... of couse I will. Just be careful as they'll tell you one thing then bluntly refuse after you did exactly as was advised.

I had an order going to the wrong address which was my fault of course and I tried correcting it with both Amazon and USPS which I couldn't because it couldn't be rerouted. However, USPS already confirmed it was going to an address that didn't exist and it would just get returned to sender anyway. Originally I was told by Amazon when the status updates (it was in transit) to let them know and they would explore our options from there.Chatted them the next day and was told nothing they could do but I knew it would get returned to sender. Once it was confirmed it was returned to sender on USPS I immediately contact Amazon and was told they were going to reattempt delivery and to wait until the next business day. I did that knowing it was a lie since it updated returned to sender. Next day it shows it arrived back to the sender and even updated on Amazon that it was returned to sender. I contacted Amazon once more and was transferred twice just to be told to fill out an incident report to "Prove" it didn't arrive. Like how the hell can you not see it was returned to sender?! what is there to prove? It shows it was returned to sender on the tracking. I filled out the incident report and was told I'd have to wait until after 09/26 and if I didn't get it by that evening to reach them for a refund. I called and was told I had to wait 14 days to get a refund! Escalated and was told to fill out another incident report which I did then prompted to fill out ANOTHER incident report. So I called back Amazon and escalated and was told due to the system I had to wait until after 09/26 and if it doesn't arrive, call them back 09/27 and they can refund. I did this and you know what I was told? We got only one of your incident reports and it was done on 09/25 so you'll have to fill out another one for your refund. I disputed this with my bank. I will NEVER use Amazon again. Their customer service is trash. They don't listen to you, they don't care, and if you are owed a refund GOOD LUCK getting it.

Ordered mobile phone(¬£350),got something else (¬£10  item),couldn't speak to any one kept being cut off.returned wrong item sent and waited for refund,and waited and waited.contacted customer services(ha.rude ) was told refund would be instigated.waited another week.had to contact credit card to raise dispute(they credited my account).Another week later still no refund.once again contacted customer services(this now being 5weeks),again told would instigate refund.5weeks and 4days.got refund.Their refund policy states 14 days to refund not 31 days.Then they had the Gaul to email me ,asking why I'd raised a dispute with my credit card provider.5 1/2 weeks to get a refund.Absolutely appalling service.Thankfully I didn't have to pay any interest(thanks credit card provider).how much did Amazon make in interest in not refunding me,and many,many others.Shocking service,will not be using again.

Review Title: They took my money and closed my account
Review Text: I have used Amazon from time to time for delivery of books and other minor stuff, as well as access to their Prime Video.September 8 I all of a sudden got an email from them stating that they "after a review of your details" had decided to close my account. They also wrote that I could not reply to the email, and that they might not reply to further email about this.I received no information about this, the full text is the following:"Hello,After a review of your details, we have determined it is necessary to close your Amazon.de account. Any pending orders have been canceled.We may not reply to further emails about this issue."That made me worried that somehow someone had gained unauthorized access to my account and perhaps even my payment information, but the email contained no information. I could not reach support since you have to be logged in to be able to do that.After much search I found their Twitter support, wrote them, and they showed me a way to find a telephone number by stating that the password did not work on the website. I called, but the person on the other end could not help, but she took my details and my number, passed the information to account handling department and promised me that they would call me back within 24 hours. They never did. I never heard from them again.About a week before they closed my account, they charged me for a month's Amazon Prime. So I have paid for the better part of a month that I cannot use because they have closed my account without giving me a reason. I still do not know why, and my credentials could still be vulnerable without them telling me.I cannot believe that they can legally charge me for a service just to close my account for no apparent reason, and not at the minimum provide a refund.

Review Title: Don't trust Amazon Customer Service. I Didn't receive my refund.
Review Text: I bought a Dell monitor with an extended warranty, and the USBC wasn't working. I did the troubleshooting and realized it was defective. I then contacted Amazon, who said they would refund me if I sent the item back. I sent the item back on July 25 and emailed them. Since I bought with an Amazon Credit Card at that time, and the Amazon Credit Card ceased to exist in the UK later, I no longer could dispute the charge with my credit card. The refund would only be available as a gift card, which is not ideal, but I accepted since I wanted to spend less time fixing this issue. I got in touch one week later since my refund didn't happen. They then said I should wait one month, which I did. I got in touch one month later, and they asked me to wait longer. It has been two months, and I still need to be refunded.

Review Title: I ordered  an item from Amazon they intentionally delivered it days later than my order date.
Review Text: I ordered  an item from Amazon.I was paying a monthly fee as a prime member.When it came to checkout and delivery options, there was a highlighted "AMAZON DAY" listed among other dates i could have it delivered by.Rather than picking the AMAZON DAY delivery date (which was a Friday, I chose Thursday simply because I wanted the item as soon as possible. Right? RIGHT!So, because I didn't choose Friday Amazon Day delivery, Someone within Amazon ordering on my account apparantly was upset that I wasn't interested in SAVING THE EARTH. So I was punished and didn't receive my order until TUESDAY the following week!Because of Amazon's decision I immediately CANCELED MY PRIME  ACCT. and stopped using Amazon all together. I truly don't miss any of it and don't have to make them rich with the monthly prime fee auto pay charge.I have found it much easier to just go buy what we need when we need it.Most of the stuff I ordered from Amazon was cheaply manufactured Chinese merchandise that you dont find out about until you open the huge cardboard box or package.Large boxes were not good for us because we burn all paper/cardboard trash so a lot less being burned in our burn pit now.Felt profiled as well depending on what we bought.Good riddance!

On more than one occasion I've been "promised" a $10 promotional credit as compensation for poor customer experiences such as my packages being delivered to other homes in my area, or in some cases not at all.  These "promises" are made over the phone by customer service reps as well as by e-mail confirmation  when I've asked for that. Yet, the credit is never issued and there's no way of knowing until the next purchase (on items sold by Amazon themselves only) when no such credit is applied.  There is no way to see these credits in the customer account section.  It's hard for me how to see that this isn't deliberate, with the thinking being, "Tell the customer they'll get the credit, but don't apply it and they'll just forgot about it."  Any REAL credit should be readily visible in the customer account section, along with a case number and description of the reason for the credit.  Period.  Stop the DECEPTION!

Amazon is great! Especially the 2 days shipping and returns. I order something every single day and will continue to do this as long as their prices stay lower than everybody else and their customer service stay as good as it is.

Navigating through the virtual aisles of Amazon.com is nothing short of a shopper‚Äôs dream! The immense variety and ease of use have transformed my shopping experience, making it my go-to for practically everything - from everyday essentials to the latest gadgets. The sheer diversity of products is unparalleled, catering to a myriad of tastes and needs. Whether I‚Äôm hunting for a niche hobbyist item or restocking household staples, Amazon never disappoints. The detailed product descriptions, customer reviews, and Q&A sections have been invaluable, providing insights that guide my purchasing decisions. Amazon Prime has been a game-changer! The promise of fast, reliable shipping and exclusive access to deals, movies, and music is well worth the subscription. It‚Äôs the epitome of convenience, with my orders often arriving at my doorstep faster than anticipated. Customer service deserves a shout-out too! On the rare occasion when issues arise, the resolution process is smooth, ensuring a hassle-free experience. The ease of returns and refunds only adds to the peace of mind while shopping. Beyond products, Amazon‚Äôs expanding ecosystem, including Kindle, Amazon Fresh, and AWS, showcases their commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction. It‚Äôs a holistic shopping and entertainment platform that keeps me coming back for more. In a nutshell, Amazon.com epitomizes online retail excellence, offering an unbeatable combination of variety, value, and convenience. It‚Äôs a seamless, user-friendly experience that has revolutionized the way I shop. Five stars well earned!

Review Title: Amazon is failing to issue refund on mistake made by them!
Review Text: Unfortunately I currently can‚Äôt trust Amazon on anything beyond $500. My husband bought a drone for his job and ended up receiving a package containing gifts for a 3-year old. After 30 days of the dispute, Amazon told the bank it didn‚Äôt accept it and was reversed by the bank. A second dispute was opened and the bank requested all the evidence from my husband, which he provided (photos, emails from Amazon, order number, etc).He still hasn‚Äôt heard back as it is within the 30-day dispute cycle at this point. Mind you, the original order from Amazon was in mid-May 2023 and we‚Äôre now in mid-September and no refund!

I have been a long time member of Amazon Prime. I used to place orders and always received them within 1-2 days. Once the pandemic hit, it apparently gave businesses an excuse to slack off on customer service. The 2 day guarentee changed to a 2 day approximate, and we would get items that ran a day or 2 late once a month or so. Back in August 2023 I ordered 2 laptops, not a cheap order it was about $2700. They were both ordered from the same amazon store and delivery to the same address. On day 2 one laptop arrived, but not the other. Although it was odd since they should have shipped together I let it slide since my account said it was delayed in transit to be delivered the next day. I contacted them on chat at the end of day 3 when it said delayed in transit again. They promptly lied to me and said it was in the system and would be dropped off on day 4. At the end of day 4 I was told after a very lengthy chat with 2 CS reps that "they didn't know where the item was but not to worry this happens sometimes" I told them I was going to be out of town on business over the weekend but the amazon store still had the item in stock saying it could be there the next day. They said they couldn't do that because the other one had shipped even though they didn't know where it was. They said there was nothing they could do just give it another day. So day 5 comes no delivery CS reps 5 and 6 both lie to me but I finally get CSR 6 a "supervisor" to "put a stop on the order and refund my money withing 48 hours" I ordered the same item from walmart+ and received it in less than 2 days. The refund that was supposed to be returned in 48 hrs took CS rep #7 on day 15 to finally process the refund. I saved all of the chat logs and highlighted where CS reps would tell me that the last rep lied to me on 5 different occassions. Amazon is not so prime anymore. Walmart+ rocked my delivery in about 36 hours though.

The card that gets charged for my amazon prime membership expired and I had unfortunately not updated it to the new card in time, so instead of amazon contacting me by phone or email, they charged a random card that I had used to purchase something a long time ago. That card is linked to a checking account I don't really use anymore so I was overdrafted and got a $30 overdraft fee from the bank. The bank wouldn't refund since the prime charge was legitimate so I went on to amazon's online customer service chat to see if they could help. One woman passed me to a supervisor named Fatima. Fatima apologized and said that she would refund August's charge to the card that shouldn't have been used and to make up for the $30 bank fee, she would refund me for June and July's charges as well. Obviously I was at that point a happy customer, until... Two weeks later and not one refund had been received. So I call this time, instead of using the online chat. I don't know the name of the man I talked to, but after placing me on hold twice, he lets me know that even though HE COULD SEE the convo I had with Fatima, he couldn't honor her promise because it was "against policy". I can't believe he was able to see the convo I had where a supervisor stated that she'd refund me and was still unwilling to resolve the issue. I was so disgusted I cancelled my account with them. Honestly, I hardly watch anything on prime video nor do I really order anything anymore, so my membership won't be missed. That company doesn't deserve a single dime from anyone if that's how it's going to operate.
UNTRUSTWORTHY, and are NOT to be believed!.......PERIODProve me incorrect!

I'll start shopping with high street shops for everything again though, forget Amazon.

Review Title: DON‚ÄôT OPEN YOUR AMAZON BOXES IN THE‚Ä¶
Review Text: DON‚ÄôT OPEN YOUR AMAZON BOXES IN THE HOUSELiving in the mountains I order multiple items from Amazon as it is cheaper than driving to Gainesville.  Plus, with Amazon prime I get free delivery, movie channels and music.  Order multiple flavors of Atkins Plus Protein Shakes (30 grams).  All drinks were arrived with the exception of the Strawberry.  Each flavor was in an amazon box, amazon prime tape with brown paper rolled to prevent the inner Atkins box from moving during shipment.  Previously, I was a victim of product tampering so I always check the box for any visual evidence of tampering.  All flavors with the exception of the Strawberry were in an inner Akins box that was glued and contained 3 4 packs of the shake.  The Amazon Prime outer box for the Strawberry was securely taped with no gaps.  It did not have any of the brown paper to prevent movement during shipment.  The inner Atkins box was taped versus side flaps glued.  Immediately noticed a lot of black spots on the Atkins box.  Opened the inner Atkins box and found more tiny black spots. The drinks were not in the 3 4packs but were in the box individually.  Tried to figure out what the heck and as soon as I started removing the shakes cockroaches ran out of the box disappearing in my Kitchen.  The black spots are cockroach poop.  The amount of poop in the box, the fact that the outer box was securely taped and the time from shipment to delivery they were not picked up in transit.  Amazon sent me the Atkins shake knowing it was opened and visually had a lot of cockroach poop on it.  Amazon customer service (CSR) keep repeating the same script in broken English taking a breath at the same time while reading the script.  They would refund the money.  Repeatedly I asked them to send me something to get rid of the cockroaches, pay for an exterminator or I would post on every website I could find that Amazon knowingly ships items with cockroaches and cockroach poop.  The CSR stated I couldn‚Äôt do it.  Call was ended with me saying watch me.  I have an AKC Cavalier King Spaniel who has an unplanned pregnancy thanks to my male AKC king Charles.  Spraying to not an option and I don‚Äôt want to endanger Princess or her babies.  Several exterminators were called and I was quoted a figure up to $200 to get rid of the cockroaches but declined treatment when I advised them of the pregnancy.  Liability issues as 1 pup could be valued at $4k One finally told me an alternative way to get rid of the cockroaches as they have not had time to lays eggs which I have started.

Dissatisfied with Amazon's Recent Policies and ServiceI have been a loyal Amazon customer for many years, but recent experiences have left me deeply dissatisfied with the company's policies and service. I want to emphasize that my dissatisfaction is not directed at any specific representative but is primarily related to systemic issues stemming from Amazon's new policies.‚Äã Incorrect Items Received: On multiple occasions, I have received the wrong items in my orders. These mistakes not only caused inconvenience but also resulted in wasted time and resources as I had to arrange returns and replacements.‚Äã Items Not Received and Police Report: One incident stands out where a package mysteriously disappeared. I had to file a police report due to the significant value of the missing items. This was an extremely distressing experience and raises concerns about Amazon's delivery and security measures.‚Äã Items Delivered to the Wrong Address: I have also faced situations where items were marked as "delivered" but were, in reality, delivered to the wrong address. This forced me to engage in a time-consuming process to track down and retrieve my packages.‚Äã Refund Delays: The most frustrating aspect of my recent interactions with Amazon has been the extensive delays in processing refunds. Waiting for 30 to 60 days for a refund is not just an inconvenience but also feels like a tactic akin to withholding customer funds.‚Äã This pattern of behavior resembles actions taken by financial institutions to retain customers' money rather than providing satisfactory customer service. It is disheartening to witness Amazon, a company I once held in high regard, resorting to such practices.‚Äã As a result of these recurring issues and my growing frustration, I have made the difficult decision to discontinue my patronage of Amazon. While I have enjoyed the convenience and variety of products offered in the past, the recent decline in service quality and the apparent disregard for customer satisfaction have left me with no choice.‚Äã I hope that by sharing my experiences, Amazon will take the necessary steps to address these issues and improve its customer service. It is my belief that companies should prioritize customer satisfaction over all else, as loyal customers are the lifeblood of any business.‚Äã In conclusion, I can no longer place my trust in Amazon as a reliable online shopping platform, and I will be seeking alternatives for my future purchases.

Once again, Amazon has proven what a HORRENDOUS AND USELESS company it is.  On 9-11-23, at around 4:00 a.m., I ordered 2 bags of dog chews.  As a Prime member, I was told I would receive them the same day, between 7-11:00 a.m.  I get a notice around 11:10 a.m., that things are running late.  I tracked my package and was told it was out for delivery at 12:30 p.m..  Then, I get another notice telling me it won't be delivered until 9-12-23, sometime before 6:00 p.m.  I had recently gone through this same scenario with them, and called Customer Service to see what was going on.  They assured me I would get my package on 9-11-23.  I got ONE package - I had ordered TWO.   I had to call Customer Service again, only to find out Amazon had split my order, and two separate drivers would be delivering it. The tracking on the 2nd package originally indicated that it was out for delivery at 11:05 a.m. Then, I get a notice that it would not be coming until sometime before 6:00 p.m. on 9-12-23.  When I spoke to Customer Service, they they again assured me I would get the 2nd package on 9-11-23 but when I asked for a timeframe, I was told sometime on the 11th,  but no later than 6:00 p.m. on the 12th. What kind of an answer is that!!!!  It is 2:45 a.m. on 9-12-23 and NO PACKAGE!!  It is unbelievable that I have to be this frustrated over dog chews!!!!! I am going to be cancelling my Prime membership today, as I am paying for nothing.

Review Title: Purchase an item on the 24th aug 2023
Review Text: Purchase an item on the 24th aug 2023 , item was being sold by Amazon eu and advertised as in stock at time of sale . After sale I was informed delivery time to be confirmed. Nearly every day since purchase item has been advertised as in stock by Amazon eu . After contacting Amazon I was informed that the item was not in stock and also told that (in stock ) does not mean the item is in stock . Hear is what happened on 11/8/23 , the item said 13 in stock and while speaking the phone a Amazon advisor was able to tell me that there was now only 12 available while we were speaking, I asked the advisor could I not have one of the 12 and was told that is not how it works (lol) . So I pay for the item and Amazon won't deliver it but won't deliver it when it is clearly in stock and can't provide a delivery date . So if you see a item you like and is in stock, understand that the term (in stock ) written on a advertisement on Amazon platform does not actually mean (in stock) and what it does mean is very unclear.

my credit card company says amazon is claiming not to have received return of goods although I have considerable proof to the contrary from Amazon's website(1) emails from amazon employees stating that Amazon has received items(2) more than 15 screen shots showing progress of returns including: tracking of return, carrier scan of goods, Amazon scan and receipt of return. Amazon 'refund issued" is shown on website, although the actual monies were never returned to me.(3) My credit card claims, on recorded lines, that Amazon says that the item was not returned.  This is false.  I provided (1) emails from Amazon employees stating that they had received the returned item, (2) provided tracking proving receipt of goods from vendor (3) showed screenshots from the vendor website showing carrier scan, vendor scan of goods received, and vendor "refund issued".(4) Amazon has alternately listed the refund (screenshots on different dates) as the amount of tax $31.16, (which is the amount of the tax for the item) and refund due $359.16 (combined amount of the subtotal and tax).  There is no explanation of why Amazon only issued the amount of tax to Capital One, but the fact that they did substantiates the fact that they received the item as a return.  I have screenshots which I sent to credit card company showing that the "return has been issued" for both 31.16 and 359.16 (which makes no sense), and this is listed as August 28, which is the same date as what is listed on the email from the employee.  It is now September 11, and I still don't have a refund for goods returned July 25.(5) Amazon refunded my card $31.16 which is just the amount of tax, which substantiates that the item was returned but doesn't explain why I was not refunded the subtotal of the returned item.  This is Fraud. I have reached out more than a dozens of times via recorded calls and emails, I have gotten nothing but robotic answers and form letter responses. I have spent untold hours on this. I sent over 15 screenshots to Capital One and returned the paperwork via mail that they requested.  I have spent literally hours on the phone with Amazon and Capital One and sent dozens of emails to both.  Capital One sent me a link which I sent back (ending 7849) On September 7, on a recorded line, the Capital One agent told me that the link they sent me would not suffice, and I would have to re-send all of the information.  This is egregious that I have to spend 15-20 hours to get a refund that is proven with screenshots, emails and has theoretically been credited because the vendor credited the tax and is in error with the amount.  This is FRAUD!

Woke up a bright summer morning with all happiness which did not last long as soon as I saw the weird message from Amazon - "Your order is still running late..!"Placed an order on May 19 2023 with an expected date in next few weeks. The order was shipped as per Amazon and amount has been deducted. Weeks and months by passed, with each day me starring at every Amazon van that stops at my community to see the strong racquets that I ordered as since the order status always said "Out for Delivery".Finally after 75 Days I contacted Amazon only to know that the I need to cancel the order and request for refund. I argued with the Amazon customer service that I have been waiting for more than 75 days after paying in full and now can not simply cancel the order as since the price of the product as gone up very much. The Amazon customer service agent has then informed me to place a new order again and once it is delivered I could reach the customer service and get the refund for the price difference amount.[ Amazon CS promised that the new price - old price will be the amount I would get refund] for which I agreed. Based on the above discuss I went ahead and cancelled the existing order and also placed a new order which arrived in next few days.All seem to be going well until when I contacted Amazon Customer service again and heard that Amazon does not have any such policy for refund. This news made me go into shock and think  "how a company such as Amazon either does not know what promise it is making or is Amazon fooling on people by keeping their money for months and simply not delivering the orders". I have been exposed to three separate incidents recently where the items delivered have NOT been the items ordered and  paid for.BBC have widely reported this scam. It seems to apply to high value items such as cameras, lenses and computer drives. For example a) I  ordered a lens ¬£699  and received a ¬£4.99 set of ear phones  and b) I ordered an external hard drive ¬£135  and received a plastic screen saver ¬£3.90.I fared better than some scammed customers who have received condoms or a tin of cat food.Amazon are aware of the fraud but do not seem able to stamp it out.Scammed customers have to spend hours  of frustration, speaking to robotic assistants  and automated chat machines. I have asked to be transferred to the Fraud Team but they do not allow this.Wake up Amazon. Your reputation is crumbling

Eventually managed to phone Amazon using customer service ‚Ä≠0800 279 7234‚Ä¨, who at first told us to send photo's, and we did but then put us on hold and came back to us by sending us a QR code for Evri to print and return the package. It seems like if you order anything from a 3rd party supplier via Amazon, you can expect a nightmare if you have to return it.

Review Title: My experience on T-Shirt I bought on Amazon
Review Text: I'm thrilled with my recent Amazon clothing purchase! I ordered the CATHY womens casual short sleeve T-Shirts and it has exceeded my expectations in every way.The fit is absolutely perfect, and I appreciate the accurate sizing chart provided by the seller. The fabric is soft, comfortable, and of high quality, making it a pleasure to wear all day. Plus, it's even better in person than in the pictures - the color is vibrant and hasn't faded after multiple washes.What truly impressed me was the attention to detail in the design. The stitching is impeccable, and I haven't encountered any loose threads or issues with the seams. This piece not only looks fantastic but feels well-made.The delivery was prompt, and the packaging was eco-friendly, which I appreciate.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase. The CATHY womens casual short sleeve T-Shirts is now a staple in my wardrobe, and I've received numerous compliments whenever I wear it. I'll definitely be exploring more clothing options from this brand in the future. Highly recommend![Hafsat Abdulkadir]

amazon prime video: two separate problems--1) extremely horrible customer service and the deliberate intention to make it difficult to even get through to them. the online chat bot takes you in circles. it's difficult to get a live chat agent. if you do, they can't understand your issue or solve the problem. if you call, the auto-prompt bot is just infuriatingly awful, doesn't even acknowledge the number prompts entered then terminates the call by stating the call is being ended because there was no response entered. last month, when i finally got a call through to a live agent, we were on the phone an hour, and the problem was not resolved, so the same problem came up again this month. on the last issue i called about, the customer-service agent was so rude and disrespectful, i just gave up on the call.2) called two months in a row about same problem regarding prime-subscription-included content (free, no-additional-charge content) downloaded to my ipad suddenly requiring payment. example: downloaded a season to watch at later time offline. was watching the series offline (wifi off), but had to run an errand, tried to resume a bit later. the series i had been watching just an hour earlier, but had to pause, suddenly is blocked from further viewing unless paid for. right in the middle of an episode, but now no longer free, payment is required. they were already downloaded and being viewed. in one case, i was on the next-to-last episode, so couldn't find out the ending without paying for the whole season i'd almost completed. the only thing that had changed was i was watching the downloads offline (wifi off), then tried to continue watching at a neighbors house with wifi on. think it's a technical issue but the customer-service rep would not even let me state the problem, kept cutting me off and overtalking me. they don't really know anything other than reading from a script, so they do a broken-record tactic to make you go away. i'm going to cancel. seriously, i'm over 65...not enough hours left in life to waste on this ridiculous exercise in futility and complete waste of time and energy!

30-Aug-2023 13:13Hello I did not receive the item as it said its been delivered i have ask my Neighbors if they got it they said they don't I would like a refund please30-Aug-2023 16:34On 25 of August I placed an order on Amazon for Ferrero rocher chocolate bars. The estimated delivery date was yesterday. I tracked the package on the Amazon website and saw that it was delivered to my address on 30 of August However, when I went to check my mailbox, there was no parcel waiting for me.I waited for several days, thinking that maybe the delivery person just forgot to leave the package in my mailbox. But after a week had passed and there was still no sign of the package, I decided to contact Amazon customer service.I called Amazon's customer service number and spoke to a representative. They told me that they could not locate any record of my order or delivery. I provided them with my order number and all the details of my purchase, but they still couldn't find any information about it.The representative suggested that I check with my neighbors to see if they had received the package by mistake. I did so, but none of my neighbors had received anything either.I then asked the representative to investigate further and provide me with more information about what might have happened to my package. They told me that they would look into it and get back to me within 24-48 hours.It has now been over 48 hours since I first contacted Amazon, and I have still not heard back from them. I am very frustrated and disappointed with the lack of communication and resolution to this issue.Therefore, I am requesting a full refund for my order, as well as a resend of the item if it is still available. I would appreciate it if you could look into this matter urgently and provide me with a resolution as soon as possible.Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. Please let me know if there is any further information or documentation that you need from me.Sincerely,Jayden hunt

Just because they have your bank details, does not give them any more rights to take your money, to which they are not entitled. This is an unlawful practice, one which would not stand up in court. Assumed Consent???? I'm sorry Amazon, now I distrust you. This is very poor business practice. My trust in Amazon has plummeted.

Review Title: Amazon support is the worst, and THAT is a FACT!
Review Text: Amazon support is the worst. I got a defective item and it stopped working just days after the return window. The seller said they would send a replacement and to have amazon support help me with getting the shipping handled since their products are in amazons warehouse. The agents refused to listen or help and just copy and paste the same responses. They refuse to help and then lie to customers. One amazon agent told me that sellers have sent replacements to customers in the past, so that meant for a FACT that this seller also has a personal warehouse. Literally said it was a fact, but then when I asked if that seller for a fact has a warehouse because the agent knew of some sellers having their own warehouses? the agent refused to respond and just kept changing the subject. I asked the agent how they could know for a fact that the agent had a warehouse? Refused to answer. So I asked if they lied about knowing for a fact that the Seller had a warehouse, and the agent said that they could not confirm or deny that.... Wow amazon. Went from stellar support to almost one star reviews on trust pilot... Not to mention stores like costco (their membership costs less than amazons even) offers 90 day returns. Walmart, with NO membership offers 90 day returns as well and I have never had issues with their support either. You spend days trying to get help and get no resolutions. With all the money amazon generates, put some money BACK into customer service, and stop outsourcing the work to people who could not give less of a damn about the customers or their experience.

Review Title: The Poorest Service I Have Ever Had
Review Text: I have been asked to be constructive when writing this review about Amazon but I will find that very difficult.I am in my late 70s and have most of my requirement delivered by various companies as I live in a second floor flat and find carrying things upstairs quite difficultand have been using Amazon for many years. Recently I have noticed that most of the deliveries from Amazon come in unmarked white vans or even cars and not in Amazon vans.I am afraid most of the drivers of these vans and cars are rude, disinterested in their job and really don't care. I have recently had one driver who having been extremenly rude to my wife left some very heavy parcels blocking a fire door instead of walking another three yards to leave them by my front door. When confronted by my wife his response was "if you don't like where I've left them I'll come and take them away - I don't care". My wife thinls he made a very rude gesture as he drove away but cann't be sure.Today I was expecting another heavy delivery. When it arrive in a plain blue van a young woman who, when she rang the bell to the main door of the flats, told me she would leave the parcels just insi8de the main door. When I told her that was not any good to me. she just got back in her van and drove of with my delivery. Within a couple of minutes I received a pre recorde phone message from Amazon Logistic saying they had been unable to make the delivery.Every day now the main entrance to our flats is littered with Amazon parcel that are just thrown in by the drivers who then just drive off without making any effort to deliver properly.Wake up Amazon and get your house into order. You are no longer providing a service and your drivers are getting away with murder probably because they are the cheapest you can find.

Review Title: I'm disappointed with Amazon.com for various reasons‚Ä¶
Review Text: I'm seriously disappointed with Amazon, a company I used to view as the best.Those days are over. Customer Service has been farmed out overseas. So reps are hard to understand and sometimes don't know how to help customers. Delivery service sucks. You're told when your delivery will arrive, and then you're notified it won't be there AFTER you've wasted an entire day waiting for it. Packages are left out in the rain, with no attempt to shield them to keep them dry. Nor do they knock on the door to give you the package, so it won't get wet. All this, and they've increased our membership fees. What are we getting for paying more--aside from shoddy service? Definitely time for me to carefully consider whether to renew my Prime Membership.

Review Title: I really like Amazon & I can trust them most of the time
Review Text: For a very big impersonal corporation, I've always surprisingly found Amazon doing a pretty good job unless I made an error, which I've done before, or if people are trying to game the system. Maybe sometimes even unrealistic expectations,  for instance most of the bad reviews on here seem to be people trying to get a refund on a gift card which obviously may have limitations on every retailer's individual policy but overall when it comes to a seamless online Internet shopping experience.  In terms of being the dominant department store, I will have to say overall I'm pretty happy one thing I would definitely recommend is checking out the most recent reviews taking the time and not going by the thousands of reviews from years ago which might be fake. Make sure to compare prices because if I have one complaint is the fact that Amazon is not always cheaper than in the stores .Honestly, I don't really expect it to be the cheapest because there is that added cost of shipping and for the convenience and I'm prepared to pay for that sometimes, and sometimes I'm not. I really dislike the fact customers lie about the product in order to get free shipping if the purchase is not as described. Please don't lie, you would not do that in store.

I bought an Iphone 14 Pro max worth over 1k on Amazon and it was meant to be delivered within 2 days. On delivery day message appeared on my account stating "Problem occurred and item won't be delivered". I spoke to countless Amazon associates via chat and phone and no one could tell me what happened. They told me to wait 14 days for the refund. After 2 weeks money was still not in my account and again after several phone calls they told me to raise an incident report which I did as per instructions and within another week got the money back. I smashed my current phone prior to ordering from Amazon and for nearly 3 weeks I was left with no phone and no money to buy new device. I could not raise complaint and as there is no such department in Amazon as I was told. Company that delivers in one day was unable to send me the replacement item, nor to give me the money back quickly enough. The service I had received was absolutely disgraceful and I won't be using them ever again.

Review Title: Sick and tired of repeeatedly being tricked into signing up for Amazon Prime
Review Text: I am sick and tired of Amazon trying to trick me into signing up for Amazon Prime.  I often have to phone them, not easy, to get it cancelled.  Today, I clicked on the box to decline a free trial of Amazon prime.  The next screen said I was getting a 30 day free trial which I HAD ALREADY DECLINED.  There was no button to decline again.  I also got a similar box on the next screen meaning I had to phone Amazon to find out what was going on.  Why are Amazon like this?  When a customer declines an offer that should be enough.  I consider their practice deceptive and it's about time the authorities in this country put a stop.  Once Amazon prime has been declined it should never again appear on a subsequent screen during the placing of that particular order.  What a nasty, horrible company to deal with.  They are too big and too powerful and need cutting down to size.  I have also heard rumours that Amazon is withholding money from sellers.  If that is true then it is a thoroughly despicable act and, again, the authorities should be taking action.

Review Title: Amazon can legit scam your money by blocking your account
Review Text: I've spent over a thousand dollar on Amazon, purchase some parts for my car, and now I have no parts and my money is taken away.Few days ago, I made purchase in one afternoon, everything was normal until next day morning I received an email confirm that my account is suspended for no reason. Amazon took my money anyway and I have no idea where my parts are, because I'm blocked, no access to invoice or custom informations.I've tired to call the customer service for past week, and I'm getting the same script answer, their India call center doesn't solve any issue. For the past week I've been trying to take my account back, uploading exactly what amazon login-option asked. Driver's license, bank statement, transaction record, even my physical card! and Amazon's India outsourced 'specialist' still saying insufficient. What on Earth?!Now after a week of hard try, my account is dead now. I might call my bank try to roll back or I'm going to small claim court. If Amazon believed the transaction is suspicious why would it take the money away by processing an 'suspicious' transaction? In my case, Amazon took my money, blocked me from accessing my 'possible' shipped items by suspending my account. It is a scam done by Amazon.

Review Title: they just buy time until the customer give up

I reached Customer service and I was told to file a police report, and I did it.(I went to local police station and Municipal department to get appropriate police report ) I sent them to Amazon CS team the next day. and I was told that I should verify this issue via call, and I did it. the agent who got the call always changed, so I had to explain my issue over and over again. they told me that I would get answer from "escalation team" within 1-2 business day, which I didn't. After I sent them several email, I got an email saying that they cannot address my issue. the detailed as below: based on the lack of information we have about the shipment, we won‚Äôt be able to provide a replacement or refund for this order at this time. For more information on our shipping policy you can review our Terms and Conditions of Use under Risk of Loss here:  They made me file a police report and make numerous call but in the end, they just sent this message without a detailed explanation. I made several calls and asked for detailed explanation about reject reason, but they never send me back. (though all agents said to me that I should wait for 1-2business day) or they(the escalartion team) just hung up on me. I doubt if amazon really had an any intention of resolving this issue in the first place. I was under the impression amazon just wanted to buy some time waiting until I gave up on this issue. There was no willing to address this issue. or it can be racism because I'm not a US customer.

Review Title: Daylight robbery by Amazon delivery:pick up agent
Review Text: I have ordered One Grey color clogs(Rs 858.00) from Kazarmax on amazon for my son and however, due to some fitting issue, I have asked for the return of the same. On 19.08.2023 at 1630 Hours, amazon pick up guy reached my place for return pick up. However, instead of asking clogs he asked for the shoes. My house-help unknowingly handed him my Hoka Shoes women shoes (Purchased from Tata Cliq for 7799.00). That guy even checked the returned product for 5 minutes at my door and even outside the house(Screenshots attached), but he did not inform my househelp for wrong product and took away that costly product with him. When I came to know, I immediately called the Amazon customer service and informed them about the same. I was told by Mr  Mohit, customer service executive that the issue will be resolved, he will personally follow up and I will receive my product back. I called again on 20.08.2023 to your customer service and these guys were not able to inform about the status of my complaint and no resolution was provided. Instead they told me that I will not get my product return back and they don‚Äôt have any contact details of the pick up guy. My wife requested them to share the contact details of the delivery guy or their warehouse address but they simply refused to provide any information. This is ridiculous, how can a company like amazon could not keep the track of the delivery/pick up guys, if this guy commits some serious crimes, then also amazon will say that they don‚Äôt have any contact details of their delivery/pick up guys. I am seriously shocked by the behaviour/attitude and customer service of Amazon. The copy of e-mail is also marked to the seller of the product M/s Kazarmax as the wrong product(Hoka Women shoes instead of Clogs) should reach back to seller(M/s Karamax) and they should be kind enough to return back my product. If that product is not reaching the seller(M/s Kazarmax) then this is a day light robbery by Amazon and their delivery partners and I shall be forced to take an action against all of them.

Review Title: Returns is way to long for this day in age
Review Text: I had a broken xbox controller pad I had prime so I got a new one the next day payed 103  they sent me a faulty pad ...I'm waiting 30 days for a refund from this day on I'm never buying anything from amazon ever again .... they received the product it then took them 6 days to process the refund that time is absolutely disgusting to hold on to 100 pounds worth of my money for that long ..

Review Title: I purchased a book on Amazon and only‚Ä¶

Review Title: If I could leave zero stars I would
Review Text: If I could leave zero stars I would. I got locked out of an old account and got an email notification that purchases were being made. The password on my account was changed and lord knows what else. I called and tried to get the account closed and  got zero help. Needless to say dozens of purchases were and are still being made and sent to my home address from this account. It's been a miserable and draining experience. I will NEVER use Amazon again . This company does not care about its customers at all.

Review Title: Item I ordered did not work as‚Ä¶described
Review Text: Item I ordered did not work as described.  Started to return it.  Amazon cut the credit amount to 50% of the purchase price because the applied the promotional code to the wrong item on the order (more than 1 item ordered.).

Review Title: Why does the customer pay for Amazon's mistakes?
Review Text: I have been a Prime customer for over five years. Today I was expecting an item I ordered several days ago. Amazon said they delivered it. They did not. They expect me to wait ANOTHER DAY and then ask for a refund if I don't get it. Why do I have to suffer the inconvenience of waiting another day for a refund? I should receive a refund whether the item is delivered tomorrow or not. When does AMAZON pay for its mistakes instead of making their customers pay?

Review Title: Good luck getting your money back
Review Text: Ordered from Amazon in April. Waited a month without getting anything. Got some shipment updates, but when it hadn't updated for 2 weeks i contacted support. I was told to wait. So a week later i contacted support again.Now they could tell me that my package was lost in transit. They never told me it was lost, before i contacted Amazon. They told me i would get my money back.Fast forward a couple of months, I had still not gotten my money, so i have been contacting support multiple times, getting different answers, and still do not have my money.After contacting customer support multiple times, and waiting 4 months, I have been told that I will receive a check with the money, but i do not believe it until i have it in my hand.

I asked where is this written on the web page or near the item itself. It's not, it's called deceptive marketing. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was transferred to Canada. Called back and transferred to Philipines. There is no one to talk to in the U.S anymore. Service - laughable.

I have noticed over the year the quality of products  being sold on Amazon has gone down dramatically. Really disappointed as I use to use them a lot ,but if I cant trust the quality of the products being sold on the platform its time to look else where .

Review Title: Amazon Prime Is No Longer Prime!
Review Text: I've been an Amazon customer for years. I started out selling books on their site in the 1990's. I became a Prime member later and enjoyed the 1-2 day free shipping and returns. My more recent orders now take weeks to arrive. Quality of products have gone way down and they don't care. I can shop the dollar stores for junk.  Returns are a horrific experience. While I used to get immediate refunds when returning through UPS to an Amazon gift card, I was told by customer service that I will have to wait 2-3 weeks for a refund. So, why exactly am I paying for Amazon Prime? It's worthless and I'm cancelling. It seems like Mr Jessy had ditched the old Amazon model and now it's about profits over customer service. Time to move on.

Review Title: Amazon no longer gives a damn
Review Text: Ultimately, Amazon has gone down hill as a business over the last couple of years. Whether it be silly mistakes like I'm ordering wood, smoking pellets and receive dog food and I don't have a dog; or most recently my wife orders some headphones doesn't like the fit, returns them and they proceed to tell us that we returned the wrong item. So they got rid of the item they received and are not going to refund us. Spent 2 days trying to work on that problem only to be brushed off and basically told they don't care or pass the buck to some other department that turns around and passes it to somebody else. $150 problem could have been fixed and a long loyal customer could have been kept. Now they're going to lose a heck of a lot more than $150 with my business going elsewhere on top of the fact that I'm going to bad mouth them as much as I possibly can and tell my story to everyone that will listen. Only further causing them lost revenue in the long run. Great business model Amazon, keep it up.  From here on in I'll just find other alternatives. Whether it's ordering direct or through Walmart or Target or going in person for a change.

Review Title: Poor knock off and cheap products have‚Ä¶
Review Text: Poor knock off and cheap products have been flooded into amazon over the last few years so you really have to mind what you buy. I dislike the direction the business is headed. I set up automatic delivery so I don't have to worry about it. Took me 1 hour on chat to get that sorted. No longer an amazon customer.

Review Title: Amazon took my money,never received mobile phone
Review Text: Ordered phone and charger for approx. 750eur but only charger was in the box I received and Amazon did not help me, washing their hands.I lost my money on Amazon Italy!! Very rude customer service,bad customer service,repetitive emails,only writing on Italian, do not read what you are telling them, do not want to introduce case to higher authority,do not understand English well,you cannot contact them via phone nor chat if you are not Italian,totally disappointed with Amazon Italy.I am buying a lot on Amazon with really good track record and 0 returning (mainly Germany and UK and no problem with them at all,with fully positive experience) but after this I will think twice for buying on Amazon,especially Italy.Since 2nd June I am trying to solve this,lot of time wasted and I am giving up and giving Amazon my money because they deserved it and obviously need it more then their customers...Recap:- On June 2nd received package from UPS, opened and only charger was in the box,no phone- Immediately contacted Amazon asking for help. I tried to solve case directly with Amazon but since very beginning they started repeating same message in different variants again and again to go to Police and report case...I didn't see any reason for that because it wasn't my fault but ok eventually I decided to go to police and waited for hours there ofc.- So I went to Police and provided Report to Amazon in official Croatian Police Report that can be only on Croatian because Croatian is only official language in Public institutions. I provided it to Amazon but Amazon ignored me and said it is not on English or Italian and their desired form, ignoring me further and said that they will not help me any more.- I reported also this missing phone to UPS and they finally UPS confirmed after investigation that there was not phone in the package and they said they will contact Amazon and pay insurance amount directly to Amazon (since Amazon hired them for transport and they can not refund me,they said they will to Amazon and Amazon should refund me...but no!). But guess what, no!! I contacted Amazon with this information with hope that this will be finally solved and that I will be refunded but Amazon told again about this police report not on Italian or English and totally ignored my refering to UPS solved case and they agqin finished correspondence with...you are guessing... will not assist any more because Police report was not in Amazon requested form and language and will not refund me!!So Amazon will at the end earn money on this lost package from UPS insurance! And for me nothing!Be aware!My only option is now to give up or to introduce this to lawyer and start fighting with big ones... overall bad taste and never expected this from Amazon.

Review Title: What has happened to Amazon Prime?
Review Text: What has happened to Amazon Prime? This colossus company has gotten so huge it's done what most huge companies all do eventually. FORGOTTEN WHO PAYS THE BILLS! In the past 6 to 8 months Amazon Prime has completely collapsed. Before that it was a great thing. Now, it's wrong items shipped, items never show up, and poor custoer service that tells you how much they care and want to help, but in the end give you a huge run around. The final straw for me was I ordered new tires.  Received totally wrong size. Was hassled to no end by CS to get return labels. Now they have had the tires back for nearly a week and have only managed to refund my money ON ONE. Have spoken to customer service and they say it takes 2 weeks to process returns. Really? Never took that long before. Tracking shows all 4 tires were received at the same time, but only one refunded. They can't explain why that is. CS claims they are too busy processing refunds. I wonder if they would be so busy if they did it correctly the first time. They're holding up over $500 that I need to buy tires elsewhere, and couldn't care less. I'm done with Amazon PERIOD! Just another compny getting too big and too fast and screwing the customers. I'm canceling Prime as soon as the current subscription expires.  I'll go back to supporting my local merchants. At least then I know what I'm getting and will see it BEFORE I pay for it
