Review Title: Just got off the phone with "Customer‚Ä¶
Review Text: Just got off the phone with "Customer Service" regarding a change to an order I placed in July and still have not received. Checked the order status and noticed that not only had the brand of product I ordered been changed, but had been replaced by a brand I've never heard of at 4X the price of the one I ordered. I am absolutely sure it isn't what I ordered, as I have checked it's status repeatedly since then. The product name, picture, and price are different than what has been there EVERY OTHER TIME I've checked. Their response? "We will give you a refund, send it back when you get it." I said ty but I'm a little more concerned with being billed and shipped things that are not what I ordered. "I'll pass it along to my supervisor." Really? Ok, so I explained my concern with the 'report to my supervisor' not really addressing the issue I have, which is how exactly did this happen?? They respond with some mumbo jumbo about the seller changing it and that they will do this and that....hello? I ordered it thru AMAZON, I expect AMAZON to handle ANYONE or ANYTHING even attempting to change my order WITHOUT consent. I have been a frequent and long time customer of Amazon. Until now, I've had no issues whatsoever. This however is a deal breaker. I just ordered expensive pc parts yesterday. Are they now gonna be swapped to top of the line $10k parts I don't need and can't afford??? Intolerable. No help whatsoever beyond the BS i got from CS. I'm aware I can get a refund, THAT IS NOT THE ISSUE I contacted them about, and I clearly outlined the issue I had with their supposed 'resolution' but they just refused to address the fact that MY ORDER WAS NOT MY ORDER AND I'M PAYING FOR IT. When I filled out a customer service complaint review, they emailed me that they refused to post it, so here I am.

I had a terrible experience with Amazon. I returned a product that didn't meet my expectations and chose the free UPS pickup option. However, UPS didn't show up on the scheduled day; they arrived two days later and mistakenly took the wrong package from my front yard. They didn't even attempt to notify me by knocking or ringing the bell. I only found out about it through a notification on the app while I was at work. I immediately contacted customer care, and they assured me they would retrieve my package from UPS. It's been 10 days now, and they're saying it's difficult to resolve the issue. They even mentioned the option of legal action, but cautioned against expecting a positive outcome. This situation contradicts Amazon's customer obsession principle. No one is taking responsibility for their mistake. It's disappointing to see Amazon not living up to their claims. The customer service representatives keep ending calls without a solution, and there seems to be no clarity on how to escalate the matter. The tracking number shows that the package is in Amazon warehouse.
Great service, fast shipping, great packaging

Review Title: Prime not what it claims to be/very difficult to cancel
Review Text: I recently tried out Amazon Prime for a free trial, but I was disappointed with the experience. The free shipping was the only real benefit for me, and I often had to wait a week or more for items to arrive. On average it was at least two to three weeks and I  never once received same-day or next-day delivery.The cancellation process was also incredibly frustrating. I had to go through multiple options to find the option to cancel, and I was asked about a dozen times if I was sure I wanted to do it. At times, the cancel option received no response. I had to click cancel about six time before the website would accept my cancel option.Even after I finally canceled, I was still reminded several times that I was about to lose my membership and to continue to the cancellation process. I understand that Amazon was recently sued by the FTC in June 2023 for making it difficult for users to cancel their Prime memberships. The FTC alleged that Amazon used "dark patterns" to trick consumers into staying subscribed.As a result of this experience, I cannot recommend Amazon Prime. In summary, Amazon Prime is not worth the hassle. The free shipping is the only real benefit, and the cancellation process is incredibly frustrating. I would recommend looking for a different online retailer with free shipping if you're not interested in the other Prime perks.

Review Title: I cannot emphasise enough how deeply‚Ä¶
Review Text: I cannot emphasise enough how deeply disappointed and frustrated I am with Amazon Ireland. For small purchases? They might be adequate. But for anything above 100EUR? Forget it.Firstly, they couldn't even get a simple invoice right, despite multiple confirmations and assurances. And when they make a mistake? They leave you to deal with the aftermath. No refund was issued, their drivers obstinately refused to take back the item, and now I'm left with the headache of sending it back myself.Moreover, the lack of an import fee or a detailed invoice breakdown isn't just an oversight, it's potentially illegal. It's clear that they're cutting corners at the expense of their customers.And the customer service? A complete travesty. I'm not sure what kind of training, if any, their team and management receive, but it's clearly inadequate. Rude, unhelpful, and utterly incompetent would be an understatement.Given this experience, I'm not only cancelling all my Amazon services, including my Prime membership, but I'm also urging everyone across the UK and Ireland to seriously reconsider using Amazon. There are plenty of other providers who value their customers and offer transparent, reliable services.For your own peace of mind, steer clear.Order Number: 202-5433225-0173931.

In recent times, there have been numerous instances of account closures by e-commerce giant Amazon without any explanation or proper communication to the affected customers. These abrupt closures have left customers frustrated, confused, and feeling violated. A negative trend of unexplained account closures is observed, highlighting the negative impact on customers and questioning the ethical practices of a company that prides itself on customer-centricity. Many customers, like myself, have fallen victim to Amazon's sudden account closures. Without warning or prior notice, access to accounts that have been faithfully used for years is abruptly terminated. When attempting to log in, a message appears stating that the account has been closed, with an email notification supposedly sent. However, in numerous cases, customers claim to have never received any such email or any details on how to resolve the situation.Adding to the frustration, attempts to seek clarification from Amazon's customer support often go unanswered. It is only when customers create new accounts and reach out to support that they receive a response, albeit in a rude form. The response typically states that the account was closed for violating the terms of the Conditions of Use agreement. However, customers vehemently deny any wrongdoing and are left perplexed by the lack of specific reasons for their account closures.Account closures without proper explanation or justification raise severe concerns about customer rights. As loyal patrons who have spent years and significant amounts of money on the platform, customers have the right to transparency and fair treatment. The sudden termination of access to accounts, which may contain valuable digital assets such as e-books and audio files, feels like a betrayal of trust. The alarming trend of unexplained account closures by Amazon raises serious questions about the company's commitment to customer satisfaction and respect for customer rights.

I ordered a electric wheelchair in Nov 22. i am a disabled vet and need one to get around. Two weeks after we had the chair, sparks flew out of the control box when we connected the charger. We called the company that sold it, and they said they would send a new box. Weeks turned to months that we waited for this box. We were being told there was a holiday in China and as soon as it was over, they would send the part. After about 7 months of calls and complaints, they talked us into buying another chair of higher quality for half price. $500. We ordered it and it was junk. It needed to be charged 3 times the first day and was so slow it was useless. We asked to return the items, and they would not send us return labels. We wanted our money back so we could buy a quality chair. After arguing for a while, we asked Amazon to step in. Speaking with these people we got a lot of wrong information. Every time I said something to them, I had to wait either 72hrs or a week for the seller to answer. They sent it to an A-Z department to settle this while I was told a number of times, I would get my money back. This department refused to do anything saying I did not return the item in the allowed 30 days. They refused to recognize that the seller kept promising a replacement part.      I will continue to tell others about my experience as a warning to them about the dishonest customer service I received. It is a shame because they seem so proud of themselves backing the customer and making sure the customer is satisfied. I found out the hard way, and it cost me $1500 that AMAZON LIKE SO MANY OTHERS IS JUST A BUNCH OF TALK!

Ok, so I initiated a return of 2 x lights appliances which had to be returned by the 2nd august.No reciept given to confirm return at the post office!Then the return has been removed from my account?Had confirmation that it is in transit and they are now making me wait even longer for the refund.Just one of many customer return issues that just get swept under the carpet.Their customer service is a jokeHow to make it better?Look after your loyal customers

Review Title: Order a toy for my son
Review Text: I ordered a toy for my son, who is autistic. This is relevant as he expected it to come overnight and was very excited. It didn't come. I figured out how to contact customer service, which is a pain in and of itself. I complained that it didn't come, but they say they "escalated" it and it will arrive tomorrow by 8:00AM. All day my son is upset. I wake up this morning and look outside. It is not there. I call again. I ask them to be honest and tell me if they lost it. We could have cancelled and gone to the store or I could have even re-ordered as it was supposed to be available same day. The guy says it is on a truck and will be there by 8:00AM. He said the truck had mechanical issues yesterday. 8:00AM comes around. It is not there. My husband calls. Turns out they lost it yesterday. So they lied to me. I called them up to complain because my husband was over it by the time he was through talking to the person. The lady asks if I asked my neighbors where it is? No. You guys told me it was on  a truck and then said you lost it. For all I know, your third party delivery person stole it. No real solution offered. In the past, this would have been resolved yesterday. I buy a lot from Amazon. Like a lot. I am greatly going to reduce how much I buy in the future. We cancelled all our subscribe and save items. I will do in person shopping. I am not going to spend $10,000 plus a year with a company that doesn't value their customers at all.

Review Title: You don't need to care once you've conquered the world
Review Text: The delivery contractor they're using in my area (Intelcom) is horrendous. They don't have a pickup location so if you're not home when they show up, they keep the package and come back another day. You never know for sure when it will be, so you have to play cat and mouse with them, sometimes for days. They seem to think that everyone is unemployed and sitting home all day. They call when they get to your place, and if you're not there, sometimes the drivers get upset. I once had one threatening to return the package after three attempts, but he always came while I was at work. If they could at least give a clear idea of when to expect them, that would help. "Between 8am and 10pm" is not exactly what I would call clear. It's infuriating. That contractor can only afford to be that bad because their main client has obliterated the competition and doesn't need to care about the quality of the service anymore. I don't think my bad review will shake them out of their mediocrity, but it feels good to vent and I hope it will provide some relief to the readers who have had a similar experience.

Amazon is the mother of all online marketplaces ... and for some very solid reasons.1. 100% customer-centered. From the first page loading on their site to the shipping confirmation, Amazon treats every customer like a VIP. Awesome!2. Adapts and evolves with customers' needs. Unafraid to charter new territory, Amazon evolves with the ever-changing needs of its customers.3. Delivers your package on-time OR early. This is such a game-changer that Amazon has seriously disrupted the US Postal Service due to their unmatched delivery system. I could easily write 10 more pages about why Amazon is #1, but it really boils down to this: customer service. In a time where true customer service has become a rarity, Amazon is the undisputed leader.

Review Title: Don‚Äôt buy valuable items from Amazon
Review Text: I ordered this printer 4 days ago with a 2 days delivery from Amazon at a good price (-21% + 50$ added discount). I am a loyal prime customer since 8 years, at least, with a lot of purchases.TBA307871694897As I was supposed to provide the 1-time pin code to the driver for delivery of this amazing printer, and the tracking was showing delivery between 2pm and 4pm initially,  I had organized my day to stay home.At 4pm , I was "next stop" on the map and the driver was 2 blocks away from my house. At 4.30pm, not seeing anybody, I checked again, the driver was still at the same place and the delivery moved to 7pm, while he was still 2 blocks away‚Ä¶.At 5.30pm, I see now the driver is in Simi Valley, CA  at an Amazon center location, 30 miles away from my house. I phone the customer service, who literally just says what I can read on my screen‚Ä¶. So not useful at all.The day after I go to this center in Simi Valley, CA where they tell me to go complain in Chatsworth, CA as they cannot help locally. Well ‚Ä¶.the driver obviously stopped here and had the printer loaded in the van there. So why cannot they help ? Being now in Chatsworth , we check, and printer is tagged as "missing" in the system. We phone together Amazon customer service over the phone, same thing again, not useful at all, we are even told it is not missing and it will be delivered this same day for sure.Now today saturday 07/29/23, same status as 3 days ago. The information are not even updated on the tracking. I phone the customer service where I am being told to wait until the 11th of august (in 15 days) to ask for a solution if I have not been delivered in the meantime. After saying I didn‚Äôt agree , I did ask to speak to a supervisor, who finally told me literally " I cannot do anything else and I will hang up", that he did while I was continuing speaking.I phoned again 2 hours ago , after having selected "cancel this delivery" , and spoke to another lady to whom I explained the whole story. This lady, this time, was courteous but told me she cannot tell me anything about this sad situation and will escalate the issue‚Ä¶.and I cannot even order another 1 at the same price that I ordered !Now if I check the delivery status, informations have magically changed :  I can read that I refused the delivery because the order was canceled before. What ??!!? So now Amazon is changing the story line ?To summarize , basically my printer was loaded in the van, the driver stopped 2 blocks away for a while and for any reason it did last, then he decides not to deliver me and goes back to the Amazon center 30 miles away. The van stays overnight and suddenly the printer is missing, but in the end it is me refusing delivery because the order was canceled !?!?Something is definitely wrong but it is being cover-up obviously. Leaving aside the fact I was hang-up by an Amazon associate representing the management, and all other associates telling me what I could read !As it is not an isolated case, aside from huge money losses (and in this case how is it handled with Epson‚Ä¶),  it says a lot about the "Customer experience" or "Customer centricity"  mindset being practiced at Amazon:- customer being held hostage if the ordered item has suddenly disappeared- customer being hung-up if not satisfied- customer unsatisfied left unsatisfied- customer is not a priority, Amazon decides to hang-up as they don‚Äôt have any solution, and decides that you have to wait the period of time they decide- customer is being handled by low cost countries personal , just repeating what they learned and not customizing their answer to your own concern. In the end the service is more expensive, being paid for‚Ä¶..nothing except providing informations you already have on your screenObviously, Amazon is not set to handle expensive orders/ items that can suddenly disappear, and for which you can be held hostage for a while. I know now that I will prioritize Amazon for cheap items but not for pricier ones where I will go in a store, or order straight from more serious companies (bestbuy‚Ä¶.).It was not like this in the past, so Amazon has taken definitely a wrong turn, probably being the result of short-term cash only oriented decisions. But this is another story‚Ä¶.

Review Title: Don't use them, beware of so called easy returns...
Review Text: The ironic thing is that despite (especially on this site) the number of negative reviews, this site will still sell a lot of stuff, making the jerk, greedy, selfish Bezos, VERY rich.  Important thing to add on, under federal law the FTC says that if you receive a wrong package, you are entitled to keep it WiTHOUT having to pay for it, that is why they kept wanting me to send the pic,  If they sent you the wrong package I suggest EVERYONE make it as difficult as possible for them in not sending the package back and disputing the charge. I was THREATENED that if I sent it back without the photo first, the package might get "lost" and I wouldn't get a refund.I had ordered an Ipad Air and wanted it in Silver, and by accident ordered the color Slate Gray and when it came realized it was wrong color.  Called cus. serv. was told it had to be shipped back and not brought in, thought that agent was processing refund, but didn't called to get shipping info and the very, VERY nice CSA, (shall be called nameless for a reason) offered to send it back and when I tried to tell her what to write (that I got the wrong color, she told me not to say anything and now I know why.)  A few days later, my second order arrived, correctly ordered and the color was STILL wrong, starlight, instead of silver.  I wanted to  reorder again but this time I wanted to ask the sellers first  if they had the correct color, but on Amazon you have to use a chat bot and I didn't know how long it would take to get a reply, called them  to see if they could call sellers. Due to complications with the website, had to talk to a supervisor and for some reason, before they accept the return I would have to take a photo as proof, which I NEVER had to do and determine whether I could get a refund. I never had to go through that before EVER, and everyone I talk to doesn't want to explain why and just quickly hangs up. They must be getting a lot of negative feedback on this. After the initial conversation, I quickly started an online return WHERE item was accepted and should have just sent it back, but I foolishly called to ask why I needed to send photo when you don't have to send if you return it with online processing and was threatened that if I didn't send a photo first, they may refuse it at the warehouse and if it gets lost, I won't get my money back.  I don't know if they legally can do that, and even those it's a hassle I will send the photo, but I don't like the idea that they have to "approve" the return and the logic behind that if I didn't call in to ask what I wanted to originally ask, none of this would have happened, no need to send photos and no one I know has ever been asked to send photos. I read somewhere that I should not have said wrong item but item not as described (wrong color) and maybe that would have made a difference, but they wouldn't change it, I know now why the nice CSA told me not to give a reason which is why I won't name her, BE WARNED-if you don't want hassle don't buy in first place, but if you do return, do ONLINE only.The naughty part of me says take a photo of bricks that you got instead of a computer, who's to say that you didn't get it, you got the proof.

Beware of the almost immoral currency conversion practices by Amazon!When you use an international card be very careful when you choose your currency at checkout.I use a Revolut card when paying on Amazon - this is basically a multi-currency prepaid card and I always use to covert between currencies using Revolut rates as they are almost interbank rates.For whatever reason Amazon always selects as default currency my home country currency thus I always have to change it to USD. For my last order, tho I switched to USD Amazon unilaterally decided to charge my Revolut card in my local currency and not USD.Long story short Amazon immorally (and in the EU also illegally) pocketed 10 USD (2% from the order value) - now imagine how many billions they make from this practice that borders basically a scam.Also they're customer support is even worse than their stupid exchange rate scam - the callback doesn't do anything whilst on the chat you end up discussing with people with very limited use and understanding of the English language, that are rude and completely useless.As a conclusion I am very disappointed in Amazon's practices.

I recently ordered a few items from Amazon.com.   The order was placed on Monday and was to be delivered by 8pm on Tuesday.  About that time I tracked the package to see where it was.  Amazon's tracking function indicated that the package was out for delivery and the visual graphic showed it to be very close to being delivered.   Checking again about 30 minutes later, the tracker indicated that the package was on its way but running late.  The next check informed me that the expected delivery date was as late as Saturday.  I was quite puzzled by this.  How could a package that seemed to be virtually on my door step suddenly be up to four days away?  I waited to see if the package would arrive the next day (Wednesday) before trying to contact Amazon.com.  It did not, so once again I tracked it.  This time, the package was was apparently not even out for delivery. Perplexed and frustrated,  I tried various avenues to contact Amazon.com to inquire about what had happened.   I finally got ahold of a person in customer service and explained the situation to him.  I gave him the information he needed and he said he'd check into it and be right back.  The call was terminated about 3 minutes later.  I never got a return call.As of 11:30am Thursday, the package is still not out for delivery. This has been a frustrating and disappointing experience.   I have been somewhat of an Amazon junkie for several years now.   I tell my coworkers, "If you can't find it on Amazon,  it doesn't exist.".  I've experienced prompt deliveries most of the time. A few late ones now and again, but this one is strange.   I have been happy with with the majority of products I have received  and have had no problems returning any items.My experience with customer service in the present situation has been very frustrating trying to get past the Inflexible, canned and recorded  messages to speak to,  or chat with, a real person.  It would be a major improvement if some of the automation were removed and direct access to real people was possible.

Would rate less than 1 star if possible!! Absolutely disgusted at the treatment I have received. I ordered a fire tablet which conveniently broke after 2 years and 6 days use. It was 6 days out of warranty and I contacted customer service who refused a refund or repair but instead offered a discount of 40% on a new tablet. They sent me an email saying to go ahead and order a new tablet and that I would be refunded a 40% discount of the price of the tablet. I ordered the tablet the following day and was waiting on the refund. 6 months later and still no refund. I have been on live chat trying to sort the issue and passed around countless different associates who have all been zero help! I have sent countless emails with zero response. I finally got speaking to an actual human being on the phone tonight who was even less help. This associate is apparently the highest in her team for customer resolutions and basically said yes she can see the email and promise of discount that was made to me but unfortunately it was incorrect and they cannot fulfill it and process the refund!!! I asked if she was happy breaching this written contract that was made between me and the associate and she said yes. I also made her aware that I never would have ordered the new tablet without the promise of the discount. She couldn't have cared less. I now have to escalate my complaint again and explain this to another individual who will more than likely fob me off also. Really disappointed and disgusted especially since I'm a prime member and constantly shop there. Will be cancelling my prime membership today!!! Absolutely fuming! Also advise people against buying the fire kids tablets. They are cheap and handy with a lifespan of 2 years then you need to purchase a new one! Better off paying a little more for an apple ipad

Review Title: Amazon Refuses To Honor Their Prime Member Agreement
Review Text: Amazon advertizes ‚ÄúBuilding a better future‚Äù. How, by cheating and lying to your customers? Its funny how my daughter can get an order to her house in two days and I live 50 miles from her and if I order the exact same thing it takes over a week to get to me and I am a prime member. The thing is I complained to customer service and when I was getting my orders in two days they suddenly went to taking a week. Amazon has no problems still charging me for my membership even though they refuse to fulfill their end of the agreement. That is nothing more than stealing. Amazon has joined in with the rest of these big companies and could care less about customer service. So what if a customer stops shopping, they will never notice. I asked customer service which warehouse my order is being shipped from and they said they didn't have that info. Yet last night I had a customer service rep tell me. How could she tell me if they don't have that information. The thing is, the rep that told me last night said I was shipped from the same warehouse as my daughter was. That tells me Amazon has marked my account to be shipped with a big delay in retaliation for me complaining. No other way to explain it considering I use to get my orders in two days and all of a sudden it stopped and add in the fact I am shipped from the same warehouse as my daughter and she can get the exact same order in two days. To hell with these big companies offering all these big discounts only to stop giving them and end up lying to their customers. Over the past 4 weeks I have been told no less than four times they were giving me a promo credit of $10 and was told that again tonight. My thing is when they give this to you it can never be seen by the customer. They say it will just show up on you next order that Amazon sells and ships. ell over the past four weeks I was never given credit from the promo money and when I asked the rep tonight what was my promo balance he said just the $10 he just put in there. That is why Amazon does not let you see the balance because most of the time it is really never given like they told you it would be and if for some reason they do they hope you forget about it and eventually they let it just disappear. Wake up folks, Amazon could care less about their customers. They will do what they have to, say what they have to just to get as much money as they can from you in exchange for as little as they can. I myself am talking to an attorney to see what I can do for Amazon refusing to live up to their end of the Prime agreement.

Honestly speaking, it has been a long time since I have received an order when promised. It's 1 - 3 days late, minimum. Every time, all customer service says is, "We're so sorry. Just give it a couple more days"It's exhausting

My recent delivery experience with Amazon was a complete disaster. I placed an order with guaranteed two-day shipping for a time-sensitive item, and I ended up waiting for more than a week for it to arrive. The delivery was delayed multiple times, and there was no clear communication from Amazon about the reasons for the delay.To make matters worse, the package finally arrived in terrible condition. It was crushed and looked like it had been mishandled during transit. The product inside was damaged, rendering it unusable. I contacted Amazon's customer support, but their response was slow and unapologetic.I expected better from a company as renowned as Amazon, but this experience has left me frustrated and disappointed. The lack of accountability and poor handling of my order has made me reconsider using Amazon for future purchases. They need to improve their delivery services and customer support if they want to maintain their reputation as a reliable online retailer.

Uday  supposedly in charge of deliveries rang and said he would send it back out and I would have it before 10 that night. Tracking said sorry they had missed original time slot but it was on its way and would arrive by 10 that night. I am disabled and don‚Äôt normally stay up that late but did it never arrived. My husband has just had a big operation and should be resting but had to keep a watch for the incompetent delivery drivers they employ. They asked for my phone number and then said she would give it to the driver. I told her she could not give my number to the driver. When I went on the tracking she had put my number on the delivery instructions. They just don‚Äôt care and tell lies all the time and don‚Äôt give a dam about their customers. Don‚Äôt order this is the worst company I have ever dealt with. Still no phone and nobody willing to speak to me.

I no longer trust Amazon. I have used them for years but really started depending on them when Covid started. A few problems here and there but was always treated fairly and things were made right. NOT THIS TIME! Be very cautious when returning an item. Amazon is not at all helpful if you return an item and it isn't scanned properly by UPS or Fedex. I returned 4 packages all to Amazon using their label. I handed them right to the UPS driver. That night 3 packages had been scanned and I was refunded. The 4th package did not show being scanned. It was A BIG box too! UPS said call Amazon, they had a contract and Amazon had to take care. Amazon told me to wait 14 business days then they would help refund me if package didn't show up. Today I received an email stating that Amazon would not be refunding me since its been too long and they have no proof that I sent the package! Was on hold for almost 2 hours, going from supervisor to supervisor..in the end I am left holding  the bag. They won't file a missing package report, UPS won't take responsibility for the item not scanned and lost. Amazon has insurance! WHY won't they file a missing package! I am out $$ and NOT happy about it. Filed a report with the BBB. Cancelled my membership and account with Amazon. A simple enough situation to fix but they won't even try. RIP OFF!!

Review Title: Amazon suspended my account without explanation
Review Text: Amazon locked my account without explanation. All I ever did was purchase some Kindle books using gift cards and my debit card. I lost access to my Kindle library. When I replied to their email and asked them to explain what exactly I did wrong, they said I "may have provided inaccurate information to Amazon or otherwise used the account in violation of the Amazon conditions of use policy". But I never did anything like that. And it's obvious that they aren't even sure I did. I'll never buy any digital content from Amazon again.

I just had the most horrible Amazon experience yet. My account was hacked into as I started seeing order confirmation emails arrive in my inbox for flags and pillowcases worth around 500 GBP. In a panic I logged into my account and started deleting orders and deleting my card information. While I was doing this, the scammer entered fake bank details with my name on them and continued to order hoping probably that the ,,invalid payment details" would prompt me to enter real ones. I successfully managed to change my password which seemed to stop any outside editing. The stores from where these orders were placed had just been created and had long word store names that were obviously fake. So Amazon, you have scammers creating fake shops, hacking into people's accounts and placing orders to their shops worth hundreds of pounds, do you not do any checking whatsoever on these before activating them? I had to fight a sea of bots before actually speaking to human beings, 1 who hung up on me, 2 passed me to other colleagues and another 2 that did not know how to help me. After I told them I was hacked I was told I would be contacted within 24h, after 1h I received a no-reply email stating the account seemed fine. I ended up having to do everything myself and when I tried to close down the account, an error message came up and I was unable to do so. Again I contacted customer service, was passed around from person to person until someone reluctantly said he raised a ticket to close the account and that it should be done within 5-7 days although I did not receive any email confirmation of this so I am again assuming you tell your employees to not help with these requests because you want to force people to stay on your platform and continue shopping. I am now watching my account like a hawk to make sure nothing else happens until it closes down, hopefully. This horrid experience plus constant missing packages for past real orders that were marked by drivers as ,,delivered", needless to say I will never use you again, I can't wait until the account is closed and I never have to deal with you again.
Now they advertise porn when you log in, people kissing ewtc. I don't want to see that, you show that to your mother not me, I just want to buy chinese plastic

Review Title: Amazon has extended it's refund time‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon has extended it's refund time because they fired so many workers. They now say it takes 60 days to process a return even though the site says up to 30 days. No business has longer than a 30 day return/refund policy. They will tell you to wait 60 days but then once it has been 60 days they will say it has been to long and they cannot process a refund. This way they can keep your money, the product, and it will be too late to dispute the purchase with your bank. Dispute your purchase with your bank 2 weeks after you return an item. That way you have time to dispute your purchase before Amazon can steal your money. They will also go as far as to block you from the cHat or call feature or close your account. If they close your account you can definitely open a dispute with your bank. The refund window used to be 14 days now it is 60 days which unreasonable long since they have no problem taking your money.

Review Title: Have to write this after a very poor experience.
Review Text: Have to write this review after very poor experience with their delivery. Ordered the item on July 11th. The product was supposed to arrive on the 13th and it didn't. It said there's issue during delivery so the item will be delayed.I waited 2 more days to contact Amazon through Chat. They told me the product is still in process of shipping. But I've had similar experience before and believe the product had been lost. But they tried to reassure me that it's not lost. And I cannot cancel and get a refund until the 18th.Today is the 18th, the product is indeed lost. I am frustrated that they made me wait so many days until I can cancel and re-order again. If they just told me sooner that the product is lost, then this wouldn't have happened.If the item is something not urgent, I wouldn't be so pissed. But it's a health product for my dog. I waited 5 extra days when they could have told me the item is lost. Anyway, I am pissed at how bad their delivery system is. The 3 people I chatted with all said they cannot find out the information. Just kept saying it's stuck in processing.If they have a better system, they would have been able to tell me the product is lost or it's no longer in process or being shipped. Very poor experience. Poor system and poor customer service as well.

Email sent to Amazon.comTo whom it may concernSince June 8 2023 I have been receiving unwanted packages through Amazon.comThe senders are unknown to meTo my knowledge I don't  even have an Amazon.com account, I do have one with Amazon.caAmazon.com and Amazon.ca potentially share the client databaseInitially the volume of unwanted packages scared me and I have contacted the RCMP ( Canadian police) about itI submitted a few unopened packages to them as evidenceThe RCMP returned the packages to me in a while saying there is not muchthey can do about this harassment but it's safe to open the packages and dispose of themAfter that I opened the packages  some had a return slip inside  and it turns out that they are packages sent through Amazon.comHere are some order ID numbersXxxxxYou could start investigating which account placed these ordersIf you notify the Police they can call the xxxx RCMP quoting file number xxxx to verify the veracity of this statement and ask for information if neededI will certainly not pay for return of any packagesI have called Amazon.com several  about this already: one time I was told it is a glitch which will be fixed, second time I talked with Leo, who explained he can do  nothing but will escalate the problemJeff ,a few days later , tried to gaslight me these are not Amazon ordersThe fourth time I called I was told some supplier is using my name and address to peddle their wares and has my address as a return addressThis seems to be a plausible explanation, I have since reached out to some senders whose ph # I found through an internet search by address and they seem to confirmThey allegedly take 7 business days to provide a response,  meanwhile I keep receiving an average of 4- 5 packages a day, of which I am refusing all I  canAmazon will not cancel the fraudulent account, I don't  have the password or the email address or the phone number for itI strongly advise people to cancel their Amazon.com account since security issues can create a world of problemsI have anxiety,stress, have spent hours on the phone to no avail, and who knows what the financial damage will be in the future. Might lose some weight cause I can't  eat because of stress LOLI am presently fighting UPS as well for customs duty bills they keep sending to me for these b COD packages they abandoned at my door without knockingAlso Amazon is letting me wait the usual time for their resolution.  I will have to call them for it because they are afraid to provide a written answer

Review Title: Don't buy Dyson on Amazon - THEY SELL FAKES
Review Text: Fake goods alert Bought a Dyson hairdryer on Amazon.It broke down so posted it back to Dyson for a repair under the warranty.Dyson have kept it and refused to send it back as it's counterfeit.Now Amazon want nothing to do with it because they claim it is now outside of the warranty period.  It might be now (because it's taken so long to get a sensible response), but when I sent it to Dyson it was within the warranty time period.Also - they say the order was fulfilled by a third party and so they can't help.  They don't seem to care that (1) Counterfeit Dyson goods can be dangerous (2) Many other Amazon customers will have been sold the same fake goods - they could find out who, and contact them, but would rather not bother (3) They don't seem to care that this is ongoing.  There is a "Buy again" option under what I bought from them first time.  Why on earth would I want to buy another fake counterfeit item.So beware of buying Dyson goods on Amazon.If they're fake, Amazon can't be bothered to help sort it out.  I've lost the money and don't have the goods any more either.  Amazon website sells counterfeit, fake Dyson goods.  And they don't care.

It's only $10 after all, not going to make or break me. God knows they don't need my money to stay in business. I gave up and reordered the item. If these mistakes continue with others it will start to take a toll. Unfortunately when they have all my money and so many others, it's hard to make an impression when they mess up once, twice, three or four times.

Absolutely NO customer protection at all.This is my -¬£500 sad experience with Amz.Earlier this month I have noticed a transaction for an expensive mobile phone and a smart band, in my account, but for some guy in US. At that time, there was a tracking number and I could see that that order didn't arrive yet. I have let Amz know immediately, and all they did was to reset my password and delete those orders from my account. Therefore, now I can't even see where those items were bought from, what merchant?!Anyway, I have asked Amz about the refund, since this is an unauthorized order, but they told me to request it from my card issuer. These guys, after looking into it, have also refused to refund me, probably because they considered to be an Amazon internal issue. I can only think of someone/somehow accessing my account and ordering something for themselves - and sadly there's no customer protection for that, as it was proven to me. Probably that's why the bank didn't process the refund and instead sent me back to Amazon.Numerous times I've contacted them and explain again and again, only to be assured that this will be processed the right team and only to get the same no-reply email advising me to contact my back and ask them for refund.So I got tired and eventually told Amazon to just send me those items, so I can recover some loss at least. After all, I've let them know as soon as possible, and those things haven't reached the hacker's address. Surely they have contacted the shipping company and told them to return the order, because the tracking number still shows undelivered.In a nut-shell: Amazon took my money somehow, and gave me nothing in return.

Review Title: I placed an order for two phones using‚Ä¶
Review Text: I placed an order for two phones using a UK address and phone number as I just relocated. Paid using my Revolut account. The items were meant to be shipped next day when one phone was delivered the delivery needed an OTP code which I didn't have on checking I found that my account has been closed for ' misuse' therefore couldn't log in to retrieve any messages on the account. On third delivery attempt the delivery man suggested that he would return the item under ' customer no longer needs the item'. Second phone was delivered but in very bad condition not worth the amount I paid at all had scratches all over. I have tried contacting Amazon for the past week with proof of payment and asking them to just return the one phone and process a refund on both phones. On all occasions have had to call and only thing I get is 'sorry we will escalate and you'll get a response in 24hours" not once have I received any response from them only to get an email from Amazon to tell me that after much consideration the account will remain closed and they won't be responding to my emails. This is so unfair as I used money to purchase which they received surely am entitled to my refund if they will not be dealing with my account anymore. Such a dissapointing experience with Amazon. Customer service is worse as I was told on one occasion they don't care if escalate.

Review Title: I have been a customer with Amazon‚Ä¶
Review Text: I have been a customer with Amazon since 2000. With inflation so high, haven't purchased from them for a few months.I got a new phone and went to log in.But I'm not allowed to log in because I now have a security alert just because it has been about 4 or 5 months since I last purchased from them.Still same email, same address.I was required to call them.They said I had to answer some security questions. Confirming my email and address not enough. Nor would they send a confirmation code to my email. Had to be security questions and get them all correct to be allowed to get back into my account.In 23 years never had to do this before.I said okay. Then after being put on hold, person came back that i haven't ordered enough stuff from Amazon lately, so she couldn't get enough security questions. 23 years of purchases and she can't get enough purchases questions!What's the point of security questions based on recent purchases when the reason for the security questions is because I haven't purchased lately. Absurd!So I'm not allowed back into my account.They want me to lose all my history of 23 years of purchases, shopping cart, wish lists. And start all over.They don't care.I haven't used Walmart in about the same amount of time but no problem getting into my account on my new phone.Bye bye foolish Amazon.Better to buy locally anyway.

Review Title: THE WORST Customer Service Of All Time
Review Text: The company I work for sell on Amazon as well as other platforms. The Amazon platform itself is incredibly faulted. As a buyer it all looks good and fine, easy to use. But when you run a company on there you realise just how awful it is. But that's just the Amazon functionality. Regarding the customer service itself? I'll give an example. We had a piece of negative feedback, it was meant for another seller as it was regarding an item we did not sell, I thought that's okay, these things happen, easy fix for Amazon just 2 seconds to click and remove it. Wrong. Weeks of back and forth via email and chat saying "go through feedback manager", which I did originally, it was declined, I reopened the case, and it was closed permanently saying they won't remove it. After weeks I finally spoke to someone on the phone who told me that no-one at all has the power to remove the feedback and I need to leave a public reply! (Which I already did might I add. You get robotic responses, no way humans are looking at these and responding, otherwise they have 1 brain cell between them. This is just one example, there are many where you get moronic, repeated responses that are sometimes nothing to do with what you have reported.Avoid them at all costs, serious sham of a company and appalling customer service and seller support.

Review Title: Worst customer service I've ever received

I just want an email address or a form to complete so I can submit a complaint, every company, especially one as large as Amazon should have a dedicated complaints procedure.

Review Title: Dear Amazon,sale used items for new items
Review Text: Dear Amazon,I am writing to you today to express my concern about the recent trend of selling products as new on Amazon when they are actually used and open. I have personally experienced this issue on several occasions, and I am sure that many other customers have as well.In my most recent experience,I returns multiple items from Amazon. When I received my order package, were clearly used or open or broken. The packaging was open, and the product themselves were dirty and had scratches and broken on them. I was very disappointed, as I had expected to receive a brand new product if any other business would do that would be held responsible but amazon is above the lawThey are aloud to do falls advertisements I contacted Amazon customer service about this issue, and they were very helpful. They issued me a refund for the headphones, and they also told me that they would investigate the seller. However, I am concerned that this issue is not being taken seriously enough.I believe that it is unfair to sell products as new when they are actually used. This is especially true when the products are sold at a premium price. Customers who purchase these products are expecting to receive a brand new product, and they should not be misled.I urge Amazon to take this issue seriously and to take steps to prevent it from happening in the future. I believe that Amazon should require sellers to provide clear and accurate information about the condition of their products. Additionally, Amazon should have a system in place to investigate complaints about sellers who are selling used products as new.I appreciate your time and consideration. I hope that you will take my concerns seriously and that you will take steps to address this issue.Sincerely,Martin raby

DIFFERENT AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE GUYS, COMPLETELY DIFFERENT SETS OF INSTRUCTION!!!Normally, Amazon is alright for me. I don‚Äôt have to pay for shipping when I want to return any products I buy from there. Also, returning is normally quite easy and only takes at the very least 15-20 mins. I end up getting a full refund a few days after sending the products.However, when I recently tried to return a defective product, I was told that I HAD to pay for SHIPPING to return. Fortunately, they said I would get a refund for that as well. I went to the nearest local mail service point. They told me they could not accept it as it contained batteries.I contacted Amazon and a representative told me that I had to return it by UPS and that I couldn‚Äôt do so by any other way, even though I had used only the local mail service and DHL to return Amazon products in the past. Like I had mentioned earlier, I had to pay for shipping. I had no idea how much shipping would be but I didn‚Äôt really care. The closest UPS store is pretty far from where I live unlike the local mail courier and DHL so imagine my disappointment when I‚Äôm told that I needed a tracking number. I already had the other papers like the shipping labels which I had always used to return Amazon products and nothing else. In addition, that Amazon representative told me that all that I had was all I needed..I contact Amazon again and it takes 20-30 mins this time to get a response. Again, another Amazon representative told me that I COULD return by DHL. So I went to a DHL store.The guy at the DHL store told me I needed a label if I wanted to ship for free(I always received that whenever I wanted to return an Amazon product and I could return for free) but that was the one thing I did not get from Amazon for the first time. An Amazon sales rep did say that I would have to pay for shipping but I wasn‚Äôt told how much it would be. The DHL guy told me it would cost TWICE as much as the cost I had paid for the product. That would mean that I would have to pay for absolutely nothing but stress and travelling and some transport costs..I contacted Amazon for the last time. A different sales rep told me that she felt sorry for all the trouble I had gone through just for this and told me that I no longer had to return the product and I would still get a refund.Will see if I actually get a refund like last time or not..If I do, I‚Äôll change this to 2 stars instead.

Review Title: I wish Amazon would value customer feedback
Review Text: I was a little disappointed with Amazon's customer service and Prime member experience. I spent a lot of time explaining the problem to multiple people during communication with them and had a hard time getting in touch with the manager. The manager's responses were unrelated to the issue most of the time, leaving me confused. In addition, I found it difficult to locate the UK team. the Prime membership service was not as practical for me and I had to wait 7-9 business days for each return to recover the money, while the payment was instant. Delivery was also often unreliable, with packages sometimes lost or delayed.I wish Amazon would value customer feedback, improve their customer service, and provide more efficient and accurate solutions. Also, I hope they can optimize the Prime membership service process to ensure that the refund process is faster and smoother. This will improve the quality of the overall shopping experience and avoid unnecessary hassles and disappointments.

The untrained folks thought I was stupid, I had my bank on the phone with them at the same time and informed them this was fraud cause I did not authorize another charge. I asked for the funds to be returned to my account immediately, they refused then I asked for them to cancel the candles as well Miguel he stated he was the highest manager at Amazon said NO we can't do that either. I requested for corporate and going to report them if I don't get my funds back next move court.

Review Title: Intimidating message from Amazon with no reason
Review Text: I have been a customer of Amazon for at least five years if not more. I bought dozens of items from these gentlemen for a few thousand euros in value. On March 3, 2023, I bought an inexpensive screwdriver drill (Amazon order number # 402-7269180-7579518) worth 54.99 euros (cheap). After a few days of use, one of the two rechargeable batteries stopped working. After having obtained the guarantee in chat from an Amazon operator that I could return an already used item, I requested and obtained the return, sending the item on June 6, 2023, even if the item only reached Amazon on June 19. On June 23 I receive the following email from Amazon:"Good morning,We are contacting you to inform you that we have processed your recent return of the article TEENO Cordless Screwdriver 21V, 2 Speed ‚Äã‚ÄãCordless Drill, 2 Lithium Batteries 1.5Ah, Fast Charge in 1 Hour, 20 Accessories Included (Drill an in the order n. 402-7269180-7579518.The item was returned in a condition that does not comply with our return policies. On this occasion, we have processed a refund for the order. However, if your returns continue to violate our policies, we may not issue further refunds or we may apply returns condition fees.To review our return policies, please see the About Our Returns Policy page:We will inform you if similar cases occur in the future.Account SpecialistAmazon. it"Aside from the semi-intimidating tone of the email, the email came to me with no reason why my returned item violated Amazon policies. The signature of whoever wrote the message is also missing and it doesn't seem correct to me. Perhaps it would be too much to ask for two specific words in the message?! And maybe even accompanying photos?! Why Amazon allows certain tones with its customers?! And why doesn't he document his motivations?Years and years of even very expensive purchases and now they send me threatening messages! What a disappointment...

SO FAR EXCELLENT BUT I CAN NEVER JUSTIFY SIMPLE INCONVENIENCES ON THE WEBSITE AND THE TIME-CONSUMING FEATURE OF THEIR WEBSITE. HENCE, A SIMPLE ACTIVITY OF ORDERING SOMETHING SMALL ENDS UP TAKING FIVE MINUTES THROUGH ALL THE PROCESSES OF ADDING, CHOOSING ADDRESS, SPEED, ETC.!UNBELIEVABLY FOOLISH IN TODAY'S AGE OF TECHNOLOGY. ALSO, CONTACTING THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE STAFF ALSO TAKES LOT OF PRECIOUS TIME WHICH IS ALSO UNBELIEVABLY FOOLISH IN TODAY'S AGE OF TECHNOLOGY. :(

Review Title: AMAZON MADE ME PURCHASE A PRODUCT SAYIN ID HAVE THE REFUND AND IS NOW REFUSING TO DO SO
Review Text: AMAZON UK I bought an Alexa and asked for it to be delivered to my place. If I wasnt at home it should be delivered to my next-door neighbour. However, the product was delivered to my door and got lost. I informed Amazon and they locked the device. Several months later, another neighbor from down the road told me he had my parcel. Immediately I contacted Amazon as I now had a device without any purpose as it was locked. Amazon couldnt activate the device anymore. But the attendant instructed me to purchase another one (Full price - and I'd purchased it for half price) and I'd get the full refund on it as soon as it was delivered. I got an email informing me that this would be the procedure. Therefore I purchased it and got it delivered to my friend's house as I am not even living in the UK anymore - he'd give it to me when we meet again. As soon as it was delivered I contacted Amazon asking for the refund. For SEVERAL times amazon said that it was being processed, and then asked me to now contact my bank to understand what was the issue. Review Title: Amazon.....my god can you not get‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon.....my god can you not get anything right!?! I've spent so much money with them over the years and customer services have deteriorated as well as the telecoms system and site issues it is almost unusable!! I've got some terrible products to return, they are just not fit for purpose which had great reviews but just don't perform, I think this is probably because they pay people or give people incentives for reviews, so please look into products first before buying them. I didn't used to worry to much as when you got a bad product from Amazon you could return it which is why I've spent a fortune with them but just recently you can't get through to anybody or return anything. In fact for the last three weeks I've wasted days on the phone just to get cut off or more frustratingly the code errors, people reusing to help of transfer you to someone who might understand English and been in a job for more than a week. When your request callback it doesn't happen, then when you do get through to somebody they don't know what they're talking about because I've only been there for few days and every time they try and transfer to a manager they refuse 99% of the time, hang up or if they do pass you on to somebody you just get cut off. Even if you tell them that you've had hours of wasted time and spent half a day on the phone and been cut off umpteen times so please take my phone number down so you can call me back I get cut off but it doesn't happen. I've been waiting for a return to be picked up and it hasn't happened, this is now taken well over a week and there doesn't seem to be any progress with it. If that they can't even arrange for the return, they just say they've arrange for a callback and again that never happens... I've had so much time wasted hopeless products and terrible terrible customer service and terrible comms. They really do need to get their act together! Even if you click Amazon assistant from the Amazon site, you get a picture of a bloody dog which is no help at all so that link doesn't work. As well as the telephone line is not working with the codes that you have to put in getting refused and then customer services not know what to do. It's a complete joke and gone to the dogs. I've had days wasted and it's very stressful. I will try and shop anywhere else now apart from Amazon and I spent a lot of money with Amazon but I'm not going to have my stress levels are through the roof and my time wasted any further. Amazon get your act together your not performing at all, the only thing I now expect from you is bad products, a terrible website, customers services and coms that are the worst I've ever came across!! HOPELESS!!!!

Review Title: I had been a long time customer of‚Ä¶
Review Text: I had been a long time customer of Amazon Prime.  I discontinued my membership about 4 months ago because very inconsistent shipping and policies to rectify the situation.  I was given a 30 fay free trial to try it once again, which I did.  I gave them a chance and ordered dog food for my puppy.  It said it would be delivered by Friday/Saturday, as I ordered it on Tuesday.  They charged my card which I only use a pre-paid card with them and only add enough to pay for the order in the event that what happened happens.  They charged the card successfully on the date the order was placed, but it did not ship.  They then attempted to make 3 more attempts at taking the same charged amount again all three times where of course, it was not available.  When I contacted customer service, they could only say they had not charged my card where I was looking at the charge which was today on 6.18.2023 still pending and will not be removed until they finalize a charge they claim they never made.  And the CS rep, had the audacity to tell me "don't worry, we are not trying to keep your money."  I will not be using them at all. They have become CONSISTENTLY INCONSISTENT and it is unacceptable.  Very few packages actually come overnight anymore, which was the main attraction for Prime in the beginning.  All you get is a message stating your delivery is going to be delayed, if they even plan to send it.

14 june, Ordered a product this morning because it said it would be delivered this evening, went to Amazon to check on delivery, got the"oops your delivery is going to be late at 830 pm, and immediately got another message saying  "carrier picked up package" the carrier message was dated 15 June, (tomorrow)  The point of this is the receipt of the second message does not give you the opportunity to cancel of the pkg if you absolutely need it today. which I do., Not sure if it's Amazon or a contracted Carrier pulling this little scam , but putting both messages in at the same time is basically a shady way to not let you cancel an order, even though it says you can right in the oops it's going to be late message. Bottom line is the carrier picked up the  package and said oops, we can't deliver until tomorrow. So the Carrier gets paid and the consumer has to jump through hoops with amazon to try to get it staightened out. of course Amazon's answer is "sorry it's already shipped nothing we can do" but you can call us back tomorrow, after it has been delivered, after I am out of town.
Great well known company for their well known services

Review Title: First of please understand one thing
Review Text: First of please understand one thing, I am not looking for someone to reach out and feed my continued lies such as what I am experiencing during Amazon Chat or phone calls.  I am hoping this will explain to Amazon that the only reason why they are as big as they are is their customer base. And we deserve better!I have been an Amazon Prime member for very many years. For most of that time, I have been very happy which is why I kept the membership. However, as of recent every purchase/order I place, especially those of the next day/one day variety, have not made it within the time frame posted on their product page. Only options for me are to wait and deal with it or request a refund. Which then requires me to take it to a facility to execute the return before I receive my credit or refund.During a recent interaction, I was told by the rep to visit my neighbors to see if the package was delivered to their home in error. Did I mention it was 9 PM?Part of the benefit of having the Prime account is provides members expedited shipping. If this has changed, why aren‚Äôt we being told and why do they continue to post on their website, next day or 1 day shipping?If they can‚Äôt hold up their end of the bargain, why should I?  At this point with everyone starting to set up online direct to consumer options, is Amazon the only place to shop?  Should I terminate my relationship with and cancel my Prime?

Review Title: Amazon is not helpful when it comes to‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon is not helpful when it comes to answering your questions. As author, they can be the worst to deal with. You ask them the same question three or more times and they copy and paste the answer before giving you more information. They give you 5 days to prove you own copyright over your own books especially those published on another website or you use public domain content. When using public domain, they will request you for a signed document to prove you have exclusive rights to use the materials freely. It took a whole day to change one book's content because of this requirement from them. Everything I gave them was not accepted as proof. The issue is there is no way to prove a public domain content version of the World English Bible to them. All the sites that I found says it is public domain. If there was a better place to publish with all their benefits, I would choose that one over them. I just like that I can still get royalties when people read my ebooks and they have ads to advertise your books. I can distribute globally and people buy my books there more than other platforms. Otherwise, I don't like them. They are troublesome to work with. I heard others complain about their author experience with them. They won't pay you for royalties you should have gained if the book page reads doesn't count them. You lose those royalties. They don't know how to do their job well or to be more considerate for the author's needs.

Review Title: If you want items quickly - shop elsewhere!
Review Text: For the second time in as many weeks, I have cancelled an order after having issues with "Amazon Logistics", Amazon's in-house 'courier' who were supposed to be delivering both the items in question. They don't give you a delivery window until you've already wasted half a day sitting indoors waiting for your item, and then they announce that they'll be delivering at a time when you're out of the house for something you can't cancel. I have my preferences set to ask that items be left with two specific neighbours if I am not at home, but the Amazon driver is always too lazy to do this, preferring instead to claim that they had difficulty delivering my item and that they will try again "probably the next working day". Sorry, but "probably" doesn't cut it when I need supplies for my craft business!

Review Title: One time pass code is a failure delivery system
Review Text: I ordered 6 items to be delivered with my prime membership on the next day delivery. I was sent 3 separate emails with one time pass codes on for my items, i didn't realise the one time pass code would be the same for ALL the items. The driver arrived and gave me Amazon boxes and asked for my one time pass code, which i gave to him. When i opened them i realised there was one item missing. Within 4 minutes of the driver delivering my goods I requested a call back from Amazon customer support stating the driver didn't deliver one of my items. The lady told me it was on a different courier and it would arrive later so not to worry. I waited an hour and looked on the app, noticing it said delivered with said item. At this point i realised that all the goods had the same one time pass code, even though there was 5 different parcels total. I called Amazon again and was asked to wait 3 days as the driver might bring it back, so I did. When i called after 3 days explaining everything I was told "sorry, it's saying delivered. You can't have a refund." The item in question was ¬£190 which I have lost. The customer service is shocking from a huge company like Amazon. I have been a long time prime member and have cancelled my account due to this. I will not be giving them another penny of my money after this shocking service. I would advise to look elsewhere for goods as at least you will receive them.

Review Title: This company (Olsen Store GMBH) is as‚Ä¶
Review Text: This company (Olsen Store GMBH) is as unscrupulous as you can possibly get. first they postponed delivery, then they started delivery with a T&T number which we have been able to follow and the item was ready for delivery today, June 9. then on the same day we received a message from Amazon that the package would not be delivered and that there would be a new date.How on earth can you not send a package when you provide the T&T number to the customer and it has been on the way, it smells far away of SCAM.This company should in no way be allowed to sell their product on Amazon.

There's plenty to like about Amazon when it works. They sell more or less everything, and lots of it can be with you by tomorrow. But, for a company that is declaring profits bigger than some national budgets, they could shave just a little off that to provide actual customer service, for those occasions when it doesn't simply go right. There simply is no way to get hold of them. If you try to begin a complaint, or ask a question, the site will guide you through a million useless questions, in the assumption that you can only have a problem that they have foreseen, and that you can be guided to an automated procedure. If you really persist, this experience will become circular, as you glimpse buttons that you think will help, but actually take you back to an earlier point in the process. Eventually, you may spot the very well hidden 'contact us' button that appears if you go round three times, and insist each time that your problem isn't listed. Sadly this contact is a chat that is -without wanting to offend those who man cheap call centres - far less intelligent than a bot. Today I had the issue that a number of Kindle books have gone from my library. When you're removing them from a device, one button says, "remove download" whilst another says, "delete," and the latter actually removes the book clean out of your library on the Amazon server. No idea why this would even be a possiblity, let alone so easy to do, but someone in our family managed to wipe a massive chunk of our library whilst emptying a Kindle. It took me about 10 attempts to explain to the guy on the other end that this is even possible - after each attempt he sent me a link to my library, insisting that the books must be there if I bought them. Eventually he pretended the chat had been quiet for too long (5 seconds) and passed it off to someone whose English and knowledge of Amazon was even worse. After reviewing the whole thing again with him, and receiving the same patronisation, he assured me there was nothing that can be done. I told him this isn't correct because I know people who have done it, by virtue of getting a slightly better assistant. Then I provided him with the order number for one of the books that is missing, so he could see that there is still a receipt in my order history, but that the book no longer appears in my library. At this point he told me that Amazon only archive invoices for a year or so, so he wouldn't be able to see a record of the order. I explained that I was looking at the record of the order, by logging into my Amazon account, which resides on their servers, so this was clearly a lie. At that point he simply closed the chat window. Normally I wouldn't go to the trouble of venting somewhere about this, but it's now about the tenth such experience I've had. This one is arguably partly my fault (although there's really no reason to have an option to completely remove books from your library, and certainly not to make it so easily done), but usually it's a complete screw up on their part, and you're still dealing with someone who can just hang up if they don't feel like helping.

Review Title: Amazon is selling fake and counterfeit beauty products
Review Text: Amazon is selling fake and counterfeit products on its website and will not take responsibility for it. I bought a Jan Marini Research cleanser on Amazon. When I opened it, the seal was broken. The cleanser was watering and ineffective. There was no expiration date on the bottle. I immediately bought a bottle of the same cleanser from Jan Marini Research directly and the difference was unbelievable. The fake Amazon cleanser was almost colorless and watery, while the authentic cleanser was green and thick. The authentic cleanser also had a seal and an expiration date. When I contacted Amazon, they would take no responsibility and they recommended I contacted the fake manufacturer/distributor. Are they serious? How is this legal? Aren't there laws that prevent this from happening? Why is Amazon allowed to violate laws that would have other retailer fined or in jail?

New Amazon Forestick not betterThe new model has preloaded Amazon apps.They eat up a lot of the memory. When I called Amazon to have them uninstall. They said preloads are not removal and just like Google and Samsung they chose to preload their software and thats that. The problem is that because they consume a lot of memory they prevent other apps from updating.  When you try to update Netflix or Max,. It tells you you need to manage your apps because you're out of space. I sometimes use a VPN to watch netlix content from Other countries, no longer on the new firestick. My VPN freezes and because i cant update , no VPN. There was almost 250mgs freed just with clearing the cache on the Amazon apps, but still not enough to update apps.  Amazon's solution is buy the expansion for memory.  So essentially they created a problem that requires you to buy, yet another product to fix the problem. But there is no way to keep the preload Amazon apps from also consuming the additional memory.  A little shady, but what you gonna do I guess.  Hppefully a comperitor will emerge that can capitalize on this crappy business practice. Kind of like Sony loosing their foothold on portable music devaces that allowed Apple to come in and dominate that field.  I definitely regret trading in my old firestick for $7.  Amazon, if you are going to flood the limited memory capacity for your apps, then increase the capacity front 5 gig to accommodate your desire to put apps on there that people don't want.  Other than That it's good?

Review Text: Worst website on the internet for refunds. Bought a large shelf labeled as engineered wood as an amazon pick. And it was just a damaged chipboard flatpack, and getting a refund is impossible as the return label stated that I carry the large item to the next county without a car to return it. I'll stick to eBay and paypal like I always have for the best security in future. Absolute shambles

If I could give Amazon Customer Service zero stars then I would.I called this morning to notify them of my father's death on 6 June 2023.No compassion, no offer of condolence. All she said was as the account holder could not give authority to speak to me, she would need to send a form to be completed.Absolute joke!!!

Review Title: I have been waiting over 4 Months for‚Ä¶
Review Text: I have been waiting over 4 Months for an item.No help at all from anybody. Just get the same oldOh! we're sorry for the inconvenience. No let's see why your package hasn't shipped yet. Worst Company ever.

Review Title: Bought an Amazon Dot just over a year‚Ä¶
Review Text: Bought an Amazon Dot just over a year ago.  I have been on chat line 3 times to try to resolve the problem of her speaking quietly, sporadically, to no avail.  Rang this mornng to request replacement pointing out I have a broken hip and cannot take the packet to anywhere.  To be fair, there was the option to have the packet collected but I would have to ring PO (they do not take Amazon returns and have no dedicated phone number and unlikely they have staff as it is a corner shop, who could collect), or Hermes.  Pointed out Hermes would not respond and could Amazon arrange collection from my home for me?  No.  They would reimburse any cost I incurred.    Decided to put the devise in the bin and not bother any longer as unreliable and Amazon do not seem to realise their suggestion about method of collection will not work and I ought not to have to go through this further inconvenience.

Review Title: I wish I could rate zero to Amazon
Review Text: I wish I could rate zero to Amazon. I received a wrong item and never got a refund of the item when I returned it, and the delivery agent took another item as well along which I didn't return. Moreover customer support executives are not able to help me out with this saying they have not received the item mentioned on the app. It's the matter of 5 thousand and they are just taking it as nothing happened, they can just simply do some investigation against the delivery agent, I've CCTV cameras installed in my house, I can even share the footage as well as audio clips of the conversation. It never never happened with me since I started using the site, now Amazon not helping neither trusting their customers. How ridiculously the service is declining. Disgusting, shameful.

DON'T THROW PARCEL OVER GATE! I'm sure there are several Amazon delivery vans in the area, as most of our parcels are delivered, as they should be, to the door. That said, today we found a parcel by our gate at the bottom of the drive for anyone to take. This is not the first time, and it's unacceptable.

Purchase was out for delivery.Then get a note while tracking it, that it was undeliverable and sent back and refund will be in 48 hours.This is the second time this has happened coming through their Bountiful, Utah service center.Every time it comes through them I don't receive product.

In the last 12-24 months, I‚Äôve seen a steady decline in on time deliveries and considerably worse customer service. While I can appreciate Amazon is focused on their AWS/Ad services business, continued disregard for what made them the juggernaut they are will only encourage me and others to use the competition. I.e. Walmart etc. nearly half of my orders have been delayed and it‚Äôs extremely frustrating. Don‚Äôt make promises on two day delivery that you can‚Äôt keep. Your prime program is deteriorating considerably.

Hello one thing I hate about Amazon delivery people they cannot follow instruction's you tell them to knock on the door real hard they don't so I got ring so I can see them coming on my phone these's Amazon people go out of their way by any means necessary to make sure not to go in front of ring camera so I can't hear motion or hear the ring sound or the camera lighting up on my phone so I can see them it's big difference between living in an apartment complex and house with the porch it's more easier for someone to walk by your door and just pick the package up if you're not standing in front of the ring camera anyone can just slide the package to the side ü§¨üëéüëéüëéüëéüëé
