I had to speak with customer support to change the email address and phone number on my account as it was set up with his information and he is now deceased. Not a single representative could help me, I just kept getting put on hold and transferred to another agent. Each time I was transferred they would greet me by my deceased husband's name and I would have to explain the situation  all over again. Twice my phone call was disconnected. I phoned in 4 separate times to get assistance. I thought I was getting the issue resolved after the first phone call but after waiting a few days and no changes/updates, I tried phoning in to follow up to find out that nothing was started. This is not the first time I have had issues with customer support but it was the final straw for me. I will 100% be reporting my issues in more detail to the BBB. This is simply unacceptable.

Review Title: Twice I've had a problem now with‚Ä¶
Review Text: Twice I've had a problem now with Amazon once where goods ordered were not what I ordered and they wouldn't offer a refund and now I've noticed lots of Chinese companies not advertising as Chinese offering reasonable delivery dates only to not be achieved by a big gap. My latest one is now saying it could take 40 days despite saying in would be delivers 3 days ago when tried to claim a refund Amazon said it's not eligible until the estimated delivery date has passed even although it has passed. Amazon used to be safe on stuff like this but definitely a big change in protecting customers now compared to a few years back

Review Title: Amazon missed the delivery then won't‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon missed the delivery then won't refund me for my order. Customer service is an absolute joke

I have been with Amazon over 20 years and the service was good but is now almost non existent. As a prime member I have tolerated parcel left on my step although I am home and the door bell works, to items dropped between the hedge and the bins although I am home. I ordered an expensive item with next day prime delivery which didn't arrive and strangely the tracking on the item disappeared on the same day. Contacted customer service who were not that helpful as I wanted to know what went wrong as is my right to. I just got walls and obstacles with no straight answers. I found an email address to register my complaint and the fact that this cost me paying for the item a second time as well as having to book the carpenter for an extra day at a cost of ¬£200.00. their response was to say that I should have waited for the item to arrive before using the carpenter's services and offering me a five pound voucher. As a provider of a service which is paid for monthly by me that delivery date is in effect a contract to deliver and therefore their responsibility. I am appalled by their blatant contempt of their customers but not actually surprised. I did however highlight to them that as crap as AliExpress is they now offer a better customer service. Seriously rethinking of using their service going forward. There is only so far you can push people

Review Title: Brilliant delivery service Just want to praise Amazon I ordered a‚Ä¶
Review Text: Just want to praise Amazon I ordered a parcel on Sunday 5th June and it arrived next day via standard delivery within the time slot 12.15 to 1.15 arrived at 12. 13Best place for online shopping and delivery 5 star but I think it deserves 10/10 Can't beat amazon for speed of delivery.
Amazon has earned my trust across hundreds of orders over many years. When something went wrong, they have always refunded my money, no questions asked. I'm grateful for the hassle-free experience!

Review Title: Horrible turn around time on returns.
Review Text: Horrible turn around time on returns, credits.They exceed their own estimate by WEEKS. I had to file a Bank credit card dispute for not having received a credit of $390.

Review Title: They do nothing to prevent scams
Review Text: They have no concern for customers being scammed.  I've been let down repeatedly by their customer service in the past, but today takes the cake.  I reported a clear scam and they literally did not care, the first seller gave me completely irrelevant information and marked my issue as resolved and the second had no concern for taking the listing down, she just claimed that the seller "probably hadn't updated it".  If you think this company cares about you at all, they do not.  And for the love of god do not order from Werycos, they will send a tracking number, never ship the package, claim it got lost, tell you the item is out of stock, meanwhile they still have it listed online.

Review Title: BOYCOTT and Cancel Amazon Prime Memberships
Review Text: The worst customer service in the industry. Steven, Franz, and LeiLei provided a poor customer experience with a lack of resolution skills. Specifically, Steven, the SUPERVISOR, provided even worse customer service than the agent's and HUNG UP the phone call on me. Overall, Amazon supplies  heavily overpriced items, poor customer service, and the delivery execution is inconsistent. Amazon does not stand behind their warranty products... i.e. garden power tools.  I purchased (3) different garden tools over a period of time and all (3) are junk!!  Amazon is fine for an ink cartridge or bottle of supplements but don't rely on them for major purchases.  I have boycotted Amazon for the past 2 months (after spending $2,000 in the first quarter) and I don't miss them. Worst company ever, said delivered a package was empty nothing in it. Second time this has happened. Refuse to refund my money. Will never ever use Amazon again. They are Horrible!! Treat your customers better, or soon you wont have any!!

Amazon is a sneaky cheat!  I have been returning some items and Amazon states I get a refund BUT that is not what is happening, it is going to CREDIT towards future purchases.  This IS NOT a refund.  So, I am forced to still pay the credit card PLUS interest and the return is credited to future purchases.  This is false advertising and blatant misrepresentation.  Credit is NOT a refund.  If you read the return options, Amazon states three return options:  1. Replace with the exact same item 2) Refund to your Amazon account balance and 3) in a lighter color so you think it is a link - is Refund to your AmazonPLCC ending in XXXX.  You have to choose option 3 or it will not go back as a refund.  Option 2) will give you credits for future purchases, even though it states 'refund' you do NOT get a refund!!! If you used your Amazon/Synchrony credit card, you do NOT have an Amazon Account Balance!!!!  You have a Credit Card Balance!  AND!!! If you choose a drop off at Kohl's to 'keep more trucks off the road' it automatically gives you a credit and NOT a refund (per customer service)!!  You have to choose UPS even though that is not as convenient! Misdirection, misrepresentation and total lies.  No one in their right mind would buy items they can't get a refund for!!  Everyone should be aware of this sneaky scam by Amazon!

Review Title: Amazon Warehouse does not check the returned items they sell  you
Review Text: During the winter I planned to redo my boat's sound system.  Saw Amazon had some Used but Like New speakers for $50.00 less than brand new ones.  Ordered them, they arrived.  I opened the box and saw the speaker grills and some speakers inside. Figured I was good.  Recently went to install them only to find no directions, no mounting hardware, no wires, missing one set of the speaker grills AND the speakers were some old used ones, not the even the model I ordered.  And one of those is broken.  I really thought Amazon was supposed to check these over before listing them as Used but Like New.  Talked to Customer Service and was basically told to take it up with the Seller as it was there problem.  I told her if she checks the order, Amazon was the seller.  She responded "then there is nothing I can do for you."  End of discussion.

Drivers do not follow instructions. There is no evidence of where the parcel actually was handed to when stated to be "handed to resident". Customer service response is woeful. Utter decline in delivery and backed up with even worse attitude and capability at the customer service end.

I placed an order for a dress. Upon receiving it,  I discovered I received a completely different item than what I ordered. I then spoke to an associate who said it could not be exchanged but I could place a new order with express shipping. Then the price difference of express shipping and sale (the item was on sale when I bought it) would also be refunded. Logical since this was not my fault nor responsibility. I made a copy of the chat where they promised this. After multiple weeks and I think 7 times contacting them about this whole order, I still haven‚Äôt received the price difference back!! Multiple things went wrong with the order and I contacted them three times about not receiving the price difference back. Two of the three times the associate again promised the refund was being processed and I should receive it within 3-5 days. Now today another associate (Asad) said they can only offer store credit!!!! So first of all: three associates promised a refund in money of the price difference. Where the first even emphasized to use express shipping since the whole thing was not my fault. 2. The mistake of receiving a completely different item should not affect the customer anymore than it already has 3. The amazon associates are completely incompetent since they cannot even read the chats properly and you have to explain the situation again and again4. I expect my money back and not some store credit which I dont use, especially not now. It‚Äôs common sense that when a store (independent sellers or not) makes a mistake, they fix it and the customer should not have to suffer or pay extra for it. Moreover, the response of the last associate was absolutely ridiculous.Be warned if you order at Amazon!

Review Text: I pay an Amazon prime subscription of ¬£8.99 each month,which entitles me to receive one day delivery on purchase of most products,but a few times now,I have received tracking for an item for that day,then later through the day get an update to say it will be delivered one or two days later,so if I need the item on that day promised,there is no option to cancel the order,I have to wait for it to turn up late and mess about returning the item and wait for Amazon to refund my payment,so if I'm paying for one day delivery on items,I think there should be some kind of compensation if the order is not fulfilled on the day promised.

Review Title: Drivers can‚Äôt ever find address they‚Äôve delivered to several times before!
Review Text: It‚Äôs so wonderful that your drivers come up to the house to deliver unimportant items but anytime I order something that is important for the farm you claim you can‚Äôt find the address. Thankfully, my goat‚Äôs eye is recovering and I have half a tube of terramycin left but this item is about to be taken off the counter very soon and farmers won‚Äôt have a choice but to get any and all antibiotics RX. It‚Äôs stressful enough that we can‚Äôt provide our animals with the proper care they need when the vet is unavailable and now we have to worry about your incompetent drivers not being able to deliver our packages during the very limited time we can still get antibiotics over the counter. There is a long gravel driveway, a big red barn, a house, and even a marker at the end of the driveway letting y‚Äôall know you‚Äôre at the right address. There is no way in heck your driver missed us, especially when we‚Äôve had packages delivered to the house! We were home at the time this ‚Äúattempt‚Äù was made and you people can‚Äôt even call? You just freaking leave? If you could find our address several times before, don‚Äôt even sit there and try to tell me you can‚Äôt find it now. This is a very important item. Get it together, Amazon!

Review Title: Would have selected no stars but ‚Ä¶
Review Text: Would have selected no stars but it wouldn‚Äôt let me. Terrible terrible service. I‚Äôm a prime customer and frequent buyer. Usually have deliveries to my home but needed something urgently for my dog and wanted to make sure I didn‚Äôt miss the delivery. Selected the closest Amazon locker to my home address. Received notifications it was delivered while I was out and felt thankful as would have missed it. Drove to locker location as soon as I could but there was no lockers. Just a big space and marks on the floor/wall as evidence that lockers were there once but not anymore. Security staff at the location confirmed that it didn‚Äôt exist anymore.  Trouble is tracking said it was delivered and I had been sent a barcode and draw number for it!!! Customer services couldn‚Äôt have been worse. Arguing with me that the item was there for collection and that I needed to collect it. I was passed through 6 agents. All bots I‚Äôm assuming as not answering my questions and repeating. Worst experience ever. Eventually spoke to a human who confirmed the lockers didn‚Äôt exist as were permanently closed but couldn‚Äôt explain why it was and still is an option for delivery on their site. The human told me I would have to wait a further 4 days for a refund and that was it. Cold hearted response. Could not give a toss that I needed the item today and I was so disappointed or that I had been around the houses trying to get one of the bots to help. Horrendous

Review Title: Amazon is no longer the company that it used to be
Review Text: Amazon used to be my favorite place to shop. I used to brag about their wonderful customer service.  Items arrived on time, if not early, and they were what I had ordered. They were quality items and I could trust the reviews. Apparently, those days are over.  For the past six to eight months I've had one problem after another.  They advertise items as coming on a certain day, even the next morning, but they don't come. Packages get lost or they are delivered to someone else and almost never come on time. The products aren't as good as they used to be and it isn't surprising to get something other than what you order. The reviews are completely untrustworthy and I have to look at the bad reviews to even get an idea of whether the product is any good or not.  I do usually have good luck with returns and customer service; however, I am sick of having to go to UPS for returns or just keeping the garbage because I don't want to hassle with it. I am sick of expecting a product to come on a certain day and then having it come two days later or even get lost. I'm going to try some alternatives and hopefully will find better service elsewhere.  The most current problem I had was yesterday but this is not a one time problem.

It‚Äôs not exactly the service I‚Äôm paying for when it‚Äôs meant to be next day or the day I‚Äôm choosing. More than 50% of my deliveries run into unexpected delays. They just make too much profit to care about losing customers nowadays.

Review Title: Trying to get a camping fridge‚Ä¶
Review Text: Trying to get a camping fridge delivered to the boatyard where I have my boat - the manager won't take deliveries, and my boat is one of several. Amazon have decided that I need to be present upon delivery, to give a code to the driver - it's not like I don't work full time, or anything. So I wasn't here today, and the delivery failed. I can be here tomorrow, but I'm not going to stand out in the car park for hours, waiting for the delivery to turn up. Have just spoken to Amazon - was sent an email where I could apparently 'put more instructions' (ie, a phone number)for the driver. Well, I've just checked my emails - one was assuring me that the 'jacket you ordered will be delivered to the Amazon locker' - (who was that email intended for, I ordered a camping fridge, not a jacket, and it's coming to my address, not an amazon locker), an email asking me if 'I solved your problem', containing a broken link, so I can't even click No, and an email saying I can 'edit delivery instructions', which only gives the option to remove old delivery addresses I no longer use. What a monumental waste of time. Still, I guess Bezos is a little distracted with his new fiancee. Meanwhile, Amazon just gets worse and worse... UPDATE: Never again will I attempt to order anything that can't be posted trough a letterbox, or delivered to an amazon locker again. Amazon - who clearly consider themselves too big to fail - are beginning to fail. It could all be resolved very simply, if they would just allow customers to send messages to delivery drivers. My circumstances don't fit into their tight little list of 'instructions for delivery' and it's beginning to look like they are simply unable to...deliver an item to a boatyard. Farcical. And a wasted day. Plus, as expected, and contrary to what it says on my order page, there has been no attempt to try again today. Liars.

Review Text: Amazon in Dublin has to be the worst online shopping experience. The first time I ordered, i did not receive my package even though it said it was delivered. I let them know and they made it look like I was keeping the packages and trying to get a refund. Third time, same situation. I did not get any reimbursements. Customer service is absolutely incompetent. They don't even read what you are saying and give you copy-paste responses. I have wasted one hour talking to them each time with ZERO solutions. They don't even listen or try to help, the worst customer care i have seen. Then a few days later, a kind old lady from a building 10 minutes away came to tell me that she saw some packages for me there. If she hadn't told me, i wouldn't have known. I ordered again and gave clear delivery instructions and they again delivered to the other building. When I tried letting Amazon know about this, they kept saying "have you checked your neighbors building?" I just told them it was delivered to another building but they don't even read what you say. Ridiculous and such a waste of time.  This experience has been so irritating that i am going to delete my Amazon account that i have been shopping (a LOT) on for the last 4 years. No more Amazon. Jeff Bezos has too much money to be providing such a low level of service. I am disgusted.

Amazon locker full?  Have you ever wondered why a range of items are not deliverable to lockers because the "locker is full"?  In my experience, this is often a lie, designed to make you bear very high postal charges. I have experimented with various items, with various lockers, over a long period of time.  In many cases, especially smallish low-cost items, the lockers are ALWAYS "FULL", even though other items ordered at the same time from other suppliers are readily delivered to the "full" locker.  As a matter of principle, I DO NOT ORDER items which Amazoin does not deliver to its lockers.  This "locker is full" business is merely designed to enable the suppliers to increase their profits by levying high delivery charges.

I am writing this review to express my deep disappointment with Amazon's delivery service, which has proven to be increasingly terrible and far from cost-effective. It is truly baffling how one can place an order for a product, only to have it delivered at the very last minute. As a Prime subscriber, I had high expectations when I placed an order for a printer in the afternoon of the day before, expecting a smooth and timely delivery process. However, my experience quickly turned into a frustrating ordeal.The delivery time for my order was changed multiple times, causing significant inconvenience. It went from an initial estimated time of noon to an ever-shifting schedule that ultimately settled on 7.15 PM the next day. Throughout the entire process, I had to wait anxiously, as the delivery time continued to be revised. It is truly disheartening to witness such a lackluster level of service from a company that prides itself on efficiency. The entire day was put on hold as I eagerly awaited the arrival of my order.What makes matters worse is the fact that the delivery time extended all the way until 10 PM, and yet, I am still here waiting. This constant rescheduling and prolonged waiting period have only added to my frustration and dissatisfaction. It has become evident that the convenience I expected from Amazon's Prime service is simply not worth the trouble.I can't help but compare this experience to that of a third-world service, as the level of inefficiency and unreliability is truly reminiscent of subpar delivery systems. It is worth mentioning that since Amazon's unionization, the quality of service seems to have taken a noticeable downturn. While I understand that various factors can contribute to delivery delays, the continuous changes and lack of punctuality are simply unacceptable.I hope this review sheds light on my disappointing experience and highlights the urgent need for improvement in Amazon's delivery service. I trust that Amazon will take these concerns seriously and strive to regain the trust of its customers by delivering on its promises of timely and efficient service.

Review Title: Amazon delivers what I want consistently well
Review Text: Hello. My bride and I order from amazon on a regular basis. Searching for what I want is easy, and the reviews are helpful when deciding on whether to purchase or not and I‚Äôm on the fence regarding a product. Returns are easy when dropping off an item at a return center. Just do the return request online, they send you a bar code and you just drop off the item and they scan your phone. Done. Thirty seconds. Don‚Äôt even need a box or anything. Prime membership is worth it to me when it comes to the shipping, and prime also comes with the amazon prime tv and I‚Äôm certain there are more perks that other people use that I don‚Äôt even use that are included with the prime membership. There have been times when something didn‚Äôt arrive on time as planned, and the story I‚Äôm telling myself is that even the best systems and processes will not be executed perfectly every time. So it is what it is. And I choose to appreciate that the majority of the time, I get what I want and it‚Äôs delivered properly as it should be. Well done amazon drivers. Well done amazon customer service. Well done Jeff Bezos. Well done amazon sellers.There are times when I think, I need to go out and go shopping. There are times when I think, I can so order that amazon and get on with my day and focus on other stuff. I like that I can purchase gifts, have them  wrapped, shipped, etc. and bada bing bada bang. Done with a few taps on my phone.Many small business owners and local mom and pop shops may get jacked and may not be able to compete. That‚Äôs a challenge everyone needs to overcome. For avoidance of doubt, I do shop at local owned stores and give them my business. I also shop at amazon and give those Amazon sellers my business. I see a bunch of negative reviews here and they are recent reviews. We receive amazon orders a few times each week, so speaking from my experience which is overall positive, I give 4 stars.

I tried going round and round with them but they were not willing to help at all and now the hacker has my address, phone number, email and card details meaning I have had to change all my passwords everywhere and completely cancel my card because they started to make purchases. Poor support from such a big company, you would expect them to have some idea of how to help a customer when they have been hacked and to be able to block the account rather than having zero support and allowing the hacker to have access to all of your personal information.

Review Title: Amazon is a stress inducing nightmare
Review Text: Normally I would never buy from Amazon because they are an evil corp, but due to budget constraints and being outside the US, I have no choice but to order from the to get reasonable shipping that actually arrives to where I am. Their customer service used to be great UNTIL the war started in March 2020 which they are a part of because they made billions while the evils forced everyone else to close. If the stores remained open, you know who's tied to the evils.Anyway, last year they told me I could NO LONGER be transferred to an American and I was FURIOUS. That's the first thing I do when I call Amazon so I can have a relatively smooth experience.This is the evils' agenda (most companies who had any Americans left working for them now have NONE) to prop up 3rd world countries and bring down first world countries so the world collapses. Now every time I call, I'm forced to deal with incompetency, and where it takes them 5 minutes just to give me a yes or no response. You should have heard their explanation for why I was charged something I should have been charged for. CLUELESS.I got one American last week and it was a wonderful experience. Every other time they don't know what they are doing and they stress me out to no end. Even their supervisors are CLUELESS and they won't let me speak to anyone higher up. I called 5 times the other day trying to get an American and couldn't.Before if they caused me a lot of time and stress they would give me a promotional credit. Today on live chat he said he can't do that. He wasn't even aware it could be done.Also, almost every item I have purchased and there's been a lot, has been defective. Chips in glass, scratches on pans and now spoon rests, broken plastic, hard pillows, and the list goes on.Even some of the sellers aren't responding to my messages anymore.And their listing says no import fees, and YET I'm charged import fees. Lastly, once AGAIN I go to a page to look at the reviews (most are fake if you didn't know) and I see reviews for a totally different product. This is the 3rd or 4th time I've encountered this in the last 2 years. It stresses me out because I have no idea which review is for what, or how many there are in total. The site is completely screwed up in more ways than one.I never loved Amazon, but now I hate them.Note: that everything about the economy worldwide is imploding. Almost every company I used to deal with has taken a dive since the scamdemic started.Again, this is no coincidence.

Review Title: It's got too bad to be worth it
Review Text: That's it for me.Amazon might have been decent in the past... but definitely, not anymore. I think I've been their customer for about 15 years, give or take.The last annoyance (out of many I've accumulated through the years) is regarding the fact that they don't price match their own stuff within the return window.I've recently bought an expensive computer, and the same day I received it, a 6% deal hit it. Now in order to get the discount... I'm supposed to send it back and order another one? In what mind is that good for anyone? Amazon would have a returned product worth less, and I would have to go through the logistics hassle... okay, maybe UPS would win with this stupid policy.I insist, it's a product where Amazon is the merchant. I would see it totally justified if the customer was hopping between vendors in their marketplace. That's not the case.I really regret not using Best Buy for this. I also stopped using Amazon when I'm in other countries, and it's not that difficult finding alternatives for many products. After leaving Amazon, some other niche products can be a PITA to find, though... specially if (like me) one has sworn off Aliexpress as well...But life goes on without Amazon. Bye, bye, Amazon US.It seems almost predictable how the customer experience would decay as a company starts becoming a monopoly.

Review Title: Know that in case of problem (warranty or damage related to transport) you have no recourseTheir current procedure is based on the‚Ä¶
Review Text: Their current procedure is based on the fact that even in the event that we have a problem on arrival or during the warranty period, we must return the package at our expense with a ridiculous little denomage to be able to be reimbursed or to have a exchange. If you are abroad and the volume / weight of the package is important, we often have a transport price higher than the price of the goods. Customer service pretends not to understand and tirelessly repeats the same unsuitable procedures. In my case, more than $400 in return costs for $20 in damages expected to recover $350 in reimbursement. Who are we laughing at? It's time to go back to smaller sites or a local merchant to still have a dialogue with a sensible human being rather than procedural machines.

My husband requested a phone call from Amazon this morning to address the latest delivery issue we're having with them.  It was a computer call, but relatively easily he got to an actual person.  Unfortunately, the first woman he talked to said she was putting him on hold then transferred him to someone else without telling him.  Then the second woman did nothing but tell him what the shipping status was, which he already knew from looking at the website.  He told her that he already knew what the status was because he was looking at it online.  The shipping status, for an overnight order, was updated yesterday (the day it was supposed to be delivered) and still hasn't been updated again.  We live in DFW, and the package was one suburb away when the update to "delayed in transit" was put up on the Amazon website.  The status is still delayed in transit, dated yesterday.  He was trying to find out when we will actually receive the package.  The second representative, although if I was Amazon I would use that term lightly about her, told him that customer service is unable to contact the fulfillment center to find out where our order is.  I honestly don't believe that for a second.....Amazon personnel have the ability to contact Amazon personnel at other facilities, I've had them do it for me before without any issues.  The only thing she offered to do is to put a request in the system that our order be delivered tomorrow, 2 days late.  And it would just be a request, not a guarantee that the package will actually be delivered.  My husband asked why it couldn't be delivered today, even though it would still be late, which is when she said they can't contact the facility we know the package is at.  My husband told her that there is no feasible reason that customer service can't contact any of their fulfillment centers directly and talk to someone.  At this point we were both highly frustrated by the run around from them.  She told him she was going to put the request for delivery tomorrow in and that's all she was doing.  She was being completely unhelpful and he finally told her so.  She started raising her voice and said "Oh, so I'm not being helpful huh?  Well then bye," and hung up on him.  I listened to the whole thing because he had speaker phone on.  Refusing to do anything to help the situation, the complete inability to deal with a customer, and then actually hanging up on said customer after yelling at them.  This sort of behavior is completely unacceptable.  Now we don't even know if she actually put in the delivery request, the shipping status remains unchanged, and we don't have any idea where to go with our original issue, the shipping status, or who to talk to to report her incredibly unprofessional behavior.  I'd give Amazon customer service a zero star rating if I could.  We're in exactly the same boat we were in when he called, except now he's been yelled at and hung up on.  I'm seriously considering closing our Amazon prime account.  If we're going to have to wait to get our deliveries anyway, I'd rather spend my money elsewhere.

Review Title: Beware of Overseas Purchases and Unresolved Refunds with Amazon
Review Text: My experience with Amazon's customer service has been deeply frustrating and disappointing. I purchased a product which turned out to be defective, and since then, I have been caught in a loop of miscommunications and delays while seeking a refund for the return shipping costs.I had to shell out $180 NZD to return this faulty product. According to Amazon's policies and the Amazon Renewed Guarantee, this cost should be fully refundable. Despite numerous attempts to resolve this, it feels like I'm wrestling with a gigantic corporation that seems bent on ignoring my legitimate concerns.If you're considering making a purchase from overseas on Amazon, I'd strongly advise against it. In the event the product is faulty, you might find yourself spending a significant amount of money to return it. Even worse, Amazon may employ a strategy that leaves you feeling disheartened: making you communicate with numerous unhelpful individuals, passing the buck between departments, and forcing you to repeat your situation over and over with no end in sight.This whole ordeal has been extremely unsettling and exhausting. The absence of professionalism, customer care, and straightforwardness has pushed me to escalate this issue to the New Zealand Commerce Commission.I'm sharing my story not only to seek a resolution for my situation but also to warn others about the potential difficulties they may encounter in a similar scenario. Customers deserve respect, honesty, and fairness, and I sincerely hope my experience can serve as a warning for others.

An Honest Review of Amazon I have been an Amazon customer for several years now, and I believe it's time to share an honest review of my experiences with the e-commerce giant. While Amazon offers numerous advantages and convenience, it also has its fair share of drawbacks that need to be acknowledged. Here's my breakdown of the pros and cons:Pros:1. Vast Product Selection: One of Amazon's biggest strengths is its unparalleled product range. From electronics to clothing, home goods to books, you can find almost anything you need on their platform.2. Competitive Prices: Amazon's marketplace fosters competition among sellers, often resulting in competitive prices. You can often find great deals and discounts on various products.3. Convenience and Speed: Amazon's Prime membership offers fast and free shipping on eligible items, making it incredibly convenient for time-sensitive purchases. Additionally, their user-friendly interface and seamless checkout process enhance the overall shopping experience.4. Customer Reviews: The abundance of customer reviews provides valuable insights and helps make informed purchasing decisions. It's beneficial to hear others' experiences before making a purchase.Cons:1. Counterfeit Products: Due to the sheer number of sellers on Amazon, there is a risk of encountering counterfeit or low-quality items. While Amazon takes measures to combat this issue, it remains a concern for some buyers.2. Third-Party Seller Discrepancies: As Amazon allows third-party sellers, inconsistencies in product quality, customer service, and shipping practices can occur. It's essential to research sellers and read reviews before making a purchase.3. Environmental Impact: The rapid growth of Amazon's operations has raised concerns about its environmental impact, such as packaging waste and carbon emissions from delivery vehicles. They have made some efforts to address these concerns, but there is still room for improvement.4. Worker Conditions: Over the years, there have been reports and controversies regarding the working conditions at Amazon's fulfillment centers. These issues highlight the need for better worker treatment and labor practices.Overall, Amazon remains a convenient and popular platform for online shopping, but it's important to approach it with awareness of its limitations. Being an informed shopper and understanding the potential drawbacks can help mitigate any negative experiences. Amazon's continuous improvements and addressing of these concerns would undoubtedly contribute to a better customer experience and make it an even more reliable platform in the future.

So shouldn‚Äôt the company be keeping tabs and quality control of the sellers?We were basically blamed for buying through Amazon BY Amazon customer support!Now we have large heavy garbage in our house that we‚Äôre stuck with until Amazon comes to remove it AND we don‚Äôt get a refund until the broken item has been returned to where it came from.So if you like spending a lot of money to be greatly inconvenienced and you love having your home filled with clutter- you‚Äôll enjoy ordering large items from Amazon.Also- the customer service rep didn‚Äôt even seem interested in filling a complaint with whoever Amazon is hiring to deliver heavy items in our area, so they‚Äôre just going to allow more products to get smashed and more customers to have to endure the inconvenience.

Dear Amazon Customer Service,I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction and disappointment with the level of service I have received regarding my recent order of a new monitor. I must emphasize that my experience with Amazon's customer service has been nothing short of abysmal.On June 14, 2023, I placed an order for a monitor as my girlfriend had to fly into the UK due to a family emergency. Unfortunately, my mother had been taken to the hospital, and my girlfriend needed to work remotely, which necessitated the urgent purchase of the monitor. Understanding the urgency of the situation, I relied on Amazon's reputation for reliable and efficient delivery services.However, to my utter dismay, the monitor failed to arrive on the promised delivery date. Frustrated and concerned, I immediately contacted Amazon's customer service on Sunday, June 15. I expressed my extreme dissatisfaction and disappointment, highlighting the urgency of the situation and the need for the monitor to be delivered promptly. I vividly remember expressing my hope that I would not be having the same conversation with your representatives the following day.Much to my disappointment, not only did I receive no resolution or explanation, but I also did not receive any response from Amazon regarding my concerns. It is profoundly disheartening to witness such a lack of professionalism and disregard for customer grievances. I find it incredulous that Amazon would send several delivery updates only to fail to deliver as clearly outlined.Moreover, the lack of accountability and responsiveness from Amazon's customer service department is simply unacceptable. It is as if your customer service team operates on the moon, far removed from the realities of timely deliveries and customer satisfaction. The inability to address my concerns, coupled with the repeated failed deliveries, has left me both profoundly disappointed and infuriated.As a long-standing customer, I have come to expect a certain level of service and reliability from Amazon. However, this recent experience has shattered my confidence in the brand. I implore you to rectify this situation immediately by ensuring the prompt delivery of my monitor today. Additionally, I request a formal explanation for the repeated delivery failures and an apology for the lack of response from your customer service team.If this matter is not resolved satisfactorily, I will have no choice but to reconsider my future purchases from Amazon and share my unfortunate experience with friends, family, and on various online platforms. I trust that you will take my concerns seriously and take immediate steps to rectify this situation.

Since Amazon does not do exchanges and only refunds, so I would have had to purchase the shirts again in my new desired size while returning the previous ones I received. Unfortunately, the same exact shirts are now $29 each today! That is a pretty significant increase from just 7 days ago! Now I know you can receive a refund for the difference if an item/product you purchased days before goes DOWN in price, but what about those who have or will experience a similar scenario as mine? All I wanted to do was exchange them for a smaller size and pay more or less the same price as last week. How is this fair? It isn't. SMH...

Review Title: Account Hacked and Amazon did Absolutely NOTHING!!
Review Text: In recent days, I received a message from my bank, informing me that they had debited the amount of 426 dollars for an alleged purchase made by me, someone entered my account, changed the shipping address and made a purchase, the scam was detected by me almost immediately, I immediately contacted Amazon to cancel that order, that was not possible, I tried to cancel the purchase almost immediately but Amazon did not allow it, despite calling and notifying that I was being scammed by a hacker Online Amazon did Absolutely nothing !! The order was delivered the next day and they even sent me photos of the delivery. I think that if the order goes out through Amazon Logistics, they must have control to stop any irregularities. Now my account is blocked for "SECURITY" and the bank also charged me. the cost of the product! A security and communication failure within the Amazon departments! I clarify that this happened to me in Amazon United States !!

Review Title: I have called Amazon on Apr 24th to‚Ä¶
Review Text: I have called Amazon on Apr 24th to help me restore access to my account, but nobody followed up with me. So, I called again on May 3rd to request a refund for an item that broke down (which they have fulfilled), and asked again for help retrieving access to my account. They said that the account management team would follow up with me via email, but 10 days passed and got no emails. I called them again last night, and they said my account doesn't exist anymore, and there's no way for them to retrieve it. I did some research on Google, and found out that they actually delete accounts without any consent if they go over a certain limit for refund requests. They are also immune from any lawsuits against them based on their terms.I hope they will go out of business and all of their members would cancel their Prime membership.

Additionally,  their tracking seems to be broken for the past 2 weeks or so , and as such ,  does not show the driver's position and number of remaining deliveries before it hits my address.Consequently,  the deliveries cannot be tracked at all, and you're left guessing when the parcel will actually arrive.  Their drivers also have a filthy and rotten habit of leaving parcels outside my property which is in front of a public road where it can be stolen , and WITHOUT KNOCKING my door. Despite several attempts raising complaints with their rubbish customer service, there has been no improvements to their deliveries.

Review Title: Amazon needs to get their Logistics issues fixed or use FedEx/UPS exclusively!
Review Text: I have been an Amazon Prime customer for as long as I can remember. Their customer service is getting exponentially worse, and their Logistics department is THE WORST! When we moved in early March, any packages sent to our address were being delivered to an unknown other address. CS directed me to provide delivery instructions. No change. Took several weeks and dozens of e-mails, chats, and phone calls to get that situation resolved. Now that they've finally found my house, we're having horrible trouble with deliveries. Amazon needs to stop with the ‚ÄúUber Eats‚Äù model of delivery. I can wait a couple days for my packages! And, at the very least, stop sending drivers out at 4:30 in the morning! Seriously. Stop that: Nobody needs their package at that time of day!! Choosing "Amazon Day" isn't always an option - which is super annoying - AND, even when I DO chose that as the delivery option, items are delivered willy nilly anyway. So, really, what's the point? Almost every time we have an issue with a driver, it‚Äôs a contractor in a private car. We‚Äôve had drivers racing down our gravel road, we had an underage deliverer driven by his mom deliver a package, had items not arrive at all, items misdelivered, items in the same order arriving in multiple shipments IN THE SAME DAY, and had an uninsured driver with expired tags get stuck on our road while trying to deliver at an unnecessary time of day using ridiculous GPS instructions that he shouldn't have followed in the first place. This is all in the last 2 weeks!! Amazon's vetting process for these drivers seems sketchy at best, and I'm not even sure anything is validated! Safety is Amazon's priority? Nope! I don't feel particularly safe having these contractors on my property. Most customer centric company in the world? No. Get your act together, Amazon! OR, let me pick who delivers my packages.

I ordered an apple ultra watch last year, it came with a "one time passcode" for security to ensure I actually receive it. I gave the delivery driver the code, when I open the box it was vitamins! Amazon have refused to believe me and rejected my claim, this took 5 months, I was fortunate enough to have paid for this with their partner finance and under section 75 of the credit consumer act the finance company allowed me to make a claim to have my money returned. Amazon state the passcode makes it safe but it actually put me at risk because I could not evidence my Apple watch ultra was stolen. Please be mindful and look out for one time passcodes because if the order is wrong or missing and you given the code to the delivery person Amazon will not except responsibility. I have now started taking my business to more local retailers.

Review Title: Returned an item but did not receive my refund
Review Text: I bought a laptop from Amazon on the 19th of June 2022 [Order number 026-4932158-0409958] and returned this laptop the post office as instructed by Amazon on the 20th of June 2022. The laptop did not start even though it was plugged in and it refused to charge so I returned it because the product was clearly faulty. Royal Mail confirmed that the item was returned on the 21st of June 2022 to the Amazon Warehouse at 09:12 and an employee at Amazon signed for it. Review Title: Amazon Has Done Terrible Things To Me
Review Text: Amazon Has Done Terrible Things To Me. I have been an Amazon Prime Member for 12 years now. At the beginning their customer service was excellent and I even got their credit card. This past year, however, they have become a nightmare to deal with and have stolen money from me and permanently banned me from writing reviews because of "suspicious activity" on my account. Let me be clear, I have left maybe 3-4 reviews the entire 12 years I've had my account, and I only reviewed something if it was a terrible product and I tried to save others from buying it.Furthermore, I ordered a Razer Monitor a few months ago, and the package was ripped open when it arrived. I tested the monitor and it was not the model I ordered, so I sent it back. Shortly after I received an email stating that I was not getting a refund and they were keeping the monitor I sent back. This was a $1200 monitor, so I lost a lot of money. I tried going through the Better Business Bureau and Amazon laughed in my face and said they would be happy to speak to my legal team. Most recently I ordered 3 Limited Edition Nintendo Switch Tears of the Kingdom models, and they were stolen off my porch. I have specific delivery instructions I have left Amazon, that they are to knock and if no one answers to deliver another time, to make sure my packages didn't get taken by porch pirates. Well, they refused the refund without a Police Report, which I did. Even after the Police investigation was done and the Police Report was approved, I sent it to Amazon as instructed. They still denied me a refund or replacement, so I had to call and argue with them and they finally agreed to the refund. Amazon in its current state is a complete mess and they no longer know how to care for their long-term customers who have spent hundreds of thousands of dollars on their platform over 12 years. Stay away from this company if you can and order from other online retailers, as places like Walmart and BestBuy Online are stocking the same products now and they have much better delivery and customer service.

Review Title: Stop the bait and switch listings and fake reviews everywhere
Review Text: They need to stop the 2 types of bait and switch that is going on in the majority of listings before they get sued into oblivion because of how rampant this issue is and how much it is costing people. The first issue is when you see a product for instance ‚Äú3 pack diamond grit polish $10.28‚Äù in the search results and then you click on it because it‚Äôs a good deal and then it shows you the horizontal row of ‚Äúdifferent sizes‚Äù but the exact item/size/title/description just the literal exact thing that it was advertising before you clicked on it says it‚Äôs $32.98 and the only ‚Äúsize‚Äù/the only product on that listing for the listed $10.28 is a piece of wool cloth. This is flat out ridiculously stupid and scummy and a waste of everyone‚Äôs time. The second and even worse thing is sellers will start selling a good product and once it gets good reviews or if they can no longer get that product or whatever they will simply delete the photos, title, and description of the original product and then replace it with a new product that is often in the same category or related to the original product but far worse quality and almost never even interchangeable with the original (for example they replace a belt sander with a palm sander or drill or just different size brand and quality belt sander) and all they did was change the title, description and photos but kept the same listing since all they technically did was ‚Äúedit it‚Äù which also allows them to keep all the positive reviews so you will be buying a product that is rated 5 stars and had hundreds of reviews and thus probably won‚Äôt even question it but yet you may be the first person to ever buy it because in essence they‚Äôre all fake reviews since they‚Äôre for the other product. The only way to tell is by reading the reviews and even then unless it has dozens of reviews or reviews with pictures of the product you‚Äôll never know. Not only is that scummy and definitely worthy of a class action it could also really cause severe harm to people physically and monetarily because a lot of people get a lot of tips and info on the use, maintenance, parts, and accessories of products from the reviews especially on Chinese products that have useless instructions. For instance, with 3d printing a lot of cheap and popular printers are from Chinese companies and come with poor instructions and if you don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôre doing it‚Äôs rough so say for instance someone says that they a hard time finding a thermister or heating element for the printer but XYZ is the correct one, well in 3d printing and especially with those parts if you don‚Äôt replace them with the correct ones and in the correct way you can easily start a fire and so if they change out the product and keep the reviews then some mom buying one for her kid won‚Äôt know any better and even doing all the research if she sees that review she could she will end up installing the wrong one and there is a high likelihood that it will catch on fire all because Amazon couldn‚Äôt care less about anything but profit, and no I‚Äôm not one of the eat the rich types but corporations are getting out of hand and this stuff is not only poor business practices and scams blatantly happening on a massive scale right in front of them it‚Äôs also 100% going to get someone killed.

Review Title: I strongly do not recommend Amazon
Review Text: I strongly do not recommend Amazon. Terrible service. As soon as I set up my account, I started having issues right away. I signed up for a trial Prime subscription and decided to buy some items for my home since I had just moved in. My first purchase wasn't very large, at 800 euros, but then I decided to buy everything I needed all at once, so I wouldn't have to split my delivery into parts. That's why I chose to pay several times more but get everything I needed immediately. My bank declined the transaction because they requested confirmation that it was me making the payment in order to approve such a large amount for spending. While I was dealing with the bank, Amazon blocked me because they considered it suspicious activity.Perhaps I wouldn't have written a review just because of this, but it was only the beginning. Because as soon as I wanted to confirm my identity with Amazon so they could understand it was me, Amazon did absolutely nothing. After blocking my account, they wouldn't let me contact customer support through the account because the account was suspended, even for communication with customer support. They asked me for documents from my bank and information that I had provided in my account. I did that, and they replied that it was not enough information and requested the same thing again. This has been happening in an endless loop. I have provided exactly what they asked for, sometimes even trying to provide more detailed information, but they still continue to ask me for the same information every day. Moreover, when I call customer support, they say they are not competent in matters of account suspension and that the department responsible for unlocking accounts is not directly accessible through a call, only through the bank information they request from me.It turns out they constantly ask for the same thing and then respond that there's not enough information. And no one can tell me what the hell they are missing. As a result, my purchases are paid for, time is passing, and I have been sitting in an empty house for several days now, waiting for them to resolve their issues. It's a waste of time, and I won't be shopping in this store anymore if I need something urgently in the coming days.

Review Title: If I could give less stars I certainly‚Ä¶
Review Text: If I could give less stars I certainly would. I ordered an iMac in March and waited at least 2 weeks for the item. I paid my ¬£1479.00 and patiently waited. Eventually it arrived ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ or did it. When I opened the battered box it was full of cabling and what looked like the inners of a computer or similar‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ anyway it was certainly not an iMac. To cut the story short, customer services were useless and rude and after calling them and speaking with a manager several times, I decided to contact my bank. I opened a dispute and during this time, Amazon told me they had paid back the monies plus postage of ¬£10. A few weeks later, Amazon decided to dispute the dispute saying I had received the goods. This went to appeal, and finally 2 months later I received my refund, thanks to my bank. PLEASE if you are sending for a valuable item, don‚Äôt buy it from Amazon. You may pay a few pounds more from a high street shop but at least it will be hassle free.

Review Title: It's time to leave Amazon and back to the stores
Review Text: Well, Amazon is getting worse.  Now I am told that when I return an item I will have to wait up to 14 days to get my refund!  This is a company that has not kept good with its own contract with its customers.  The 2-Day delivery is a farce.  You don't get your orders delivered as stated.  They are becoming more often late than on time (or the item is not received at all), yet, they make you wait before you cancel the non-delivered item.  It's an absolute disappointment.  I've had my share of disappointments with this company that I'm going outside of my comfort zone and back to the stores.  It's not worth the lies to keep the business going with them. I've been a long-time customer and patient.  You don't take advantage of my money.  You got paid, and the item requested to return is the item returned.  Here's the thing when I drop off my items I am told no boxes or packaging is required so the shipping company is aware of what is being sent back.  It matches the QR code, so I don't understand the delay in reimbursing me for my refund.  I want my refund.

Review Title: Amazon Fresh Failure and BAD Customer Services
Review Text: My Amazon Fresh order was due to be delivered between 12 and 2 pm on the day of delivery.When the order didn't arrive by 2pm I contacted customer services. The first representative told me that they couldn't get in contact with the driver and asked me to try - I couldn't contact the driver either. They then said they were going to refund the order. I agreed. Later they said that the driver was "in my area" and would be no later than 4pm "Max".Due to the cost of living I didn't have the budget to go and buy more food so I only had the option to take more time out to wait in for the delivery.It didn't arrive by 4pm.I then contacted customer services again who told me that a FREE replacement would be sent out by midnight the same day. After a very long wasted day, time taken off work and an autistic son waiting to be fed, the replacement order arrived by 11:30pm.Today Amazon has taken the payment of ¬£40 despite promising a full refund of the order.I contacted customer services again today and that representative told me that I would be charged the ¬£40 and there was nothing that could be done about it.This has caused stress for both me and my son. I have written to customer services on the email address they provided but that was a few days ago, and they haven't even acknowledged receipt of my email. Needless to say I won't be ordering food from them again and will likely cancel my Prime membership also. Don't bother buying a Prime membership. Doesn't make a shred of difference tbh. And get your food elsewhere.

So my deliveries are free 100%Every issue I ever had before, was solved with truly effective customer support. There was just one highly technical issue with Prime Video which agents failed to understand but I resolved it on my own as a geek.So again and again, thanks, Amazon! I don't share your political and social policies, but you do an amazing job.

These headphones are worth every penny and I highly recommend them to any music lover or frequent traveler.

With the end of the COVID-19 pandemic, Amazon has been on the news because Amazon has been losing customers and CUTTING JOBS to save money. Is Amazon in the throes of going out of business? The plant that I had ordered was NOT an Artemisia absinthium plant, the absinthe plant. I and most people would call that FALSE ADVERTISING. I tried (Sunday)  to cancel the order, but Amazon would not cancel the order. Several times on Monday, I tried to cancel the order but Amazon would not cancel the order. Today, Tuesday, I tried to cancel the order, but Amazon would not cancel the order. This afternoon, the plant was shipped and cannot be returned. What is wrong with Amazon? Review Title: Amazon returns cost more than original shipping.
Review Text: I ordered a few things from Amazon that seemed necessary.  All the items were shipped separately, as expected.  They all arrived in a very short amount of time and am pleased with their shipping.  What really ticked me off was the attempt to return something.  One of the items I ordered came in a box from the original manufacturer and was shipped to me via USPS.  When I asked for a return, I was given a Q code for my nearby UPS store...not a USPS label or Q code.  I took the original, unopened package to the UPS store and was told I had to "PAY" for another shipping box because the original box was not "STURDY" enough.  Funny...the USPS thought it was sturdy enough when they originally picked it up, shipped it and delivered it to me.  With a cost of almost half the estimated refund I would get from Amazon in return shipping fees for re-packing and re-boxing the item, I canceled my return.  With the money for gas and the money I must spend to get the item returned to Amazon, it isn't worth my time or effort.  BEWARE what you purchase with Amazon.  I will go back to ordering from Walmart, as they allow returns to their stores.

Review Title: My Account got compromised as someone‚Ä¶

Review Title: Absolutely shocking customer service. They simply don't care.
Review Text: Ordered 10 shoe boxes to be delivered from Germany in Nov 22. 2 shoe boxes arrived in January 23. Was todl to send them back to Germany and my postage would be refunded and correct item would be shipped. Returned product and sent them proof of postage. No refund received. Chased up and was told I hadn't followed the process which in fact I had, the to the letter.  New delivery arrived in February and only 2 of the 10 boxes arrived again. Called them again to complain about A: not refunding my original postage B: How can they make the same mistake twice.  Was told to return the boxes again and they would refund me.  I was not going to get caught out on that again and told them about the first incident. I have sent no fewer than 30 emails and asked for this to be escalated to someone who can fix the problem. They won't escalate. I cannot speak to a manager or supervisor.  This is a faceless company who are great when they get it right, but when they get it wrong they don't want to resolve matters.  Absolutely shocking customer service. They should be ashamed. I have lost money and still do not have my product ordered in November 22.

Review Title: The driver delivered me a box full of paper rolls!!!
Review Text: On 15th of April i was delivered by an allocated Amazon driver two packages. One labelled with the proper ordered item from their website , and another one unlabelled  which supposed to have an Ecovacs cleaning robot . Now , to my horrid stupefaction, when taken inside , and start unpacking, instead of a robot cleaner, on that unlabelled box, i found a pack full of paper rolls!!!!!!  The reason why I am writing this experience everywhere  I can is to rise awareness on the level of theft that happens in 2023!!!! I doubt that package left the Amazon warehouse unlabelled and if so, how did the driver know where to delivery it ???? The facts are very simple, and the driver knew what he was doing not caring a damn in the world that he is seen, nobody will do anything, and the ‚Äú item‚Äù now in someone‚Äôs house will be marked as ‚Äú lost‚Äù . Such a shame I can‚Äôt post the pictures too in here ‚Ä¶. What Amazon does? Apologies and a refund is issued, the review i wrote on their website it‚Äôs not made visible. So, how can you trust buying electronics or more expensive items from Amazon when the people who work with them steal customers goods????? And it‚Äôs happening all over Uk, mostly London not only with Amazon and why companies like these and other delivery companies don‚Äôt do anything?????? How many times they didn‚Äôt delivered the goods, or to the wrong address , or lying you were not yo be found although you were at home and so on???? And now you come to my door and disrespect me to such a horrid level to deliver me a pack full of paper rolls instead of a robot cleaner  ???  How bad is that in 2023???? Horrible , Horrible experience‚Ä¶.. I am beyond disappointed‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ this needs to change !!

Review Title: I'm not going to say I have never had‚Ä¶
Review Text: I'm not going to say I have never had issues with Amazon because I have mostly from their lazy delivery people who  suck at delivering orders when you're living at an apartment complex. They don't even try to call to ask how to find your apartment or bother looking for your apartment. I know getting a refund or sometimes a replacement if you're lucky to get a replacement fast at least with me it had been easy. That was when I used to live in apartments not anymore. Now, issues with orders? No, I always get what I want even without prime I got what I ordered but of course I had to wait for it. I ordered two chest binders for myself, it was easy to return one & repurchase a second one. Never got anything used or broken, I mean shampoos or liquid soaps always tend to leak & I wish it was more protected from leaking but I guess it can't be helped. I did for a fact have a family member who has had issues with returns. Don't know if it's the sellers being scammers, but whenever you do return something always keep the tracking receipt from UPS or USPS because even though you did return everything sometimes you'll get your money taken as if you never returned it. Then you get an email threatening you about your money being taken because the sellers "never received the items" so always keep your tracking numbers & take pictures of your returns. Sometimes calling customer service is useless, I always go for the chat it's easier & faster in my opinion. This is my review, I'm not saying it's terrible to shop there but it isn't always the best.

Review Title: Words can‚Äôt adequately describe how disgraceful their customer service is
Review Text: Customer service is utterly appalling. Great if everything goes fine but the moment you have the slightest problem or concern it goes to hell. It‚Äôs an utter disgrace. They will NEVER call or email you back but will readily promise to do so. The reps ability to understand a problem or even follow written or verbal English is insufficient for problem-solving that you constantly have to repeat yourself. You have to repeat yourself to a new person every time, they don‚Äôt bother to look at chat records (if there even are any). There is no ownership of issues. They don‚Äôt make any kind of notes against your account, nothing. They don‚Äôt understand their own processes, at least in terms of the information customers receive. They allow people who don‚Äôt have the skills or knowledge to deal with serious matters around contractual obligations and your own account security and cyber threats. There is no meaningful complaints process even for the most serious issues and it‚Äôs all done outside of the UK with apparently no ability to escalate beyond the customer reps own manager. They can‚Äôt handle anything remotely outside the scripts they‚Äôre given. Some of the worst customer service I‚Äôve ever experienced

Review Title: $514 BILLION in revenues should at least come with good customer service. Not even close!
Review Text: Amazon is no longer the company it once was - not even close. It raised the price for Amazon Prime $30 per year, it took away Amazon Fresh free delivery for Amazon for Prime members and now charges $10 and up, it took away free shipping for Whole Foods, customer service is now mostly staffed by agents who cannot speak English, do not understand English, are not trained, and have no idea about USA business protocols, it continues to sell inferior and often bootlegged merchandise from China, and orders are seldom delivered on time, often missing POORLY packed. Considering that Amazon made $514 BILLION last year, there is no reason it cannot hire trained customer service agents who speak and understand English, delivery the correct items on time and packed correctly, and actually provide the service that was promised to Prime members. I have been a Prime member for years and am not renewing my membership. Amazon needs to rethink its decisions.

I tried to logon to my Amazon account and the two step authentication failed since they had my old cell phone number.  There is currently no way to solve the problem on-line.  Their website always takes you to logon with two step authorization, even when you specifically select two step failed.   So, I called customer service for help.  Before she could help me she had to ask several questions to verify my identity.  That failed since I could not list the last three orders I had placed with them without access my account.  I finally got fed up and asked her to close the account.  I then got a email stating: "If you are experiencing issues with logging into the account you wish to close, visit the Help page below..." and they give you a web address.That address winds up taking you to the login page that requires two step authorization, which of course fails because of the wrong telephone number.  Every attempt at using their website to correct the problem or cancel the account winds up taking you back to the login page that requires two step authentication.

Review Title: Fighting for Amazon with a refund ‚Ä¶
Review Text: I have been with Amazon for several years. I‚Äôve never had a problem getting a refund either from Amazon directly or for my second or third-party seller. Recently I placed an order and canceled in the same day. Amazon refunded the money that they had charged me from their fulfillment center, but I actually had to call and find out why the second party seller had not refunded the money. Amazon sent an email to the seller after 72 hours. There was no response. Amazon‚Äòs policy is to refund the money. I called Amazon and filed a complaint. They gave me the card member service center. The agent told me and I quote we never charged you for that money. Yes that‚Äôs what I said they told me they never charged me for either of the charges . I told him that‚Äôs funny because I‚Äôm looking at my bank account and I can see both charges the one for $39 the other one for $25. I also can see a week later that you guys refunded the $39 but I filed a complaint with you guys and you had to file an email with the second party seller to get that money. He insisted that they never charged me the money. Then he said they refunded the money  so I said so how was it? You‚Äôre telling me one minute ago that you guys never charged me for either of the products and now you‚Äôre telling me that you refunded them both? I said I think that you‚Äôre lying to me trying to cover your ass. So I had to go to my bank my bank put a hold on it and the money has already cleared now I have to wait and fight for $25.17 from Amazon  highly disappointed but not that a billion dollar  company gives a crap about one persons $25 that they ‚Äúnever took, and then ‚Äúrefunded it, but they never took it  . I can‚Äôt make this up. ü§Æ

Review Title: Beware when you buy a USD 300 + item
Review Text: After being a Prime member for years and always receiving a daily good service, the day arrived when I was not only let down but mistreated by a Amazon Customer Service representative.Sadly I placed an order on March 23rd for a watch that cost USD 450 aprox. I kept receiving messages the delivery was running late until I received a message I should ask for a refund. Why didn‚Äôt the refund it automatically I never understood but now I do.To ask for a refund you have to return your item. How can I return something I never received ? The only option is cancelling the delivery (even if it‚Äôs days late) and it can be cancelled by the seller (Amazon) or the client, since I was not the seller I had to do it as the client. After that I could only ask for a refund. I called before and I was told that was the method.  By chat the representative told me the item was going to be ‚Äúdelivered tonight‚Äù and I asked ‚Äúyou mean in the next 4 hours because it‚Äôs already 8pm‚Äù and the answer was yes.The following day after not receiving the item I did what I was told. I couldn‚Äôt wait longer because I was visiting the US and was flying back to my country. The strange thing is that they told me it was ‚Äúundeliverable‚Äù which is impossible because I was staying in a 5star hotel with 24/7 service and front desk receiving packages. Amazon sent me a code to be given when delivered and I gave it to the hotel. They never arrived to deliver anything nor requested a code. I confirmed that with the hotel. But it‚Äôs funny because in 6 days I received at least 10 other orders from Amazon, never missed or lost 1 single order. So ‚Äúundeliverable‚Äù was not accurate.It‚Äôs April 12th and still haven‚Äôt received anything, the watch or the refund. They told me it was undeliverable and then they told me it was damaged but ‚Äúsince you cancelled the delivery‚Äù now I have to wait 30 days for it to be returned to Amazon for my refund.It was never in my hands and I cancelled because they told me to do it but now it‚Äôs their excuse for having me wait until they decide.Meanwhile I have had to pay the bank for the USD 450 charged to my credit card.I have chatted 4 times and talked over the phone 1 time with Customer Service Representatives, this lady whose name is Cha. She was rude, arrogant and 0 willingness to help.. just told me I have to wait 30 days and that‚Äôs it. I asked if I can talked to somebody else and she told me she was going to hang the phone‚Ä¶ 2 times.What can I do ? It‚Äôs impossible to get to Amazon, nobody understands the issue.I am responsible for whatever Amazon sold, they decided which carrier to use, they didn‚Äôt deliver the order, haven‚Äôt sent it back yet BUT everything is about me. They have already charged me but won‚Äôt give the money back.A disaster. They work well with sells under USD 300 but more than USD 300 just beware.I have the terrible feeling I won‚Äôt see my USD 450 back. Very bad Amazon !!

My Mom and I have been faithful Amazon customers for over 20 years. Recently I got tangled up with a scammer that asked me to order apple gift cards from my Moms and my account. So Amazon blocked those accounts and really put me through the wringer trying to keep them open and state my case. They kept asking me to submit proof of the cards I was using and billing statements from the bank. Which I did to know avail. We lost all the Kindle books we‚Äôve purchased over the years and both being avid readers that‚Äôs a lot of money, all the movies we‚Äôve purchased on those accounts customer service told me they couldn‚Äôt be transferred. We would have to create a new account and repurchase. I finally created my mom a new account with a new email and I told her if I wanted something I‚Äôd just use her account. It‚Äôs been going well for about a month and a 1/2. Yesterday I ordered a movie from prime video and a charging cable for one of my devices. I paid with my moms debit card. An hour later she gets an email stating that they have put her account on hold due to suspicious activity‚Ä¶what suspicious activity? Since when is a movie and a charging cable suspicious activity? I was supposed to send them a copy of our bank statement and proof that we were the owner of the debit card used which I did. Only to get another email saying that what I provided wasn‚Äôt good enough. They wanted information on a credit card ending in 5719 but we don‚Äôt use credit cards on that site. I called the account change and issue department 800.388.5572 if anyone needs it and I was told that an email had been sent to them and they would respond within 24 hours. What sucks about a account being blocked is you can‚Äôt access anything, you can‚Äôt make orders, listen to music, watch videos you own or have rented your just dead in the water. All I can say about this is if everyone is being treated the same way I‚Äôm being treated they are going to lose customers fast. I‚Äôve also had packages come to me opened, I‚Äôve had things I‚Äôve bought come broken. It‚Äôs taken a long time to get things refunded and or replaced. What is it about the bigger the company gets the worse they treat the people that made them successful to begin with? It‚Äôs the same with Wal-Mart.

Review Title: Amazon is not what it used to be...
Review Text: Recently I had a terrible experience with the Amazon refund process. I bought the product and returned it the next day, but even after receiving the package three days later, the status still indicated that the product should be received. Review Title: Amazon Don't Always Refund Money Timely
Review Text: I don't want to be negative about a company I could trust. But this is about valuing your customer when a mistake has occurred. I ordered a Cell Phone in December from Amazon it arrived on the 11th of December. I returned the phone on December 16th according to the return rules. I called after about 14 days. Then they told me I had to wait up to 30 days to expect my refund back to the debit card. Which I think is excessive waiting time. at the end of the 30 days, I was on hold for at least 10 minutes and because of work, I was forced to hang up. The next day I traveled to work, for seven days. when I returned I tried to follow up again they ask me for information that I didn't have at the time. So another thirty days go by.  I called today and a  very nice lady help resolve the issue but told me that would have to wait an additional 14 to 30  days for a refund although it had a process. I found that behavior unacceptable. That means they had my money from December 11th until late April. Let's say roughly 12 weeks, at 5% interest for $879.00 equals $43.95 times 3 equals $131.85. When I mentioned this to the nice lady her tone changed and then said there is nothing they can give me except they are sorry for the delay in payment. Well, in my business if I feel like a customer is not happy with my service I make a reasonable offer such as a discount or a refund because if you are a good customer; who can afford to lose good customers? Amazon can! well, like a said I don't want to put down a vendor just because they made one mistake. But they would still have my money if I didn't call today. No go checks and balance systems. I am quite sure this is not the first or last time. But check your Amazon account for your refunds. As a punishment to Amazon for the next 90 days I will not make a purchase with them. That is the only power I have. They offer me a 10-day gift certificate and because I protested they gave me 20 dollars. It is from thank you but no interest to, a 10-day gift certificate to 20 dollars. Plus they lose my money for the next 90 days

So I have to wait for a month to get my goddamn money back because of them not doing their job. And the only thing that could say is ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry‚Äù. Hate Amazon. So sad they have no competition.
