Review Title: I went to place an order on 14 items
Review Text: I went to place an order on a tablet (I usually use a computer). Even though I signed in, Amazon did not recognize the device and sent a suspicious activity notice. They then sent me a special password to use to my email account on file. Not only didn't it work, they suspended my account for suspicious activity. They sent a special phone number to call. When I did, they asked me security question as to what I purchased since January. I gave them 4 items. That was not good enough and they cancelled my account. They said I had to reapply for a new account. After verifying all the information I already had, I told them I was not going to re-apply for a new account.  I had this problem years ago and dumped them. Wish I had never come back. Now they lost my family's business (who used Amazon exclusively), relatives and several business accounts, not to mention mine. Good luck people.

1. I researched online, and Amazon has upwards of 60 to 70% Asian sellers now (USA site): It's ridiculous - their clothing size measurements are often WAY off (a small in a shirt was 53" in the bust! I wear an XL and have a 45" bust); they often don't list the fiber content at all (one item was listed as 100% cotton AND 35% polyester); If you don't read carefully, your item(s) could take a month+ to get because they're shipped from China!; The BROKEN ENGLISH in MOST of product descriptions is absolutely ridiculous, plus wrong color names, duplicate listings of the exact same product, wrong items sent, cm measurements instead of inches, long driveling descriptions like "You look pretty, sexy for you, so sensual, best dress make you feel luxurious, husband like you better, wear to party, office, vacation, pool, shopping, best dress for your wear...." . Oh, it gets so freakin' old. For once I'd like to see a whole bunch of LITERATE listings for products.2. Searching for products on Amazon is an absolute joke: You cannot pick your own price-range (it has to be 25$+); when you do a manual search for a specific brand, the results still show off-brands and often will be loosely related to the search you entered; The Asian sellers have illiterate store names: "Floerns", Cufech", "Linkiom", "BTFBM", "Dokootoo", "Romwe" "Micticsi", and they're everywhere on the site.3. I'm convinced Amazon purposefully rearranges customer product reviews, since the review dates are often out of date order (not sequential); There's absolutely no way 10's of thousands of products all have 5-star reviews before you would see any negative reviews for those thousands of products! At the top of a product review page you can see the percentage of 1-5 star reviews, yet I have had to go in as far as 18-20 pages of product reviews to find ANY ratings under 5 stars. Absolutely ridiculous.4. Amazon Prime isn't worth $140 a year (it went up from $120 in 2022): Prime Video is supposedly free, but most of the videos COST money to watch. I don't use digital books, so that's not a perk for me; I can still get products delivered within 3 days or so, sometimes earlier, and I can find things for a good, low price WITHOUT PRIME! AMAZON, YOU NEED TO GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER.

Review Title: Amazon - Arrogant organization and people who believe they are the only place to shop.
Review Text: Going, going gone. Customer service and their loyalty to the customer are a thing of the past.  Their people are spoiled little know-it-alls who are arrogant and actually know very little. Many Amazon representatives have very heavy accents, are difficult to understand, in many cases speaking broken English, lacking basic writing skills. This translates into people who cannot understand what you are calling about or how to help you. Amazon yet again ticked me off with more aggravating issues.  First was a problem with my Amazon 55" Omni TV which recently started having additional software issues, this time with the picture setting Vivid. I called Amazon and explained the TV would not stay on the Vivid setting and kept going to Natural instead. This was never an issue in the past. Per their request I rebooted the TV, after, I unplugged the TV which still did not work. They then wanted me to reset the TV back to factory settings which I said I would not do as it would not fix the issue, the problem was on their end and that they needed to submit a ticket. The Amazon support person said they cannot until I reset the TV as requested. After over an hour, I advised I would just wait until someone else calls, then takes the hours to reset the TV for them to find out I was right. It only took two days for me to be proven right and the issue to be fixed. Next I wrote a product review for a shampoo and conditioner as follows, which was rejected by morons several times.Review: Title: Excellent product - highly recommend.Text: I developed a very itchy scalp from environmental allergies which was greatly exacerbated by another high end conditioner. Even when I stopped using it, the itch would not go away, even after several months. I read many reviews, found this conditioner along with the shampoo which was in a two pack. Love it. Stopped the itch completely, and it keeps it under control. Both the Shampoo and Conditioner smell great. I did receive a card in the mail from the manufacturer stating I would receive a small gift for leaving a honest review which I would have done without it, so it was just an additional benefit. Tip: In my opinion the conditioner goes faster, so we buy at least a couple of the combination pack, and then an extra one or two of the conditioner.Amazons reply: Hello, Specifically, I would like to draw your attention to the following guideline: -We don't allow content that advocates or threatens physical or financial harm to yourself or others. ------ review you posted (as listed above) the line we rejected for is "Stopped the itch completely, and it keeps it under control." Why we rejected ---1. Product work differently for every individual not same working for everyone.2. If you said it worked perfectly and we approved and if some another customer uses it and have harsh reactions , then that person will be in serious trouble.Note, my review is like millions of others giving their opinion. Amazon has dug in their heels. Their CEO and Executives are cowards who cannot and will not take the time to respond to the little people, instead their underpaid, low intelligence employees handle it. From this point on, purchasing from Amazon is only, and I mean only in on an emergency basis, such as for health issues where I cannot get the product anywhere else. From what I read I believe they already laid off around 10,000 employees, and I look forward to many more to come.  Amazon is very slowly becoming a thing of the past. A relative has Walmart+ and they are making inroads, getting better and better by the day. I will make sure to post my opinion on every website possible along with sending copies of the Amazon email to family and friends for a good laugh!

I am disgusted that Amazon are now washing there hands of this issue....the have since the 28th March told me my credit is on its way....today I find out that that‚Äôs a lie!

Amazon is a truly outstanding online retailer that offers an extensive range of products to customers around the world. As a frequent shopper on Amazon, I have always been impressed by the quality of the products and the excellent level of customer service provided by the company. I have found that Amazon's products are consistently of high quality and are always delivered promptly and efficiently.In addition to its wide selection of products, Amazon also provides exceptional customer service. The company is committed to providing a seamless shopping experience, and I have always found its customer service representatives to be friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Whether I have a question about a product or need assistance with an order, Amazon's customer service team is always ready and willing to assist me in a timely and professional manner.Overall, I highly recommend Amazon to anyone looking for a reliable and trustworthy online retailer. With its vast selection of products, exceptional customer service, and commitment to quality, Amazon truly stands out as one of the best e-commerce platforms in the world.

Review Title: Third party suppliers on Amazon tricking long term customers
Review Text: Have been a long term customer spending thousands of pounds a year. Have a Canon copier and always use Canon cartridges bought on Amazon. Recently looked at website and ordered cartridges that were packaged and imaged to fool the buyer that they were genuine. What turned up were Chinese copies that do not work in a Canon machine - ¬£30 wasted.  My issue with Amazon is that there are a dozen reviews, going back some time, saying the same thing, that the cartridges are useless, but Amazon simply print the review but take no further action. Resulting in more of their customers, who trust the Amazon brand, to be tricked. They need to be more proactive and censure companies who are selling goods not fit for purpose on their site.

Review Title: I got scammed buying a DJI Mini 3 Pro‚Ä¶
Review Text: I got scammed buying a DJI Mini 3 Pro from Amazon in January of 2023. The package delivered had been previously returned by someone that took out the drone and replaced it with a CPU cooler and aluminum foil shaped like the DJI remote along with a busted cellphone. Then they sealed it again to look unopened. After numerous attempts to talk to a person I finally gave up. I was instructed to return the item which I did. After Amazon received the box the sent an automated reply saying the parts were not returned and the contents would be discarded and no refund given. Hours more on the phone got nothing and nowhere. After this the only option was to file a credit card dispute for the amount. A nightmare and Amazon never got a manager to call me to discuss or even check into what I was saying to see who previously bought and returned the item. They don‚Äôt care. They don‚Äôt care even now losing me as a 10 year or more customer. I cancelled my Prime membership and all other Amazon service. They do not deserve or respect their customers. The worst experience buying something online. Amazon can not be trusted they will not look into or care at all when their own customer is scammed. Whoever did this knew exactly what to put in the box to fool the automated return system and will do it again I‚Äôm sure. Amazon won‚Äôt care because they will pass the scam on to you without spending 10 minutes to look into it. If only I could upload pictures of the day I received the false merchandise. Heart broken.

Review Title: I am very disappointed with the way things are going at Amazon
Review Text: I am very disappointed with the purchase of a item. I ordered a Murphy bed in white on 3/23/23. This past weekend it was delivered to me and I attempted to put it together. After opening the boxes, I noticed that I received BLACK colored drawers. I contacted Amazon's Customer Service hotline and they at first asked me to disassemble the ENTIRE bed, repackage the items, and return it to the postal service. I explained that I do not need the entire bed replaced, I just need WHITE colored drawers. In addition, it would cost me more money to purchase new boxes to place the pieces that are over 200 pounds, in ten different boxes, into my economy car (that does not fit). They then suggested they would send "Pilot" to package and pick up the items because their policy is to return the entire item for a refund, and I would have to order it again instead of just sending me replacement drawers. ...The bed is now $500 more than what I paid originally. Amazon was not accommodating for their error. The bed was over $2,000 and you would think they would help resolve this issue. I am very disappointed with how Amazon is operating lately and will not be purchasing anything from them again until they get things right.

Review Title: Amazon is Operated Like an All-Powerful Kingdom
Review Text: Great selection, fast shipping. BUT, Amazon did not get big by being nice or fair. My seller account was suspended for no given reason. It took a year and letters to Bezos to get it back.  By the way, when you post content, Amazon owns it forever. Then they locked my consumer buyer account - again for reasons unknown. Amazon insisted that my account was new (WRONG - had it for years) and finally suggested that I just open a new account (what, and lose years of purchase history?). This is the short version of things. I will NEVER use Amazon again.

I complained about this also complaint about the warranty which has been manipulated on most purchases example: upon purchasing an item when you read the description, i would always only purchase from amazon and fulfilled by amazon! and there would be a year or three year warranty, then upon returning to the site that would of been changed to one month or less than that! and a different seller name, not amazon! never purchase from third parties! or tried not too, when the item broke, I would then go back to the site only to find the listing that I bought, changed to some other shop which is now closed! so, you cannot contact anyone to get a refund! so the third party is changing the script to make it look like i am purchasing from amazon when in fact it is not! Review Title: Prime day delivery defaulting to all orders cannot be switched off
Review Text: Amazons introduction of prime day delivery means that customers will often not get their next day delivery that they pay for with a prime subscription unless they double check all delivery options when placing every order.  They will not let you default all orders to next day delivery.  I have had several orders arrive late if I don't check the order delivery date.  In the past you didn't have to do this.  This is made worse by the fact that a placed order is marked as dispatched up to a week before it is delivered and Amazon won't cancel the order as it has shipped.

Review Title: So many reasons why I'm giving Amazon‚Ä¶
Review Text: So many reasons why I'm giving Amazon only 2 stars. #1 The product offerings have gone downhill. They're no longer the cheapest (I can usually find a better deal elsewhere), the quality is low, and sellers can easily manipulate the system and sneak by. #2 It's nearly impossible to complain to or communicate with Amazon for any reason. How can customers hold Amazon accountable without a forum to do so? #3 Items sold and shipped by Amazon often use USPS, which I won't know until I go to track the order. USPS won't deliver packages to my door...but the whole reason I'm ordering online is for delivery service to my door (it's very difficult for me to get out of the house). #4 Amazon's search feature is not great. I usually have to use Google search and Google lens to find the product with an Amazon shopping link. #5 I feel like I am actually the product that Amazon is selling with its invasiveness online. #6 Two stars instead of one because of how easy it is to get refunds for most products.

As much as I love ordering things there will ALWAYS be some sort of issue with amazon such as scamming, false advertising and damaged parcels.If you truly care about your customers you would get rid of the scammers and fake advertising and maybe hire some actual dedicated people rather than the young UNI kids that have no work ethic.

Review Title: I recently ordered electric mountain bike
Review Text: I recently ordered electric mountain bike from Amazon for $379. Two days later my wife decided she wanted the same one as well. So I looked up the same bike and the price was now advertised for a lesser price of $353. I immediately added it to my cart. I had not yet received my bike yet at this point. I got back to my house 2 hours later and went to purchase my wife her bike but when I went to purchase the bike in the cart the price jumped back up to $379 even though it still showed $353 in the cart. I then contacted customer service to see why this was happening. They were very rude from the start of our conversation. They continued to gaslight every question I was asking. They then requested I send them screenshots of what I was trying to explain‚Ä¶. So I did. I was then put on hold for 15 minutes. When she came back ‚ÄúCS‚Äù she stated that in that two hour period the price had changed and had gone up. Never explaining why it still said the lower price in my cart. I then went back to my cart after getting nowhere with customer service. I then saw that they had adjusted the price in my cart on the same bike to $455 after our conversation. This company is corrupt from the top down to the bottom. Great way to appreciate a member of your store. Sorry for the long story. But if you can find what you are looking for at an alternative site such as ebay I suggest you do. I have never had an issue like this with eBay‚Ä¶ EVER.

Review Title: Amazon will steal your money and keep package
Review Text: My delivery was supposed to arrive on 3/19. The Amazon driver did not ring my doorbell but left the package outside. When I went to collect the package (saw on my ring camera) I realized the package that was delivered was actually for my neighbor across the street. I gave my neighbor my package and assumed my package was on another truck. I then realize that my delivery status was updated to delivered with a picture of my neighbors package. I contacted Amazon about this and they stated they weren‚Äôt responsible after delivery. The only problem was my package was never delivered so they should be responsible. I was then berated by one of the ‚Äúsupervisors‚Äù and told I was lying and couldn‚Äôt speak to anyone else. I was then bombarded with different emails from different representatives saying they weren‚Äôt responsible or I would need to show a picture of the incorrect package (I let them know that it was given to the right address so I wouldn‚Äôt be able to take a picture). After 3 days the last email I received stated that too much time had gone by and there was nothing else they could do. I‚Äôve been using Amazon for many years and I have never had a problem with them until now. I‚Äôm disgusted with how they treated the situation and I am now out of over $100 because they do not want to take responsibility for their drivers negligence.

Absolutely appalling customer service. Been an Amazon Customer for over 18 years, mostly without incident although there have been some hiccups along the way.  In mid Feb I ordered a Punkcase for iphone but got a case for Galaxy S9 instead. Initiated the returns process and sent that one back and got my refund and then ordered a new one. New one came OK ... but now have recieved email saying they want to "Recharge" me ¬£29.99 because   "I didnt return the iphone case but returned a Galaxy S9 case instead"  !!   Have spent the last 26 days going back and forward via email and phone calls and no-one seems to be able to sort this out. Last straw was today when I got talking to a "Customer Agent" who basically said that a "Specialist Team" will contact me within 72 hours via email and I will have to regurgitate the whole story all over again to them for the 4th time. Apparantly then are not allowed to contact the customer via phone.  What a terrible terrible way to treat your customers in 2023.  I am on the cusp of shutting down my Amazon Prime account, scrapping my Amazon Firesticks and dumping my Kindles in the bin if they cannot sort this out.  Will update in due course.UPDATE:  So ... basically they did respond to my issue .... email stating that they have reviewed the situation .... and understand my concerns ... but thier decision is final and they would "likely not respond to further emails about this issue"  !!!    How absolutely shabby is that for customer service !!    And they had the cheek to add that I can "continue to shop as usual on Amazon" !   I DONT THINK SO !!       I have now closed my Prime account, scrapped a couple of Firesticks and given away my Echo dots to family. I will Never shop at Amazon again.

Amazon suck,   when will we learn you get what you pay for. Finally finished with amazon account deleted.It sells cheap nasty products and cannot guarantee delivery now thinking a email saying it will arrive 3 days late is acceptable.  Not me I'm out.

Review Title: Amazon‚Äôs Customer Service is unable or‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon‚Äôs Customer Service is unable or unwilling to handle anything but very basic questions. Don‚Äôt fall for the ‚ÄúUnhelpful‚Äù Library, robo-chat etc for anything more. You‚Äôll just descend further into dead-end madness. I‚Äôve had return, refund, delivery, billing issues accrue for months while I bear losses.Some respectful suggestions: email the Executive Customer Relations Dept at (Trustpilot won‚Äôt allow addresses). Try Jeff at Amazon.My concerns were still blown off, but I got some insight. Delivery: ~38 carriers. If you have any issue, it‚Äôs YOUR onus as Customer to figure out which one supposedly delivered (Amazon Reps refused me that info), contact them, resolve it. With no recourse if you‚Äôre told, for example, their driver ‚Äúproved‚Äù a missing ~$450 delivery by their private Log stating they got a Required Signature. From an office Receptionist (my address is a private home.Refunds: be aware that if you select applying any back to your original Credit Card, Amazon can and will apply it to an Amazon Gift Card. That they opened for you/you may not know about, because Reps won‚Äôt readily tell you. I‚Äôve been chasing missing refunds for years; a Rep only very recently disclosed this.These 2 issues alone (there‚Äôs far more) lead to my ‚Äúbest‚Äù suggestion: shop online elsewhere. At least don‚Äôt pay for Prime membership, don‚Äôt apply for a Synchrony Prime card. (Their  CS is just as sketchy.) Good luck.

Review Title: BECAUSE I AND MANY OTHERS EXPRESSED‚Ä¶
Review Text: BECAUSE I AND MANY OTHERS EXPRESSED NEGATIVE OPINIONS ABOUT RACIST MOVIES PUSHED ON AMAZON, OUR COMMENTS HAVE BEEN ERASED (ABOUT ANY PRODUCT PRIOR TO MOVIES), AND PREVENTED FROM POSTING EVER AGAIN. Conversation with foreign dialect/accents is tough enough then add the stress brought about by personal and financial information in a world loaded with scammers and con artists. Prompt #5- THE LIVE PEOPLE THAT DIRECT YOU TO CONTACT CUSTOMER SERVICE,,, THEY ARE JUST THE CALL CENTER,,, CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THE NUMBER I CALLED THAT EVENTUALLY RETURNS TO THEM!WHEN YOU START GETTING LOUD BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT LISTENING WHEN YOU TELL THEM THAT DOING WHAT THEY TOLD ME TO DO DIDN'T WORK AND ASK "NOW WHAT?",,, THEY THEN HANG UP ON YOU. Review Title: Who is watching you, Amazon or Santa?
Review Text: So I filled out a survey a few days ago where you can earn points. The survey asked about past purchases so I selected hairdryer from the list. Wouldn‚Äôt you know it, the next screen wanted to know the brand and I couldn‚Äôt remember the name so I searched Google. About an hour later Amazon sends me one of their email adverts with a selection of hair dryers. Well, I thought are they tracking me? I was sure I had all tracking turned off so I called them and was told that if you search any site the cookies that are still on your device can be used by Amazon. The only alternative is to Block All Cookies. The thing is I always clear the cache which includes websites, data and cookies whenever I close my browser and I had just opened the app for the survey so that means Amazon is more powerful than Santa.

Pain in the ass on every ways with paying extra too.

Review Title: Customer service here is a joke
Review Text: I have been having issues with them, they keep shipping my order out to a different address. They keep saying its been delivered to the right place but on the tracker I can see the exact address they are shipping to. I have had issues with this constantly from them, the first time I had ordered I ended up getting real irritated because they were not understanding my issue or problem. They kept saying that I wont get a refund for a item I paid more than 150$ for, had to call like 10 times before I could get my refund. I am starting to rethink my choice of having a prime membership. At this point, it seems like their customer service is not going to get any better. I hope no one else has to go through the bad service issues I have had.Edit: They fixed my issue but this time it took around 20 calls. Almost all of the conversations I have had were very stressful because they continued to miss the problems that I had, they kept saying it was delivered without even checking. Review Title: Outsourcing to India a HUGE mistake! Poor Customer Service
Review Text: I've been with Amazon for years, and with PRIME.  They've always been very professional until today.  I'm a senior with disabilities and do all my shopping with Amazon because I can't/don't go out.  I had 2 items to return & had to speak to 4 agents & 1 supervisor with the same results in the end.  Disappointing service.  Amazon's delivery & pick up were very helpful to me but now they expect me to return by going to post office which I can't or to UPS & pay for return which I can't/won't pay for.  Today was horrible, I believe every single person I spoke to was East Indian & very rude!  Totally unacceptable.  I spend $150-$200 monthly plus subscriptions which I've cancelled all items & returning all the newest items, if I have to pay for a taxi to go to a post office I might as well return all their less than quality items.  I'm so disappointed, they were once an A+ service, now they're outsourced to India and very poor quality service with people you can't understand!  Once I've received my refunds, I'll be closing the account so no more stress ... reading their reviews has made me terrified! If you take the time to watch Jeff Bezos on youtube, he trained his staff to have the best customer service with the goal that the customer is always right...that is no longer the case and I bet he has no idea what's going on now, I'd be ashamed to be the owner or work for this place.

I strongly recommend that Amazon immediately cancel their contract with whomever is doing their customer service and hire a new team. DO NOT PROVIDE AMAZON WITH YOUR CREDIT CARD OR DEBIT INFORMATION. Review Title: Amazon tried to charge my inactive account without my consent or knowledge
Review Text: I have used Amazon a handful of times over the last decade and have not used it in over 2 years at this point.Out of the blue they tried to charge me with a prime subscription without my consent, permission or even knowledge. My account was inactive for over 2 years, I had changed card since then and they still managed to charge me 8.99.When I asked customer service they told me because I was on some kind of linked account I was being charged. My partner has Amazon prime however she pays for it herself and has done since before we met, we have NEVER linked accounts and again, for emphasis, Amazon tried to charge me without my consent or permission for a product I never signed up for. The only reason I noticed is due to my banking app.Amazon is devolving into a purely criminal enterprise, literally just reaching into people's pockets to see if they can stealth charge them without their knowledge.I am appalled that this practice is even legal let alone adopted by Amazon. What a terrible company. I have cancelled my account, all of the cards on it and will be disputing the charge.How can you charge people for a service with no consent taken or even a notification.Disgusting.

Review Title: Shipping issues and fraudulent activity seems to be the new normal
Review Text: Used to be great. The company is completely going down the drain service wise. First off, I‚Äôve never had so many issues with shipping until recently. They now use USPS for shipping and they are the worst! They literally lie about attempting to deliver and get away with it with no solutions offered after the fact. I‚Äôve had this happen 3 times now and I work from home. They‚Äôll say an item is being delivered then all of a sudden the status changes to attempted delivery when no one ever came to my door. Never used to happen when they solely used their own drivers. Getting in contact with them is also a nightmare trying to get it reshipped. If that‚Äôs not bad, reaching out to the customer service line is a complete joke now and operations seem sketchy. We used Amazon for our baby registry recently and received some gift cards we put on our account to be used later. Fast forward to the next day I get an email about 100 dollars of the gift cards being used for a PlayStation gift card. A) we don‚Äôt have any gaming systems. B) I didn‚Äôt even receive an email to approve or deny an unknown login like I always do when I sign in. I called customer service twice about this and get the same answer that someone will call me back in 2 days and no one ever does. The only thing I get is a bogus email stating they believe someone accessed my account and they have taken steps to ensure my account is safe and that the gift card funds will be reimbursed in 2-3 days. It‚Äôs been over a week now and no call back and the gift card isn‚Äôt reimbursed. Wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if this was some shady internal thing going on at the rate this company is going. We just want our money back. It used to be so easy calling in and getting a resolution in one phone call, now it just a joke and complete waste of time and no one actually cares about your issues.

Review Title: Impossible to log in with new number
Review Text: The reason for this 1-star review is just one crucially important bug: it is impossible to log in if you've changed your phone number. Here is how I try to do it:1. I press log in.2. I enter my email address (or old phone number)3. I enter my password4. Sometimes (at least on the computer page) I have to re-enter the password and then the interpret characters from a photo for "extra safety."5. I page shows up where Amazon says they've sent an OTP to my old phone number.6. I press resend after 60 seconds to see if they can send it to another phone number or email address instead, but that isn't possible.7. I press the "I need help"/"contact customer support" button below.8. I have to select one of four problems: forgot my password, password not working, no account but still need help, cannot create an account.9. I try anyone of the top two, but they still require me to confirm my phone number.10. I try any on of the bottom two, or just contacting customer support directly, but you have to log in to do that (and thus confirm your phone number).11. I consider calling, but I live in Europe and don't want to spend insane amounts of money on a phone call I don't even believe will help.12. I write this review in hope that Amazon will respond here. Can they really have let such an obvious error slip past? I googled of course and couldn't find any solution to it.

Review Title: Dreadful delivery people and zero customer service outsourced to India.
Review Text: Our two hundred dollar package was delivered 3 days earlier originally scheduled date. Amazon driver did not buzz my unit, so we had no way of knowing he is coming. Next, instead of going upstairs and leave package beside our door, driver left the box in the lobby of 12 story building and left. Now Amazon says they delivered to the correct address (lobby that is, I don't live in the lobby of 12 story building). So, we have no cameras in the lobby, package was stolen. I didn't know about that delivery until the next day, Amazon didn't send any notifications of delivery nor emails so when I accidentally opened Amazon website to check if my product was shipped it said DELIVERED!!! I ran downstairs to the lobby, obviously there was nothing because it's Wednesday and delivery date was yesterday on Tuesday. Now Amazon says open police report, we did that 18 days ago, police report have been concluded but Amazon says they can't reach police to check the case. I emailed police department and got response within 24 hours. Amazon representative with Indian name and English worse than mine said he can't reach police department they aren't answering phone. Imagine that heh a Vancouver police department in a city of 3 million people doesn't answer phone calls :) I emailed again saying maybe email them like I did, Amazon have not replied yet. It's been 18 days I am dealing with the stolen package. Amazon doesn't refund nor send replacement. I am a prime member until next membership renewal, no more for me. Amazon is a sinking ship if they don't change their outsourced horrible customer service and drivers that damage or steal packages.

Review Title: Don't count on getting your delivery on time.

On multiple occasions, we have had to wait to ask for a refund and then repurchase, only to find a higher price on the same item. The customer service is a joke, there is no real concern for the consumer. The live agents are simply reciting from a textbook, and offering a meager credit to use on a future order. "Just throw money at the problem and it will go away", no real attempt to fix the problem.

Review Title: Conned into signing up for Amazon Prime. BEWARE!
Review Text: I don‚Äôt like Amazon because they advertise things for sale that are out of stock. I had a very bad experience just over a year ago when I bought a book. Like many people I ticked free postage.BEWARE! If you click Free Postage you will inadvertently sign up for Amazon Prime.I did not know I had done this until I had to change my bank card because of a security scare. I then had a phone call from Amazon saying they could not process my Amazon payments. I was horrified and thought it was a scam. I then rang the real Amazon and they told me I had signed up to Amazon Prime. I was appalled and cancelled my Amazon Prime account.I gave the card number of the expired card which was safe to do.  I then received a phone call from BT saying my call to Amazon had cost ¬£80.BT refunded half of this as a goodwill gesture. Beware of signing up to Amazon Prime if you click Free postage. I lost several payments of ¬£7.99 and ¬£40 so lost about ¬£80. Disgusting company who are conning and tricking people into signing up for Amazon Prime. I tried to download a kindle app the other day but discovered I could only use the app to read a book if I buy the book off Amazon. No chance!Other thing I hate about them: you can‚Äôt use PayPal.

Review Title: Does not reliably deliver on delivery promises, questionable products from big name brands
Review Text: This review is based upon a continued worsening of service from Amazon. We have been doing business with Amazon since late 2016, and had mostly satisfactory service from them until the pandemic happened. Our biggest problem is a failure to deliver products on time, if at all. For example. I was just informed for the 4th time in a single week that an order was going to be late, or as with the one I was just informed of, completely undeliverable. This used to happen on occasion, but now happens regularly. Dealing with customer service is just some customer service rep repeating a sentence, phrase or paragraph from the "how to get rid of (choose your own descriptor) customer as quickly as possible with as little help/work as possible" book they must all be handed the second they are hired. The second problem we regularly deal with, from day one, is receiving faulty, fake, knock-off, etc. products from "big brand" names, such as Energizer (entire 12-pack of CR2450 batteries that were bad), Wrangler (jeans that look like factory rejects, buttons sewed in wrong spot, horrible dye jobs), so on and so forth. That problem was easily solved, only order the cheap knock-off items from Amazon, that way you know what to expect. We order the name brand stuff from Walmart, and those orders rarely arrive late and/or in bad condition.We have tried to be understanding of the problems going on in the world, but we pay for the prime membership mainly for the free two-day shipping promises, and Amazon just cannot deliver on that any longer. Also, if they are able to pull my money immeditately upon "placing order", then I shouldn't have to wait 5 business days for a return of my $71 for an order that became "undeliverable" on the day it was supposed to be delivered. We cancelled the membership today, and decided to leave a review here, not necessarily to try to hurt Amazon, but to make future customers aware of problems they will likely run into.

Liars. I can buy what I need from numerous other sources, but I chose Amazon because I was promised next day delivery. The only difference was the delivery time. 3 days later, my order isn't here- and I needed it yesterday. If Amazon can't keep their word, they are no good. I'm done considering them as an option. Fast shipping is no advantage, if they just lie and make excuses.

We ordered toilet paper and Amazon sent us diapers instead.We were not interested in the diapers and wanted our toilet paper. Unfortunately the toilet paper price almost doubled and Amazon refused to honor the agreed upon price on the toilet paper and will charge us a fee to pick up the diapers.

Review Title: Accused of misconduct and denied appeal.
Review Text: My set of Evo headphones came in an open box with one earpiece torn off. It did not look like the set I ordered but rather looked like it had been a returned item and did not look like the item I ordered. I examined it and tried to get the earpiece on. But it wouldn't stay on and was slightly ripped at a seam.I sent it back and asked for a refund but received an email  message that I returned the wrong item and to return the correct item. I sent back the very item I received and they say I sent back the wrong item and am still going to be charged for the item I ordered even though they are two different things ( confirmed by the email). They followed to say I may be banned from ordering from Amazon if I do not return the correct item. What the actual.......?Buyer beware.And don't assume your$120 Amazon Prime account gives you the protection that they claim.I have, of course,  appealed the decision. Immediately I was sent an email stating there would be no appeal process, the decision was final. I was denied an appeal and accused of the misconduct of sending back an item other than what was sent to me. I am being charged for the item ordered but not received. This isn't the first time I have received damaged items or even the wrong item from Amazon. The customer service is getting worse. The membership is going up. Now they have the item they sent me and are still going to charge me. Isn't that theft?

I just have a regular account at Amazon.  Each time I order stuff I pay for it with gift cards, and my Debit card.  The last four times my bank has called me about fraudulent charges or some clown from India or Pakistan called saying I made a purchase on my Prime Account, which I don't have for $1900. or some like amount.  First, how did they get my phone number, secondly they have my name and address because I didn't give it to them.  The thing that pisses me off is each time they do this the bank kills my debit card and issues a new 1 which can take up to 10 days unless you opt to pay $25 for express delivery cause the nearest branch is 200 miles away.  When I called Customer Service to ask about the possibility of a data breach the nutjob had no IDEA of what I was talking about.  So I asked if there was a security person or someone with a little more knowledge he said there was no one around so I asked for a supervisor but he couldn't find one of them either. If this happened just once, no big deal. But 4 times and for them to act as if it isn't anything, give me a break!  I can't be the only one! I had been using a reloadable Debit card but this time I was purchasing A Laser which cost $467 I used my regular card and today about a week after I received it I get a call from 530 562-9742 saying they show I purchased some apple crap for $1900 which I would never do cause I hate apple and all of their overpriced products.  The nutjob I spoked to at Amazon was Ben, totally useless.  How do they get the info if someone is not feeding it to them?  I guess Amazon doesn't want people to know their info is at risk?  So they act as if it not a big deal and tell you to contact your bank to report fraud only after your bank has contacted you because the shipping address or not all the info is correct.  I wish they would let me use PayPal cause I would feel a lot more secure.  Guess I just will stop doing business with Amazon, can't take these breaches!

The pack with 2 monitors and a stand was cheaper than just one monitor plus the stand, which seemed suspicious. As I should have expected, only one monitor (and the stand) arrived. I contacted Amazon and learned that this was a typo (only 1 monitor was intended), but they honored the order anyway and shipped a second monitor for free. Amazon customer service is empowered to fix problems, unlike customer service in most companies. This is a typical Amazon experience, despite the bizarre rating on this page.

Review Title: The worst customer service on Earth
Review Text: I returned an order on 31st December 2022, it was actually collected by Royal Mail. Through tracking information I established that it was delivered back to Amazon  on 7th January 2023.Amazon sent me an email later that month to advise me that I would get a retrocharge if I didn't return it.  I spent hours over several phone calls trying to resolve the matter, yet believing it was sorted out I still got a retrocharge of ¬£60 on 6th February.  I made more calls, twice having the phone put down on me.In the end, they advised me that I would have to answer 6 questions to get my money back.  I did so, but they later claimed they hadn't received the email, so I sent the six questions again.  I still had to call another two times and I finally got my ¬£60 back on 7th March. So after nearly 17 years of being a customer, I will now learn to do without this unbelievably incompetent company.

Review Title: We ordered a "brand name vacuum." It‚Ä¶
Review Text: We ordered a "brand name vacuum." It arrived with no brand name on the box, on the vacuum, or on the instruction booklet. We then noticed that the vacuum we ordered was reduced in price the following week by almost $90. We called customer service to ask that they give us the difference, because it makes no sense for us to send it back, just to purchase the item again at a lower price. They refused. We sent the item back, and will no longer be purchasing items through Amazon. Bad business practice.

The Amazon representative stated that since the weight of the box was correct when shipped, the problem is with the shipper or receiver.  I explained that when I picked up the Amazon package the box was intact and the Amazon seal unbroken.I find it frustrating that Amazon cannot accept that their scaling system may have made an error. The only other possibility is that I am lying in an attempt to receive free product, which is extremely insulting. I have been a loyal Amazon customer for years.Paul

Review Title: They delivered my package to a random‚Ä¶
Review Text: They delivered my package to a random house in my neighborhood. It was marked as delivered to the correct address so they will not issue a refund. Immediately after I received the notification that my package was delivered, I messaged customer service and let them know the package was not delivered. I asked if they could retrieve the package. They told me that I would be contacted within 24 hours. They never did. I asked why and they told me that my email address needs to be updated. After all of this, they finally tell me that they will not refund me for their mistake and they would not attempt to retrieve the package. So basically they just stole my money. Even though I was literally standing on my front porch waiting for my package, I have security cameras with a dvr, I had a package delivered a few days earlier and the delivery photo is obviously of 2 different places, they refuse to take accountability for their mistake. Amazon does not care that people don't get their items as long as they get paid. Also, they throw (not toss, not slide, not stack) your packages around while they load them. They will literally stack a wall of packages and then will throw other packages over the wall of boxes they stack. Doesn't matter if it's breakable. They don't care. I worked there. I witnessed this first hand. It's a common practice for loading their trucks

Review Title: Amazon's sells products just can't deliver them
Review Text: It has become very apparent that Amazon is allowing more and more vendors that are scam artists list on their sites. And I get why they do it as there is millions of dollars that they get to hold on to of people's money while you wait to process an order that's never going to ship and then go through the process in order to get a refund from Amazon. They obviously know about it and are continuing that process. So in the end you may or may not get any product you order from them and if you don't get the product they will certainly put you through all the steps in order to get your refund while they're hanging on to your money. This is become an ongoing issue with them ordering product, being told it's been delayed, waiting, waiting, waiting and then being told it's not going to arrive at all. I'm sure they're making millions of dollars a month off of consumers who don't track their orders or at the very least being able to hold on to consumers money for quite some time while they continue to delay and order that's never going to actually come. It's obviously their choice what vendors they allow to list on their site and in the end they're making their problem our problem and trying to speak to somebody from Amazon about it is absolutely impossible. So buyer beware Amazon is becoming the new Facebook marketplace.

Review Title: As a subscriber to Amazon Prime Video‚Ä¶
Review Text: As a subscriber to Amazon Prime Video for over a decade, I have to say that I am thoroughly impressed with the service. The streaming platform has an extensive library of movies and TV shows, including a wide range of genres and languages, so there is always something new and interesting to watch. The user interface is intuitive and easy to navigate, and the video and sound quality is top-notch. I also appreciate the fact that Amazon Prime Video produces its own original content, which is often of very high quality and offers something new and different from the usual programming. Over the years, the service has added more and more benefits, including free and fast shipping, access to music, and other exclusive offers. The best part is that Amazon Prime Video allows multiple users to stream at the same time, so my family and I can watch different shows on different devices without any issues. Overall, I highly recommend Amazon Prime Video to anyone looking for a quality streaming service with a great selection of content, additional benefits, and a long-standing reputation for excellence.

I am a seller on Amazon uk. Re a loss over ¬£300. Beware of delays when selling to customers abroad. Your goods can be delayed by customs. Amazon will not reimburse you for the loss, in fact, they will ignore any correspondence. Not only that Amazon's selling fees are horrendous, approximately 20%. This is how Bezos finances his space flights and all the rest of his money wasting projects.

Review Title: If I could leave a negative star‚Ä¶
Review Text: If I could leave a negative star rating, I would. They have MAJOR PROBLEMS with their system! I had ordered a CPAP pillow last week, paid for it, received it with absolutely no problems. Then three days later I received an email telling me my payment was declined. Of course, I was confused to what was going on; I  didn't have to dig very long to see that a completely different order of the same CPAP pillow, made on my account with my name, and the reason they were saying my payment declined was bc they had used a credit card (marked as the default card for some reason) I had on the list of cards I've used in the past that no longer worked (I had closed the account a few months ago); this "order" even had an entirely DIFFERENT ORDER NUMBER! This is NOT a case of someone anonymously trying to scam a free CPAP pillow; this is a case of THEIR SYSTEM making a random second order for some strange reason, and even tried to collect payment for it a SECOND TIME! And no, I of course did not authorize or was even aware of this! Actually, this has happened twice before, and I of course contacted them immediately and explained what was going on; the customer service rep didn't know really what to say or do about it, as she is just an employee earning a paycheck. But she would not let me speak to a supervisor or anything! She did not do anything about it, and how is a person expected to feel safe shopping on their site when they make random multiple orders at the person's expense? All I can say is I think IT'S A VERY BIG DEAL, and I'm not done making "noise" about it either! I hope everyone reads this, bc it's bad enough with all thieves and scammers out there, but you also need to worry about these huge shopping websites (Amazon has been around a long time and they're supposed to guarantee that you're safe) making random repeated orders and taking your money, probably hoping you won't notice? They've gotten too big for themselves and something is going on with them! I'd watch out with Amazon if I were you!!

Review Title: About to buy firestick which was on‚Ä¶

Tried to sort out via text chat at Amazon was told "nothing can be done but credits last 3 months so keep checking back see if item goes on offer again"Tried to escalate complaint was then given run around from person to person. Asked for manager was told already talking to manager who offered me a solution: buy item at now price then contact Amazon when it arrives then manager will credit my account with ¬£10. I asked why not put ¬£10 credit on account now so I'm not having to ask for ¬£10. Told can't "sorry".Gave up with text chat phoned up Amazon spoke with a human and got it sorted within half hour. Don't waste your time with text chat go straight to phone or better still shop elsewhere!

I can't believe how many times I've complained to Amazon customer support, Amazon delivery, and a few Amazon delivery supervisors. How GOD. DAMN. HARD. IS IT TO READ AND FOLLOW BASIC INSTRUCTIONS?? I've had 10 packages in a row not here at all or get here late because people cant follow basic instructions. The best part about the current situation I'm having is that the item I'm waiting on was a replacement for one that was screwed up on Saturday LOL (they delivered 2 packages, to TWO SEPARATE DOORS, on TWO SEPARATE FLOORS in the wrong building?? Why?? If you're gonna mess up, AT LEAST mess up at ONE. DOOR.) I bought this new item with the refunded Amazon card money and I STILL DIDNT GET IT. I live in an apartment complex so in my delivery instructions I have -- I live in the small building, not the big one. Please deliver package to the small building. Please call ((my phone number)) when arrived. If I do not answer, it means I am at work and you can leave the package on the porch as a camera records 24/7 The Amazon support people also put down instructions -- Customer lives in the small building in the back parking lot. Please call ((my phone number)) upon arrival. If customer does not answer, it means she is at work and you can leave the package on the porch. There is a camera that is always recording. Please do not attempt delivery before 5pm, as the customer works until that time Monday-froday Oh and guess what?? The delivery customer service people ALSO left basic instructions -- Customer lives in the small building, not the big one. Please call ((my phone number)). If customer does not answer, it means she is at work and you can leave the package on the porch. Please do not deliver until after 5pm on monday-friday I don't understand how anyone could possibly simplify it more. Why can't people read?? This never used to be a problem. They used to always deliver it. Sometimes it would even be in front of my apartment door! Educate your god damn driver's Amazon. Make it a requirement for them to be AT LEAST at an intermediate reading/comprehension level. My 4 year old nephew is better at following instructions than these people are.

Review Title: I ordered a transmission control module‚Ä¶
Review Text: I ordered a transmission control module for a 2011GMC 3500hd on December 19, 2022. This is now February 14, 2023. Have not received this item yet and according to the manufacturer‚Äôs own site ‚Äúthis item is on back order and we don‚Äôt know if or when it will be available.‚Äù This part is on back order from GMC, has been for over 9 months and is unavailable in the United States, Canada, and Mexico. I have tried 5 times to cancel this order, Amazon will not stating ‚Äúthis order is in the shipping stage and cannot be cancelled.‚Äù They have extended the shipping date 3 times and then place a hold on my debit card for the amount ($315) tying up my money until it finally drops off two weeks later. I am on a fixed income and have had to transfer $ from savings and had money transferred from my credit card to cover bills while my funds were tied up. Trying to reason with customer service is a waste of time, all they do is read off of a script, if they can be understood. Solution-‚Äúwhen the part arrives, refuse it and we will process a refund in 4-6 weeks ‚Äú I asked for a supervisor and was informed that non are available. No further options available and no one will read this and that might have a lick of common sense, that might be able to see that ‚Äú this part is unavailable‚Äù. I have since traded this truck in on a new one so I have no need for this part. They might think that was a legitimate reason for canceling the order but not so. I have no idea what to do next.

Review Title: I've been an Amazon Prime member for a‚Ä¶
Review Text: I've been an Amazon Prime member for a long time.  And in all that time, I've witnessed and experienced a progressive erosion in the quality of service provided by, and an increased lack of professionaIism, diligence, understanding, and/or intelligence on the part of Amazon's Customer Service staff.  Today was the worst, most nightmarish experience yet.  I had to return a malfunctioning Fire TV.  Everything went smoothly until I received the replacement TV today.  It arrived without a remote, power cord, or legs. Now whether or not I was supposed to KEEP those parts from the TV I returned, I have no idea.  None of the reps I dealt with at the time said anything of the sort.   So I spent over 3 hours on the phone or chat with Amazon trying to figure out the easiest way to get a TV that was complete and works.  I was transferred to various individuals (11 at last count -- and I was disconnected or cut off from THREE of those) all saying they would fix the problem to my satisfaction.  However, nothing ever ever happened and the only solution that they could ultimately come up with is for me to return THIS TV as well, and they'd issue a refund (when they're good and ready). Some of the suggestions provided by some of the agents were frankly ludicrous.  One actually suggested that I go online (on Amazon, of course) and order the missing parts, purchase them, and then request a REFUND for those items FROM Amazon! When I asked if she could provide me those item numbers (since she was supposedly affiliated with their "special" Fire TV unit), or better yet JUST SEND ME those missing parts, she simply ignored my request.  Especially when I asked why she thought it would be acceptable for me to PAY again for something that should have been included WITH the TV to begin.Anyway, towards the end of all of this, having hit the end of my patience, the reps wouldn't even listen to me, went into some spiel about how they are entitled to terminate their calls, which several of them did.  The follow-up emails I received were just as abrupt and helpless/hopeless.  So I'm sitting here with a TV that is no use to me; waiting for UPS to pick it up to return it.  And then -- once Amazon in Lexington KY gets it -- I'll have to wait a good month or longer to see a penny of what I've paid.  Frankly, I'm not holding my breath.  I've read the postings here from people who PURPORTEDLY work for Amazon's Customer Support.  One says that most of their reps are located here in the US.  Color me suspicious, but I highly doubt it.  One also says they DO have a bit of autonomy and flexibility regarding what they can and cannot do for a customer.  Again, color me doubtful:  all I was told over and over again today (from 95% of those I spoke to or dealt with) is essentially their hands are tied, and they are limited to what they can or cannot do based on their systems and its policies.

God... no comments. I made a very expensive purchase on Amazon from an original brand seller. In the end, I received a very used item, you could tell by many aspects. So Amazon offered me a return, but for some magical reason I couldn't bring it to my local Amazon fresh, but only Ervi, and that's it, from the 28th of Jan, my nightmare started. Ervi provided me with a receipt with an invalid tracking number, so neither I nor Amazon couldn't locate the parcel. At least at Ervi, you are talking to real robots, at Amazon you are talking to humans which are worst than robots. For almost 3 weeks, I was receiving misleading information that I am either getting a refund today, tomorrow I am not receiving it, contact Ervi, I have to wait 14 days and will get a refund, and in the end no, bla bla bla. Not only that people at Amazon are either rude or using pre-copied text messages. I even visited the shop where I dropped the parcel and a lady managed to get through to Ervi, Ervi couldn't locate it and said to contact Amazon. Amazon on that day told me 2 things, first get in contact with Ervi, report it as lost and we will give you a refund, second 14 days passed you will not get a refund. Hahahahha, my IQ dropped during these conversations dramatically. Thankfully, I have a proper bank, so I made a report and my bank will be dealing with these m*r*ns at Amazon. I am a customer of Amazon since 2017, and only after the pandemic, I started experiencing worse and worse deliveries in general. Either I am receiving used or broken things, or my parcels are simply lost. Amazon, Ervi, DPD you name it, deliveries are getting so much worse, it is better to get it by yourself.

Shopping on Amazon is among the worst online shopping experiences I have ever had. I've admittedly used this service for years in buying generic goods that are difficult to find in-person. It seems to me that, particularly lately, Amazon is flooded with very poor-quality knock-off products, and there is very little oversight as to whether the consumer receives a quality version of the product or a very poor reproduction. I've received books that are only a scanned image of the cover, used kitchen wares, completely different products than ordered, and other bizarre issues. I do appreciate that the return policy is generous; however, Amazon frequently replaces the product with the same erroneous product. To further this experience, when I try to pursue some sort of real solution, I am faced with an automated labyrinth of chat bots and short, unhelpful articles meant to pacify any complaints rather than fix them. I no longer trust Amazon to deliver the products I purchase. I will scour the internet trying to find items to buy from anywhere but Amazon.

Review Title: Delivery attempted - we ran into an issue when attempting your delivery (the new lie)
Review Text: After several years of primarily good experiences with Amazon (and them being my first port of call for all online orders) something has recently changed. In the last couple of months, Amazon drivers appear to be allowed to get away with the same lies that cowboy courier services indulge in, which is claiming that a delivery has been attempted when they have not bothered to knock, or follow simple instructions on the delivery notes. This has now happened with my last two orders in a row. High value items? Forget it. The new 'one time passcode' protocol is nothing but hassle every single time - if you live in an apartment, or flat, these are the orders that the drivers are most likely to lie about attempting to deliver and will simply walk away without trying (all for the cause of avoiding actually having to come to your door, or even calling you on the phone to come down and collect). If they can't dump it in reception they'll simply leave the premise without trying and lie on the tracking. Whether it's drivers lying, or system problems with Amazon that mean the driver is unable to accept your code, it's an absolute headache every time. I'm still waiting for my recent order - the driver lied about attempting to deliver yesterday. I called Amazon who scheduled a redelivery for the next day. However, last night my parcel was put out again for evening delivery (unbeknown to their system or tracker) - the driver actually came to my door this time. However, due to an Amazon customer service rep organising the redelivery for the next day, the 'one time passcode' was no longer active and the driver was not able to hand me my parcel. What a joke - the parcel was right there but they refused to hand it over due to system errors and outright confusion. The standard of driver behaviour and quality of service has clearly taken a massive nosedive. Amazon Prime have now lost a loyal customer - no chance in hell I'll ever order a high value item from them again.

Quality and reliability of Amazon's services are going down. Especially shipping which is now terrible. Rarely on time, scheduled dates are almost always changed. Description "until 10pm" is clear sing that it will be late for a day in best case.

Review Title: Banned when trying to follow the rules
Review Text: I started selling on Amazon last year, but because of water damage in my warehouse, I had to dropship some of the orders I had previously received. I then closed all of my listings in order to organize my inventory. A few days later, I got a message from Amazon warning me that drop shipping may result in the cancellation of my account. I took it seriously and carefully studied the code of conduct and all the restrictions. They authorized my course of action, which called for shipping all of my product to Amazon's warehouse rather than doing it myself. I sorted my inventory over the course of 2.5 to 3 months with no action on my account.

Dead on arrival (new in box!) units that fail to power on Or even FIT in more recent issues.the 2 stars are for CS reps who try to help out. If they could understand me better, it might help. My English is great, but that‚Äôs all I got.  After so many falsely advertised/ poor QC debacles, one realizes the waste of time shopping there. Caveat emptor

Review Title: Amazon.com - double subscription with Amazon Uk.  Trying to get refund for double payments if they occurred.
Review Text: I‚Äôm a happy Amazon UK customer ( as I live in the UK). However a few years ago I accessed Amazon.com whilst in Houston.   Today I‚Äôve received an email saying my .Com subscription is up for renewal and to update my payment details. I was surprised, as I‚Äôve only just resubscribed to Amazon UK (¬£95).  I contacted customer service on my laptop ( can‚Äôt access on iPhone app).  The CS assistant was very helpful and cancelled future US subscriptions. I asked if she could go back on my account and see if other automatic payments I may have missed had gone through. She could not and referred me to raise it with my bank. I asked if I could see my payment history on Amazon.com page and told yes.   Looking at my history it doesn‚Äôt show any annual subscriptions.  So, either subs were not previously taken or subs were and I‚Äôm unable to see them.   If no subs previously taken by Amazon.com why the email to update my payment details?  I asked for an email to escalate my query to to be told not possible. How can a company as huge as Amazon have no way to escalate concerns/complaints?  This is not great customer service. If Amazon read this please get in contact. You must have .com payment history. As I said I‚Äôm a happy UK customer. Use Amazon a lot.  I don‚Äôt think it unreasonable to ask about past subscription payments and enquire about a refund for double payments.

Review Title: Amazon are a bunch of amateurs with no customer experiance, should avoid this company at all cost.
Review Text: I ordered over ¬£800 worth of items from amazon 30 + items on 18th January 2023 next day delivery, 4 items failed to turn up. Stayed in all day as did 4 of my house mates, no knock at door, had email confirmation to say items handed to resident !! Which was total lies by the driver.!!Amazon calling card stuck in between the 2 letter box flaps found the next morning. On the card there was no reference, no name, no item or order number, no driver details, no date,no time.. all it said was 'bin'. I went out side looked around bins and in bins and found no parcels !! Called Amazon customer services 30 + times now and 15 + emails for a refund of the items i paid for and not recieved, was told to report to my local police and get a crime reference number which i did, police were very helpful. Amazon say they tried calling the police but are put on hold and cannot contact police to verify the crime of supposedly stolen items( or failed delivery ) Amazon have told me to call the police to verify the crime reference, but the police won't reveal it to me over the phone as data protection and i am the victim, so god knows how amazon think how they will get my data !! So basically going round in circles day after day calling and emailing them like am at a circus talking to clowns at customer service. I called them this morning and chatted twice to customer service and they must have a note on my file to hang up as all 3 times i was cut off lol i wasn't rude in any way either!! I replied to some emails from last week which are just generic emails to explain again whats just happened and no response whats so ever... ( to be expected i guess ).Amazon biggest retailer in the world how professional of them!! I've twice sent emails to mangement and complaints processing which are advertised on amazon websites only to find my emails bounce back to me as emails don't exist lol its the same great help you get on the drop down menus on your account!!! Waste of time !!! So now am looking at financial ombudsman to complain to and then small claims court. When this is eventually resolved from these day light legal robbers i will close my account and use 'very company' and my old faithful 'Ebay' I'd advise everyone to boycott this uncaring , unprofessional company, bad customer service who use lying delivery drivers and on top of all that it would be nice when you call customer service and spoken to that they would be able to understand you and you could understand them !!!! Does anyone else have that problem of poor communication ? stick to honest reliable company's that you know. I rest my case. Good luck all and good to read all of your reviews, wish I'd read them before signing up to Amazon the clown outfit from rip off England.!!

A monitor and hand console requiring a pin no due to be delivered to the house.The pin no given but only the was delivered,Amazon refuse to accept that the monitor was not delivered despite clear evidence from the ring doorbell, the person who took delivery and the marked weight on the box that it should have weighed 2.7 kg- the parcel delivered was much smaller.They refuse to accept there must have been a mistake their end and after considerable back and forth in webchst and their customer service adviser hanging up, the supervisor was requestedHe insisted we report this to the police for a crime reference no, a police report and then they would investigate with the police and maybe issue a refund.When told the police are unlikely to investigate a ¬£140 monitor not delivered as they had other priorities and when asked for a copy of their policy which justifies this approach, we kept being parroted the same line over snd over and over without any escalation available to the next level.So we have duly filled out a theft report for what is most likely an error with their systems.For anything electrical or requiring a pin no, avoid Amazon and go to your local retailer.

Review Title: ZERO Stars for Amazon's Customer Service, especially those in the Philippines
Review Text: I would give Amazon's Customer Service, especially those in the Philippines, ZERO stars if it were an option.Amazon's Customer Service Agent used to be good and helpful, but it has gotten significantly worst nowadays. I was talking to a couple of Customer Service Agents and supposedly one Customer Service Supervisor from the Philippines. Both agents and supervisor were not only rude, but they also didn't care if I wanted to cancel my Amazon Prime Membership due to my frustrations with the issue at the time of the call. Some of these people don't have the honor your trust that we are accustomed to in the West, and when we try to arrange for a return, they blame the customers for having to return an item that doesn't serve our purpose and charge return fees. One of the reasons I buy from Amazon is because of the hassle-free and free returns, being a Prime Member.As an Amazon Customer, I think Amazon can better provide service by employing Customer Service Agents who are local rather than from other places in the world.Today, Feb 02, I called again and spoke with an agent, who hung up the phone. I called about an email dated Feb 01 that I saw today, and I wanted to find out why an Amazon specialist sent it to me. It's even more frustrating trying to reach Customer Service at Amazon.

Review Title: Amazon Prime has become a ripoff!
Review Text: Amazon Prime has gone downhill. I initially signed up for Amazon Prime several years ago when it was $99 per year because Amazon guaranteed I would have my items within 2 days of placing my order. I could rely on this, and if I ever failed to get my item on time, I could call and complain, and they would give me a month of free Prime. Today, it takes exactly one week to get my Prime items because Amazon waits five days to ship them. I called and complained, and they claim that I cannot have a refund for my Prime membership because I received expedited shipping on my orders. I can order from Walmart.com or anywhere else with paying a $140 premium and get my items in 2-3 days. My son who does not have Amazon Prime gets his items in the same amount of time. I was also a Prime seller on Amazon for a couple of years. Amazon made more money from my product than I did, and in many cases, Amazon took so much that I owed money. I have also read horror stories about how they treat their workers in shipping and receiving. I will be cutting ties with Amazon. I can't stand anything about this company.

Review Title: Literally the biggest shambles of lies‚Ä¶

Advisors lie and fob you off, none of them have a clue. I‚Äôm sure Amazon won‚Äôt miss my business and likewise I won‚Äôt miss their incompetence, lies and total grief that this shower manage to give out. Good riddence!

Review Title: I purchased an Exterior Heavy Duty‚Ä¶
Review Text: I purchased an Exterior Heavy Duty greenhouse in September.  It took until the 1st of November to completely get built and setup.  The temperatures were averaging mid 30s at nite and 50 to 60 degrees daytime.  After a few short weeks, I discovered all my plants were dead and we hadn't even reached freezing yet.  I immediately contacted Amazon.  To date we are at 2 plus months of trying to get a refund.  Each time I have had to call and spend hours trying to get resolution.  Their A to Z Team was to contact me each time and never did in anyway. 5 different calls from me at least.  The 2nd last Supervisor I spoke with approx 9 plus days ago told me that a claim had never been filed with their A to Z Team and this was why I never got a response.  She also told me not to deal with their supplier, that a claim would be issued in full within 7 days.  She also proceeded to give me 100 00 gift card for my frustration and trouble.  I never asked for this.  Please understand I lost several 1000 of dollars in plants.  I also spent 350.00 in labor to setup.  Along with  Clear silicone for sealing, heavy duty base tarp and pebbles, metal tables and I even placed an approved Green house clear tarp over the green house purchasing all but pebbles from Amazon.  It still failed.  When I first contacted I was within the 30 days from setup by the way. How can we know somethings no good until it's tried. My 1st call to them requested a full refund on greenhouse, the tarp, tables and labor as I was devastated.   The women told me no problem on recieving any of this...The last call was made yesterday to a supervisor/gentleman in their A to Z department. This man was not only rude and condescending he was threatening as well.  He made me feel like a crook for the monies given to me by Amazon for the horrible way they had handled things to date (gift cards when nothing happened on my claim)He would not acknowledge anything stated and promised to me prior.  I have been an excellent customer of Amazon's forgoing true stores for ease of access.  Never ever again.  The frustrations, lies ect are so not worth it if you have an issue.  This gentlemen stated that no refund would be issued as I only had 30 days to return and I would have to deal with their supplier.  Understand, that these items were purchased in good faith through Amazon.  I do not know their suppliers nor did I sign up to deal with them at this level.  Amazon needs to stand behind anything they promote and obviously this is not the case. So very sad and wrong Amazon.  Never ever again.

Review Title: Rude customer service who shouted and hung up on me
Review Text: I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the recent customer service experience I had with Amazon related to the AirPods Pro I purchased. The product exhibited defective sealing and was still within the return window. Despite this, the customer service representative I spoke with refused to offer any support and kept insisting that the return window had passed. This was clearly not true as I am still able to request a return label. I was hoping for a replacement for the product instead of a refund, which I thought Amazon would prefer.Further, the person I spoke with on the phone continuously talked over me, refusing to offer any explanation and hung up on me before I could seek any clarification. She clearly wanted to argue and sound forceful and controlling rather than supportive.This type of customer service is unacceptable and I demand that Amazon take appropriate action to address this issue. I expect a full refund for the product and a sincere apology for the experience I had to endure.I also expect Amazon to take appropriate corrective action to ensure this type of customer service is not repeated. This could include improved training for customer service representatives, better customer service policies, and better dispute resolution procedures.I look forward to hearing from Amazon about this matter as soon as possible.

Review Title: Item wasn't delivered or left outside plus terrible customer service
Review Text: My item was delivered to another house and  still don't know where it went, i spent half an hour in the cold trying to find the item in the garden. They often don't deliver right, leave it outside in a paper or cardboard envelope where it gets wet. On the times where u are in and they do knock, they run off leaving it outside, before you can receive the parcel and whether you are in or out it's just left, when u are out they send you an email to say it was handed to resident when it wasn't. The customer service is abysmal! It's impossible to get anyone on the phone and it took me over an hour and a half to get anyone one on the chat bots. Eventually a human in the internet chat offered me a voucher for my terrible experience to which a manager took over and reversed it and said it was tough but they couldn't give me anything. I made a complaint about their customer service and the reply to which I copy below. I since haven't received any refund for the item that wasn't delivered despite as advised requesting. Use this company at your peril. Yes it's slightly cheaper when you don't have any problems but once you take into the delivery costs there's not that much in it. Instead of a corporate entity that doesn't care about its customers Im now going to use independent reliable companies with a good reputation and I  don't mind paying a tiny bit more for.  U can get similar prices for books with forbidden planet where you can get someone on the phone if any problems and you can also shop around with Blackwell's, bookshop org, foyles, hive, Waterstones, wordery, whsmiths and world of books to name a few to try instead....Here's the reply to my complaint quoted from Amazon....HelloI'm Greeshma from Management team.I'm sorry to hear that you had an unsatisfactory experience when you contacted us previously and for any misunderstanding that may have occurred. We appreciate that you took the time to share your concerns about our customer service. I have passed your feedback along to the appropriate people in our company.I'm sorry to hear that you still haven't received your order #202-4980457-7937901, even though the tracking says it's been delivered.I can see that my colleague has issued a replacement for the item to the same address but it has been cancelled.If you'd like to receive a refund instead, please feel free to write us back.After reviewing our previous correspondence with you, please accept my apologies for any misunderstanding caused due to incorrect promise on goodwill gesture.This situation was the result of a human error, and I'm sorry for any inconvenience caused.We hope you'll understand that we can't offer you any concession in relation to this matter.Rest assured that we're striving to correct any inconsistencies in our processes and those of our carriers, and that your feedback is invaluable to us.I hope that you will allow us another opportunity to prove the quality of our service to you in the future.Warmest regards,Greeshma
