This morning (26-1-‚Äô23) I got an email with an invoice confirming they had charged me for an e-book I didn‚Äôt buy because according to Amazon‚Äôs records I owned it already. I cancelled the ‚Äòorder‚Äô with a request for refund. Amazon immediately started the refund-process. So far so good, were it not that Amazon (.com where my initial account is registered and all e-book purchases) removed the book in the library of my device (the one I already owned). As a frequent customer of Amazon's very 1st hour I loved shopping there (mainly books, paper versions & e-books). Its Customer Service used to be excellent. It was approachable by email, people working there understood what the problem was. Now it turned into a sheer nightmare. There is a chat option which is a complete waste of time. Spent exactly 2 hours reading hollow niceties such as ‚ÄúI really apologize for the inconvenience‚Äù and ‚ÄúI understand your concern regard the e book‚Äù and repeated ad nauseum, but the person was unable to offer a solution because he/she just didn‚Äôt understand what the issue was. After exactly 2 hours I stopped the chat because I had to attend a meeting.  A company that sells products under its own responsibility should have a well-functioning customer service. Refunds are not always the only solution. In my case I want to know where the (paid for) ebook is I bought a couple of years ago. The amount Amazon refunded today is the amount they charged me yesterday. Not for the book I already had and which they removed today. Just imagine a transaction with a much higher-priced product and a de facto defunct customer service. Inadmissible practices, Amazon!

I am waiting for an order that was supposed to be delivered on Monday.  No show. It is now Thursday and an update says I will receive it tomorrow or Saturday and to call if I don't receive it and want a refund.  Seriously?  I checked the tracking and the seller shipped it immediately.  It has been delayed in shipping twice.  As of 3:30 this morning, it was in a facility about 20 miles away, (it was only 75 miles away yesterday morning,) yet it doesn't show out for delivery.  Why not?  I had other sites where I could order this, and chose Amazon because of the delivery date.  They lied to me.  If I cancel this, I will have to start all over again and wait longer.  The seller fulfilled their commitment, and this is all on Amazon.  I am not impressed, and am done with them.

Review Title: There‚Äôs a reason why there are two‚Ä¶
Review Text: There‚Äôs a reason why there are two extremes of reviews for Amazon. As a long time Amazon customer, spending almost $10,000 a year, I have plenty of experience.Purchases sold by Amazon direct are well supported, very easy to deal with and more than fair refund policies for returns. Five stars any day. The problem is with Amazon resellers. Amazon does not manage their resellers well. And the resellers will do everything they can to hide the fact that they are resellers. Exorbitant restocking fees are never mentioned, even though the product description says it is qualified for returns. Amazon should be mandating that resellers clearly state any limitations on the return of their products so that buyers can make an informed decision. Until that time, my future usage of Amazon is going to be greatly diminished.

I recently was prompted to sign up for Prime for 30 days free & then I placed my order which was going to take 3 days to get to me which is unacceptable.I called them the next day and the agent tells me that I will now get it in 2 days.So on the the next day I check the tracker and my parcel is still in transit, so basically I have been lied to by Amazon.I get my parcel from Amazon after 72 hours so I call them to comp the order. The agent says that she can comp half the cost and I tell her that I want it comped for 100% of the cost.So I ask for a supervisor and he won't do anything about it. He tells me that I have been given a $5.00 credit (whoopee) and that is it.I will never sign up for Prime as the delivery times are garbage and it is not worth $10 per month.Amazon has gotten so cheap and if they give you a $5 credit they think that they are doing you a big favour.Boycott Amazon! They are garbage!Amazon has degraded itself to the bottomfeeder category where Walmart already is. Sad to say but Amazon has gone from good to really bad for both customer service and delivery times!

Review Title: Amazon sales can end while you're in the middle of trying to buy the item
Review Text: I am extremely disappointed with Amazon's sale price policies. I had seen an item I wanted on sale recently, but I missed the sale. As a result, I was watching closely to catch it on sale again. This morning I saw that it was on sale again at the price I was willing to pay. I clicked on "add to cart" and went to check out. Sometime between when I found the sale price and when I went to check out, the price had increased by more than 20%. When I contacted customer service about this, their response was basically "tough luck, you missed the sale". After I gave up on getting it from Amazon at that price, I Googled the item to see if I could find it cheaper elsewhere. Right at the top of the results was an ad for Amazon with the item listed at the price I wanted, but when I clicked on it the price on their site was still the higher price. When I contacted their customer service again to point this out, there response was that they don't honor any price advertised anywhere else besides our site. I thought they had some input on the prices advertised on Google. I'm sure they pay Google for higher rankings in the search result, so to me it seems like false advertising.

Policies are built for entrapment. After fraudulent activity occurred right before Christmas whoever got in my account changed my password. It became a password war of sorts with the scammer. Got TOTALLY locked out of my account. I called customer service multiple times for help & was given the runaround. I once was told I could answer some security questions over the phone but if I got even 1 answer wrong would have to start all over with a different customer service person. These questions were not typical security questions. They asked stuff like when did I join Amazon (have had the account for years so I couldn't answer correctly), they asked for expiration dates & last 4 digits of 2 credit cards I had stored as payment methods, and what was the last thing ordered, etc. Stuff of that nature. Wasted time on that since they don't tell you until the end of the questions whether or not you missed any or not. Nobody could help me get back into my account. The last call I tried to just cancel my account & was told they couldn't do it over the phone & that I could login to my account & do it. They wanted me to log in to an account that they couldn't help me get back into & offered no additional help.Now they're sending emails telling me that my "last order has been cancelled and I need to login to get my account straight". I haven't ordered anything & I think have had all the cards that were on there cancelled. Seems to be set up to try to keep me paying for a service I can't even use bc if their inability or desire to actually help. Still stuck. I do not recommend to anybody. Not even my worse enemy. When they "removed" the fraudulent transactions from my account, my bank told me it was never reversed on their end & that I needed to call Amazon again. So I ended up having to eat the fraudulent charges. I'm still trying to recover. In the end, I'm confident they'll learn about karma & they will get theirs. I know I can't be the only one they've done like this.

I've rarely had issues with Amazon prior to this, but I have cancelled my prime membership and closing out my Amazon credit card account and I will NEVER use Amazon again. After realizing I needed a cable to connect to a conference at 10am the next morning, I purchased this item specifically because it had next morning delivery, even adding two other items I did not need to be above the $25 threshold for the 4am-8am delivery. I woke up at 6 because I didn't want the package sitting out front after sunrise only to find the item hadn't shipped yet. After waiting until 9am, only because the order had changed to 'preparing to ship' before I raced to Walmart and purchased the item. Later, the order delivery time changed to between 5pm & 10pm, so I used the Amazon assistant to cancel the order, but received a message saying that it might be too late to cancel. Shortly after I got an email saying it was too late to cancel. I then used the messaging system and after initially being told the same thing by 2 employees, I was put in touch with a supervisor who told me he contacted the warehouse to cancel order. A short time later I saw that the item now showed 'shipped' but still had delivery window of 5p to 10pm. This time I requested a call back, and after wasting approximately 45 minutes trying to explain that because it had not arrived in the promised timeframe, I was forced to purchase it already and since I had only purchased it because of early morning delivery, even adding items I did not need to be eligible, asking for order to be cancelled was not an unreasonable request. The two employees and 'supervisor' I spoke with were not helpful and even rude, telling me the item had shipped (but wouldn't arrive for another 5-9 hours), they could not cancel order. I know for a fact that they can contact drivers because of a previous missed delivery where they contacted driver to complete delivery the same night. But all attempts to cancel this order were denied, telling me I would either have to track the order and be out front when truck arrived to refuse delivery or waste my time to return item. The order was delivered at 7pm, I tried tracking, checking about every 5 minutes, but somehow after seeing 6 deliveries before mine, when I next checked back it showed delivered. I was not asking for anything outrageous, they failed to meet the promised delivery window, which is THE ONLY REASON I MADE PURCHASE, even adding two items for my dog in order to get order above $25, this shouldn't have been an issue. I'm finished with Amazon, if they fail to respect or appreciate their customers, I will take my business elsewhere.

Review Title: Amazon Delivery doesn't really know how to deliver anything
Review Text: I have been a loyal amazon prime customer for years. I ordered an XTERRA 4500 Treadmill on January 9th, 2023 and paid the additional $99 for assembly and room of choice delivery. On January 13th, a third party delivery service "JB Hunt" Arrived at my door, and the delivery drivers informed me that the treadmill was too heavy to take upstairs, and offered to leave it in the garage. I informed them that I had paid for the room of choice service, and they said to contact Amazon to establish different delivery options. I called Amazon that day, spending more than 3 hours on the phone being transferred between multiple departments from account services, to heavy and bulky, to home services. During that phone call, the customer service representative in Heavy and Bulky assured me that Jb Hunt had no right to refuse delivery because I had paid for room of choice, and the treadmill only weighed 213 lbs. He assured me that if I reschedule the delivery, they will redeliver it, and that he could not change the delivery company. Consequently, I rescheduled the delivery for Wednesday, January 18th. On that day,  The same Jb Hunt driver arrived and informed me that they could not take the treadmill up the stairs. I contacted Amazon for a second time and Amazon apologized profusely and provided me a 20% discount for my inconvenience issued as a gift card, And reassured me again that Jb Hunt should have delivered the package, and rescheduled a 3rd re delivery attempt for the following day. On January 19th, Jb Hunt did not even bother to show up. Instead, the order was cancelled, unilaterally and marked fraudulently by Jb Hunt and marked as undeliverable for lack of access to the front door, which is NOT true. I called Amazon, and they informed me that I could fill out a special form with their heavy and bulky department that would specify that I do not wish Jb Hunt to deliver products to me anymore, and to re-order the treadmill. After filling out that form, and attempting to re-order the treadmill, I found that Amazon refused to give me the 20% discount on the 2nd order for my inconvenience. Honestly, after 9 hours of waiting through their delivery windows, and spending more than 6 hours on the phone with Amazon customer service to figure out how this Treadmill should get this delivered, I found it shocking that Amazon refused to carry the 20% discount to my 2nd attempt at purchasing the treadmill, even though I would have been able to get that 20% if Jb Hunt would have delivered the package like they were supposed to. In summary, Amazon delivery and logistics is a mess. The left hand does not know what the right hand is doing, and their third party delivery contractors such as Jb Hunt refused to do what they are contractually obligated to do and the customer is caught in the middle. Amazon kept insisting that Jb Hunt must deliver, and Jb Hunt refused to deliver and I wasted more than 15 hours of my life trying to coordinate between the two. I cancelled my prime membership because honestly, prime delivery is more like crappy delivery.

Review Title: Parcel turned up across the other side of town to a stranger, one week after being ‚Äòdelivered to a neighbour‚Äô

Later that day I received an email the second shipment had been delivered to a neighbour even though I had not left the house all day. The second shipment was ‚Äòdelivered‚Äô by Amazon Shipping. Today, one week after ‚Äòdelivery‚Äô I have been informed by a kind hearted stranger by parcel was delivered to them two days ago, at the other side of the town I live in.I now have to collect my parcel, from the other side of town. Isn‚Äôt this the job of a courier?Amazon Shipping are the worst courier, if they don‚Äôt leave your parcels out in the rain they falsely inform you of a delivery then a week later deliver it to the completely wrong address. Review Text: Amazon customer service has been going into decline. I ordered a product which I did not receive. I called and reported a missing package, and I requested a refund because it was a gift and I will not receive another package on time as needed. They told me they will refund $175.59 to my Amazon gift card. Days past by and I thought they have already refunded me, just to find out that they said they would, but they did not. Few hours later I still do not see any credit on my Amazon account, even though they told me that the refund will appear within few minutes. If I do not see the refund, now I will simply go and dispute the credit card transaction, Their customer service used to be much better and much more professional, now it seems like they are going down into the ditch.

I'm a watch collector and spotted a particular piece that I wanted from Amazon and stocks were low.I ended up having to buy 5 of the same model, as the first four were faulty (3 missing the same hand (QC issue!) and 1 not working!).I was going to keep the fifth watch, but now have chosen to return it due to an email indirectly accusing me of underhandedness.This accusation levelled by Amazon was due to the fact that I had to send 4 faulty watches back.I have been informed that if this continues then they may close my account and will not refund anymore of the watches.So three watches which had the hands  completely missing (not even within the watch face enclosure) was my fault apparently and the fourth wasn't working... probably due to a dead battery.Next problem is all 5 watches came from Europe, so I had to pay somewhere in the region of ¬£200 for customs charges for all 5 watches over a few weeks and could only retrieve the charge back, as each arrived back at the Amazon warehouse in Germany. However I contacted Amazon about the first watch refunded without the custom charges being repaid. This was quickly sorted and a refund issued. After enquiring about the next watch, I've now been told that the remaining custom charges of approximately ¬£160 wil take up to 180 days for each customs charge to be refunded... WHY?So be careful what and how you buy from Amazon. Before this invalid accusation, I would have rated this site much higher. But now, if I could give 0 stars I would!NB

When Amazon was experiencing rapid growth, the company's management focused on growing market share and managing company growth. This is why Amazon is notorious for selling counterfeit products. But, with the global economy contracting and Amazon's sales with it, the company's management has shifted its focus to prioritize its customers. For example, Amazon has implemented many reforms designed to eliminate counterfeit products from its website. In addition, customer reviews on the Amazon site for food products provide many examples of the company selling outdated and stale products. Amazon is also addressing this issue, with a new focus on delivering food products in an acceptable condition. In fact, I order canned foods by the case from Amazon because they arrive in pristine condition. In stark contrast, their largest competitor refuses to sell canned foods by the case and instead ships severely damaged cans to its customers. I congratulate Amazon on its new customer focus and the improved experience it has produced.

Review Title: A true story about Stephane and Menzzo
Review Text: A true story about Stephane and Menzzo, a company  supported by Amazon. Ripping of people can have heartbreaking consequencesSummer 2020, after 15 years of marriage, my friend Stephane and his wife are separating. Life stops for St√©phane for a moment, he rents a small apartment in Brussels, except for a chair and a table, there is nothing there, the once so lively creative man was onlya shadow of himself. He misses his two daughters very much during the week. After a hopeless year, of intense sadness, in 2021, St√©phane decides to put his life back on track, he works very hard, as a freelance cameraman, also for our company, and takes care of his 2 children with great pleasure and dedication during the weekend. He saves as much money as possible, lives like a hermit and is convinced to lead a respectable life again in no time. After a few months of saving, St√©phane decides to place an order at a French low budget, online furniture store, to finally furnish his apartment, fully motivated he really wanted to make a new start. Unfortunately something goes wrong with the delivery. (what we don't know and is also irrelevant) The goods go back to the supplier and St√©phane waits months to see his money back. Unfortunately after dozens of apologies, the money is not coming back. He no longer has any savings and at his small apartment in Brussels, the social inspector comes by one day after a complaint from his ex-wife, where according to her the children did not have the necessary accommodation to stay with daddy. After this visit we never heard from our friend again, he used his only furniture, his table and chair to do the most unthinkable and took his own life. Months after his death we found printed advertising in his drawer, from a few furniture companies, also Menzzo, we read some reviews and together with the editors decided to place an order at both companies, we ordered a table at one company, with a value of 700 ‚Ç¨, this was returned and within a week we had all our money back. On the same day, we ordered 12 chairs from Menzzo, for a value of ‚Ç¨ 1250, until the end of last week, we did everything we could to get our money back , hoping that our suspicion would not be correct, but unfortunately we also keep getting to hear another excuse and another and another ....so we realize our money will never be paid back again. Our intention is certainly not to shame a company, we ourselves realize how difficult doing business is and that comments are always relative. That is why we decided to do the test ourselves, despite the many negative reviews already suggesting that the same pattern could be observed here as told by our good friend at the time. It is therefore only a suspicion that our friend ordered from them, yet they use the same method to rob people in this way and we found the printed adds remember. The customers who order furniture from Menzzo and other rogue companies are usually guided (misled) by cheap prices and are therefore happy that they can also afford a new table, chair or sofa, often they have to make a huge financial shortfall for this and use their last pennies to realize a small dream to have a dignified life again. Often it turns out that this trust is only a one-way street, deceit, abuse of trust and the umpteenth blow, which can lead to even the most ultimate act for people like St√©phane. Fortunately, there are still many companies that mean well. We can only hope that with the introduction of our website, good people like St√©phane will be warned about companies such as Menzzo. and their collaborators, because one day on Judgment Day, whatever your faith is, you will be welcomed by someone like St√©phane, or maybe by your own grandmother, grandfather, mother, father.... deeply disappointed in the choices you've made, ripping of other people, by the sad disillusioned look in their eyes, you can see, you did the wrong thing, no matter how hard you are trying to ignore it , carma can never be avoided. Not here, not now, not later.Please make sure that kind people like St√©phane, can't be the victim anymore of lawless CEO's like D.M. and all of his co-workers. Everyone of them is guilty, because they just have other choices. Don't buy from them, they are not worth it, inform Amazon of their practices, Facebook and other social media, the only way you can hurt them, is to hurt them in their wallet, because a heart they don't have.

Review Title: Amazon has lost ALL customer respect.
Review Text: I usually swear by Amazon, they were a company who could do no wrong as far as I was concerned.  But, their standards have fallen so far, I cannot support them anymore.  The final straw was just this last week when I bought a pair of JBL Gumy earbuds.  I bought them ‚ÄúUsed: Like New‚Äù and was really excited when they arrived.  Then I opened them.  The earbuds were covered in earwax and it was disgusting!!  I didn‚Äôt bother doing a damn thing else, I boxed them back up and started the return.  Usually the returns are ridiculously easy, you take a QR code to any UPS Store and just drop off the return, the UPS Store does everything else.  This time, I‚Äôve got to print out the label and box everything up all nicely myself.  Then, what really ticked me off, is they refused to post my review warning everyone else about these diseased earbuds.  I wrote a review (just like what I‚Äôm doing here) detailing exactly what happened and posting photos of the nasty earbuds.  I get an email saying they ‚Äúcould not post the review‚Äù mainly because it had ‚Äúseller feedback.‚Äù  Since they‚Äôre the seller, I feel they‚Äôre just trying to cover their own asses by hiding things from unsuspecting buyers.  I‚Äôll say the same thing here that I said in that review: NEVER waste your money buying used on these types of products.  Clearly, Amazon has ZERO return quality control protocols and they will resell any disgusting, worthless product as long as it gets them a few bucks.  From now on, if it doesn‚Äôt come new, in a SEALED box, I won‚Äôt even look at it.

Amazon started to cheat it's loyal customers back in November 2022.  1st, I have an Amazon security  product, The Amazon Cloud Cam that included free cloud storage.  Support was cancelled and we were given a much cheaper Blink Mini with a limited cloud storage plan.  Wasn't happy, but...things happen?THEN a weeks later they altered my Amazon Music, a free included part of my Prime Membership.  The programming change has made it unusable.Be careful with Amazon they broke my trust.

Review Title: What happened to quality customer service?
Review Text: I ordered several items on Jan 2, this review in reference to the return I started on Jan 4 to exchange a couple of those items (a lunch bag and purse).  First, let me say AMAZON IS NOT what it used to be.  I tried to contact customer service and the "request a call" is NOT readily available.  I have to type call AMAZON in the search field.  I followed their instructions on the app and the computer and "request a call" does not pop up like they say it should.  But the real issue is this - upon requesting the return of these two items that came shipped together in the same box, yet evidently AMAZON uses two different return codes.  You can't know this because the code is non-discernable.  I dropped the items off to UPS and only scanned one item.  That is the only item showing up as refunded on my account.  Now we talking UPS not USPS, but evidently AMAZON STILL hasn't received the return so the refund is not processed on the second item and it's still showing "refund started".  (Oh and lets not forget the 30 day return policy, but your shipping sucks)Clearly AMAZON has outgrown its capabilities.  This is now the third issue I've had with them in recent months.  So to recap:a) calling customer service is not as easy as it used to beb) a simple note when returning multiple items that they will each receive different codes and each item needs to be scanned at drop off seems easy enoughc) shipping is a joke. Its slow in both directions, so why am I paying to be a PRIME MEMBERd) who doesn't offer exchanges (same item diff color/sz) without the whole return and reorder?  Thats just dumb!That CHAT is a joke!  That is automated as well.There is a such thing as TOO BIG! I've said it before and I will say it again AMAZON is slippin.  They are losing their touch.  They have hands in so many pies, they are losing sight of the little details that will cost them customers in the long run.I have already in the last year slowed my ordering from them.  I foresee ordering becoming all but non existent in the future.
What a joke, offered ¬£20 and one month's free Amazon Prime (¬£8) for loss of ¬£250 due to failed delivery twice by their courier

Review Title: Amazon is an often hated occasional necessity...
Review Text: Amazon is frequently a lifesaver, delivering what you need as soon as you need it. I leave in two weeks for the trip of a lifetime, backpacking in Cambodia and Laos. I'm a professional photographer sometimes, and it was time to upgrade to include a professional camera drone. The inexpensive EXO Cinemaster II sounded like a great deal, but CAREFULLY reading Amazon reviews, I concluded it was a well-marketed drone, but NOT a great drone. The DJI Mini had many more reviews, almost all positive, so at spme extra expense I went with the DJI. I don't want to give more money to Jeff Bezos, but Amazon -even if you hate it- has its upsides, especially on product reviews and on the sale of unusual items. So, use it when needed, shop local when you have the option.

Review Title: Don't believe everything their agents tell u.
Review Text: I have to be completely honest..  Amazon has to have some of the worst customer service compared to pretty any company. They will give u the run around regardless of what your needs are, just to get you off the phone..  I placed an order 4 days ago and needed the item rush shipped so I would receive it before Saturday..  first off, in no point was the item I ordered not available. And it showed it was in stock. After numerous calls and agents I spoke with, they pretty much guaranteed they would get the order escalated so it would ship priority so I would receive it by the date I needed it by. Fast forward to today, the day before I needed to receive it. The item never shipped. When I called, they again, gave me the run around and told me that the reason it didn't ship was because the item was shipping from a third party company that was shipping the item from China. Which basically meant I was screwed out of my order..  when I asked to speak to a supervisor, she then gave me the run around again and told me that the item was out of stock and they couldn't issue a credit to the order until after January 7th, which was after the day of should've shipped. I was livid..  for a multi billion dollar company, you would think their customer service personal would be a little more forthcoming when it comes to the information they give to their clients.. I hope I never have to deal with any of their agents again..  good luck to anyone that has to deal with them..

Review Title: A Prime way to cause Stress.
Review Text: Ordered a laptop on Nov 18th. Shipped December 30th with 2 day shipping.Expected delivery is the 10th of January.Amazon paid UPS for 5 day shipping as confirmed by their rep (This is fraud).Customer service is a hassle to reach, gives indirect answers and leaves you in limbo for over a month with no communication. In fact, customer service is generally rude and will hang up on your or just close your chat if they don't fancy the conversation.This happens too often, and the majority of the time I buy computer parts I constantly have issues. 3 DOA motherboards within 1 years span, and other IoT devices fare about the same. High chance the product you bought was mis-advertised, and likely will be defective or their delivery service will deliver it to the wrong address. 5+ Items delivered to the wrong people last year alone. Was able to recover about 3.And now Prime is completely useless. Pay extra for "whenever it gets to you" prime day delivery service.This is my last amazon purchase. They need to change their ways, everything about how they operate now is just crap. Even my "Amazon warehouse Like-New" purchases were DOA computer parts. People should start boycotting their service and choose reputable stores that actually want your business. This will force them to change their ways or they fall and a new service will take its place.

Review Title: My gripe is with the drivers who don't‚Ä¶
Review Text: My gripe is with the drivers who don't pay attention to the delivery instructions. I purchased a deck Box and a sign for my packages to be Safely delivered to. Review Title: I grow tired of amazon and from‚Ä¶
Review Text: I grow tired of amazon and from yesterday events which was hilarious shocking I think now I will start to support shopping offline more at its competitors in my UK area then online. Let's look at the business model firstThe idea is to order an item and if you have prime your suppose to be received a guaranteed date and time for order to arrive Now yesterday I should of received a bulky french freezer American style freezer straight from prime which I paid over 800gpb for? Order was placed on 29 december with additional services of unpacking and installation for additional fee into our apartment home Date gets pushed back to 4th Jan 2023 waiting 6 days delivery  No problem I think Yesterday amazon confirms delivery in email delivered by a short woman and a man with a European polish accent who on opening our door I say hello mate the Woman says I'm not your mate I'm a woman which I found very odd being just northwest UK guy greeting The man and my neighbour and woman started to push the item up 6 steps to my apartment slamming it on every push by delivery  drivers Once at front door they started to agrue  and say it won't fit through the front door and refused to try I said one second grabbed my drill and took my front door off the hinges to help out fitting through The European delivery driver then said no I won't do this accusing me of contacting amazon if he made a mark to property on floor or wallpaper I could create a claim and would not budge on decision I reminded him I paid for room of choice and unboxing of item and I would not do such a thing His attitude was "all customers say that" and refused" and was so unhelpful  he started to moan saying he has another 300 drops to do and I felt pressured and forced to agure he will take it back I offered to sign yet he took it back my neighbour and myself was shocked terrible serviceA few days before that also I tried to order a amazon cooking hob which never arrived (went instead to a amazon locker) after numerous calls on the previous incident and Hob issue I'm now down by 1000gbp awaiting on amazon to refund 5-7 working days  Poor staff and poor service

Amazon does not like to post negative reviews. I have attempted to post several and have had nearly all of them cancelled. I have never had a positive review cancelled. Try it and see... Buy a yellow shirt and then post a review about much you like your new red coat and watch them post it. I have read their rules for making product reviews and been very careful about following them. I have even resubmitted previously cancelled reviews with all the information removed except the most basic - i.e. This is a counterfeit item, etc.. And they cancelled them anyway. It seems to me that if you submit a negative review and attempt to post facts that any future reader could verify their self, then the review is cancelled. As long as your review looks like you are just a customer suffering buyer's remorse - it's fine and can be posted. Anything else and not so much. Attached are photos of a recent purchase that was a counterfeit item. The comment I attempted to leave at Amazon warning others was cancelled. No derogatory comments, no bad language, just several facts pointing out the differences between the product sent and the one shown on the Amazon product page.

Their customer service application on their website is absolutely dire, none existent. There is no customer service application that is fit for purpose apart from a list that you can click on which is almost worthless; no customer services phone number, no customer services email you can actually engage with that is directly on there site, no complaints platform you can actually use. This company has ballooned into a monstrous entity that it has forgotten about customer services completely. They have ditched the core principles that the "Customer is King" and the "Customer is the life blood of your business". I'm starting to go off buying Amazon shopping because there is no proper avenue to give your grievance to, no proper customer service you can ask for help. Amazon doesn't care about (us) their customers'. Recent experiences using Amazon shopping on line has left me very frustrated with their systems. I ordered goods from them to arrive at an Amazon pick up hub, they send me a code to open the hub locker but it won't open. I spent 3 days trying to open it. What was worse I couldn't contact an Amazon services customer advisor because there isn't one, just a computer offering basic general questions that couldn't answer what I wanted answering. If I had a telephone number or an email then that would of helped my frustration but instead I'm left there standing frustrated that I had no idea why I couldn't access the hub and my parcels. But hey let's talk about global warming shall we! Now a van has to pick up my parcel send it back to the depot, then as I THINK about reordering my parcel another van has to pollute the air twice to get it to me; so much for Amazon's environmental policy well that is just a joke. Come on Amazon get a grip with customer services, stop making US the customers do all your dirty work and stop adding vehicle fumes to the environment unnecessarily transporting parcels back and forth when a customer services team can help reduce that problem. Very poor customer services. I'm shopping more and more on the high Street because I'm increasingly becoming more frustrated with Amazon shopping experiences.

Review Title: Suffered a very bad experience over the‚Ä¶
Review Text: Suffered a very bad experience over the xmas period. Because they were offering delivery on New Years eve, I thought, why not? There are lots of people, probably, who don't celebrate New Year! So I make an order which includes, LEMSIP. So first of all, I sit for four hours waiting for a delivery which failed to arrive because the driver couldn't find me! All the others do, but this one didn't! And not to rub salt into the wounds, I later discovered they hadn't included the one six pack of LEMSIP! I had, (still have) got a cold of sorts) and now I discover I'm listed on Amazon as someone vulnerable, and likely to OD on LEMSIP!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Well thankyou Amazon, you've excelled yourselves !!!! And lastly please pass on my best wishes to the driver who turned out to be someone with less brain than a newt!!! I hope the party he or she attended instead of completing his or her job, was worth leaving a 76 year old someone, in great discomfort at New Year! Well done!! It will be a story to tell your grandkids, if ever you discover how to have them, of course! Amazon, you really must start vetting these casual drivers you take on, they are not doing your reputation any good at all!!!

I never received the boots. After searching for Amazon Customer service phone number. I called amazon on December 28th and was able to speak with an Amazon customer rep. The first call dropped so I had to call back and wait again. The next customer service rep could not speak or understand english well and i had to repeat my situation over and over . They eventually transferred me to the infamous supposed "Try before you buy" section of Amazon. The rep for this section saw the order placed on December 18th but could not tell me why it never shipped.I was offered a lame apology and promised the order would ship immediately and was given a "5.00 dollar promo credit, Lol!January 2nd and I have yet to receive the boots nor shipping update.The Amazon "try before you buy" option is nice especially for boots....if they show up.Stay away from Amazon "try before you buy" as you may never receive your item.This is the worst Amazon customer service I've experienced since becoming a Prime member.think twice about Prime membership.

Review Title: Never had a bad experience with Amazon
Review Text: I recently had the pleasure of shopping with Amazon, and I must say, I was thoroughly impressed with their services. From my experience, their deliveries are always prompt and arrive on time, which is a big plus in my busy schedule. In addition, I was delighted to discover that they offer free returns, which provided me with a sense of security and confidence when making my purchases. I have never had a negative experience with Amazon, and I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a reliable and efficient online shopping experience.

Amazon have attached reviews of Martin Scorsese's American film 'The Age of Innocence' to a different dvd altogether, Alan Bridges' Canadian film 'Age of Innocence'.  They are not even adaptations of the same source.  The Scorsese is from Edith Wharton's novel, whereas the Bridges is a screen original.  I    first told them of the error two years ago.  They refuse point blank to make a correction or to publish my review making it.  Indeed, they have banned me from reviewing the dvd at all. (Update.  Amazon now threaten to ban me from all reviewing, on the ground that I reviewed a seller.  That is a lie.  Their behaviour is despicable.  They should thank me, not bully me.  I have emailed Jeff Bezos, but of course that will be ignored.   Further update.  The rot is international.  American Amazon has Americans' reviews of the wrong film. Amazon France has reviews of the wrong film in French.  Amazon Italia has reviews of the wrong film in Italian.  Yet another update.  Amazon apologised and undertook to investigate.  It did not last. The next time I tried to log on Amazon decided they needed to be sure it was me, and sent a one-time code to my email address. That wasn't enough.  They supposedly sent another code to my mobile with a number ending in 01.  This mobile does not exist.  I have no mobile.   I have never had a mobile.   Heaven knows where this fictional number came from.   Year after year after year this happens, and over and over and over I tell Amazon what a nonsense it is.  But this time Amazon has inexplicably disabled my account and imposed intolerable procedures to revive it.  I am ninety-one years old.  I cannot take this stress.   Another update.   Madness follows madness.  To confirm my identity, Amazon wants me to use the scanner I do not have to send a copy of the driving licence or the passport I do not have.  Talk about piling Pelion on Ossa.                                               Or are the most recent developments the work of a scammer impersonating Amazon, trying to persuade me to use the scanner I do not have to provide a copy of the passport I do not have? Later still.  Can I believe Amazon, who now say they have reinstated my account?                                     Yet later, they have - and apologised and credited me with ¬£50 for my trouble.   I suppose I should give  them a second star.                                                      But now I find that - two or three brief recent ones excepted - Amazon has deleted all my past reviews, including a lengthy analysis of Francois Ozon's film 'L'Amant Double'.  I take this to have been punishment for the false accusation about a seller.   Taxed with this, Amazon have the brass neck to tell me to recreate my reviews.  I kept no copies and I have better things to do.  I have taken the second star away...                                                 Possible final update: the reviews of the wrong film have, at last, been removed.)

Review Title: Amazon has really gone down the drain
Review Text: I used to think Amazon and their CS was awesome (at least it was years ago). Amazon claimed to deliver a package to me a day earlier than planned. I was working so I could not check for it until and hour after but there was no delivery. Looked and waited for 2 days per their recommendation. After that, I asked for the photo proof of delivery... they said they didn‚Äôt have one. So I went back and forth with them for days about what to do and talking to their logistics teams they asked me to file a police report in order to further assist. So I did. The report was completed. I called the police to confirm, they did. Amazon claims they cannot contact the police, and that they want a URL to the police report, which doesn‚Äôt exist since the city police department does not offer this.The CS team would copy and paste the same information again and again to me, it was ridiculous and made me feel like every single one of their agents was incompetent. I had offered copies, photos and contact info for the police report filed but still this was not enough, or well they couldn‚Äôt do anything with this information. I‚Äôm like why TF do you make me do all this for you and you don‚Äôt even make an effort?! I have so many regrets, I should have just gone to the store to purchase this somewhat expensive item. Now I‚Äôm at a loss here, no help, no refund. Amazon has really gone down the drain these past few years. I‚Äôm done with being a prime member.

Review Title: I would  give zero if I could
Review Text: I would  give zero if I could. Appalling service when trying to deal with a return item. There systems are antiquated and they clearly do not listen to what you‚Äôre telling them. Be careful ladies and gents as they are awful to deal with when you‚Äôre have an issue

I just wanted to update on my previous review submitted just 30 mins ago. I have since been back on the Amazon Website and the items that I were told were out of stock are showing '10 in stock'What a joke. Is that 10 other customers that are going to pay over ¬£1000 for items that aren't received.Another update on 17th Dec I have now been informed that my parcel will be delivered on Wednesday the 23rd Dec. This is 10 days after I made the purchase with AMAZON PRIME.... I question if my delivery date has been put back to the Wednesday as Amazon perhaps expect that they cant deliver the item but perhaps i wont chase it so close to Christmas OR by the time I know it isnt going to be delivered it is too late for me to do anything about it. Who knows. But I will of course update.Update. A very kind colleague placed the same order through her account and received delivery the following day.... Whilst I was still waiting for delivery of several repurchased items. I didn't eventually get a full refund on all of the orders placed (after Christmas) but none of them ever showed up in a delivery. I've never had a response to my email or complaint either. I will never make any big purchases through Amazon Prime again.

I have only written two reviews in the past. I have done so to relate my experiences with companies, and I strive to stick to the facts. This is my third, and it is alarming. Today I posted a review about a defective watch that I received from a third party seller, but fulfilled by Amazon. I contacted Amazon and requested that I be allowed to return the item and that a refund be issued to me. Amazon co-operated but told me that they could not provide me with a return shipping label. That would have to come from the seller, who is in China. OH? OK. I asked how long would that take? Amazon stated that if the seller did not respond within 10 days, then Amazon would begin a claims investigation. I accepted this and gave it no further thought. Then, I took off the watch, which I had been wearing for 3 days. OH... MY... GOD! My wrist had a raw area where the watchband had been. I called the emergency room of my VA hospital and told them what was happening. They advised me to come in to have these marks examined and documented. I said I would do this tomorrow. But first, I got onto the Amazon product page, looked for my review, and couldn't find it. So I went to my Profile and there it was. Curious. So I selected "Edit" and tapped the "add photo" box and loaded from my files the photo's of the marks on my arm, which I had also loaded into my PC documents. I submitted them and waited. That was 6 hours ago. No change in my updated review "with photo's". Meanwhile, the "marks" had started to ooze a clear liquid. That FREAKED ME OUT! I called the VA hospital again and told them the new development. The attending ER physician said that most likely I was suffering from a contact chemical burn from the watch band and to come with the watch and they could have it analyzed. I haven't gone in as of yet. What I HAVE done is contact Amazon again and forcefully demand why my edited review that contained the photo's of the injury to my wrist were not posted? I am aware from experience that customer reviews are scanned by a team of the "Communities" section of Amazon to insure that the Community Rules and Guidelines are not "violated". OK. But what the hell does that have to do with me trying to raise an alarm to the buying public that Amazon is selling a dangerous product? Is my review being suppressed by Amazon in an effort to hide this and what they are selling? I gave the patient Amazon representative an earful, but he responded by assuring me that all that I had relayed to him would be delivered ASAP to his upper chain of command. He asked for my telephone number and stated that I would be contact by "someone" in Amazon internal investigations. Well, for now, I'm going to have to wait and see if that actually happens. I'm headed for the ER room in a few hours and I definitely will get an answer from them at least as to what in Gods name this watchband is made of and to have the wounds documented. And yes. I am contacting a legal representative of the Veterans Administration for advice as to what my rights are in regards to personal injury attained from a product sold by Amazon. If Amazon didn't like me because of my edited review, they sure as hell aren't going to once I file court papers on them. Anyway. There you have it. And like I have said in my last reviews, "just the facts".12/25/2018 11:43 AM PST Seattle, Washington, USAYesterday I contacted Amazon.com customer service. Asked if the they had received the 4 photos of the burn marks on my wrist. The agent acknowledge that she could see them on her monitor. I asked her what were my options. She said she would send me an e-mail with the Amazon Legal Contact information. She did send it. But it was only an address with no phone or e-mail link. The only way to contact them is through snail mail. But here is what has NOT happened. I was told that "someone" from Amazon would be contacting me in 6 hours. That was 12 hours ago. Maybe because of the Christmas holiday, no one is available?None the less. The Watch that caused my injuries is still listed on the Amazon web site. So. I am providing the product name, AND, the seller name for the sake of public discloser and safety.Item: Winhy 8 GB HD Waterproof Wrist DV Watch Camera Digital Video DVR Camcorder 1280 x 960 by WinhySeller: Jiad KdeI will continue to provide updates as they develop.

Review Title: Had minor problems, but overall - great
Review Text: I had some problems with them, such as fake sellers, missing deliveries, or deliveries, that got delivered to pick-up points, when ordered as home-delivery ( I got a free delivery for next purchase as compensation ). It's frustrating when problems come up, but support is brilliant for the most part, unlike in other stores I will not name... They have never given me the "polite middle finger" in a reply, that implies "we do not have to..." or "according to our policies you have to [random inconvenience, that costs you time/money]".

Review Title: Being flooded with far too many Chinese ‚Ä¶
Review Text: Amazon has become similar to a flea market of sorts flooded with Chinese counterfeits. It's become too difficult to trust I will receive what I order from Amazon anymore, even when I order something "sold by Amazon", I seem to have a 50/50 shot of getting a generic substitute. There is also a high percentage of fake reviews and gaming the Amazon system by all of the Chinese based sellers. Amazon is doing nothing to stop it. I'm switching to Walmart.

Review Title: Considering the volumes they have to deal with, it's as close to perfection as it gets
Review Text: For years now, our entire family has been buying books and other goods at Amazon.com, as well as selling some (mostly books).  Their customer service is in general excellent and they always have been able to resolve any issues, which were few and far between.  Considering the enormous volumes of business the company deals with, they are as close to perfection as it gets. I have no hesitation recommending them.
